entries.title: Archmage Sylvaris, the Archivist of Eternity
entries.body:
### **Archmage Sylvaris, the Archivist of Eternity**

- **Magic Specialty:** Chronomancy (Time Magic) & Arcane Archives
- **Personality:** Calculating, reserved, and speaks in riddles.
- **Notable Abilities:**
    - Can read and transcribe spells lost to time.
    - Manipulates time within a limited radius, slowing or accelerating it.
    - Stores memories and knowledge in enchanted tomes, creating an ever-growing arcane library.
- **Lore:** Some say Sylvaris has lived for a thousand years; others claim he merely **remembers** everything that ever was. He guards the Ivory Tower’s deepest secrets and decides what knowledge is too dangerous to be shared.
	
- **Class**: 5th Class?
	
- **Origin:** High Elf, [[Regalia Prime]]

entries.title: Grand Magister Orvus Pyrelight, the Sunforged Sage
entries.summary: ### **Grand Magister Orvus Pyrelight, the Sunforged Sage**
entries.body:
### **Grand Magister Orvus Pyrelight, the Sunforged Sage**

- **Magic Specialty:** Solar Magic & Elemental Mastery
- **Personality:** Stern, righteous, unwavering in his pursuit of balance.
- **Notable Abilities:**
    - Calls upon the power of the sun to cast searing beams of light.
    - Can forge weapons and constructs made from pure flame.
    - Resistant to all forms of fire and heat.
- **Lore:** Once a battle-mage, Orvus abandoned war for wisdom, believing magic should be used for enlightenment, not destruction. Still, he remains the **Ivory Tower’s last line of defense**, wielding the Sunfire Aegis—a shield that burns away corruption and deceit.
	
- **Class**: 5th Class?
	
- **Origin:** Dwarf, [[Ter Dracht]]
entries.obsidianPath: Azterra_world/Guilds/Ivory Tower/Five Sages/Grand Magister Orvus Pyrelight.md

entries.title: Lady Morgaina Vale, the Veilbinder
entries.body:
### **Lady Morgaina Vale, the Veilbinder**

- **Magic Specialty:** Illusion & Shadow Manipulation
- **Personality:** Enigmatic, theatrical, enjoys toying with perception.
- **Notable Abilities:**
    - Can weave illusions so real they can inflict physical sensations.
    - Walks between shadows, stepping from one darkened corner to another across vast distances.
    - Creates living illusions that act independently.
- **Lore:** It is said that Morgaina has no **true** face—her form shifts constantly, and none can recall what she originally looked like. She controls the **Veil of Secrets**, the Ivory Tower’s hidden defense against those who seek to steal its knowledge.
	
- **Class**: 5th Class?
	
- **Origin:** Tiefling, Unknown

entries.title: Master Alaric Thornweave, the Fleshshaper
entries.body:
### **Master Alaric Thornweave, the Fleshshaper**

- **Magic Specialty:** Biomancy & Alchemy
- **Personality:** Arrogant, fascinated with pushing the limits of the mortal form.
- **Notable Abilities:**
    - Can alter his own body and others', healing or reshaping flesh at will.
    - Creates magical elixirs with permanent effects.
    - Can grow extra limbs or imbue his body with unnatural resilience.
- **Lore:** Alaric’s research into **living magic** has made him both respected and feared. Some call him a healer, others a madman. He is the most controversial member of the Ivory Tower, and some whisper that he seeks immortality not through magic—but through perfecting the human form
	
- **Class**: 5th Class?
	
- **Origin:** Human, [[Serathiel]]

entries.title: Veylin Astra, the Starlit Oracle
entries.body:
### **Veylin Astra, the Starlit Oracle**

- **Magic Specialty:** Celestial Magic & Divination
- **Personality:** Soft-spoken, eerie, speaks in half-truths.
- **Notable Abilities:**
    - Reads the future through the movements of the stars.
    - Calls upon celestial entities to aid her in battle.
    - Can create constellations in the air that act as sigils, empowering allies or cursing foes.
- **Lore:** Veylin was once a wandering prophetess who received visions from the cosmos. The Ivory Tower took her in, recognizing her ability to **foresee the consequences of reckless magic**. She never gives direct answers—only cryptic messages of fate.
	
- **Class**: 5th Class?
	
- **Origin:** Half-Elf, [[Kyrathys]]

entries.title: Ivory Tower
entries.summary: The Ivory Tower is a guild, comprised of those deemed powerful enough to be mages. They are extremely selective unit, taking in new members only when they are deemed talented in the area of magic. Any who refuse to join are forever shunned and those who do not get an invitation to join the first time they are evaluated must wait a whole 2 years before being re-evaluated.
entries.body:
The Ivory Tower is a guild, comprised of those deemed powerful enough to be mages. They are extremely selective unit, taking in new members only when they are deemed talented in the area of magic. Any who refuse to join are forever shunned and those who do not get an invitation to join the first time they are evaluated must wait a whole 2 years before being re-evaluated.

By accepting the invitation, all previous titles would be stripped, depicting a new, fully dedicated life of being a Mage and studying magic. Though, Mages of the Ivory Tower did have more respect from nobles and commoners than the average commoner would. Nonetheless, this title did not make you of higher power politically, meaning Nobles were still viewed as higher importance and respect.

The Ivory Tower gauges power within the Tower by Mage classes, each succeeding class believed to be 10-fold the previous. (i.e.: 10 1st class Mage == 1 2nd class Mage).

The main tower resides far North in Regalia, but several other towers exist in areas like [[Regalia Prime]], [[Halvis]], [[Kyrathys]] and [[Serathiel]]. (Up to change)

Mages of the Ivory Tower are in the following order of power:

1 Tower Master
5 Tower Sages
10 Tower Captains per Sage
4 Tower Vices per Captain
50+ Tower Members per Vice (varies from Tower to Tower)

There is one Tower Master, he currently is unknown in power level but is believed to be at least a master level 6th class Mage. Though they know his name, [[Caelum Veyros]], they know not of his looks, or even what magic he uses. Instead, the front line of the Ivory Tower to the rest of the world are 5 extremely powerful mages. 

Their names are [[Archmage Sylvaris]], [[Lady Morgaina Vale]], [[Grand Magister Orvus Pyrelight]], [[Veylin Astra]], and [[Master Alaric Thornweave]]. 

All 5 of the Sages are confirmed to be of 5th class Mage, but they may be upwards of lower 6th class.

entries.title: Caelum Veyros
entries.summary:
- **Magic Specialty:** ??????????????????
- **Personality:** ???????
- **Lore:** Not one sighting of him in flesh by any who aren't royalty or high ranking nobles. At least 6th class, currently the leader of The Ivory Tower for a few centuries, successor to the previous Ivory Tower Master, [[Lucius Grinvera]], the founder of the Ivory Tower nearly 800 years ago.
entries.body:
- **Magic Specialty:** ??????????????????
- **Personality:** ???????
- **Lore:** Not one sighting of him in flesh by any who aren't royalty or high ranking nobles. At least 6th class, currently the leader of The Ivory Tower for a few centuries, successor to the previous Ivory Tower Master, [[Lucius Grinvera]], the founder of the Ivory Tower nearly 800 years ago.

entries.title: Lucius Grinvera
entries.body:
- **Magic Specialty:** All Powerful
	
- **Personality:** Prideful, willing to help any and all in order to bring peace to the world
	
- **Lore:** Created the Ivory Tower to act as a haven for those powerful enough to change the world for the better. Previously attempted to mediate a treaty between the nations to no avail, leading to the destruction of his dream of peace. Stepped down from the Tower Master position after his wife's passing alongside the conflict between nations that he failed to resolve. 
	
- **Class**: Only recorded 8th class Mage as per 400 years ago
	
- **Origin**: High Elf, Velarion

entries.title: Historical Legends
entries.body:
### **1. Saint Alyssara, the Ever-Burning**

Alyssara was a knight **captured by a heretical sect** that sought to extinguish the flame of Kaya. They tied her to a pyre and set her ablaze, but instead of screaming, she **prayed aloud** as the flames **did not consume her flesh**.

For **three days and three nights**, she burned, untouched by the fire. On the fourth day, her captors, terrified, attempted to cut her throat—but the moment the blade touched her, **a divine firestorm erupted, consuming her enemies in white flame**.

When the flames died, Alyssara was gone—her body **ascended into the heavens**, becoming one of Kaya’s celestial warriors. Her **burned shackles remain in the Grand Cathedral**, still warm to the touch.

**Oath of Fire:** To honor Saint Alyssara, every knight must **hold their hand over a flame** during their oaths, proving their willingness to suffer for the light.


### **2. The Pale Crusade and the Betrayal of Solmarr**

Long ago, the Order waged war against the **Lords of Night**, a cult dedicated to the eclipse of Kaya’s light. The war seemed unwinnable until **Lord Commander Solmarr** led a final charge into the **Obsidian Spire**, the heart of the enemy’s power.

But when the knights breached the gates, they found **Solmarr kneeling before the Dark Lord**, his armor blackened and his blade inverted. He had **betrayed the Order, turning to the darkness** in exchange for eternal life.

The battle was a slaughter. Only **one survivor** returned—a knight named **Benedict the Unyielding**, his armor cracked, his blade shattered. He declared that **Kaya’s wrath would fall upon the traitor**, and to this day, it is said that **Solmarr is cursed to wander the world, unable to die, tormented by the light of the sun**.

**The Solmarr Vow:** To ensure no knight follows in his footsteps, **every knight must take an oath of unwavering faith**, binding their soul to Kaya’s will.



### **3. The Siege of the Grand Cathedral of Kaya**

During the **Age of Storms**, the sacred **Grand Cathedral of Kaya** was besieged by a monstrous warlord named **The Black Hand**. His army of shadow-forged beasts numbered in the tens of thousands, and for **forty days and forty nights**, the knights defended their sacred home.

On the final night, with their numbers dwindling, **Grand Paladin Isolde** took her **radiant sword, Dawnbreaker**, and **plunged it into the earth**, calling upon Kaya’s light.

A **pillar of divine fire** erupted from the ground, blinding the enemy. When the light faded, the **Black Hand and his army were nothing but ashes**.

**The Dawnfire Pledge:** Every knight swears to **never abandon their post, no matter the odds**, in honor of those who died that night.

entries.title: Knights of the Order
entries.summary: The Knights of the Order are a knightly order, serving the light goddess Kaya. Under her guidance, they enact [[The Code of Radiance]]. Every day, the Knights of the Order complete what is known as [[The Dawn Vigil]]. These duties are more often than not, romanticized wording of the already everyday lives the Paladins and Priests of the Order. There is no such thing as a useless follower, all who uphold the values of [[Kaya]], can and should be used in ways that they can enact. All people can vow themselves, no matter the power they hold or their capabilities. Those who can serve in knightly manners, can and are encouraged to do so. All who worship [[Kaya]] and are blessed with holy power can and are greatly encouraged to take the path of the cleric.
entries.body:
The Knights of the Order are a knightly order, serving the light goddess Kaya. Under her guidance, they enact [[The Code of Radiance]]. Every day, the Knights of the Order complete what is known as [[The Dawn Vigil]]. These duties are more often than not, romanticized wording of the already everyday lives the Paladins and Priests of the Order. There is no such thing as a useless follower, all who uphold the values of [[Kaya]], can and should be used in ways that they can enact. All people can vow themselves, no matter the power they hold or their capabilities. Those who can serve in knightly manners, can and are encouraged to do so. All who worship [[Kaya]] and are blessed with holy power can and are greatly encouraged to take the path of the cleric.

Those with greater influence and service of [[Kaya]] will rise in the ranks, leading to a greater importance and economic gain, as [[Kaya]] would reward those who follow closely to her guidance. 

[[The Order's Ladder of Power]] is seen as legitimate power and oftentimes can lead to great relations with Noble families who worship [[Kaya]] and fund the churches. 

The Knights are special in that they must all undergo a process called the [[Pilgrimage of the Sun]]. This process is vital in that it proves their unwavering devotion to Kaya. There, they undergo one last ceremony called [[The Oath of Illumination]], binding their soul to Kaya's service. 

To become a Paladin of the Dawn or a Templar of Radiance, one must undergo the [[Lightbringer Trials]]. These result in some of the most powerful Paladins and clerics, ones who can lead valiantly and bring peace to the lands. Those who succeed most and continued to lead those around them to a greater place shall advance into the Grand Hierarchy, a select group who are seen as above nobility or at a few levels below royalty. These few are powerhouses in their own respect, people who have lived through much and praise Kaya for the guidance she has offered them. 

To this day, there are a few early stories which are passed down and held with the utmost respect. 
These [[Historical Legends]] are what bring changes to the worshipping of Kaya.
entries.obsidianPath: Azterra_world/Guilds/Knights of the Order/Knights of the Order.md

entries.title: Lightbringer Trials
entries.body:
### **Lightbringer Trials**

The **Lightbringer Trials** are the ultimate test of faith, discipline, and endurance for knights seeking to ascend to the highest ranks. They are brutal, both physically and spiritually, designed to strip a knight of weakness, test their very soul, and ensure only the truly devoted can bear the title of **Templar of Radiance** or **Paladin of the Dawn**. Many knights do not survive the trials, and those who fail often find their faith shaken, requiring years to recover.

#### **The Trials:**

#### **1. The Trial of Flame** – _The Fire That Burns Away the Unworthy_

Before, this trial required walking the **Path of Embers**, but it has since evolved into something far more extreme.

- The knight is stripped of all armor and weapons and must walk across the **Pyre of Kaya**, a sacred battlefield where fire burns **unendingly** in Kaya’s name.
- They must cross the field carrying a **brazier of sacred flame**, a symbol of their duty to **carry the light of Kaya through suffering and darkness**.
- If the knight hesitates, the flames grow hotter, scorching their body—a sign that their faith wavers.
- If they make it through **without screaming or dropping the brazier**, they are marked with the **Sigil of the Sun**, a radiant burn across their hands, permanently branding them as Kaya’s chosen.
- **Failure:** Dropping the flame is considered an unworthy act, and knights who do so are cast out for a year to perform penance before they can attempt the trial again.

#### **2. The Trial of Radiance** – _The Burden of Leadership_

Originally about defending a village or temple, the trial has since been **twisted by time and war**, becoming **a brutal test of sacrifice and wisdom**.

- The knight is assigned a **squad of initiates**—some **real**, some **illusions conjured by Kaya’s clerics**.
- They must lead their squad through a **simulated war**, making life-and-death decisions.
- At some point, they are forced to choose: **sacrifice one to save many** or risk total annihilation.
- The illusions react as if they are truly alive, showing fear, pain, and despair.
- Once the battle is over, the truth is revealed: **Did they lead wisely? Did they act with both justice and mercy?**
- **Failure:** If the knight is reckless, cowardly, or selfish, they are **sent to war as a foot soldier** for one year to understand the cost of leadership.

#### **3. The Trial of the Eclipse** – _The Descent Into the Void_

The final and **most feared** trial, for **many do not return sane**.

- The knight is locked in the **Vault of Shadows**, an underground **holy site-turned-prison** where the some of the most **wretched evils** in history were sealed away.
- For three days, they must **endure absolute darkness** and confront their **own demons**—visions of past failures, whispered doubts, and hallucinations crafted by Kaya herself.
- The darkness in the vault **feeds on weakness**, growing stronger the more the knight fears it.
- The only way to endure is **through faith alone**. Kaya’s light will manifest in their soul **if they are truly worthy**.
- Some knights emerge **forever changed**, speaking of divine revelations. Others **emerge broken, weeping, completely mute, or even blind from the horrors they have witnessed**.
- **Failure:** If the knight succumbs to the darkness and loses faith, they are marked as **Eclipsed**—no longer trusted, forced into exile, or, in extreme cases, executed.

entries.title: The Pilgrimage of the Sun
entries.summary: ### **The Pilgrimage of the Sun** (A Knight’s Sacred Journey)
entries.body:
### **The Pilgrimage of the Sun** (A Knight’s Sacred Journey)

The **Pilgrimage of the Sun** is a rite of passage undertaken by every knight at least once in their lifetime. It is a journey of faith that serves multiple purposes: spiritual reflection, proving one's devotion, and strengthening the bond between the knight and Kaya.
#### **Stages of the Pilgrimage:**

1. **Departure at Dawn** – The knight must leave behind their armor and weapon, dressed in humble white robes, signifying purity and surrender to Kaya’s will.
2. **The Journey of Trials** – The knight must travel alone to the **Grand Cathedral of Kaya**, located at the highest peak in the realm. Along the way, they must perform acts of service—healing the sick, feeding the poor, defending travelers, or rooting out corruption.
3. **The Fire of Devotion** – At the Cathedral, the knight kneels before the **Eternal Flame of Kaya**, offering a personal vow. The flame is said to judge sincerity—those unworthy feel a burning pain in their soul, while the devoted are blessed with renewed strength.
4. **The Return at Dusk** – Having proven their faith, the knight returns to the Order, now bearing a **Sun-Marked Sigil**, signifying their bond with Kaya.

Failure to complete the pilgrimage is seen as a sign that the knight is **not yet spiritually ready** and must undergo penance before attempting it again.
entries.obsidianPath: Azterra_world/Guilds/Knights of the Order/Pilgrimage of the Sun.md

entries.title: The Code of Radiance (Sacred Tenets of Kaya)
entries.summary: #### **The Code of Radiance (Sacred Tenets of Kaya)**
entries.body:
#### **The Code of Radiance (Sacred Tenets of Kaya)**

The **Code of Radiance** is a sacred doctrine given by Kaya, guiding the knights in their duties and spiritual lives. It is inscribed in the **[[Tome of Eternal Dawn]]**, a holy text kept at the **Grand Cathedral of Kaya**, and recited during ceremonies.
#### **The Ten Tenets of Radiance:**

1. **The Light Guides All Paths** – No darkness shall be left unchallenged, for the light must illuminate every shadow.
2. **Justice Before All** – A knight must uphold divine law, punishing corruption and protecting the innocent.
3. **Mercy for the Worthy** – Kaya’s grace is given freely to those who seek redemption; only the irredeemable must be cast into darkness.
4. **Purity of Heart, Purity of Purpose** – A knight’s soul must remain untainted by greed, cruelty, or selfish ambition.
5. **Shield the Weak, Smite the Wicked** – The strong exist to serve, not to oppress.
6. **The Dawn Never Falters** – When hope seems lost, remember that Kaya’s light will always return.
7. **Words are Light, Actions are Fire** – Speak the truth, but let your deeds prove your faith.
8. **The Soul is a Sacred Flame** – Each life is a spark of divine creation; guard it fiercely.
9. **Fear Not Death, Only Dishonor** – A knight’s body may perish, but their deeds will shine in eternity.
10. **Kaya’s Will is Supreme** – When in doubt, look to the sacred light for guidance.

These tenets serve as the moral foundation of the Order. A knight breaking them risks censure, penance, or even exile.
entries.obsidianPath: Azterra_world/Guilds/Knights of the Order/The Code of Radiance.md

entries.title: The Dawn Vigil
entries.body:
### **The Dawn Vigil** (Daily Worship & Meditation)

The **Dawn Vigil** is a sacred ritual performed by all knights **at sunrise**, regardless of where they are. It is both an individual and communal practice that reinforces their connection to Kaya.
#### **Daily Ritual:**

- Knights rise before dawn and **bathe in cold water**, symbolizing purification.
- They light a candle and kneel in silent meditation, reflecting on the tenets of the Code of Radiance.
- In temples or fortresses, knights **chant a hymn** to Kaya as the sun rises:

_"Light of the world, banish the night;  
Grant us wisdom, strength, and sight.  
By Kaya’s grace, we stand so tall,  
No shadow shall make us fall."_

- At the end of the vigil, knights perform a personal act of devotion—some fast until midday, others perform charitable deeds, while warriors dedicate their morning training to Kaya.

This practice strengthens the spiritual and mental resilience of the knights, ensuring that their faith remains unwavering.
entries.obsidianPath: Azterra_world/Guilds/Knights of the Order/The Dawn Vigil.md

entries.title: The Knight of Kaya: The First Champion
entries.summary: ### **The Knight of Kaya: The First Champion**
entries.body:
### **The Knight of Kaya: The First Champion**

#### **Prologue: The Light Bringer's Call**

Before the first rays of the sun illuminated the world, there was only darkness. In that primordial void, the goddess **Kaya**—the Light Bringer—awoke. The darkness was oppressive, and Kaya, radiant and determined, sought to dispel it. But to do so, Kaya needed a mortal champion, someone whose strength would match the vast power of the light.

As the first of many who would serve Kaya, **Seraya Lumara** was chosen—a woman of extraordinary skill, unwavering faith, and unmatched courage. She was not born into nobility or power, but she possessed a fierce heart, one forged by hardship and battle. She lived in a time where kingdoms warred for dominion over the land, and it was during a siege of her village that she first encountered Kaya’s divine radiance.

---

#### **Chapter 1: Seraya’s Calling**

Seraya, the daughter of humble farmers, grew up hearing stories of the gods—of their power, their justice, and their cruelty. Her village had been ravaged by war, and her family had been caught in the crossfire. But in the darkness of night, when the soldiers had set fire to the town, she witnessed a radiant figure descending from the sky: Kaya, bathed in brilliant light, standing as the embodiment of hope against the encroaching forces of chaos.

In a moment of divine grace, Kaya’s voice filled Seraya’s mind. _"You, child of the land, will carry my light. Rise up, for the world is mired in darkness, and I have chosen you to break it."_ Seraya knelt before Kaya, heart pounding, and accepted the call.

---

#### **Chapter 2: Trials of the Radiant Path**

Kaya did not simply grant Seraya power; she subjected her to a series of trials to prove her worth. Seraya faced not only her physical limits but also her inner turmoil. The first trial took place in the **Forest of Shadows**, where Seraya had to face her own fears and confront the darkness inside her heart.

In the **Cavern of Reflection**, Seraya had to retrieve the **Lightstone**, an artifact that would become the source of her divine power. The stone, however, was guarded by a fierce and ancient guardian—a serpent of smoke and ash. To defeat it, Seraya was forced to wield not just strength but wisdom. She learned that only through understanding and compassion could the serpent be overcome, its rage quelled by the understanding that all creatures, even those of darkness, seek the light.

The trials were not just physical but spiritual. The essence of her character was tested—her resolve, her integrity, and her loyalty to Kaya’s light. After many trials, Seraya emerged not just as a warrior, but as a **Lightbringer**, wielding a blade forged from the **Lightstone** itself, a sword that could cleave through shadow and bring justice to the land.

---

#### **Chapter 3: The War of Darkness**

As Seraya returned from her trials, she found the world in chaos. The war between gods had escalated. THING's followers sought to extinguish the light, believing that the world should return to its primordial state of nothingness.

Seraya, now the Knight of Kaya, was called upon to lead the charge against them. Her first battle was at the **Battle of the Sunset Sky**, where her blade cleaved through THING’s forces, and her radiance blazed across the battlefield, banishing the darkness that had lingered there for so long. It was said that the skies themselves parted as her sword struck, sending a wave of pure light across the land, revealing a sunset at the end of her blade.

The **Knight of Kaya** became a symbol of hope, not just to her people, but to all who sought light in their hearts. Legends say that she could heal the sick with a touch, dispel curses with a word, and command the very elements with her will. As her fame spread, so too did her enemies.

---

#### **Chapter 4: The Final Sacrifice**

Seraya’s greatest trial came when the THING unleashed the **Obsidian Wyrm**, a creature born of darkness itself, capable of destroying entire cities. To defeat the wyrm, Seraya would need to channel all of Kaya’s power into a single, devastating blow. But doing so would come at a great cost: it would burn away her mortal essence, leaving only her soul, a shard of light that would live on forever.

In the **Desolate Valley**, the final battle raged. Seraya faced the **Obsidian Wyrm** alone, her blade aglow with Kaya’s radiance. As the wyrm loomed over her, Seraya lifted her sword high, and the heavens themselves answered her call. With a single stroke, she pierced the wyrm’s heart, but in doing so, she vanished, her mortal form consumed by the light.

Her body was never found, but her spirit lived on in the hearts of those who still carried her story. The light of Kaya had passed on to the world, and Seraya’s legacy would inspire generations of knights, priests, and warriors to come.

---

#### **Chapter 5: The Artifacts of Seraya Lumara**

Only remnants of Seraya’s existence remain: her sword, **Luminata**, an unblemished blade forged from the very heart of the Lightstone, and her armor, which radiates an ethereal glow and is said to be indestructible. These artifacts have been passed down through the centuries, hidden in sacred places, guarded by the **Knights of the Order**.

Legends say that those who are worthy can wield Luminata, but it will only respond to those who have the same purity of heart as Seraya. The **Radiant Shield**, a shield blessed by Kaya herself, is said to have been part of her equipment, capable of repelling any shadow, but it was lost in time.

Some say that Seraya’s spirit still watches over the world, guiding the chosen champions who bear her name. Her story is told as a lesson in selflessness, devotion, and the eternal battle between light and darkness.
entries.obsidianPath: Azterra_world/Guilds/Knights of the Order/The Knight of Kaya (Seraya Lumara).md

entries.title: The Oath of Illumination
entries.summary: ### **The Oath of Illumination** (The Knight’s Binding Vow)
entries.body:
### **The Oath of Illumination** (The Knight’s Binding Vow)

Before being fully recognized as a knight, an initiate must take the **Oath of Illumination**—a solemn vow made before Kaya’s sacred flame, binding their **soul, honor, and purpose** to the Order.

#### **The Ritual:**

- The initiate kneels within the **Grand Cathedral of Kaya**, their right hand over their heart, left hand raised to the heavens.
- A **Cleric of the Eternal Flame** anoints them with blessed oil, symbolizing Kaya’s grace.
- They recite the Oath:

_"By the Light that guides and the Dawn that rises, I pledge my soul to Kaya's eternal radiance. I shall wield my blade in justice, my shield in mercy, and my heart in faith. The darkness shall not claim me, nor shall fear shatter my resolve. I stand as a beacon against the abyss, and I shall never falter. Kaya, bear witness to my oath, and may your light forever dwell within me."_

- The **Eternal Flame** burns bright for those whose hearts are true. A flickering flame signals uncertainty, requiring further meditation before the oath can be accepted.
- Once accepted, the knight’s **cloak and armor are blessed**, marking their official entry into the Order.
entries.obsidianPath: Azterra_world/Guilds/Knights of the Order/The Oath of Illumination.md

entries.title: The Order's Ladder of Power
entries.body:
### **1. Grand Hierarchy**

- **Grandmaster of the Order** – The supreme leader, chosen through divine vision or council vote. Serves as both the spiritual and military head of the Order, interpreting Kaya’s will and guiding the knights accordingly.
- **High Templars** – The ruling council of the Order, composed of seasoned knights, scholars, and clerics. They ensure the doctrine of Kaya is upheld and oversee the Order's various branches across the land.
- **Knight Commanders** – Leaders stationed in major cities or regions, responsible for enforcing the Order’s laws, training recruits, and managing local affairs.

### **2. Religious & Military Ranks**

- **Paladins of the Dawn** – Elite warriors who act as Kaya’s chosen, wielding divine magic and leading crusades against darkness.
- **Templars of Radiance** – Holy warriors trained in both scripture and combat, responsible for maintaining temples and guarding relics.
- **Wardens of the Sacred Light** – The Order’s investigators and emissaries, ensuring that heresy, corruption, and dark magic are rooted out.
- **Clerics of the Eternal Flame** – The spiritual heart of the Order, responsible for performing sacred rites, blessings, and healings.




To Do: Fill in docs for the rest of the Order
entries.obsidianPath: Azterra_world/Guilds/Knights of the Order/The Order's Ladder of Power.md

entries.title: The Tome of Eternal Dawn
entries.body:
### **The Tome of Eternal Dawn**

**Description:**  
The _Tome of Eternal Dawn_ is one of the most sacred relics of the **Knights of the Order**, said to have been written by **[[The Knight of Kaya (Seraya Lumara)]]** herself under divine guidance from Kaya. The book is bound in radiant silver-white leather, its cover adorned with a golden sunburst sigil. The pages, made from an unknown material, never age or decay, and they glow faintly in darkness.

The tome is believed to hold **Kaya’s divine wisdom**, sacred hymns, lost knowledge, and even spells granted by the god of light. It is said that only those truly devoted to Kaya can read its full contents, as lesser beings perceive only blank pages or blinding radiance.

---

### **Contents of the Tome**

The _Tome of Eternal Dawn_ is divided into several sections, each with profound religious and magical significance.

#### **1. The Song of Light (Divine Hymns & Prayers)**

A collection of **hymns, prayers, and chants** believed to invoke Kaya’s blessings. When sung or recited, these words amplify the faith of the devoted and can even channel divine magic. Some of the most well-known hymns include:

- **The Dawn’s Embrace** – A morning prayer that strengthens one’s spirit and repels corruption.
- **The Lament of the Fallen** – A hymn sung for knights who have perished, ensuring their souls pass safely into the divine radiance.
- **The Radiant Chorus** – A battle chant that emboldens warriors and blinds their enemies.

---

#### **2. The Teachings of Seraya (Moral & Philosophical Writings)**

A collection of **Seraya’s wisdom**, written during her time as Kaya’s champion. These passages serve as guidance for the knights and priests of the Order, reinforcing the importance of justice, compassion, and unwavering resolve.

- _“The light does not waver, nor does it falter. Those who walk in its path must be steady, for even the smallest flicker can ignite a beacon.”_
- _“To wield the light is not to banish the dark, but to give hope to those trapped within it.”_
- _“A blade in darkness is a tool of war, but a blade in light is a tool of salvation.”_

These teachings form the core of **the Knightly Code**, and knights often memorize entire passages as part of their training.

---

#### **3. The Dawnforged Mysteries (Divine Magic & Rituals)**

This section contains **forbidden knowledge**—holy spells and rituals that only the highest-ranking priests and paladins may access. These incantations are written in a celestial script that mortals can barely comprehend, and attempting to misuse them can result in devastating consequences.

- **The Light’s Mantle** – A ritual that allows a knight to be temporarily imbued with Kaya’s divine essence, glowing with pure light and striking down shadow.
- **Eclipse Banishment** – A powerful exorcism that can purge entire regions of darkness and demonic corruption.
- **The Everlasting Beacon** – A lost spell said to summon Kaya’s own radiance, burning away all evil in a massive explosion of divine light.

Some believe that Seraya herself used these spells during the **War of Darkness**, but many of them have been lost to time.

---

#### **4. The Prophecies of the Eternal Dawn**

One of the tome’s **most mysterious sections**, filled with cryptic visions of the future. These prophecies, supposedly dictated by Kaya to Seraya in her final days, predict great trials and the coming of a second Lightbringer.

- **The Return of the Obsidian Wyrm** – A prophecy warning that the darkness Seraya banished may one day rise again.
- **The Shattering of the Lightstone** – A passage foretelling the fragmentation of Kaya’s power and the quest to restore it.
- **The Dawn Reborn** – The prophecy of a new knight, destined to wield Seraya’s blade and lead the world into an era of golden light.

No one knows when these prophecies will come to pass, but scholars and priests continue to study them, searching for signs in the world.

---

### **Powers of the Tome**

The _Tome of Eternal Dawn_ is more than a book—it is a **divine artifact** with mystical properties. Some of its rumored abilities include:

- **Illumination** – The book glows in the presence of evil, warning of nearby darkness.
- **Healing Words** – When read aloud, its passages can mend wounds and cure afflictions.
- **Barrier of Light** – In times of great need, the tome can project a protective shield, shielding the faithful from harm.
- **Hidden Knowledge** – The tome reveals different passages to different readers, showing only what they are ready to understand.

entries.title: Elverdeen shit
entries.summary: Key ideas: Diversity, Culture of the People, Festivals, History (Founding/Important events), Public Spaces(Naming specific locations and their role)
entries.body:
Key ideas: Diversity, Culture of the People, Festivals, History (Founding/Important events), Public Spaces(Naming specific locations and their role)


- **Historical Background**: Every city has a history that plays a significant role in its cultural identity. Understanding key events, migrations, or social movements that shaped the city can give insights into the values, conflicts, and traditions present today.
    
- **Local Traditions & Festivals**: These are deeply rooted cultural practices, rituals, and celebrations unique to the city. They can include annual festivals, religious observances, or traditional performances that reflect the collective identity of the people.
    
- **Art & Architecture**: A city's architectural style and public art speak volumes about its cultural values, historical periods, and aesthetic preferences. Iconic landmarks, street art, and local design trends can offer a window into the city's soul.
    
- **Cuisine**: The food scene often reflects the city’s geography, climate, history, and cultural diversity. Local dishes, street food, and the dining culture tell you a lot about the daily life and social dynamics.
    
- **Language & Dialects**: The language spoken in the city and any regional dialects or slang can influence communication, identity, and belonging. This can also include non-verbal communication, such as gestures or body language.
    
- **Social Norms & Values**: These are the unspoken rules that govern interactions, behavior, and expectations within a city. They can be shaped by religion, political views, or long-standing traditions, such as attitudes toward individualism, collectivism, or authority.
    
- **Artistic Expression**: Whether through literature, theater, music, or dance, artistic practices in the city contribute to its cultural narrative. Understanding the local creative scene, from famous authors to indie music groups, can provide insight into how residents view themselves and their world.
    
- **Cultural Diversity & Inclusivity**: The extent to which a city embraces diversity, such as racial, ethnic, or cultural differences, plays a huge role in shaping its cultural landscape. Understanding how various communities interact and coexist helps in appreciating the city's complex identity.
    
- **Economic Practices**: The way a city's economy functions—whether through trade, industry, or tech innovation—often impacts its cultural dynamics. For example, a city with a thriving tech industry might prioritize innovation and education, while a port city may celebrate global connectivity.
    
- **Values around Education & Innovation**: A city’s approach to education, creativity, and innovation often aligns with its values and aspirations. Universities, research centers, and the local attitude toward learning can reveal much about how a city views progress.
    
- **Public Spaces & Social Life**: Parks, plazas, cafes, markets, and other gathering spots serve as cultural hubs where people engage socially. The design and use of these spaces can influence the city's communal identity.

entries.title: The Birth of O-Block: The Dark Legacy of Elverdeen
entries.summary: ### The Birth of O-Block: The Dark Legacy of Elverdeen
entries.body:
### The Birth of O-Block: The Dark Legacy of Elverdeen

Three centuries ago, in the heart of the grand city of Elverdeen, King Varros the Ever-Ambitious sat upon his throne, consumed by a single, desperate obsession—eternal life. He was a ruler of unmatched cunning, a master of war and politics, yet all his power was meaningless against the relentless march of time. As his body aged and his strength waned, he scoured the lands of Azterra for a cure to mortality.

Among the many forbidden answers he uncovered, one stood above the rest: the hearts of elves. Their unnaturally long lifespans were said to hold the secret to delaying death itself. At first, Varros sent his royal hunters to harvest these organs in secret, raiding elven villages under the guise of border skirmishes. But as his need grew more urgent and his body continued to wither, he abandoned subtlety altogether.

Instead of outlawing the trade of elf hearts, he allowed a black market to fester in the underbelly of Elverdeen. What began as a handful of desperate traders dealing in stolen organs soon became something far greater. Smugglers, assassins, slavers, and alchemists flocked to the city's forgotten districts, carving out a lawless realm known as O-Block—short for the “Organ Block,” named for the dark trade that birthed it.

Varros never found his immortality. Despite consuming countless elixirs distilled from elven hearts, he died at the age of 67—a husk of a man, twisted and broken by his own obsession. But the black market he had nurtured did not perish with him.

Over the centuries, O-Block grew beyond its grim origins. The trade of elf hearts remained, but it became just one piece of a vast underground empire. Cursed relics, stolen artifacts, forbidden tomes, poisons, and even creatures from the depths of Azterra’s most twisted corners—all found their way through O-Block’s labyrinthine alleys. It became a city within a city, governed by its own ruthless lords, where gold and blood were the only laws that mattered.

Now, 326 years later, O-Block is stronger than ever. Even the rulers of Elverdeen dare not challenge its dominion. Kings have come and gone, but the black market remains—an immortal legacy of the man who sought to defy death and instead gave birth to something far darker.

### The Shadow Spreads: O-Block Across Azterra

Though O-Block was born in the heart of Elverdeen, it did not remain confined to its streets for long. As the centuries passed, its influence spread like a creeping plague, reaching into every major human city across Azterra. Wherever there was gold to be made from forbidden trade, O-Block took root.

In [NAME 1], a city known for its sprawling docks and lucrative maritime trade, O-Block’s presence thrives in the form of smugglers who move illicit goods under the cover of legitimate shipping companies. Here, rare magical artifacts, stolen relics, and contraband alchemical substances change hands in candlelit backrooms, their origins buried beneath layers of false records.

In [NAME 2], where the noble class revels in excess and indulgence, O-Block has woven itself into high society. Assassins, poisoners, and flesh traders cater to the dark desires of the elite, while secret auctions offer cursed treasures and forbidden knowledge to those willing to pay in blood. Even the city’s most powerful lords whisper the name O-Block with a mix of fear and admiration, knowing that the hand that feeds them today may slit their throat tomorrow.

In [NAME 3], a city built atop ancient ruins, O-Block’s trade is in secrets. Forgotten tomes, lost spells, and artifacts of terrifying power flow through hidden vaults beneath the streets. The city’s scholars and mages often find themselves entangled in its dealings, some willing participants, others trapped in debts they can never repay.

Now, O-Block is more than a district—it is an empire of crime spanning Azterra. Each city’s branch operates with a degree of independence, adapting to local conditions, yet all remain connected through a vast network of smugglers, informants, and enforcers. Gold, blood, and power flow endlessly through its veins, ensuring that no ruler, no law, and no force of nature can ever truly erase it.

O-Block was born from the ambition of a dead king. Now, it belongs to the world.

  
  
  
  

### The Lords and Factions of O-Block

O-Block is not a monolith—it is a shifting web of power, ruled by factions and lords who each hold dominion over different aspects of the black market. While some work together in uneasy alliances, others are locked in silent wars, their conflicts fought in blood and gold beneath the notice of kings and emperors.

#### 1. The Bloodied Veil (Assassins & Enforcers)

The Bloodied Veil is the silent blade of O-Block, a network of assassins, enforcers, and bounty hunters who enforce contracts with ruthless efficiency. No one truly knows who leads them, for their highest members hide behind masks of flayed skin, a reminder of their first kill. Payment is accepted in gold, secrets, or life debts—those who cannot pay often find themselves recruited into the Veil, trained in the ways of silent execution. Their motto is simple: Death is a currency all men will one day spend.

#### 2. The Gilded Maw (Smugglers & Contraband Dealers)

If there is something illegal to be moved, the Gilded Maw will get it where it needs to go. This faction specializes in smuggling, moving everything from enchanted weapons to entire kidnapped noble families across borders unseen. Their influence runs deepest in [NAME 1], where their control over the docks ensures that not a single ship enters or leaves without their knowledge. Their leader, known only as Lord Harrow, is said to have a ledger detailing every illicit transaction in Azterra—a ledger no one has ever seen and lived to speak of.

#### 3. The Ebon Ledger (Relic Traders & Forbidden Knowledge)

O-Block is not just about physical goods—knowledge is power, and no one understands this better than the Ebon Ledger. This faction deals in stolen tomes, lost spells, and artifacts too dangerous for the world above. Their members are scholars and occultists, willing to trade secrets in exchange for even darker truths. The leader of the Ledger is Master Quell, an ancient figure rumored to have lived for over a century, sustained by the very artifacts he sells.

#### 4. The Crimson Tide (Flesh Trade & Slave Lords)

The Crimson Tide deals in flesh—willing or otherwise. Slavery is their primary business, but their influence extends to gladiator pits, body modifications, and exotic transformations using alchemical or magical means. Their most grotesque operations involve elf hearts, a trade that has never fully died since the days of King Varros. Their leader, Madame Nyza, is a former noblewoman whose body is stitched together from countless donors, her youth and power preserved at a terrible cost.

#### 5. The Rot-Touched (Monstrous Entities & Experimental Alchemy)

Nowhere is O-Block’s adaptability more evident than in Kyrathys, where the Rot-Touched thrive. This faction specializes in the capture, study, and manipulation of monstrous entities—particularly slimes. They have found ways to use the creatures as weapons, as enforcers, and even as alchemical resources. Their leader, Doctor Ylric, is a former mage who was consumed by a sentient slime and now exists in a half-dissolved state, his body shifting between human and ooze. He speaks through a mouth that is never in the same place twice, whispering of a future where the living and the formless become one.

### The Unseen Hand: The Hidden Lords of O-Block

Though the factions wage war and strike deals, there is whispered talk of greater forces pulling the strings. Some believe O-Block itself is ruled by an unseen council, figures who have remained in power for centuries, their influence stretching across Azterra. Others claim that the market serves something even darker—an entity that does not trade in gold, but in something far more valuable.

For those who rule O-Block, wealth is only a means to an end. Power, after all, is the only currency that never devalues.

  
  
  
  
**

- **Notable Features:** The _Briarford Crossing_, an ancient stone bridge said to be enchanted for protection. The town’s annual _Riverlights Festival_ draws visitors from nearby cities.

entries.body:

- **Resources:** Timber, handcrafted furniture, wagons, carpentry tools
    
- **Economy:** Woodworking guilds dominate the economy, exporting fine carpentry to [[Serathiel]] and [[Regalia Prime]].
    
- **Notes:** Proximity to major trade routes makes [[Halvis]] a hub for overland caravans.

entries.title: Oakreach
entries.body:
### **Oakreach**

- **Population:** 8,000
    
- **Description:** Oakreach is a small yet prosperous logging village nestled along the edges of [[The Warrens]]. Towering oaks and dense woodlands surround the town, providing abundant timber resources. The village is known for its skilled woodworkers, who craft everything from simple furniture to ornate carvings infused with traces of ambient forest magic.
    
- **Leader:** Warden Elsira Thornwood, a half-elf ranger respected for her deep knowledge of The Warrens and its magical ecosystems.
    
- **Resources:**
    
    - High-quality oak and rare enchanted woods sourced from the outskirts of [[The Warrens]]
        
    - Handcrafted woodwork, including furniture, sculptures, and decorative panels
        
- **Economy:**
    
    - Oakreach exports timber and artisan woodwork primarily to [[Halvis]]s and [[Regalia Prime]].
        
    - Seasonal fairs featuring enchanted wooden goods attract merchants and collectors from across Regalia.
        
- **Notable Features:**
    
    - **Thornwood Timberyards:** The heart of Oakreach's lumber industry, where timber is processed and traded.
        
    - **Verdant Hollow:** A sacred grove on the village outskirts believed to be blessed by forest spirits, where locals perform rituals for protection and prosperity.
        
    - **The Green Path:** A guarded trail leading into [[The Warrens]], used by hunters, herbalists, and mages seeking rare materials.
        
- **Notes:** Oakreach maintains a delicate balance with [[The Warrens]], respecting the boundaries set by the magical creatures within. Warden Thornwood ensures that timber harvesting remains sustainable, and local traditions emphasize harmony with the forest.

entries.body:

- **Notes:** Hosts _The Harvest Feast_, celebrating seasonal yields with visitors from Kyrathys.

entries.title: The Warrens
entries.body:
### **The Warrens**

- **Description:** The Warrens is a vast, magic-dense forest where the veil between the material world and arcane realms is thin. Luminescent flora lines winding paths, and ancient trees hum with latent power. Mystical streams run with shimmering waters believed to have healing properties.
    
- **Inhabitants:**
    
    - **Sylphs and Dryads:** Guardians of the forest's oldest groves, maintaining the balance of its magical energies.
        
    - **Arcane Foxes:** Ethereal creatures that glow faintly at night, believed to be messengers of forest spirits.
        
    - **Luminelk:** Large, antlered beasts with crystalline horns that store arcane energy, sought after by mages.
        
    - **Warren Wisps:** Flickering orbs of magic said to lead travelers to either fortune or peril.
	    
    - **Wildfire Bunnies**: Mass-reproducing creatures who appear similar to Rabbits, unknown as to how they feed. 
        
- **Notable Locations:**
    
    - **The Heartglade:** A central clearing where magic is strongest; rituals and summoning ceremonies are often performed here.
        
    - **Silverroot Grove:** Trees with silvery bark said to contain ancient enchantments, loved by scholars.
        
    - **Echoing Hollows:** Deep caverns beneath the forest that amplify magical sounds, rumored to house slumbering arcane beings.
		
    - **[[Taurial Forest]]**: Hidden Village of High Elves, vowing to protect the creatures of the warrens from evildoers
        
- **Economy & Resources:**
    
    - Rare magical herbs and alchemical ingredients
        
    - Enchanted wood used in crafting staffs and wands
        
    - Crystalized mana shards found near arcane convergence points
        
- **Notes:** The Warrens is both revered and feared. While it is a place of immense magical knowledge and resources, those who enter unprepared risk being lost forever to its shifting paths and arcane guardians.

entries.title: "Brady (Clod)"
entries.body:
![[Clod.png]]

Duergar

Birthplace: [[The Underdark]]
Owns: [[The Egg]]

Born - MOTHER DEAD
Orphanage - till 6

Surface - at 61

![[ClodCldoPlayerSheet.pdf]]

entries.title: "**Brady’s Character - Clod the Duergar**"
entries.body:
#### **Brady’s Character - Clod the Duergar**
[[Brady (Clod)]]

- **Early Life**:
    
    - Grew up in the Underdark, surviving in the harsh depths.
        
    - Had little to no interaction with the dwarven kingdom but was aware of its existence through black-market dealings.
        
- **Discovery of the Egg**:
    
    - Found in a deep tunnel connected to the dwarven kingdom’s ruins.
        
    - The egg was unearthed with the help of subterranean creatures, possibly a species of sentient ants.
        
    - The egg is mysterious, absorbing life force from other creatures to sustain itself, feeding through hidden tendrils.
        
    - Clod’s black-market dealings revolved around acquiring rare magical foods to nourish the egg, keeping its nature a secret.
        
- **Current Goals**:
    
    - Unraveling the nature of the egg and its origins.
        
    - Learning the true reason behind the fall of the dwarven side castle and the theft of its magical artifacts.
        
    - Eventually discovering what the egg “wants” and why it was hidden beneath the kingdom.


### **The Trader and the Egg** 

The egg was hungry again. Clod moved through the tangled alleys of O-Block, past shifting eyes and muttered conversations. The air reeked of damp stone and burning incense, but he ignored it. His destination never changed. **Marlund** was waiting, hunched behind a cluttered counter, his thick fingers turning a dagger over in his palm. His shop was more of a hoard, stacked high with magical trinkets, bottled curses, and artifacts that hummed with forgotten power. As Clod approached, Marlund grunted. He didn’t smile, didn’t smirk. He never did. He just reached beneath the counter and pulled out a small vial. Inside, the substance shifted, pulsing in slow, unnatural waves. Clod took it. The egg stirred. Marlund leaned back, watching him. “Ever wonder what you’re feeding it?” His voice was low, like gravel being ground down. Clod stared. The egg pulsed. Marlund exhaled through his nose, shaking his head. “Didn’t think so.” Clod turned and left, the vial disappearing into his pack. The egg was silent now, satisfied—for the moment. He reached into his pouch, letting the ants crawl between his fingers. They never asked questions. ### **Marlund: Merchant of the Forbidden** Marlund is a gruff, no-nonsense trader who runs a cluttered shop deep in O-Block, specializing in strange and dangerous magical artifacts. His store is a chaotic jumble of relics, cursed objects, and potent magical items—everything from enchanted daggers to forbidden tomes, all with a dark history. The air smells of incense and ancient power, and the shelves are packed with bottles of glowing liquids, each holding a secret. Marlund doesn’t explain his goods or where he gets them. He doesn’t have to. Those who seek him out already know what they’re after, and his reputation for providing rare, dangerous items is unmatched. He’s blunt, uninterested in small talk, and gives no guidance to those who buy from him. If the price is right, the item is yours—regardless of the consequences.


### Legend of the underdark

In the depths of the Underdark, they speak in hushed tones of a warrior who walks unseen upon the surface, a phantom of retribution. No name is given, only titles—**the Shadow of Freedom, the Chainbreaker, the Last Darkness.** To the freefolk below, this figure is no mere assassin but a symbol, a force striking against the self-proclaimed righteous. The paladins of light have long sought to impose their will, shaping the world in their god’s image even after his death. But where they bring order, chains follow. And so, the shadow rises to sever them. The surface tells a different tale. There, the legend is one of blood and terror, whispered by frightened paladins and wary travelers. They say that in the dead of night, torches flicker and snuff out without warning. A cold wind follows, though no storm brews. Then, the killings begin—merciless, efficient, leaving no trace but bodies drained of their light. Each paladin, found with their holy powers sucked dry-an empty husk of one who was once championed as a warrior of good. The paladins call it a monster, a demon clad in darkness, hunting them as if drawn by the very radiance they wield. To them, this is not a warrior, but a curse upon the world, a remnant of Krovi, seeking vengeance from beyond the grave. Yet no one has ever seen the shadow’s face. Survivors are rare, and those who claim to have glimpsed the figure cannot agree on the details. Some say they move faster than the eye can follow, others that they strike from afar without ever being seen. A few whisper that the shadow is not one person, but many, an endless tide of vengeance rising from the Underdark.

Mentored by [[Opta (Cordo's Mentor)]]
Is what many see as the symbol of freedom in [[The Underdark]]
A vigilante that kills paladins and servants of Kaya.
Possibly Father of [[Brady (Clod)]] 


In the depths of the Underdark, they speak in hushed tones of a warrior who walks unseen upon the surface, a phantom of retribution. No name is given, only titles—the Shadow of Freedom, the Chainbreaker, the Last Darkness. To the freefolk below, this figure is no mere assassin but a symbol, a force striking against the self-proclaimed righteous. The paladins of light have long sought to impose their will, shaping the world in their god’s image even after his death. But where they bring order, chains follow. And so, the shadow rises to sever them.

The surface tells a different tale. There, the legend is one of blood and terror, whispered by frightened paladins and wary travelers. They say that in the dead of night, torches flicker and snuff out without warning. A cold wind follows, though no storm brews. Then, the killings begin—merciless, efficient, leaving no trace but bodies drained of their light. Each paladin, found with their holy powers sucked dry-an empty husk of one who was once championed as a warrior of good. The paladins call it a monster, a demon clad in darkness, hunting them as if drawn by the very radiance they wield. To them, this is not a warrior, but a curse upon the world, a remnant of Krovi, seeking vengeance from beyond the grave.

Yet no one has ever seen the shadow’s face. Survivors are rare, and those who claim to have glimpsed the figure cannot agree on the details. Some say they move faster than the eye can follow, others that they strike from afar without ever being seen. A few whisper that the shadow is not one person, but many, an endless tide of vengeance rising from the Underdark.

The killings have not stopped. In the Underdark, they celebrate each fallen crusader. On the surface, fear spreads. The righteous cling to their faith, praying that the light will banish the darkness once and for all.

But the gods are dead. And the shadow remains.

entries.title: "**Rare magic Animal Parts (Enhanced Energy Gains)**"
entries.body:
## **Rare magic Animal Parts (Enhanced Energy Gains)**

### **Low Tier (Common)**

_(Easy to find, but minimal gains.)_

1. **Moonlit Moth Dust**
    
    - **Cost:** 50 gp
    - **Energy:** **4 points**
2. **Silver Spriggan Bark**
    
    - **Cost:** 70 gp
    - **Energy:** **5 points**
3. **Starberry Nectar**
    
    - **Cost:** 100 gp
    - **Energy:** **6 points**

---

### **Mid Tier (Uncommon)**

_(Better gains, modestly priced.)_

1. **Shadow Stag Antlers**
    
    - **Cost:** 250 gp
    - **Energy:** **15 points**
5. **Blink Fox Eyes**
    
    - **Cost:** 300 gp
    - **Energy:** **18 points**
6. **Gossamer Weaver Silk**
    
    - **Cost:** 350 gp
    - **Energy:** **22 points**
7. **Eldertree Sap**
    
    - **Cost:** 400 gp
    - **Energy:** **25 points**

---

### **High Tier (Rare)**

_(Excellent returns, worthy investments.)_

1. **Phase Panther Heart**
    
    - **Cost:** 600 gp
    - **Energy:** **45 points**
9. **Dream Beast Skull**
    
    - **Cost:** 750 gp
    - **Energy:** **52 points**
10. **Starborn Phoenix Feather**
    
    - **Cost:** 800 gp
    - **Energy:** **60 points**
11. **Crystal Ant Mandibles**
    
    - **Cost:** 850 gp
    - **Energy:** **65 points**

---

### **Elite Tier (Very Rare)**

_(Highly valuable, significant leaps in energy.)_

1. **Golden Ant Queen’s Royal Jelly**
    
    - **Cost:** 1,200 gp
    - **Energy:** **100 points**
13. **Wind Serpent’s Air Sac**
    
    - **Cost:** 1,400 gp
    - **Energy:** **120 points**
14. **Molten Scarab Husk**
    
    - **Cost:** 1,500 gp
    - **Energy:** **135 points**
15. **Scryer Beetle’s Third Eye**
    
    - **Cost:** 1,600 gp
    - **Energy:** **150 points**

---

### **Legendary Tier (Extremely Rare)**

_(Best possible energy-to-cost ratio, immediate progress.)_

1. **Heart of the Fey Prince**
    
    - **Cost:** 3,000 gp+
    - **Energy:** **300 points** _(Instantly pushes the queen through her next growth stage.)_
17. **Echoes of a Fey Giant’s Footsteps**
    
    - **Cost:** 3,500 gp+
    - **Energy:** **340 points**
18. **Root of the Elderglade Ygg-Seed**
    
    - **Cost:** 4,000 gp+
    - **Energy:** **400 points**

entries.title: "**Energy System:**"
entries.body:
## **Energy System:**

- **Daily Passive Energy:** 3 -> 5 points per day.
- **Energy from Basic Corpses:** 1 point per corpse (must be large enough).
- **Energy from *********-infused Animals: 10-20 points depending on rarity and potency.
- As the queen hatches, she starts with 6 energy.
---
## 🐜 **Ants After Queen Evolution – Stage I**

### **1. Soldier Ant** (3 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Form Up**  
    Soldiers lock together, creating an unbreakable shield wall that provides cover.
    
- **New Trait:** **Bulwark Step** – Gains advantage on Strength saves to avoid being moved or knocked prone when adjacent to another Soldier Ant.
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 16
        
    - **AC:** 14
        
    - **Attack:** Mandibles (+5 to hit, 1d6+3 piercing)
        

| Strength | Dexterity | Constitution | Intelligence | Wisdom | Charisma |
| -------- | --------- | ------------ | ------------ | ------ | -------- |
| 14 (+2)  | 14 (+2)   | 13 (+1)      | 4 (-3)       | 10 (0) | 6 (-2)   |
|          |           |              |              |        |          |

---

### **2. Worker Ant** (1 Energy Point)

- **Special Ability:** **Rapid Construction**  
    Builds bridges, ramps, or barriers from available materials or themselves within minutes.
    
- **New Trait:** **Anchor Grip** – Can climb vertical surfaces at normal speed and cling upside-down like a spider. Great for awkward terrain jobs.
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 10
        
    - **AC:** 10
        
    - **Attack:** Weak Bite (+2 to hit, 1d4 piercing)
        

|Strength|Dexterity|Constitution|Intelligence|Wisdom|Charisma|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|10 (0)|12 (+1)|12 (+1)|4 (-3)|10 (0)|5 (-3)|

---

### **3. Acid Spitter Ant** (4 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Corrosive Spray** _(REPLACED)_  
    Now fires **Slowing Mucus** – Target hit must make a DC 12 Dex save or have their speed halved for 1 minute.
    
- **New Trait:** **Sticky Residue** – Surfaces hit by missed shots become difficult terrain for 1 round.
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 12
        
    - **AC:** 8
        
    - **Attack:** Mucus Spit (+4 to hit, 1d6 acid + slow effect)
        

|Strength|Dexterity|Constitution|Intelligence|Wisdom|Charisma|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|8 (-1)|14 (+2)|10 (0)|5 (-3)|12 (+1)|4 (-3)|

---

### **4. Scout Ant** (2 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Shared Senses**  
    Clod can share this ant’s vision and hearing up to 500 ft.
    
- **New Trait:** **Phase Skitter** – Can Dash as a bonus action and move through enemy spaces as difficult terrain.  
    Can now **cast _Detect Magic_ 1/short rest**.
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 6
        
    - **AC:** 14
        
    - **Attack:** Tiny Bite (+5 to hit, 1d3 piercing)
        
    - **+6 Perception**, **+4 Stealth**
        

|Strength|Dexterity|Constitution|Intelligence|Wisdom|Charisma|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|6 (-2)|18 (+4)|8 (-1)|6 (-2)|14 (+2)|5 (-3)|

---

### **5. Guardian Ant** (6 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Guardian’s Resolve**  
    Sacrifices HP equal to blocked damage to protect an ally within 10 ft.
    
- **New Trait:** **Rooted Shell** – If it doesn't move on its turn, gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing until its next turn.
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 24
        
    - **AC:** 17
        
    - **Attack:** Heavy Mandibles (+6 to hit, 1d8+3 piercing)
        

|Strength|Dexterity|Constitution|Intelligence|Wisdom|Charisma|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|18 (+4)|10 (0)|16 (+3)|3 (-4)|12 (+1)|6 (-2)|

---

### **6. Burrowing Ant** (4 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Instant Tunnel**  
    Digs a short tunnel up to 20 ft. quickly.
    
- **New Trait:** **Burrow Sense** – Can detect nearby vibrations within 30 ft while underground (tremorsense 30 ft).
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 18
        
    - **AC:** 13
        
    - **Attack:** Mandibles (+5 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing)
        

| Strength | Dexterity | Constitution | Intelligence | Wisdom | Charisma |
| -------- | --------- | ------------ | ------------ | ------ | -------- |
| 12 (+1)  | 14 (+2)   | 14 (+2)      | 4 (-3)       | 11 (0) | 5 (-3)   |

---

### **7. Bombardier Ant** (3 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Explosive Demise**  
    Explodes on death or command, dealing 6d6 fire in a 10 ft radius (Dex save DC 14).
    
- **New Trait:** **Delayed Burst** – Glows and emits a high-pitched whine 1 round before detonation, allowing allies to reposition.
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 4
        
    - **AC:** 14
        
    - **Attack:** Bite (+3 to hit, 1d4 piercing)
        

| Strength | Dexterity | Constitution | Intelligence | Wisdom  | Charisma |
| -------- | --------- | ------------ | ------------ | ------- | -------- |
| 8 (-1)   | 16 (+3)   | 10 (0)       | 5 (-3)       | 13 (+1) | 6 (-2)   |
|          |           |              |              |         |          |

---

### **8. Drone Ant** (3 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Amplified Hive Mind**  
    Extends Clod's command range by 300 ft and allows precise control of all active ants.
    
- **New Trait:** **Hive Echo** – Once per short rest, can repeat Clod’s last command across all ants instantly as a free action.  
    **Beacon Relay** – Link with another drone extends control range further.
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 12
        
    - **AC:** 11
        
    - **Attack:** Bite (+2 to hit, 1d4 piercing)
        

|Strength|Dexterity|Constitution|Intelligence|Wisdom|Charisma|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|7 (-2)|14 (+2)|12 (+1)|6 (-2)|15 (+2)|10 (0)|

entries.body:
## **Energy System:**

- **Daily Passive Energy:** 3 points per day.
- **Energy from Basic Corpses:** 1 point per corpse (must be large enough).
- **Energy from *********-infused Animals: 10-20 points depending on rarity and potency.
- As the queen hatches, she starts with 6 energy.
---

## **Ant Types & Energy Costs**

### **1. Soldier Ant** (3 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Form Up**  
    Soldiers lock together, creating an unbreakable shield wall that provides cover.
    
- **Appearance:**  
    Thick-plated, chitinous armor runs along their broad backs, shimmering with an almost metallic sheen. Their mandibles are jagged, designed to shear through tough hide and armor alike. Their legs are sturdy, ending in sharp claw-like grips that allow them to brace against any force.
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 12 | **AC:** 12
    - **Attack:** Mandibles (+4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing damage)

| Strength | Dexterity | Constitution | Intelligence | Wisdom | Charisma |
| -------- | --------- | ------------ | ------------ | ------ | -------- |
| 14 (+2)  | 14 (+2)   | 13 (+1)      | 4 (-3)       | 10 (0) | 6 (-2)   |

---

### **2. Worker Ant** (1 Energy Point)

- **Special Ability:** **Rapid Construction**  
    Quickly builds bridges, ramps, or barriers from available materials or themselves within minutes.
    
- **Appearance:**  
    Smaller and more compact than the others, their legs are lined with tiny hooked claws for gripping onto surfaces. Their backs are segmented into flexible ridges, allowing them to pile onto each other with ease. Can carry a LOT of weight. 
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 8 | **AC:** 8
    - **Attack:** Weak Bite (+2 to hit, 1d4 piercing damage)

| Strength | Dexterity | Constitution | Intelligence | Wisdom | Charisma |
| -------- | --------- | ------------ | ------------ | ------ | -------- |
| 10 (0)   | 12 (+1)   | 12 (+1)      | 4 (-3)       | 10 (0) | 5 (-3)   |

---

### **3. Acid Spitter Ant** (4 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Corrosive Burst**  
    Fires a glob of acid that corrodes armor, reducing target's AC by 2 for one minute (DC 12 Dex save negates).
    
- **Appearance:**  
    Slender and elongated, their carapace is covered in small pulsating sacs filled with a glowing green liquid. Their abdomen is most of their body mass, a giant sac that creates acid. Their mandibles constantly drip with a faintly sizzling substance, and their large, bulbous eyes shift between shades of deep emerald and amber. 
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 10 | **AC:** 7
    - **Attack:** Acid Spray (+3 to hit, 1d4 acid damage + 1d4 ongoing)

|Strength|Dexterity|Constitution|Intelligence|Wisdom|Charisma|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|8 (-1)|14 (+2)|10 (0)|5 (-3)|12 (+1)|4 (-3)|

---

### **4. Scout Ant** (2 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Shared Senses**  
    Clod can share the ant’s senses, scouting safely from a distance up to 500 ft.
    
- **Appearance:**  
    Thin and agile, their bodies seem to almost shimmer as they move, blending into their surroundings. Their antennae are long and fine, constantly twitching, detecting movements imperceptible to others. Their eyes appear like multifaceted pools of starlight.
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 5 | **AC:** 13
    - **Attack:** Tiny Bite (+4 to hit, 1d3 piercing damage)
    - +6 Perception
    - Can cast detect magic

|Strength|Dexterity|Constitution|Intelligence|Wisdom|Charisma|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|6 (-2)|18 (+4)|8 (-1)|6 (-2)|14 (+2)|5 (-3)|

---

### **5. Guardian Ant** (6 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Guardian’s Resolve**  
    Sacrifices its current HP equal to the damage (allowing overkill to 2x max health) to instantly block an incoming attack or spell aimed at an ally within 10 ft.
    
- **Appearance:**  
    Massive and imposing, its chitin gleams like polished obsidian. Deep ridges and cracks across its shell glow faintly with energy. Its mandibles are thicker and reinforced, designed not for attack but to absorb forceful blows.
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 20 | **AC:** 16
    - **Attack:** Heavy Mandibles (+5 to hit, 1d8+3 piercing damage)

|Strength|Dexterity|Constitution|Intelligence|Wisdom|Charisma|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|18 (+4)|10 (0)|16 (+3)|3 (-4)|12 (+1)|6 (-2)|

---

### **6. Burrowing Ant** (4 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Instant Tunnel**  
    Rapidly excavates a short tunnel (up to 20 ft.) usable by medium-sized creatures for surprise attacks or escapes.
    
- **Appearance:**  
    Stockier than the others, its mandibles are longer and jagged, reinforced for rapid burrowing. Its legs end in broad, spade-like protrusions, allowing it to dig with frightening speed.
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 16 | **AC:** 12
    - **Attack:** Mandibles (+4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing damage)

| Strength | Dexterity | Constitution | Intelligence | Wisdom | Charisma |
| -------- | --------- | ------------ | ------------ | ------ | -------- |
| 12 (+1)  | 14 (+2)   | 14 (+2)      | 4 (-3)       | 11 (0) | 5 (-3)   |

---

### **7. Bombardier Ant- Allahu Akbar!!!!** (3 Energy Points) 

- **Special Ability:** **Explosive Demise**  
    Upon death or command, explodes violently, dealing **8d6 fire damage** in a 5-foot radius (Dex save DC 12 for half damage).
    
- **Appearance:**  
    Its abdomen swells with an ominous glow, crackling with unstable energy. When agitated, its carapace vibrates audibly, and faint sparks arc between its limbs.
    
- **Stats:**
    - **HP:** 3 | **AC:** 13
    - **Attack:** Bite (+3 to hit, 1d4 piercing damage)

| Strength | Dexterity | Constitution | Intelligence | Wisdom  | Charisma |
| -------- | --------- | ------------ | ------------ | ------- | -------- |
| 8 (-1)   | 16 (+3)   | 10 (0)       | 5 (-3)       | 13 (+1) | 6 (-2)   |

---

### **8. Drone Ant** (3 Energy Points)

- **Special Ability:** **Amplified Hive Mind**  
    Temporarily increases Clod’s ant-command range and clarity, allowing precise orders across longer distances (up to 300 ft radius). Increases command over inferior ants.
    
- **Appearance:**  
    Unlike others, this ant has a long, slender body with intricate vein-like lines running across its shell. Its head is crowned with branching antennae that pulse faintly, relaying signals across vast distances.
    
- **Stats:**
    
    - **HP:** 10 | **AC:** 10
    - **Attack:** Bite (+2 to hit, 1d4 piercing damage)

|Strength|Dexterity|Constitution|Intelligence|Wisdom|Charisma|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|7 (-2)|14 (+2)|12 (+1)|6 (-2)|15 (+2)|10 (0)|


## **Commander Ant** (Unique – Ascended Soldier)

- **Special Role:**  
    Acts as a **tactical leader** for all ant units. Can issue commands that buff nearby ants or direct coordinated maneuvers. Only **one Commander Ant may exist at a time**. If downed, it can be revived by the Queen at a high energy cost or through a special ritual.

Resurrection Cost: 8 energy
**Special Abilities:**

- **Command Pulse (1/Day):** All ants within 30 ft. gain +1 to attack rolls and AC for 1 minute.
    
- **Fortify Line:** When nearby Soldier Ants activate **Form Up**, the Commander Ant allows them to also gain temporary HP equal to his Constitution modifier.
    
- **Warpath Charge (Recharge 5–6):** Charges in a straight line up to 30 ft., dealing 2d6+3 bludgeoning damage and knocking enemies prone on failed DC 13 Strength saves.
    
- **Tactical Revival:** If a non-commander ant dies within 10 ft., the Commander can instantly spend its reaction to transfer its own HP to revive it (minimum 1 HP to the revived ant).

**Appearance:**  
Towering over standard soldier ants, its armor is an iridescent black-blue, cracked with glowing veins of amber light. Its mandibles are not only weapons but also symbols of command, etched with ancient hive-marks. Two long antennae curve like horns, glowing faintly when issuing orders.

**Stats:**

- **HP:** 30 | **AC:** 16
    
- **Attack:** Commanding Mandibles (+6 to hit, 2d6+3 piercing)
    
- **Speed:** 30 ft.

| Strength | Dexterity | Constitution | Intelligence | Wisdom  | Charisma |
| -------- | --------- | ------------ | ------------ | ------- | -------- |
| 18 (+4)  | 12 (+1)   | 16 (+3)      | 6 (-2)       | 13 (+1) | 10 (0)   |

entries.title: "**Egg Growth & Tracking**"
entries.body:
#### **Egg Growth & Tracking**

##### **Tracking Info:**

- **Current Stage:** Stage 2 - Stirring
    
- **Food Level:** Moderate (Requires more Feywild nourishment)
    
- **Next Growth Requirement:** 1+ High-Tier Feywild Part
    

##### **Growth Stages & Abilities**

**Stage 2: Stirring (Current)**

- Clod has **minor control over ants**, able to influence their movements and direct them toward simple tasks.
    
- The ants begin acting with **unnatural intelligence**, occasionally assisting Clod without command.
    
- The egg’s whispers grow stronger, forming coherent thoughts in Clod’s mind.
    

**Stage 3: Cooperative Command**

- **Requirement:** 1+ high-tier Feywild part (ex: Blood of a Phase Panther, Starborn Phoenix Feather).
    
- **New Abilities:**
    
    - Clod can command ants to **coordinate** their movements, forming bridges, walls, or rudimentary shapes.
        
    - The ants begin to exhibit **more advanced problem-solving**, capable of carrying out more detailed orders.
        
    - The egg glows faintly, showing the first signs of life within.
        

**Stage 4: Juvenile Hatching**

- **Requirement:** A unique Feywild catalyst, something deeply tied to the Queen's lost power.
    
- **New Abilities:**
    
    - The egg hatches, revealing a **small Feywild Ant Queen**, about the size of a dog.
        
    - Clod no longer carries an egg but the young queen, who develops her own **stats and minor combat abilities**.
        
    - The queen can begin producing **larger, more specialized ants**, such as soldier ants for battle or worker ants for crafting.
        

**Stage 5: Emerging Colony**

- **Requirement:** Final infusion of Feywild energy.
    
- **New Abilities:**
    
    - Clod’s connection with the Queen strengthens, allowing him to **command ants in large numbers**.
        
    - The Queen’s power matures, creating **elite variants of Feywild ants**, such as guardian ants or burrowing scouts.
        
    - Clod’s ability to **communicate telepathically with the Queen** develops fully, allowing complex orders.
        
    - The Queen’s presence attracts the attention of powerful Feywild entities, drawing both allies and threats.
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Players/Brady (Clod) Folder/The Egg/Egg Stages.md

entries.title: "**Feywild Animal Parts & Meats for the Egg**"
entries.summary: ### **Feywild Animal Parts & Meats for the Egg**
entries.body:
### **Feywild Animal Parts & Meats for the Egg**

Marlund
#### **Low-Quality (Easier to Find, Cheaper, Slower Growth)**

1. **Evershroom Spores** – Fungi that grow in the shadows of Feywild trees, mildly nourishing.
2. **Silver Spriggan Bark** – Bits of enchanted wood with faint magical energy.
3. **Moonlit Moth Dust** – Harvested from Feywild moths, contains traces of essence.
4. **Starberry Extract** – A mildly enchanted berry that exists at the edges of the Feywild.
5. **Gossamer Threadworms** – Small, silk-producing worms from the **Weaving Glades**.
6. **Pixie Pollen** – A minor energy source, often infused into sweets or pastries in the black market

#### **Mid-Tier (Moderately Expensive, Satisfying but Not Transformative)**

1. **Shadow Stag Liver** – Taken from creatures that phase between worlds, rich in unstable energy.
2. **Blink Fox Tail Fur** – Contains lingering teleportation magic.
3. **Eldertree Sap** – Thick golden sap from the oldest Feywild trees, potent but rare.
4. **Chimeric Jackalope Horn** – Stores latent fey energies, ground into powder for consumption.
5. **Sylphic Cloud Honey** – A delicacy from Feywild air sprites, enhances magical potential.
6. **Dewdrop Wasp Venom** – From giant Feywild wasps, can fuel rapid bursts of magical energy.
7. **Glasswing Butterfly Chrysalis** – Holds raw Fey transformation magic, useful in feeding.
8. **Luminous Cavefish** – From underground Fey pools, glows with life energy.

#### **High-Tier (Incredibly Rare, Expensive, Accelerates the Egg’s Growth Significantly)**

1. **Heart of a Dream Beast** – Beasts that roam Feywild dreams; their hearts contain raw magic.
2. **Blood of a Phase Panther** – Grants immense life force when consumed.
3. **Starborn Phoenix Feather** – Holds the energy of Feywild rebirth.
4. **Echoes of a Fey Giant’s Footsteps** – Bottled resonance from an ancient Fey giant’s movements.
5. **Root of the Elderglade Ygg-Seed** – Ancient seed imbued with Fey life essence.
6. **Wings of the Last Fey Drake** – Extinct in most places, but rumored to still exist in secret.
7. **Golden Ant Queen’s Royal Jelly** – Produced only once in a Fey ant queen’s lifetime.
8. **Whispering Willow Essence** – Captures the voices of the ancient Feywild forests.
9. **Blood of a Fey Prince** – The most potent essence, rumored to accelerate the egg’s growth immediately.
