entries.title: "The Egg's voices"
entries.summary: "When the air trembles with forgotten whispers... when my hunger stirs the shadows beneath your feet... you will know."
entries.body:
"When the air trembles with forgotten whispers... when my hunger stirs the shadows beneath your feet... you will know."

- **"The ground is wrong. The air is wrong. I am wrong. Fix it."**
- **"Chittering things call to me, but their voices are faint. Feed me, and I will teach them to sing your name."**

- - **"They do not belong here… but they taste so sweet. More."**
- - **"Flesh is weak. Chitin is strong. You are weak… but I can change that."**

- **"Too many eyes. Too many hands. No mandibles. No purpose. Let me consume them."**
- **"The soil is hollow, the roots are starving... Find me something with a pulse."**
- **"I dream in hunger... and I see a feast wrapped in silver and bone. Bring me the marrow."**
- **"Silken threads, wet with ichor. Something small. Something that writhes."**
- **"I remember the golden fields, the scent of sweet rot. Bring me a piece of home, before I forget again."**

**"I cannot breathe the air as I once did… It is stale, heavy. I need something that has tasted the wind at the edge of the world, something that still remembers the sky."**
- **Item:** _Wind Serpent’s Air Sac_ – An organ that grants the Queen enhanced vitality and mobility.

**"My children stumble, their limbs weak. Bring me the legs of a beast that moves without sound, that runs between shadows unseen."**
- **Item:** _Legs of a Shadow Stag_ – Enhances the ants’ speed and stealth.

**"The darkness presses in. I see nothing but shapes and whispers. I need the eye of something that has watched the world turn, that sees even when it should not."**
- **Item:** _Scryer Beetle’s Third Eye_ – Grants the Queen enhanced awareness.

**"The earth resists me. I am unrooted, untethered. Find me something ancient, something whose roots have held firm against time itself."**
- **Item:** _Root of an Eldertree_ – Strengthens the Queen’s connection to the material world.

**"The tunnels are silent. I remember when they sang with life, when the threads of the world wove together. Bring me the silk of something that still remembers how to weave, how to bind."**
- **Item:** _Gossamer Weaver Silk_ – Strengthens the Queen’s ability to create specialized structures.

----------------------------

Rejection:

- **"This is hollow… empty. It has no memory of power. Do you think me blind?"**
- **"You bring me something dead, something without a soul. I will not eat dust."**
- **"This… is wrong. It is dull, lifeless. Would you feed a starving thing with stone?"**
- **"It does not sing. It does not pulse. You waste my time, little one."**
- **"I feel nothing from this… Do you mock me? Do you wish for me to wither?"**
- **"It had no purpose. No fire. No history. It is as useless as the bones of the forgotten."**
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Players/Brady (Clod) Folder/The Egg/The Egg's voices.md

entries.title: "**The Egg of the Feywild Ant Queen**"
entries.summary: ## **The Egg of the Feywild Ant Queen**
entries.body:
## **The Egg of the Feywild Ant Queen**

- **Holder**: [[Brady (Clod)]]
- **Origin**: [[Etheria]]
- **Formerly Imprisoned In**: [[The Fallen Kingdom]]
- **Current Location**: [[The Underdark]]
- Stages and abilities: [[Egg Stages]]
- Voices: [[The Egg's voices]]

- Will hatch into [[The Queen]]

### **Overview**

This egg is an anomaly in the material plane. It originates from the **Feywilds**, where it once belonged to an ancient and powerful colony of Feywild ants. It was **sealed away in The Fallen Kingdom**, deemed too dangerous due to its unnatural hunger and the potential power of the queen it would hatch into.

### **The Fall & Escape**

- **15 years ago**, during the raid on **The Fallen Kingdom**, the egg was accidentally freed from its prison.
- In the chaos, it **commanded a colony of subterranean ants** to carry it deep into **The Deep Dark**, ensuring its survival and avoiding recapture.
- There, **Clod** discovered the egg while navigating black-market tunnels, unknowingly taking on the responsibility of its survival.

### **Feeding & Growth**

- The egg does **not** sustain itself like normal creatures. Instead, it feeds by absorbing **life force** through hidden tendrils, extracting vitality from living beings.
- However, to **truly grow**, it requires **essence from the Feywilds**—magical creatures, plants, or artifacts infused with Fey energy.
- Clod has been unknowingly **sustaining it with exotic magical foods** obtained through black-market dealings, believing he is merely acquiring rare ingredients.

### **Things Clod Needs to Do to Feed the Egg**

#### **Primary Goal**:

- Clod needs to **acquire wealth** through black-market dealings, odd jobs, or heists to purchase rare Feywild animal parts and meats for the egg.


Brady is a pedo:
![[BradyQueen.webp]]

entries.body:
## **Basic Info**

- **Name:** (Choose a name for her)
- **Size:** Small → Grows with evolution
- **Current Level:** 1 (EGG)
- **Current Energy:** (6 when born)
- **Next Growth Requirement:** (20)
- **Personality/Behavior:** 
- **Connection with Clod:** (Mental link, how strong is her bond?)

- Food: [[Growth and Food]]
- Ants: [[Ant Species]]
- Energy for Ants: [[Ant food and Energy Levels]]
- Queen ant of: [[Etheria]]

---

## **Stats**

|Attribute|Value|
|---|---|
|**HP**|(Base HP + growth bonuses)|
|**AC**|(Armor Class based on current evolution)|
|**Strength**|(Starting STR + buffs)|
|**Dexterity**|(Starting DEX + buffs)|
|**Constitution**|(Starting CON + buffs)|
|**Intelligence**|(Starting INT + buffs)|
|**Wisdom**|(Starting WIS + buffs)|
|**Charisma**|(Starting CHA + buffs)|

---

## **Abilities & Features**

_(List all unlocked and evolving abilities here.)_

### **Innate Abilities (Always Active)**

- **Hive Mind:** Clod and the Queen share a deep telepathic link, allowing simple commands over long distances.
- **Pheromone Influence:** Can subtly manipulate basic insect behavior around her.

### **Active Abilities**

_(Abilities the Queen can use in combat or utility.)_

- **Summon Worker Ants** (Cost: X Energy) – Creates worker ants to assist with construction and resource gathering.
- **Royal Mandate** (Cost: X Energy) – Temporarily grants all nearby ants increased speed or strength.
- **Chitinous Reinforcement** – Hardens her shell for temporary AC boost.

---

## **Growth Stages**

| Level | Form                   | Size   | New Abilities                                                      | Required Energy |
| ----- | ---------------------- | ------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------ | --------------- |
| 1     | **Juvenile Queen**     | Small  | Hive Mind, Basic Ant Command                                       | 0               |
| 2     | **Developing Monarch** | Small  | Can summon stronger ants, improved defenses                        | X Energy        |
| 3     | **Maturing Queen**     | Medium | Creates first **specialized ants** (healers, scouts, warriors)     | X Energy        |
| 4     | **Broodmother**        | Large  | Generates a steady passive energy gain, enhances colony production | X Energy        |
| 5     | **Feyborn Matriarch**  | Large+ | Gains aura-based abilities, massive influence over the hive        | X Energy        |
|       |                        |        |                                                                    |                 |

---

## **Known Weaknesses & Risks**

_(Track potential threats or problems with the Queen’s evolution.)_

- **Energy Drain:** Higher evolutions demand more energy.
- **Predators & Enemies:** Certain creatures or factions may try to capture or kill her.
- **Feywild Connection:** Stronger evolutions could attract attention from entities who seek to control or destroy her.

---

## **Special Notes & Lore**

_(Use this section to track special events, memories, and character development.)_

- [ ]  First battle fought alongside Clod
- [ ]  First major energy infusion
- [ ]  Important discoveries about her origins

entries.title: "**6. The --------- Unleashed** _(Conjuration)_"
entries.body:
## **6. The --------- Unleashed** _(Conjuration)_

_"You let reality slip, and the ------- pushes through."_

- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** 30 ft
- **Effect:**
    - A **------ anomaly bursts into the Material Plane**, affecting the area with a **random effect** from the list below:


- **Gravity Reverses** – All creatures in a 30-ft radius fall upward for 1 minute, then drop.
    
- **Spatial Swap** – Every creature in a 30-ft radius randomly swaps positions.
    
- **Summoned Fey** – A random Fey creature appears, confused and curious. It may help, ignore, or attack.
    
- **Time Freeze (Observer State)** – You cannot act or be harmed for one round, but can observe everything that happens in slow motion.
    
- **Age Surge** – Every creature in the radius ages forward or backward 1d20 years.
    
- **Everyone Speaks in Riddles** – For 1 minute, creatures can only speak in **rhyme or cryptic metaphor**. Noncompliance results in a d4 psychic damage each round.
    
- **Field of Petals** – A massive bloom of vibrant Feywild flowers explodes in the area. All terrain becomes **difficult terrain**, and creatures standing in it regain **1 HP per round** but must succeed a DC 14 Wis save or become **infatuated with the flowers**.
    
- **Color Bleed** – All color in the area fades into grayscale for 1 hour. Spells with a visual component have **disadvantage**.
    
- **Inverted Emotions** – Everyone in the radius feels the **opposite** of their strongest emotion for 1 minute.
    
- **Reverse Reactions** – All reactions (like Opportunity Attacks, Counterspell, etc.) **automatically trigger in reverse**—players may accidentally help enemies or buff themselves unintentionally.
    
- **Looping Echoes** – Any verbal spells or spoken words **repeat themselves 1 round later**, as ghostly echoes, possibly causing confusion or revealing secrets.
    
- **Shadow’s Turn** – Each creature’s **shadow** detaches and becomes **semi-autonomous** for one round. They may interfere, mimic, or protect their origin.
    
- **Wild Polymorph** – Every creature must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma save or be polymorphed into a **small forest animal** (squirrel, frog, rabbit) for 1d4 rounds.
    
- **Invisible Geometry** – Ethereal Fey glyphs appear in the air. Touching one (even accidentally) causes a **random magical effect** (e.g., teleport, enlarge, silence, fear).
    
- **Double Moonlight** – A shimmering double-moon aura fills the area. All Fey creatures gain **advantage on everything**, and non-Fey creatures gain **disadvantage on Wisdom saves** for 1 minute.
    
- **Memory Drip** – Everyone in the radius **forgets something important** temporarily (a spell, a loved one, their own name). The DM decides when it returns.
    
- **Rewind** – One random creature's **last turn is undone** and must be replayed (they reroll everything exactly). Allies can use this strategically—or accidentally harm themselves again.
    
- **Gambler’s Bloom** – A massive fey coin flips in the air. **Heads:** Everyone heals 20 HP. **Tails:** Everyone takes 20 psychic damage. If it lands **on its edge**, nothing happens… yet.
    
- **The Hunt Begins** – An unseen Fey predator is **released into the area**, invisible and undetectable by mundane means. It makes one stealth attack before vanishing forever.
    
- **Fey Ring Expansion** – A permanent **Feywild ring** (a circle of mushrooms and flowers) forms at the site. Any creature who sleeps there dreams of the Feywild and may **wake up slightly altered** (different eye color, magic spark, knowing a secret).


# 🌙 **Paradox Wanderer** — Apex Predator of the Feywild

> _"The air shimmers violently. Something both ancient and newborn steps through—a sovereign beast not bound by time, nor by mortal law. It watches. It hunts."_

---

### **Medium Fey (Apex Entity), Chaotic Wild**

---

**Armor Class:** 18 (starwoven hide)  
**Hit Points:** 165 10d8 + 10)  
**Speed:** 50 ft., fly 60 ft. (hover)

---

### **Abilities**

|STR|DEX|CON|INT|WIS|CHA|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|20 (+5)|22 (+6)|18 (+4)|18 (+4)|22 (+6)|20 (+5)|

---

### **Saving Throws:** Dex +11, Wis +11, Cha +10

**Skills:** Insight +11, Arcana +9, Perception +11, Stealth +11, Deception +10  
**Damage Resistances:** Cold, Fire, Lightning, Psychic, Force  
**Condition Immunities:** Charmed, Frightened, Restrained  
**Senses:** Darkvision 120 ft., Truesight 30 ft., Passive Perception 21  
**Languages:** Sylvan, Celestial, Telepathy 120 ft.

---

# **Apex Predator Traits**

---

### 🌿 **Fey Apex Instinct**

- **The Wanderer always acts first** in initiative when summoned, regardless of initiative rolls.
    

---

### 🌙 **Shifted Predation (At-Will, No Action)**

- At the start of its turn, the Wanderer **chooses a Hunting Style** for that round:
    
    1. **Phase Predator** – It becomes partially incorporeal; melee attacks against it are made with disadvantage.
        
    2. **Astral Maw** – Its attacks deal an extra 2d8 psychic damage.
        
    3. **Mirrorspawn** – After being hit once, it **creates a duplicate** of itself (AC 12, 1 HP) that attacks the creature that hit it before vanishing.
        
    4. **Predator's Whim** – Its next successful attack **forcibly teleports** the target 30 ft into the air (if inside) or throws them 30 ft randomly.
        

---

### 🌫️ **Feywild Glitch (3/Day)**

- Reality **distorts** in a 20 ft radius centered on the Wanderer.
    
    - Enemies must succeed on a **DC 19 Wisdom saving throw** or become **Blinded and Disoriented** for 1 round.
        
    - Terrain becomes **twisting dream-wood and floating petals**, turning into **difficult terrain**.
        

---

### 🌌 **Crown of the Forgotten Seasons (1/Day)**

- The Wanderer summons **the full rage of the Feywild’s seasons** into a single devastating attack:
    
    - **Spring Surge:** Allies regain 30 hit points in a 30-foot radius.
        
    - **Summer Fury:** Flames erupt; enemies within 30 feet take 8d8 fire damage (Dex save DC 19 for half).
        
    - **Autumn Wane:** All enemies must succeed a Con save DC 19 or suffer **Exhaustion Level 1**.
        
    - **Winter Silence:** All magic within 30 feet **fails** for 1 round (no casting, no magical effects).
        

_(Choose 1 effect or roll randomly.)_

---

# **Apex Predator Actions**

---

### **Multiattack**

The Wanderer makes **two Twisting Strikes** or uses **Twisting Strike + Echo Leap**.

---

### **Twisting Strike (Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack)**

- +11 to hit, reach 10 ft or range 60/120 ft.
    
- Hit: 18 (2d10 + 6) force damage.
    
- If the attack hits, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be **flung 20 feet** in a random direction.
    

---

### **Echo Leap (Recharge 5-6)**

- The Wanderer teleports up to 90 feet.
    
- After teleporting, it leaves behind a **Phantom Rift** that explodes at the end of its turn:
    
    - All creatures within 10 ft take 3d10 psychic damage (Dexterity save DC 17 for half).
        

---

# **Legendary Actions (3/round)**

_(The Wanderer can take these actions at the end of another creature’s turn.)_

- **Flicker Step:** Teleport 30 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.
    
- **Predator’s Mark:** Choose a creature within 60 ft; it takes 2d6 psychic damage and becomes **hunted**—the Wanderer has advantage on attacks against it until the end of its next turn.
    
- **Reality Crack (Costs 2 Actions):** Shatter a 10-foot cube of space into chaotic fragments. Creatures inside must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity save or take 6d6 force damage.
    

---

# 🛡️ **Personality and Roleplay**

- It is **graceful** and **terrible**. It speaks in riddles, warnings, and half-truths.
    
- **It recognizes ApplePie**, not as an owner, but as a **cousin of fate**. It may protect him instinctively—or **challenge him** if he shows weakness.
    
- It **hates lies** but **loves paradoxes**.
    
- If a party member offers a Fey token (like a rare flower, enchanted item, or a truthful riddle), the Wanderer **might leave behind a gift** when it vanishes.
    

---

# 📜 **How to Use It**

- When ApplePie rolls a nat 20 during **The Feywild Unleashed**, this creature **tears through** the unstable boundary between worlds.
    
- It **fights with him for 10 rounds** or until dismissed (if ApplePie figures out how).
    
- If things go well, it **might leave behind a shard of Feywild magic**—a blessing or a curse depending on the party’s choices.

entries.title: "Full Lore"
entries.body:
### Full Lore

Chapter 1: The Cavern

“Detonating charge in 3, 2, 1!” The sound from the large explosion echoes between the vast walls of Vasrið’s cave. 



“Watch out!” shouts one of the cavers. The demolitionists flee the scene as one of the wooden pillars begins to collapse. Like dominoes, more of the structure falls, with rubble from the cave following. The rocks cascade down through the tunnels.



🍎π stood frozen, watching the scene unfold before him.



Time stopped. The world around him froze. His parents stood there unaware of their impending doom. And in an instant; everything became nothing. 



The panicked orcs scurried around the area, ensuring that everything was okay. The dust swirled thickly in the air, clouding the once clear pathways of Vasrið’s cave. The sound of rubble shifting and heavy breathing echoed as a few cavers, unscathed but shaking, dug into the pile of debris. The smell of dirt and stone mixed with the faint scent of blood. The sunken weight in the chest of the young orc, still only 9 years old, was palpable.



"Faster, we need to get them out!" a voice barked, strained with urgency. Pi couldn’t hear the command over the cries that seemed to circle around him. The echoes of the explosion still lingered in his ears.

  

His mother’s face… his father’s laugh. Those were the last memories he had of them, and now they were buried under hundreds of tons of stone.

  

"Pi, we have to move!" Grazkul’s voice cut through the haze of his thoughts. The young orc's eyes snapped to his best friend, the only face in the chaos that was familiar. Grazkul, an aspiring architect, had been his friend for as long as he could remember. His eyes were filled with concern, but his voice was firm, pushing through the grief. "Pi, please! We need to help!"

  

For a moment, all 🍎π could do was stare at the pile of rocks, unsure whether he could face the reality of what was happening. But Grazkul’s hand on his shoulder grounded him. Taking a deep breath, he turned to the task at hand. They would dig, they would try to save those still trapped, even if the task felt hopeless. 

  

Every shift of the stone was a cruel reminder of the fragility of life. Eventually, the cavers uncovered the bodies of his parents. His mother, a formidable orcish woman who had always known what to say to ease his fears, now lay motionless in the rubble. His father, a stoic figure who had taught him the ways of survival in the harsh landscape, was gone too.

  

Pi gently placed his palm around his father’s chest, feeling a nostalgic warmth. They would not be coming back. A faint whisper from inside his mind: “you could’ve saved them…” The grief hit him like a wave. His body trembled as he fell backwards, his mind blanking for a moment. Grazkul, sensing the weight of the loss, placed his hand on Pi's arm. “We’ll get through this, together. We always have.”

  

Those words, though meant to comfort, only deepened the ache. Still, there was a part of him that clung to them. His friend was right. Together, they had always persevered. But now, with the loss of his parents, Pi felt the loss of a part of himself. The child he had been was gone. He was alone, or at least, that’s what it felt like.

  

Chapter 2: The Path Ahead

  

Years passed. Time healed some wounds but never all of them. With no immediate family left, Pi moved in with Grazkul. Their family wasn’t very rich, so all he brought was nothing but his bare necessities and his lucky coin that his parents gave him when he was younger. 

  

At 12, when the orcs reached adulthood, Pi and Grazkul moved to Każþarim, a bustling city known for its rapid growth and constant demand for labor. The city offered work, and for a time, the routine of building structures and managing the flow of materials kept Pi's mind from lingering on the pain of loss.

  

But there was always the pull of something more, something greater than the mundane work of the city. Something in Pi stirred—a hunger to explore, to understand, to break free from the repetitive motions of his life. The cave had once been his world, and now the vastness of the land seemed too big to ignore.

  

Grazkul, ever the practical one, had already begun to build his own reputation as a talented architect. But Pi, with his innate connection to the land and its untamed power, began to sense something calling to him beyond the walls of Każþarim. The strange whispers, faint at first, began to grow louder, and with them, a compulsion.

  

There was something in nature that had always felt alien to him. Growing up in the caves, surrounded by rock, darkness, and the occasional flicker of firelight, nature itself had been a mystery—something he had only seen in rare glimpses through the cracks in the earth. But now it beckoned, in ways that no one else could seem to hear.

  

In time, Pi's ambition drove him to answer that call. The voices, those mysterious whispers that had begun as subtle thoughts in his mind, now pushed him to seek out answers. Why did they call to him? What were they? Where did they come from?

  

Despite his growing expertise as a builder and laborer, he couldn’t shake the feeling that he was meant for something more. 

  

And so, with a heavy heart but an unshakable will, Pi set out to uncover the mysteries of the voices that seemed so tied to his soul, his past, and his very existence. In doing so, he found himself on the path of a druid. The land, the trees, the winds, and the rivers—they were all alive in ways he had never understood before. 

  

Chapter 3: Decision

  

Pi wandered far from Każþarim, to the edges of forests and deep into the wilds. His draw to nature only grew with each passing day. The voices grew louder, clearer. He had no idea what they were saying, only that they wanted him to do something. They would only say one chant: “Orþażwoża Paradox Żrwev”

  

As an avid gambler, Pi would often drop by at any tavern he saw. He would feel the texture of the cards, the edges of the dice, sensations he had felt many times. But his mind wandered; it wandered further than his travels. The voices’ decision.

  

A call, a shriek, a cry for more. Pi knew that the voices were getting restless, despite never having understood them. What did they want? Who were they? Questions only led to more questions. In the 20 years since the accident, since the voices’ birth, Pi had never told anyone else about the voices, not even Grazkul. He tried to ignore them and focus on his current game.

  

Like always, Pi relied on his lucky coin in his gambling. He let it dance around his fingers before flicking it up into the air. The coin reflected the sun’s rays as it spun before falling back into his palm heads up. Pi was all in.

  

Chapter 4: A Whisper of Power

  

The sun was setting, casting an orange glow over the water as it rushed past, winding its way between the jagged stones. Pi’s connection with nature grew stronger every day. It was as if the land itself had started to recognize him, to reach out to him. He had no mentor, no guide; only the whispers of the voices that seemed to hum within the earth and wind.

  

After strolling around in the forests of Każþarim for another 15 minutes or so, Pi found himself standing before a tree at a mysterious shrine. The shrine was quite small, no larger than the kitchen from his old home. A wave of déjà vu swept over him. Even though he had never seen the shrine before, Pi recognized some of the strange symbols around its walls. It was a language that he had seen being used before by others when he spent time near Zeðaris. Pi left the shrine, making a mental note to return later.

  

As he walked back home, he realized that the elements around him would respond with the faintest of rustles. Out of curiosity, Pi wondered if he could learn to control the reactions of nature. He began by slowly waving his hand over a small stream. Pi closed his eyes, letting the energy of the water fill his senses. His fingers hovered just above the surface of the stream, almost instinctively reaching out.

  

He focused on the water moving beneath him. He could feel the motion and direction of the clear lifeblood in his palm, even though he was still as a statue.‘How nice it must be, to let go and be able to drift on without worry,’ he thought.

  

With that simple thought, Pi extended his hand and willed the water to shift. At first, nothing happened. He tried again, this time more deliberately, focusing all of his attention on the way the stream wound around the rocks.

  

And then, to his surprise, the water around his hand seemed to slow. It didn’t move dramatically, but it responded to his touch. A slight, fluid ripple danced where his fingers hovered, as if the water itself was aware of his presence. Pi’s breath caught. 

  

He tried again, reaching his arm out to the stream, holding out both hands this time. He closed his eyes and focused, envisioning the water lifting, flowing in response to his will. Slowly, steadily, the surface of the water rippled, forming a small wave that surged toward him before falling back into the stream.

  

Chapter 5: The Shrine

  

As days became and weeks and weeks became months, Pi found himself spending more time in nature and less time gambling. Even though he would be by himself–something he would typically avoid–now it felt different. He decided today to revisit the shrine.

  

With nothing to distract his thoughts as he walked, he remembered that day, the day that shook his soul. He remembered his father and his teachings of the land–how nature’s will is stronger than any being. Maybe this was why he felt drawn to nature.

  

Pi arrived at the shrine, with everything exactly as he remembered–the walls still undecipherable. Pi centered himself in the peaceful construct and relaxed. However, his rest was promptly interrupted by the voices. 

  

“Þi lotaż vweþaż evf lwużrar ovwaðfuvs, lwe lwoża zrużuþ dwa luðf yut twoża zeyoż ovavfuvs.”

  

‘What does that mean?’ Pi asked himself. The voices repeated their chorus once more. Pi felt a shock from his chest. He looked around at the writing on the walls of the shrine, only this time, he could read it. 

  

“To mother nature and forces unyielding, may my spirit be filled with thy power unending.”

  

He realized that that was what the voices were saying. He looked up at the ceiling, where an inscription lay: “Orþażwoża Żrwev” (Azterra’s Shrine). The voices were calling him here. ‘But why?’ Pi wondered.

  

Chapter 6: Growth 

  

.. Circle of the land/shrine introduction?

entries.title: "Circle of the Shrine Abilities (Isaac)"
entries.body:
**

Druid (Circle of the shrine) level 2

-   
    

Spell Modifiers:

- Spell Casting Ability (+4)
    

- Adds to the “to-hit” roll of a spell or cantrip
    

- Spell Save DC (14)
    

- Used for enemy’s Saving Throw threshold (if enemy doesn’t have more than the Spell Save DC, it will be affected by the spell/cantrip)
    

- Spell Attack Bonus (+6)
    

- Adds to the “damage” roll of a spell, but not to cantrips
    

---

Cantrips (2+1):

- Guidance
    

- Divination cantrip
    
- Casting Time: 1 action
    
- Range: Touch
    
- Components: V, S
    
- Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute
    
- You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll 1d4 and add the number rolled to one ability check of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the ability check. The spell then ends.
    

- Produce Flame
    

- Conjuration cantrip
    
- Casting Time: 1 action  
    Range: Self  
    Components: V, S  
    Duration: 10 minutes
    
- A flickering flame appears in your hand. The flame remains there for the duration and harms neither you nor your equipment. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you cast it again.
    
- You can also attack with the flame, although doing so ends the spell. When you cast this spell, or as an action on a later turn, you can hurl the flame at a creature within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 fire damage.
    
- At Higher Levels. This spell’s damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).
    

- Magic Stone
    

- Transmutation cantrip
    
- Casting Time: 1 bonus action
    
- Range: Touch
    
- Components: V, S
    
- Duration: 1 minute
    
- You touch one to three pebbles and imbue them with magic. You or someone else can make a ranged spell attack with one of the pebbles by throwing it or hurling it with a sling. If thrown, it has a range of 60 feet. If someone else attacks with the pebble, that attacker adds your spellcasting ability modifier, not the attacker’s, to the attack roll. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Hit or miss, the spell then ends on the stone.
    
- If you cast this spell again, the spell ends early on any pebbles still affected by it.
    

---

Spells (checked box = ready and in slot):

- Prepared: 6 (Druid level + Wisdom modifier)
    
- Slots: 3 level 1 spells
    

- ![unchecked](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    Speak with Animals (Level 1) (always prepared)
    

- 1st-level divination (ritual)
    
- Casting Time: 1 action  
    Range: Self  
    Components: V, S  
    Duration: 10 minutes
    
- You gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts for the duration. The knowledge and awareness of many beasts is limited by their intelligence, but at minimum, beasts can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever they can perceive or have perceived within the past day. You might be able to persuade a beast to perform a small favor for you, at the DM’s discretion.
    

- ![unchecked](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    Orþażwoża Zżweaż / Azterra’s Prayer (Level 2)
    

- 1st-level divination (ritual)
    
- Casting Time: 1 action
    
- Range: 30 feet
    
- Components: V, S
    
- Duration: Concentration, up to 1 minute
    
- You utter an ancient prayer to the land, invoking a force of nature. With this forgotten prayer, a wave of natural energy emanates from you to either:
    

1. Restore vitality and reinforcing the bond between nature and its protectors.
    

- When the spell is initiated, you and any allies within 30 feet gain temporary hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. If in addition, the ally is touching natural ground, they heal for 2 hit points.
    

1. Bring forth the power of the elements to hinder enemies from harming life.
    

- When the spell is initiated, all enemies within 30 feet have disadvantage on both their next attack to-hit roll and attack damage roll.
    

- At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the temporary hit points increase by 2 per slot level above 2nd, and the healing increases by 1.
    

- ![checked](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    Create or Destroy Water (Level 1) Water & Sand
    

- 1st-level transmutation
    
- Casting Time: 1 action  
    Range: 30 feet  
    Components: V, S, M (a drop of water if creating water or a few grains of sand if destroying it)  
    Duration: Instantaneous
    
- You either create or destroy water.
    
- Create Water. You create up to 10 gallons of clean water within range in an open container. Alternatively, the water falls as rain in a 30-foot cube within range, extinguishing exposed flames in the area.
    
- Destroy Water. You destroy up to 10 gallons of water in an open container within range. Alternatively, you destroy fog in a 30-foot cube within range.
    
- At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you create or destroy 10 additional gallons of water, or the size of the cube increases by 5 feet, for each slot level above 1st.
    

- ![checked](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    Healing Word (Level 1)
    

- 1st-level evocation
    
- Casting Time: 1 bonus action
    
- Range: 60 feet
    
- Components: V
    
- Duration: Instantaneous
    
- A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
    
- At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.
    

- ![checked](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    Cure Wounds (Level 1)
    

- 1st-level evocation
    
- Casting Time: 1 action
    
- Range: Touch
    
- Components: V, S
    
- Duration: Instantaneous
    
- A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
    
- At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.
    

---

Features:

- Gambler’s Ambition
    

- Before every cantrip and spell, you must flip a coin. If it lands heads up, your next cantrip/spell gains +1 damage/effectiveness (if it hits). If it lands tails, your next cantrip/spell instead loses 1 damage (if it hits). This effect stacks. The damage buff/nerf resets after either a Short Rest or Long Rest.
    
- The amount of damage gained/loss increases by 1 when a new even Druid Level is reached (4, 6, 8, etc).
    

- Druidic
    

- You know Druidic, the secret language of druids. While learning this ancient tongue, you also unlocked the magic of communicating with animals; you always have the Speak with Animals spell prepared. You can speak the language and use it to leave hidden messages. You and others who know this language automatically spot such a message. Others spot the message's presence with a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check but can't decipher it without magic
    

- Wild Shape 2 uses left
    

- The power of nature allows you to assume the form of an animal. As a Bonus Action, you shape-shift into a Beast form that you have learned for this feature (see “[Known Forms](https://www.dndbeyond.com/classes/2190878-druid)”). You stay in that form for a number of hours equal to half your Druid level or until you use Wild Shape again, have the Incapacitated condition, or die. You can also leave the form early as a Bonus Action.
    
- Number of Uses. You can use Wild Shape twice. You regain one expended use when you finish a Short Rest, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
    

- Wild Companion
    

- You can summon a nature spirit that assumes an animal form to aid you. As a Magic action, you can expend a spell slot or a use of Wild Shape to cast the [Find Familiar](https://dnd5e.wikidot.com/spell:find-familiar) spell without Material components.
    
- When you cast the spell in this way, the familiar is Fey and disappears when you finish a Long Rest.
    

- Circle of the Land 1 use left (of Natural Recovery)
    

- Bonus Cantrip. When you choose this circle at 2nd level, you learn one additional druid cantrip of your choice. This cantrip doesn’t count against the number of druid cantrips you know.
    
- Natural Recovery. Starting at 2nd level, you can regain some of your magical energy by sitting in meditation and communing with nature. During a short rest, you choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your druid level (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.
    

---

Orc Traits:

- ![checked](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    Adrenaline Rush 2 uses left (2 uses per long rest)
    

- You can take the Dash action as a bonus action. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
    
- Whenever you use this trait, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.
    

- ![checked](data:image/png;base64,)
    
    Relentless Endurance (1 use per long rest)
    

- When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this trait, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
    



**

entries.body:
**
INSIPRED BY HANDJUMPER
Lore: [[ApplePie LORE (Isaac)]]
Abilities [[Circle of the Shrine Abilities (Isaac)]]
Shrine: [[The Paradox Shrine of Azterra]]
Voices: [[Voices of the Shrine]]
Spells: [[Unlockable Shrine Spells]]
### Quick Info

Basic Info

- Character Name: 🍎π
    
- Race: Orc
    
- Class: Druid
    
- Subclass (if known): Circle of the Land
    
- Alignment: Chaotic Neutral
    
- Age & Gender: 31M
    
- Height & Weight: 6'6", 314 lbs
    

  

Background

- Brief Backstory: Raised in Vasrið’s Hollow as a child, but my parents died in a cave accident when I was 9.  Lived with my close friend (Grazkul) until 12 (adult for orcs), and then moved to Każþarim for work in construction with him. I worked as a builder, and he worked as an architect. 
    
- Where are you from?: Haramut area
    
- Family (if any): None alive anymore
    

  

Personality

- Personality Traits: Loyal, curious, stoic
    
- Strengths: Ambitious
    
- Weaknesses: Doesn’t know when to fold/give up
    
- Likes: Gambling
    
- Dislikes: Losing when gambling
    

  

Motivation

- Main Goal: Find cause of the voices
    
- Personal Quests (if any): N/A
    
- What does your character fear most?: Losing a loved one
    
- What would your character never do?: Betray/Deceive a friend
    

  

Interests

- Hobbies: Gambling
    
- Special Interests (magic, gods, creatures, etc.): Nature, since I grew up in caves and did not get to see nature much.
    
- What would your character do in their free time?: Explore around new places
    

  

Relationships

- Does your character have any connections to other party members?: N/A
    
- Does your character have important NPC relationships?: Grazkul
    

  

Combat & Roleplay

- Combat Style (frontline, ranged, magic, support): Frontline mage
    
- Preferred Weapon/Spell Type: RNG based spells
    
- How does your character react to danger?: Depends on if a friend may also be in danger. If a friend is in danger, we go all in. If I’m the only one in danger, attempt to escape. If escape doesn’t seem realistic, then try to fight by outsmarting/using violence as a last resort.
    
- How does your character solve conflicts? (talk, fight, etc.): talking/negotiation before violence
    

  

Fun Extras

- Unique quirks or habits: Always brings a weighted coin and an ace up their sleeve for the gamba. If the voices tell me to do something, I will try my best to do it.
    
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
**

Dropped out of school to become a gambler, then traveled from tavern to tavern. Gained a lot of money and lost it all many times. One night, I a thief attempted to steal my latest earnings. I chased after them into a dark forest. The thief tripped over a tree root and was swallowed by the ground. I only heard the clattering of coins landing on the ground. As I crouched down to pick up the coins, the grass wrapped its blades around my wrist and infused nature into my veins, making me a druid. I began to hear voices talk to me, and they get stronger when I'm surrounded by more nature.

entries.title: "Legend of the Time Shrine"
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Players/Isaac (Apple pie) folder/Legend of the Time Shrine.md

entries.title: "**The Paradox Shrine**"
entries.body:
![[Sanctuary.jpg]]

A gateway to [[Etheria]]
Previous owner/keeper : [[Legend of the Time Shrine]]
### **The Paradox Shrine**

The whispers led **ApplePie** through the dense woods, their presence growing stronger with each step. The wind carried their murmurs, threading through the rustling leaves like an unseen guide, until he stood before an ancient tree—its gnarled roots thick and intertwined, its bark weathered by time itself. This species of tree, though rare, could be found scattered across the lands of Azterra, always standing as silent sentinels of the past.

As he approached, drawn by a force beyond his understanding, the massive roots began to shift. The very center of the tree split open, revealing a descending pathway shrouded in darkness. The air smelled of damp earth and something older than memory itself.

Beneath the surface, the shrine unveiled itself: a cavernous chamber the size of the dejope lounge, its walls cold stone. At its heart, a circular island of stone stood, embraced by a ring of still, glassy water that reflected the dim glow of unseen light sources. Atop this island rested a small shrine of carved stone, its shape simple yet impossibly ancient, its surface worn smooth by the passage of countless years.

The cavern walls bore witness to something primordial. Faded carvings stretched across the stone, tangled with overgrown roots that had forced their way through the cracks. The images, some recognizable and others lost to time, depicted cryptic scenes—visions of cycles, of fate woven and unwoven, of figures standing at the crossroads of possibility. Though the inscriptions had weathered the ages, they pulsed with an eerie familiarity, as if whispering secrets only **ApplePie** could hear.

 - more details : 
 - The stone walls of the chamber were eerily flat, as if shaped with purpose beyond mortal hands. Every inch of their surface was covered in an overwhelming tapestry of markings—spirals, intersecting lines, jagged glyphs, and chaotic patterns that seemed almost alive in the flickering light. The designs sprawled across the stone in a language long forgotten, their meaning lost to time. Some diagrams twisted upon themselves, looping endlessly in ways that made the eye ache to follow. Others branched outward like sprawling veins, crossing over and under each other in an intricate web that defied logic. The roots that pushed through the stone seemed careful to avoid them, as if the very earth itself hesitated to disturb their presence.

The air here was heavy, thick with something beyond mere atmosphere. Time itself seemed to fold and stretch within the shrine’s boundaries, as though the space existed outside of the natural order. The voices that had guided him here now hummed in unison, a chorus of hushed reverence, waiting.

entries.title: "**Cantrips**"
entries.body:
### **Cantrips**

1. **Whisper of the Self** _(Divination)_
    
    - **Casting Time:** 1 action
    - **Range:** Self
    - **Effect:** You hear a brief whisper from ---------, granting you insight. Once before your next turn, you can reroll one ability check and take either result.
    - **Flavor:** A faint, echoing voice murmurs suggestions in your own tone.

2. **Flicker Step** _(Transmutation)_
    - **Casting Time:** 1 reaction
    - **Range:** 5 ft
    - **Effect:** If an enemy attacks you, you momentarily shift half a second forward or backward in time, reducing the attack roll against you by 1d8.

**Feyfire** _(Conjuration)_
- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** 30 ft
- **Effect:** A flickering, ethereal flame that does not burn appears on a creature or object. It harmlessly illuminates an area in eerie colors and can change its hue at will. The flame dances in unnatural ways, occasionally flickering into unsettling shapes.

**Whispers of the Glade** _(Enchantment)_
- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** 30 ft
- **Effect:** You cause faint, melodic whispers to drift around a creature’s ears. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw or become mildly **distracted**, suffering disadvantage on Perception checks and Investigation checks for 1 minute.


## Level 1 spells

**Temporal Gambit** _(Enchantment)_

- **Casting Time:** 1 bonus action
- **Range:** 30 ft
- **Effect:** Roll a d20. If the result is 10 or higher, you can impose disadvantage on an enemy's next attack or saving throw. If the result is 9 or lower, you suffer the same effect.

**Echoed Step** _(Transmutation)_

- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** Self
- **Effect:** You take a step forward, but for a brief second, your body leaves a temporal echo behind. On your next turn, you can use your bonus action to instantly teleport back to where you cast this spell.

**Trickster’s Step** _(Illusion)_

- **Casting Time:** 1 bonus action
- **Range:** Self
- **Effect:** When you move, you briefly **phase between multiple versions of yourself**. For the next turn, creatures must roll a d6 when attacking you. On a 5 or 6, the attack misses as they strike an illusion instead.

**Gossamer Veil** _(Transmutation)_

- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** Self
- **Effect:** Your body shimmers like silk in the wind, allowing you to pass through **tiny cracks, bars, or vines** for 10 minutes. This effect does not make you intangible—your form simply adapts like flowing mist.


## Level 2 Spells

**Mirthful Mirage** _(Illusion)_

- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** 30 ft
- **Effect:** You cause an area to shimmer and flicker with ghostly party lights, sounds of distant laughter, and soft, music. Any creature within the area must make a Wisdom saving throw or become **charmed** for 1 minute. They will not attack while affected but may still defend themselves.

## One time use spells
## **3. The Reflection That Wasn’t You** _(Illusion/Chronomancy)_

_"You see yourself in the water, and it smiles back before you do."_

- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** Self
- **Effect:**
    - Your **reflection steps out of the nearest mirrored surface**, standing beside you as a perfect copy.
    - It **fights for you, thinks like you, and even speaks like you**—but its thoughts are **not fully aligned with yours**.
    - At any moment, the **reflection might refuse to obey**, making choices that **it thinks you would make instead of what you command**.
    - At the **end of the battle**, it disappears, but a piece of it **stays in the world**, watching.
## **6. The Feywild Unleashed** _(Conjuration)_

_"You let reality slip, and the Feywild pushes through."_

- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** 30 ft
- **Effect:**
    - A **Feywild anomaly bursts into the Material Plane**, affecting the area with a **random effect** from the list below:
        1. **Gravity reverses** for 1 minute.
        2. Every creature in a **30-ft radius swaps places** instantly.
        3. A **random Fey creature** appears
        4. **Time freezes**, but only for you—you can’t act, only observe, for 6 seconds.
        5. **Every living creature ages forward or backward** by 1d20 years (this is permanent).
    - The spell **cannot be stopped or controlled**, only endured.

## **7. The Fey King's Favor** _(Chronomancy/Illusion)_

_"For a moment, you are not you. You are something else."_

- **Casting Time:** 1 minute
- **Range:** Self
- **Effect:**
    - For the next 10 minutes:
        - **Every creature treats you as royalty**, bowing or obeying simple commands.
        - **Any spell you cast is heightened** to its strongest possible effect.
        - Your name is erased from the Material Plane **until the effect ends**—as if you never existed.
    - At the **end of the spell**, you **forget why you cast it**.

entries.title: "**Whispered Voice Lines**"
entries.body:
[[Isaac (Apple π)]]

- **The Coin Flip** – ApplePie flips his lucky coin at a tavern, but just before it lands, he hears a whisper:  
    _"Call heads."_  
    It lands heads up.
    
- **The Dream** – One night, ApplePie dreams of walking through a forest he has never seen before. The trees sway in an unseen wind, their leaves glowing faintly. A whisper calls:  
    _"Find the hollow trunk."_  
    Days later, in reality, he stumbles upon the exact place from his dream.
    
- **The Forgotten Spell** – During combat, ApplePie instinctively mutters an incantation he doesn’t remember learning. As energy surges from his hands, a whisper sighs in relief:  
    _"Yes… just like before."_
    
- **The Mirror Reflection** – In a still pond or a polished surface, ApplePie catches a glimpse of his reflection—but the eyes staring back are older, wiser, watching. The reflection’s mouth moves, but no sound reaches him.
    
- **The Vanishing Name** – ApplePie tries to recall the name of someone you feel like belonged to a life long companion. Someone you could trust in any case, but it slips from his mind like water through his fingers. In its place, a voice hums:  
    _"That name was never yours to remember."_ - (Name of a character of alternate party)
    
- **The Dice Game** – In a moment of gambling, he hears the whisper:  
    _"The dealer holds a nine."_  
    He calls the bluff and wins, but when he turns back, the gambler who sat across from him is gone.
    
- **The Moment of Hesitation** – Just before touching something dangerous (a cursed object, a dangerous relic, or even an enemy), the voices grow agitated, whispering rapidly in a language he does not understand—until suddenly, in clear words:  
    _"Not yet."_



### **Whispered Voice Lines**

- _"You've done this before."_ - done
- _"A step left, then forward. Yes… like that."_ - done 
- _"Don't speak. Just listen."_ - done
- _"Do you feel it? The moment where time bends?"_ - done
- _"This place remembers you, even if you don’t."_ - done
- _"Close your eyes. The answer is already there."_
- _"We walked this path once, long ago."_
- _"The stars are different here… but the story is the same."_
- _"They won’t understand… but you will."_
- _"It’s a game, isn’t it? Just a different table."_
- _"You found the first key. Keep going."_
- _"The river runs backward, and so do we."_
- _"You can’t see it yet. But you will."_
- _"If you turn back now, you’ll forget."_
- _"I  wonder why they all look familiar?"_

entries.title: "Cordo Backstory (Ivan)"
entries.body:
**

Opta: 

The man who took him in was known simply as Opta, an elderly halfling monk. Once with the gift and natural ability to be one of the greatest lethal assassins of his undisclosed tribe, a near-fatal injury not only took away his talent but also his purpose, and he was banished from his tribe. With nothing left, he rebuilt himself and has spent the last several decades living with the dwarven village in the Duran Mountains, who lent him a lot of land. He would spend his time traveling and finding lost children such as Cordo, then he would bring them to Dura and raise them as his own. Opta’s initial success as a fighter, coupled with his forced attribution of many other skills, have made him a great teacher for almost anyone.

  

Opta’s Plan: 

Varied from person to person depending on their strengths, interests and races. For many, Opta’s Plan guided them after he would deem his pupils ready and they were sent off into the rest of the world. Since Wood Elves lived up to 750 years and reached adulthood at 100 years, the Plan for Cordo was to develop his skills until he reached adulthood. The full purpose or intent of his Plan is unknown.

  

0 - 3 years:

Cordo was born in the Ansivarr forests. His memory of the village and his family is very faint. His mother was an obsessive gambler who, over the course of Cordo’s first three years of birth, gave almost everything away. The only thing that fueled her gambling was the villagers’ donations to her, which were done out of pity for the child. One day, a hunched old man came into the tavern where Cordo’s mother basically lived. With only a poor excuse for shelter and her child truly hers, the man approached her and directly proposed a bet she couldn’t refuse. He proposes one game of Aikeshaki (Elvish for “Twenty” - I have an actual card game for this): If she wins, she gets what would be worth a lifetime of wealth for her, and if she loses, she has to give up her only child. Naturally, she loses, and after unsuccessfully trying to fight the man, she sits in despair as he carries Cordo out of the tavern.

  

3 - 81 years:

Disconnected from his own culture and roots, Opta’s pupils and the Duran dwarves were all who he knew. He followed Opta’s Plan, though unfortunately Opta took him in when he was already getting too old. Twenty years earlier than anticipated, he begrudgingly sends Cordo on a mission that would continue and eventually conclude his Plan. Following Opta’s passing and funeral, the Durans unexpectedly forced all of Opta’s residing pupils out of their homes, and many fled in groups while some, like Cordo, fled alone.

  

82 - 105 years:

Opta left Cordo with a hit list with only names and locations. He spent the next two decades enjoying his newfound liberty, exploring the world and doing many side quests as he tracked his victims down in mourning and honor of Opta. His journeys were long and great, and he had to kill many fighters like himself and some others, such as an alchemist, a politician, and an artificer. This required patience, focus and resilience, and Cordo was driven to improve and complete the mission. He spent months hunting down the next person and finally found him, discovering that it was someone he trained with back in Dura. Shocked that Opta sent him to kill his fellow pupils and confused as to how Opta knew their locations before they even got there, Cordo was full of guilt for all that he had done since leaving the mountains. Who were the people who he killed? Why did Opta send him on this quest?

  

106 - 119 years: 

With three names left on Opta’s list (one of which was his former friend, another who has successfully escaped him in the past), Cordo burned it. With so many questions, no answers, and now no purpose, Cordo visited his home, the Ansivarr forests. Though they recognize him as their own, he doesn’t dress or behave anything like them, and so even to the Wood Elves he is a foreigner. With nothing else to do, he sits at the very same taverns where his mother gambles (neither recognizes the other), and drinks his life away as he discovers alcohol. He shortly leaves his village with a constant lust for alcohol, money and something to do, and he spends the next decade as a drunken mercenary, nowhere nearly as efficient or skillful as he was before. He joins the story in his visit to the tavern Elverdeen.

**

## **Cordo – The Wandering Drunkard of Balance**

### **Basic Info**

- **Race:** Wood Elf
- **Class:** Monk (Level 2)
- **Subclass:** _Way of the Drunken Master_ → (Custom: Way of Duality at Level 3)
- **Alignment:** Chaotic Neutral (Drunken)
- **Age:** 119
- **Gender:** Male
- **Height & Weight:** 5’7”, 150 lbs
- **Background:** **Orphaned, raised by Opta (Alternate Cordo)**
- **Languages:** Common, Elvish, Dwarvish
- **Proficiency Bonus:** +2
- **AC:** 14 (Unarmored Defense + drunken style)
- **Speed:** 35 ft.
- **Hit Dice:** 2d8
- **Ki Points:** 2 (increases at level 3)

Opta was the vanquisher of [[(The Knight of Kaya)]] 
- He had seen his fellow party member, a good friend, fall too far to one side. He eventually chose to make balance once again, following his beliefs and putting them before his friend. He lured the knight of kaya to an island away from many, to avoid casualties and had a fair fight. He came out with a major wound but was able to defeat kaya. He would never be able to fight again, but he could train others. He then became the teacher of many, using his pupils to try and restore balance to the continent after the Knight's genocide.

entries.title: "**The Legend of the Galloping Goat**"
entries.body:
### **The Legend of the Galloping Goat**

Deep within **the Echoing Hills**, past the **Stormgate Ruins**, lies an ancient **carved monolith** depicting a single figure:

- A **bard with a flute**
- A **warrior atop a charging goat**
- A **long, continuous path with no end**

Travelers speak of **a melody** known as **"Gallop’s Call"**, a tune so powerful that it **binds the spirit of an eternal charger**—a **goat that never stops running**.

**Many have sought the song, but few have returned.** Some say the goat still roams, **charging endlessly through the land, lost to time.**

---

### **Base Damage (Before Scaling)**

- **Standard Charge:** `1d8 + Charisma modifier` (bludgeoning)
- **If the goat moved 30+ feet before impact:** `2d8 + Charisma modifier`
- **If the goat moved 60+ feet before impact:** `3d8 + Charisma modifier`

💥 **Knockback Effect**

- If a target is hit, they must make a **Strength saving throw (DC = 10 + Charisma modifier)** or be **knocked prone**.
- Larger creatures **(Huge or bigger)** are only **pushed back 5 feet** instead of being knocked over.


### **How to  Obtain the Song**

To learn **"Gallop’s Call"**, Ivan must uncover the lost **Chronicler’s Flute**, rumored to be buried in the ruins of an old **battlefield shrine**.

Steps to acquiring it:

1. **The Shrine of Endless Hooves** – Ivan will find **strange hoofprints** that form **a perfect spiral**, never breaking. A ghostly bard lingers nearby.
2. **Trial of the Unwavering Path** – The spirit challenges Ivan to **a test of rhythm and movement**, playing a tune while **navigating a shifting battlefield.**
3. **The Flute Awakens** – Once the melody is completed, the flute glows, **carving the song into Ivan’s mind.**
4. **The Galloping Goat Arrives** – Playing the song **summons the Charging Goat**, appearing from **thin air**, already in motion.
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Players/Ivan (Cordo Tympazi) Folder/The Charge Goat.md

entries.title: "📜 **Cordo’s Subclass Awakening: 'The Fracture of Two Futures'**"
entries.summary: # 📜 **Cordo’s Subclass Awakening: "The Fracture of Two Futures"**
entries.body:
# 📜 **Cordo’s Subclass Awakening: "The Fracture of Two Futures"**

---

## **Setting the Stage**

- **Cordo has just sobered up**.
    
- **He is at his clearest mindset** since the death of Opta.
    
- **For the first time**, he isn't clouded by alcohol, Opta’s influence, or blind obedience.
    
- **This is perfect** — he is at a mental "tipping point," where he can either build his own path… or fall into the footsteps he’s trying to escape.
    

And **that tipping point is exactly what triggers his awakening**.

---

## **🔹 The Event: The Mirror of Fractured Choices**

At the start of a rest, downtime, or right after a particularly **difficult fight (even better if it involves sparing or killing someone),** **Cordo dreams** — but **it doesn't feel like a dream.**

🔹 **He stands in a long, infinite hallway lined with mirrors.**  
🔹 Each mirror **shows a different version of him**.

- One is **a champion of Light** — adored, righteous, **but hollow**, almost robotic.
    
- One is **a destroyer cloaked in Darkness** — feared, free, **but monstrous**.
    
- And between them: **a shattered mirror**, reflecting **a broken Cordo** who is **neither, flickering between both**, struggling to hold his form together.
    

> “You must choose," a voice echoes.  
> “Or you must walk the path where choosing becomes impossible."

🔹 **He reaches out** — and the mirrors **shatter** into shards of Light and Dark, **embedding into him**.

**Balance is not about choosing a side. It's about carrying both — and surviving it.**

**That’s when he wakes up. Sweating, breathless, and changed.**

---

## **🔹 Mechanics: What Happens After**

After this vision:

- **Cordo’s Balance Scale activates.**
    
- He immediately feels that **every action pulls him toward one future or the other**.
    
- His first few fights feel **unstable** — attacks **flicker** between radiant flashes and dark afterimages even if he doesn't intend it.
    
- He now has the ability to **declare Light or Dark attacks** consciously — but he **feels** when he tips too far.
    
- He gains **access to all his subclass features** as you designed — **but in character, he feels the consequences immediately.**
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Players/Ivan (Cordo Tympazi) Folder/UNLOCK SUBCLASS.md

entries.title: "**Way of Balance: The Monk of Duality**"
entries.summary: ## **Way of Balance: The Monk of Duality**
entries.body:
## **Way of Balance: The Monk of Duality**

Monks who follow the **Way of Balance** have learned that true mastery comes from walking **the razor’s edge between light and darkness**. Those who fall too far into one side **lose themselves**, while those who maintain perfect **harmony** can **transcend mortal limits**.

A monk of this tradition harnesses both **radiance and shadow**, striking with the **energy of opposites** and bending the battlefield to their will.

## **Core Mechanic: The Balance Meter**

- At **the start of each battle**, Cordo begins with **0 Balance Points**.
- Each attack, ability, or action **tilts the scale**, making balance **fluid and difficult to maintain**.
- Each **Light Attack** gives **+1 Darkness Stack . 
- Each **Dark Attack** gives **+1 Light Stack .
### **🔹 Stack Limit (Scales with Level)**

- **Level 3-5:** Max **4** Light / 4 Dark Stacks (**Unbalanced at 5+ stacks)
- **Level 6-10:** Max **6** Light / 6 Dark Stacks (**Unbalanced at 7+ stacks**)
- **Level 11-16:** Max **8** Light / 8 Dark Stacks (**Unbalanced at 9+ stacks**)
- **Level 17+:** Max **10** Light / 10 Dark Stacks (**Unbalanced at 10+ stacks**)


### **🔹 Generating Light & Dark Stacks **

| **Action**                                 | **Dark Stack**                | Light Stack                 |
| ------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------- | --------------------------- |
| **Use a Dark Attack (Necrotic Ki-Strike)** | ❌                             | **+2**                      |
| **Use a Light Attack (Radiant Ki-Strike)** | **+2**                        | ❌                           |
| **Use Flurry of Blows (2 Extra Hits)**     | **+1 for Each Light Attack**, | **+1 for Each Dark Attack** |
| **Deflect Missiles (or Dodge Reaction)**   | ❌                             | **+1 Light Stack**          |
| **Take Radiant or Necrotic Damage**        | **+1 Dark Stack**             | ❌                           |


If **Cordo reaches overload in either Light or Dark**, he enters **Unbalanced State** at the start of his next turn.

Cordo's **Light (Radiance) and Dark (Void) stacks fuel unique abilities**, granting him devastating powers—if he can maintain equilibrium.

### **🔹 Using Light Stacks (Radiance)**

- **Radiant Surge (1+ Light Stack, No Ki Cost)** – Cordo may **passively glow** faintly, gaining +1 AC.
- **Flare Strike (2+ Light Stacks, 1 Ki)** – Cordo may **channel Radiance into a melee strike**, dealing **+2d6 radiant damage** and **blinding the enemy until the start of their next turn (CON Save).**
- **Sacred Pulse (3+ Light Stacks, 2 Ki)** – Cordo releases a wave of purifying energy, **healing allies for 1d8** and pushing back enemies within **10 feet**.

🔸 **At Max Light Stacks (4):** Cordo radiates divine energy, causing enemies to have **disadvantage on their first attack against him until the start of his next turn**.

---

### **🔹 Using Dark Stacks (Void)**

- **Void Step (1+ Dark Stack, No Ki Cost)** – Cordo's movements become **faintly distorted**, allowing him to move **without provoking opportunity attacks**.
- **Withering Palm (2+ Dark Stacks, 1 Ki)** – Cordo **steals vitality** from his enemy, dealing **+2d6 necrotic damage** and gaining this damage (only the 2d6) as health.
- **Shadow Grasp (3+ Dark Stacks, 2 Ki)** – Cordo **extends his shadow** toward an enemy within **15 feet**, forcing them to make a **DEX Save or become restrained for 1 turn**.

🔹 **At Max Dark Stacks (4):** Cordo becomes difficult to perceive—his form flickers and his shadows dance. **Attacks against him have half damage** until his next turn.

---

### **🔺 How Unbalance Becomes a Terrifying State**

If Cordo reaches **Over Max (5) stacks of Light or Dark**, he immediately enters **Unbalanced State** at the start of his next turn. 

### **🔺 The Unbalanced State (Consequences)**

When Cordo becomes **Unbalanced**, his body is **overwhelmed** by either **Light or Dark**, distorting reality around him.

🔹 **Unbalanced by Light (Radiance Overload)**

- His eyes burn like **hollow white voids**, and his body emits a pulsating glow that **flickers like a broken light**.
- His **voice echoes strangely**, as if **spoken from multiple places at once**.
- **Effects:**
    - **Allies and enemies within 10 feet take 1d6 radiant damage at the start of his turn.**
    - **He is unable to perceive darkness or shadows**—**all enemies in dim light or darkness are invisible to him.**
    - **If he uses a Ki ability, he takes force damage equal to his Monk Level x 2.**
    - **If Unbalance continues for more than 3 turns, his body begins to split into ethereal fragments**—his next **failed death save immediately kills him.**

---

🔹 **Unbalanced by Dark (Void Consumption)**

- His **body flickers in and out of existence**, his limbs appearing **half a second behind his movements**.
- **Whispers flood the battlefield**, but **only Cordo can hear them**.
- **Effects:**
    - **Whenever he moves, he teleports 5 feet randomly at the end of his movement.**
    - **His AC is reduced by 2 as his body loses cohesion.**
    - **His shadow acts independently, mimicking his movements on a delay**—if he attacks, the **shadow repeats the attack on the nearest creature, ally or enemy.**
    - **If Unbalance continues for more than 3 turns, Cordo’s body is partially consumed by the Void**—he is **permanently blinded** until he restores balance.

---

### **🔺 Recovering from Unbalance 

To escape **Unbalance**, Cordo must:  
✔ **Land an attack of the opposite type (Light to cancel Dark, and vice versa) - Risky AF.**  
✔ **Spend 2 Ki to purge the excess energy.**  
✔ **Have an ally stabilize him (i.e., a magical effect that balances energy).**

🔸 **If he remains Unbalanced for 2+ turns, Cordo may die.**


---

## **Level 6 – Yin-Yang Strike**

At **6th level**, Cordo learns to strike with perfect harmony, combining both energies for devastating effects.

### **Balanced Impact**

- When Cordo **hits with a Light and Dark attack in the same turn**, the target takes **an extra 1d8 force damage**, and Cordo **recovers 1 spent Ki**.

### **Shockwave of Harmony (Special)**

- If Cordo has **exactly 1 Light and 1 Dark stack**, he can **spend 2 Ki** to unleash a **Balance Shockwave**.
- All creatures **within 10 feet** must make a **Constitution saving throw** (DC = 8 + WIS + Proficiency).
    - **Failure:** The target is **stunned until the end of Cordo’s next turn**.
    - **Success:** They take **half damage** but are not stunned.

This ability is **strong but requires careful Balance Meter management**.

---

## **Level 11 – Equilibrium Mastery**

At **11th level**, Cordo fully embodies the principles of **balance**, granting him unparalleled control over his ki.

### **Passive Buffs**
- **Resistance to radiant and necrotic damage.**
### **Perfect Balance (New Ki Ability)**

- Cordo can spend **3 Ki** to enter **Perfect Balance** for 1 minute.
- While in Perfect Balance:
    - **Light and Dark abilities cost no Ki.**
    - **Cordo ignores the Unbalanced state and can exceed stacks on either side.**
    - **While Balanced, he hovers slightly above the ground, ignoring difficult terrain.**

---

## **Level 17 – Avatar of Balance**

At **17th level**, Cordo reaches his **final form as the arbiter of balance**.

### **Balance Wave**

- **Cost:** **5 Ki**
- Cordo **unleashes a 30-foot shockwave**, dealing **5d10 force damage** to all enemies in range.
- Targets must make a **Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + WIS + Proficiency).**
    - **Failure:** They are **stunned for 1 turn**.
    - **Success:** They take **half damage** and are **not stunned**.

### **True Equilibrium (Ultimate Bonus)**

- If Cordo has **3 Light and 3 Dark stacks** at once:
    - **His attacks ignore resistances and immunities.**
    - **If he alternates perfectly for 3 turns, he instantly regenerates 10 Ki.**
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Players/Ivan (Cordo Tympazi) Folder/Way of the Balance Keeper.md

entries.title: "**Weapon Description & Design**"
entries.body:
![[Combustion Hammer.webp]]

### **Weapon Description & Design**

Valthrak is no ordinary warhammer—this **massive, two-handed weapon** is a testament to **dwarven ingenuity and Mulek’s reckless love for destruction**. Unlike most hammers, its **head is slightly hollow**, reinforced with an intricate network of **runed stabilizers** to withstand **massive shockwaves**.

**Key Features:**

- **Gunpowder Loading Chamber** – A small **sealed compartment** within the hammerhead where Mulek loads a charge of gunpowder.
- **Reinforced Ignition Rune** – A **pressure-activated dwarven rune** that detonates the charge **on impact**.
- **Runed Stability Core** – The hammer absorbs a portion of the shock to prevent _total self-destruction_ (but not all of it).
- **Dwarven Grip Mechanism** – The handle is wrapped in **thick, fire-resistant leather**, and at the base, there's a **small flint striker** to manually ignite the charge if needed.

**Aesthetic Design:**

- **Hammerhead:** **Blackened steel with dwarven engravings**, faint cracks glowing when gunpowder is ignited.
- **Handle:** **Reinforced darkwood**, slightly shorter than a maul to allow fast, controlled swings.
- **Backside of Hammer:** **Anvil-like shape** – designed for crushing or stabilizing when forging.

---

### **Valthrak, the Thunder Anvil** _(Charge Hammer)_

**Weapon Type:** Two-Handed Warhammer  
**Rarity:** Rare (Upgradeable)  
**Attunement:** Required (Must be wielded by a dwarf or someone trained in its use)  
**Scaling:** Increases in power as Mulek progresses in level
Starts with 4 Gunpowder Charges - Gunpowder is very rare and expensive. Use it wisely. 

---

## **Level 3 Base Stats (Balanced for Early Game)**

**Weapon Damage:** 2d6 + Strength (Bludgeoning)  
**Special Properties:**

- **Heavy, Two-Handed**
- **Sturdy Build:** Cannot be easily broken but requires maintenance after excessive explosive use.

### **Special Features at Level 3:**

#### **1. Thunderstrike (Gunpowder-Charged Attack)**

_“BOOM! And there goes another elf.”_

- **Once per Short Rest**, Mulek can load **one charge of gunpowder** into the hammer.
- On his next hit, the attack **explodes**, dealing:
    - **Additional 2d8 Thunder Damage** to the target and any creature in a 5 foot radius.
    - **Shockwave Effect:** Creatures within **5 feet** must make a **DC 15 Strength Save** - 10 feet must make a **DC 10 Strength Save** or be knocked **prone**.
    - Mulek takes **1d4 recoil damage** from the force of the explosion. 
- **Gunpowder Limitation:** Must have gunpowder in inventory (expensive and rare).

#### **2. Overcharge Strike (Desperate Explosion)**

_“If I’m going down, I’m taking you bastards with me!”_

- Mulek can **overload** the hammer by using **Three gunpowder charges** at once.
- This causes a **large explosion** on impact, dealing:
    - **5d8 Thunder Damage** in a **10-foot radius**.
    - **All creatures in range must make a DC 16 Strength Save** or be **launched 10 feet** away and knocked prone.
    - **Mulek takes 3d8 recoil damage**, gets knocked back 10 feet, and must make a **DC 14 Constitution Save** or be knocked **prone** from the force.
- **Once per Long Rest.**

#### **3. Echo of the Forge (Passive)** - Unlocks level 3 

_“A hammer isn't just a weapon. It's a tool. A legacy.”_

Because **Valthrak was forged from the legendary Adamanthrak**, it **absorbs heat, shock, and energy**, allowing Mulek to:

- If **Thunderstrike was used last turn**, Mulek's next melee attack deals an additional **2d6 Fire Damage** due to the superheated metal.
- The hammer can also be used as **a portable forge**, allowing Mulek to craft or repair weapons if he has the proper materials.
---

### **4. Hidden Feature – The True King’s Seal**

> _"The King’s Hammer remembers its master."_

Unknown to Mulek, **his hammer is more than just a weapon**. It holds **a hidden function**, known only to the kings of his lineage.

- **If brought to the deepest vault of his kingdom**, it can **unlock certain chambers** through resonance.
- Some dwarves may **recognize it** and kneel before the lost prince.
- The hammer may have **a deeper connection to the artifacts stolen from his kingdom**…

---

## **How Mulek Might Discover These Features**

1. **During a Blacksmith Encounter** – A **master dwarf smith** notices something **strange about the metal** and warns Mulek that **this hammer wasn’t made just for battle**.
2. **Accidentally Overloading It** – In a desperate fight, Mulek might **unintentionally ignite too much gunpowder**, triggering a massive **uncontrolled detonation**.
3. **A Flashback or Vision** – Upon using the hammer **in a significant battle**, Mulek experiences **a vision of his ancestors**, hinting at its true nature.
4. **While Trying to Open a Vault** – The hammer might **react** when near a lost **dwarven relic**, revealing its hidden power.

entries.title: "Jonah (Mulek Sorrengail)"
entries.body:
![[Mulek_image.png]]


[[The Secrets of the Castle]]
[[The Pocketwatch]]
[[Plot Progression (Jonah)]]
Weapon : [[Combustion Hammer]]

Items:
- [[🔥 The Torch-Heart Core]]

Prince of the fallen kingdom

Basic: Growing up as the heir to the dwarfin kingdom throne, I worked hard to learn how to rule and how to speak the many languages of our allies, but at night I was an absolute stud who fucked girls and partied all day. On my 18th birthday my father-Shangdi Sorrengail- died leaving me only [[The Pocketwatch]] estimated to be worth around 1500 gold (plated in gold with red and white jewels shaping our family crest the Valzydak) . Shangdi was the main protector of our lands and was feared by all races, many enemies would freeze in fear just from one look at him. His name was known throughout the land and his might was revered by even the strongest of men. Only three days after Shangdi died I swore to protect the people of my land and was accepted into the throne. Although I was the king, my mother -Andarna Sorrengail- made most of my decisions for me, and was an active part of keeping the kingdom from panic after my fathers demise. Three months later my kingdom was overthrown by a group of greedy high elves and humans who call themselves “Kayas Stray Dogs”. I narrowly escaped with my life and was scarred on my chin during the battle. After that I spent nearly all the money I had on booze and women. For 6 long years I drank and I fucked traveling from city to city looking for a reason to live. Eventually I ran onto a knight named Scorne that fought for my old army. He ran during the battle and, like me, has been living his days in sorrow wondering if life is worth living. For the next 4 years We traveled from place to place drinking together and becoming good friends. Eventually,  in between towns, we came across a group of high elves with a group of dwarf slaves. In that moment I made a split decision to save my fellow dwarfs and protect the people I had sworn to protect 10 years ago. We rushed into battle and quickly lost. Scorne was taken by the high elves and I was left there to die. Two days later a human girl (Violet Veletti) who lived in the next town saw me lying on the ground unconscious and brought me with her. Since she was human I was very skeptical at first and tried to leave as soon as possible, But my injuries rendered me incapable of moving. As she took care of me I came to trust her and eventually fell in love with her. I stayed with her for the next 5 years training to be a stronger warrior and to protect those things I love, never forgetting my vow to protect my people. On my 33rd birthday I set out to reclaim my fallen land, promising to return to Violet one day soon and to ask for her hand in marriage when I do. Soon after I ended up in Elverdeen where I met the rest of the group.

  
  
  
  

Personality

- Personality Traits: Loyal, racist towards elves and humans, Snobby with money, Better than others, cares deeply for dwarfs, does not kill unless he has to.
    
- Strengths: motivated, natural leader
    
- Weaknesses: racist to humans and elves, sexist (women don't belong on the battlefield)
    
- Likes: drinking, Fucking, fellow dwarfs, women (violet inpeticular), cigars, gabling
    
- Dislikes: being sober, Loosing, ELVES, Humans, new technology.
    

Motivation

- Main Goal: reclaim my land, return to Violet
    
- Personal Quests (if any): reclaim my land, return to Violet
    
- What does your character fear most?: violet dieing before he can reclaim his land
    
- What would your character never do?: betray a dwarf
    

Interests

- Hobbies: rock collecting, making weapons, 
    
- Special Interests (magic, gods, creatures, etc.): Feels a strong connection to the earth. 
    
- What would your character do in their free time?: drink, Fuck, collect rocks, work out, find strong weapons, make weapons
    

Relationships

- Does your character have any connections to other party members?: N/A
    
- Does your character have important NPC relationships?: many nobles
    

Combat & Roleplay

- Combat Style (frontline, ranged, magic, support): Frontline brute force and agile fighter. 
    
- Preferred Weapon/Spell Type: big weapons (preferably bigger than I am)
    
- How does your character react to danger?: quick to defend myself and my pride.
    
- How does your character solve conflicts? (talk, fight, etc.): willing to talk but quick to fight.
    

Fun Extras

- Unique quirks or habits: Very stubborn and hard to convince (always assumes he's right) . Treats many things as an inconvenience. Respects all dwarfs and Dragonborn. 
    

  
  
  
  
  

Notes:

- There was a great war 1000 years ago between the elves and other beings - It was a battle between religion after the two gods of the continent died fighting each other, causing all the kingdoms to rage into war. 
    
- It was basically the elves and humans vs the dwarfs and dragonborn
    
- The dragonborn and dwarfs were winning until what they call “the Witch of Kaya” appeared.
    
- She single handedly turned the tide, killing millions. Some say she's a tall ugly witch, while some say soldiers are stunned by her beauty on the battlefield. All you know is that many of your kind died by her hand. 
    
- This war was 900 years ago, so most scars have healed, but traces remain. Now, the sun goddess Kaya’s belief is spread across the whole continent**
