entries.summary: After elverdeen (season 2) - which elverdeen will either fall or the party will run - there are currently 2 places to go to
entries.body:
After elverdeen (season 2) - which elverdeen will either fall or the party will run - there are currently 2 places to go to

We either go south to the desert city so the party can level up or
We go north to the hidenburg vault to find out the secrets of the knight of the sun

In the hindenburg vault, the knight of the sun resides. She was in a coma a long time after the war, but recently the kingdom has requested aid from healers to cure a strange desiese - the patient has fever, nightterrors, and is in screaming pain at night after the sun sets, but ok during the day. It is a curse but can be subdued by medicine and magic. The party must go to the vault and sneak in, disguising themselfs as staff to get closer. The knight is told to be kept in a magically sealed vault, in the lowest floors, when in reality, she is kept at the highest floors that are off limits to all but the high maid. She disguises herself as a maid within the castle, trying to live a normal life and get to know people. She is unable to leave, due to the restrictions of the elf king. The knight's secret is that she is also an Elkin, whos powers come from etheria and she is controlled by great kaya magic. An incredible illusion spells is over her at all times, to hide her horns and her eyes. Her eyes are the color of a sunset, with great glowing reds, oranges, and yellows. The spells only supresses the vibrance of her eyes. If a player deicded to try and look into her eyes they might sense magic, and try to look through the spell. It is a very high DC and when they do, they see the true colors, like looking into the burning sun. They will also get a hint that the mirauge does not stop there and continues around her head (hiding her horns). 

Things that the party might find out before this arc is talking to an old lady in the woods. She was a friend of elkin from long long ago. She is a high elf who god knows how long shes been alive. Living along in the woods in a tiny hut, she will mistake ruby, our party elkin, for the knight of kaya's name. She is simply so old that she forgot if shes in the present, past, or future. 

To the south we come across the city in the desert, known for its dense magic and is ruled by a few roble houses, one being the house of domination, whos heir is Valen. 

city in the desert - main source of magic form the river that flows over the sand from the oasis of magic - many monsters and magical animals gather around it. The city is built in steps with a gate to let the river in. The gate is thick and strong, but not very wide. It only protects the river and its walls dont reach too far - not even a quarter around the city. Pirates venture into the desert to try and sand whale hunt or get a jar of the oasis's pure water. The river flows to the highest point first, and the water flows down, slowly collecting dirt and trash as it trickles to the city below. The desert city is a city of magic, wonder, and fast progress. Although the culture is colorful with spice and cloths, it is also heavy in magic.

Valen is a human, a nomal looking man holder a giant greataxe by the god kaya herself. He STRONGLY beluieves in kaya - the holy god. He follows the church and will do what must be done. His greatest posestion is the hangaxe he carries - handed down in the family through generations in his noble house. He warships the duke of domination. He holds his father in highest regard but to succeed he must kill him through trial.

 Valen is strong at time and weak at times. When he is weak, he often clings to those close to him - often his sister petra, known as the lily of the desert. He often stays close to his comrades when weak, and is bad at keeping face even though its supposed to be a secret that the house can be extreamly weak at tines
 hes a little of a dramatic fellow
peta is a very individual and very not touchy. Although she is the gem of the house she hates the attention
 Valen is known throughout the city and well by the wealthy.  often used as entertainment by the nobles to show our power, against crazy powerful opponents that have been druggen and poisened before the fight, so the duke of domination takes effect

entries.title: "📜 Elverdeen Adventurers' Guild – Job Board"
entries.body:
# 📜 Elverdeen Adventurers' Guild – Job Board

[[Guild board details (Bronze)]]
[[Guild Board details (Silver)]]
[[General Monsters]]
[[Forgotten Loot]]
[[Random Funny Loot]]



## **🟤 Bronze Tier (Beginner Jobs – Low Risk, Low Reward)**

| **Quest Name**                     | **Description**                                                                                                                      | **Location**                 | **Reward**                                      |
| ---------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ---------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------- |
| **🐀 Giant Rat Infestation**       | A warehouse is overrun with **giant rats**. Kill at least **10** and bring proof.                                                    | Elverdeen Warehouse District | **20 GP total + **bonus for removing the nest** |
| **🏹 Caravan Escort**              | Merchant **Grelwin Thorne** needs **protection** for a caravan traveling to **Redbrook**. Bandit activity is rumored along the road. | Elverdeen West Gate          | **20 GP total** + **bonus if no cargo is lost** |
| **🔎 Missing Heirloom**            | **Lady Amira Venmire** lost a **family heirloom** in **Ashenwood Forest** and wants it recovered.                                    | Ashenwood Forest             | **25 GP total, no questions asked**             |
| **⛏️ Mysterious Cave**             | A **new cave** opened near the **Ruins of Faedrin**. Strange **noises** and **glowing lights** have been reported inside.            | 8 miles south of Elverdeen   | **20 GP + anything found is yours**             |
| **⚔️ Bounty: Goblin Raiders**      | **Goblins** have been harassing nearby farmers. The town council offers a bounty.                                                    | Farms west of Elverdeen      | **30 GP total, +1 GP for extra goblins slain**  |
| **🦴 Grave Robbery Investigation** | The **cemetery caretaker** reports **disturbed graves** and missing corpses. Investigate the cause.                                  | Elverdeen Cemetery           | **30 GP and bonus if the bodies are recovered** |


## **🔹 Silver Tier (Intermediate Jobs – Moderate Danger, Better Pay)**

|                                       |                                                                                                                |                    |                                                    |
| ------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------ | -------------------------------------------------- |
| **Quest Name**                        | **Description**                                                                                                | **Location**       | **Reward**                                         |
| **🐺 Wolf Pack Terrorizing Farmland** | A **large wolf pack** has been attacking **livestock and travelers** near the village of **Durnhill**.         | Durnhill Outskirts | **60 GP total + wolf pelts can be sold for extra** |
| **🦷 Cave of the Gnoll Warband**      | A **small gnoll warband** has been seen **gathering weapons** in an abandoned cave. The mayor fears an attack. | Broken Fang Cave   | **100 GP total + any loot found**                  |
| **🦑 Something Lurks in the Lake**    | The **fishermen of Stillwater Lake** report that something **huge** is attacking boats at night.               | Stillwater Lake    | **50 GP if driven off, 150 GP if slain**           |
| **👁️ The Hermit’s Crypt**            | A **lonely crypt** on the outskirts of Elverdeen has begun to **glow with eerie green light at night.**        | Old Hermit’s Crypt | **80 GP total + anything found inside**            |

## **🧑‍🎤 Scene 3: Meeting the Guild Master**

The party is **greeted by the Guild Master**, a seasoned **half-orc fighter named Varrek Steelhide**.

**👤 Varrek Steelhide – Guild Master**

- A **massive, scarred half-orc** with a **gruff but fair attitude.**
- He **doesn’t care about pasts**—only **if you can handle yourself in a fight.**
- **His Motto:** _"No gods, no masters—just coin and steel."_

### **🔹 What He Asks the Party**

✔ _"You new here? You fight well?"_  
✔ _"Guild takes a cut, but the pay’s fair."_  
✔ _"You want glory? Stick to the big jobs. You want to stay alive? Start small."_

### **🔹 Guild Registration**

Before they can take jobs, they must **register.**

- Each member gets a **Guild Token**, proving they belong.
- **Guild Ranks:**
    - **Bronze (Beginners)** – Basic jobs (pest control, escort quests).
    - **Silver (Veterans)** – Bigger risks, better pay.
    - **Gold (Elites)** – Only the best take these.

Once registered, **Varrek directs them to the Job Board.**

entries.title: "**💀 Deceptive Creatures & Traps**"
entries.body:
## **💀 Deceptive Creatures & Traps**

### **🦴 Mimics & Deceptive Creatures**

#### **📦 Mimic Chest (Classic Trap Creature)**

- **AC 14, HP 50, Slam +6 (2d8+3 Bludgeoning), Adhesive (DC 14 Strength to escape grapple).**
    
- **Mimics disguised as treasure chests, doors, or even weapon racks.**
    
- **Will attempt to grab the first person who interacts with them.**
    

#### **🪑 Chair Mimic (Deceptively Comfy)**

- **AC 13, HP 35, Bite +5 (2d6+2 Piercing), Grapple (DC 13 Strength to escape).**
    
- **Lures people by appearing to be the most comfortable seat in the room.**
    
- **When sat on, the mimic latches on and attempts to restrain the target.**
    

#### **🪞 Mirror Wraith**

- **AC 15, HP 45, Shadow Strike +6 (2d8 Psychic), Reflection Trap (Creates a duplicate of a character with their exact stats for 1 minute).**
    
- **Lurks inside mirrors, pulling people into a twisted, reversed reflection of the real world.**
    
- **Breaking the mirror forces a Wisdom save (DC 14) or suffer disorientation for 1 minute.**
    

#### **🎻 Haunted Violin (Mimic Variant)**

- **AC 12, HP 38, Psychic Tune +5 (2d8 Psychic), Maddening Melody (DC 13 Wisdom save or be charmed for 1 minute).**
    
- **If played, the mimic attempts to influence the player’s mind, making them unwilling to stop playing.**
    
- **Every failed save causes the musician to take 1d6 Psychic damage.**
    

#### **📜 Living Spell Scroll**

- **AC 13, HP 40, Arcane Lash +5 (2d6 Force), Spell Theft (Once per turn, absorbs a spell cast near it and can use it next turn).**
    
- **Mimics an ancient, high-value spell scroll but strikes when read.**
    

#### **📔 Cursed Book (Sentient Tome)**

- **AC 12, HP 30, Psychic Screech (DC 14 Wisdom save or take 3d6 Psychic and be stunned for 1 round).**
    
- **If touched, attaches to the reader's hands, forcing them to make Intelligence checks to resist reading further.**
    
- **If read fully, the target learns a dark secret but suffers 2 levels of exhaustion.**
    

#### **🚪 False Door Mimic (Wall Trap Variant)**

- **AC 14, HP 42, Slam +6 (2d6+2 Bludgeoning), Sticky Latch (DC 14 Strength to avoid getting stuck).**
    
- **Appears as a normal door but grabs anyone who tries to open it.**
    
- **If not noticed, it slowly shuffles positions in the dungeon, leading players in circles.**
    

#### **🪜 Ladder Mimic (Deceptively Useful)**

- **AC 12, HP 40, Climb Latch (Grapples whoever climbs it, DC 13 Strength to escape).**
    
- **Once a player reaches the top, the mimic "retracts," slamming them into the ground for 2d6 damage.**
    
- **If attacked while someone is climbing, the mimic will shake violently to throw them off.**
    

#### **🛏 Bed Mimic (Restful Ambush)**

- **AC 13, HP 45, Suffocate (DC 14 Strength or Dexterity save or take 2d6 bludgeoning per round).**
    
- **Feels unnaturally soft and lulls adventurers into immediate rest (DC 12 Wisdom save to resist drowsiness).**
    
- **Once someone falls asleep, the mimic wraps them in its "blanket," trying to digest them slowly.**
    

### **⚠️ Traps & Hazards**

#### **🏹 Dart Trap (Ceiling or Wall Mounted)**

- **Triggered by pressure plate or tripwire.**
    
- **Attack Roll: +6 to hit, 1d6 Poison or Piercing Damage (DC 13 Con save to resist poison).**
    

#### **🔥 Explosive Runes**

- **Triggers when an item or book is read aloud.**
    
- **DC 14 Dex Save, or take 3d6 Fire Damage.**
    
- **A faint magical glow hints at its presence.**
    

#### **🌿 Choking Vines (Living Trap)**

- **Vines animate when someone steps on them.**
    
- **DC 14 Strength Check to escape, or restrained for 1d4 rounds.**
    
- **Deals 1d6 bludgeoning per round if not escaped.**
    

#### **🕳 Pit Trap (Hidden Drop or Collapsing Floor)**

- **Hidden beneath a thin layer of dirt or unstable flooring.**
    
- **DC 13 Dex Save or fall 10-20 feet, taking 1d6 per 10 feet fallen.**
    
- **May contain spikes (1d8 additional damage).**
    

#### **⚡ Arcane Feedback Loop**

- **Triggers when a spell is cast within range.**
    
- **The caster must make a DC 14 Intelligence save or suffer their own spell at half damage.**
    
- **If activated multiple times, it builds in strength, increasing the save DC by +1 each time.**
    

#### **🧊 Ice Floor Trap**

- **Triggers when a creature steps on a specific tile.**
    
- **DC 14 Dexterity Save or be knocked prone and slide 10 feet.**
    
- **Can be used by enemies to create a battlefield hazard.**
    

#### **📜 Scroll of False Information**

- **Appears to be an ancient spell but is completely nonsense.**
    
- **If a player spends time reading it, they must make an Intelligence save (DC 12) or believe a completely false historical fact.**
    
- **Could be used to manipulate lore or NPC interactions.**

| **Quest Name** | **Description** | **Location** | **Encounter Details** | | ---------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ---------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | **🐀 Giant Rat Infestation**

DONE | A warehouse is overrun with **giant rats**. Kill at least **10** and bring proof. | Elverdeen Warehouse District | **10-15 Giant Rats (HP: 7, AC: 12, Bite: +4 to hit, 1d4+2)**. Nest may contain a **larger rat (HP: 15, AC: 13, Swarm Attack)**. Potential hidden contraband. | | **🏹 Caravan Escort** - Abandoned | Merchant **Grelwin Thorne** needs **protection** for a caravan traveling to **Redbrook**. Bandit activity is rumored along the road. | Elverdeen West Gate | **Bandit Ambush likely (4 Bandits, 2 Bandit Archers, Bandit Leader)**. Players may negotiate, fight, or reroute the caravan. | | **🔎 Missing Heirloom** | **Lady Amira Venmire** lost a **family heirloom** in **Ashenwood Forest** and wants it recovered. | Ashenwood Forest | Search check needed. **Small fey creature (Pixie or Quickling) may have taken it**. Convincing, trickery, or combat may resolve the issue. | | **⛏️ Mysterious Cave** - DONE | A **new cave** opened near the **Ruins of Faedrin**. Strange **noises** and **glowing lights** have been reported inside. | 8 miles south of Elverdeen | **2-3 Lesser Undead (Skeletons or Shadows) or strange magical anomaly**. Possible minor treasure or a cursed item. | | **⚔️ Bounty: Goblin Raiders** | **Goblins** have been harassing nearby farmers. The town council offers a bounty. | Farms west of Elverdeen | **6-8 Goblins (AC: 13, HP: 9, Scimitar +4, 1d6+2 damage, Shortbow)**. May be led by a **goblin boss** with minor magical ability. | | **🦴 Grave Robbery Investigation** | The **cemetery caretaker** reports **disturbed graves** and missing corpses. Investigate the cause. | Elverdeen Cemetery | **3-4 Zombies or Skeletons, possibly controlled by a rogue necromancer or spirit**. Hidden tomb entrance likely. | # 📜 DM Detailed Encounter Notes – Adventurers’ Guild Jobs ## **🟤 Bronze Tier (Beginner Jobs – Balanced for a Strong Level 3 Party)** ### **🐀 Giant Rat Infestation** - **Area Description:** A dark, damp warehouse filled with towering crates and the stench of moldy grain. Scratching sounds echo from the shadows. In the center of the room, a hole in the wooden floor descends into darkness—something has been burrowing. - **Unique Features:** A rusted iron chest rests under a beam of moonlight filtering through a broken roof panel. Inside are old merchant records and a silver dagger with rat skull engravings. Strange footprints that do not belong to a rat are found near the hole. **🐾 Hidden Story:** The warehouse was once home to **Veska the Ratkeeper**, a reclusive merchant who specialized in breeding "trained" vermin for underground fights. Over time, her obsession with rats grew unnatural, and she vanished one night, leaving behind only her journals and a network of tunnels beneath the warehouse. Some say her presence lingers, her whispering voice urging the rats onward. If the party listens closely, they may hear a woman’s laughter—despite the warehouse being empty. **🦴 Enemies:** - **Giant Rats (x12)** – AC 13, HP 24, Bite +6 (1d6+3 Piercing), Pack Tactics, Diseased Bite (DC 13 Con or Poisoned for 1 hour). - **Alpha Rat (x1)** – AC 15, HP 40, Bite +7 (2d6+3 Piercing), Toxic Spray (Cone 15 ft, DC 14 Con or take 3d6 Poison damage). - **Mutated Rat Swarm (x1, if nest is disturbed)** – AC 15, HP 45, Swarm Bite +7 (3d6 Piercing), Resistant to Non-Magical Weapons, Spawns 1d4 new rats per round. ### **🗡️ Unique Weapon:** - **Dagger of Vermin** – +1 dagger, when used against beasts or swarms, deals an additional 1d4 poison damage. Once per long rest, can summon rats. ### **🎲 Possible Trinkets:** - **Rat King's Crown** – A tiny golden circlet, oddly well-crafted, found in the Alpha Rat’s nest. If worn, grants **advantage on Animal Handling checks with rodents** but also makes cheese smell irresistible to the wearer. - **Cheese of Questionable Age** – A moldy wheel of cheese that **emits faint heat**. If eaten, grants **temporary hit points equal to 1d6** but imposes disadvantage on **Charisma-based checks for an hour** due to the breath. - **Warehouse Ledger with Missing Pages** – A record of **mysterious shipments**. If pieced together, reveals a secret **smuggling route** beneath the city. - **Paw of the Pestilent** – A mummified rat paw on a string. Once per long rest, the wearer can **cause a small swarm of harmless insects to appear nearby**, useful for distractions or unsettling enemies. --- ### **🏹 Caravan Escort** - **Area Description:** A winding dirt road cutting through thick woodlands. The trees create long shadows as the sun sets. Wagon wheels creak as they roll over uneven cobblestone remnants of an old imperial road. The caravan is heading toward **Valmere**, a small trading town on the frontier, known for its bustling market and reliance on imported goods. - **Unique Features:** A shattered stone mile marker by the roadside has faint, ancient writing—possibly from a lost civilization. A wrecked wagon lies further ahead, its supplies scattered and torn apart. **🚛 Hidden Story:** Valmere was once a peaceful town, but a **string of recent disappearances** among traders has led to rumors of something lurking in the surrounding forests. Some believe bandits are responsible, while others whisper of a **cursed traveler** who steals the names of those who meet his gaze. Grelwin Thorne, the merchant, is particularly nervous—he’s heard the tales and refuses to stop for the night, even when exhaustion sets in. If the party investigates the wrecked wagon, they may find a **ledger with names, the last few entries violently scratched out.** **🦴 Enemies:** - **Bandit Scouts (x5)** – AC 15, HP 26, Shortsword +6 (1d6+3 Slashing), Sneak Attack (+1d6 on surprise attack). - **Bandit Captain (x1)** – AC 17, HP 50, Cutlass +7 (1d8+4 Slashing), Tactical Orders (Grants +2 AC to an ally for 1 turn), Parry (+2 AC once per round). - **Hidden Archers (x2, setting up ambush)** – AC 15, HP 30, Shortbow +7 (1d8+3 Piercing), Marksman’s Aim (Ignores half cover, can target weak points for extra 1d6 damage). **🎲 Possible Trinkets:** - **Silver Merchant's Seal** – A stamped coin of **Valmere's trade guild**. Can be used to negotiate better prices or convince a merchant you are a trusted trader. - **Lucky Bandit’s Coin** – A coin with **two heads**, always landing on heads when flipped. **Gives advantage on the first gambling check per day**, but someone may **recognize it as false.** - **Fine Bottle of Elverdeen Reserve** – A bottle of **very rare wine** worth 50 GP to collectors. Drinking it grants **+1 Charisma for 1 hour**, but drinking too much **imposes disadvantage on Dexterity checks.** - **Torn Wanted Poster** – A crumpled, half-burned bounty poster. The name and face are too faded to read, but the reward is **200 GP** if turned in to the right person. - **Horsehair Fetish** – A braided strand of horse hair tied with a small silver charm. Grants **advantage on Animal Handling checks with horses** but smells slightly of sweat and hay. ### **🎲 Additional Trinkets:** - **Valmere Trader’s Token** – A **symbol of Valmere’s trading guild**, which grants **advantage on Persuasion checks with merchants**. - **Runed Arrowhead** – A dull metal arrowhead **engraved with strange markings**. Glows when pointed north. - **Shattered Spyglass Lens** – Holding this up to one eye **reveals faint, ghostly outlines of where objects used to be.** - **Silver Button of Luck** – When flipped, grants **advantage on the next skill check**, but disappears after use. ### **🍴 Consumables:** - **Merchant’s Rations** – A fancy box of preserved food. Restores **3d4 HP**, but the packaging is **so noisy it imposes disadvantage on Stealth checks** for an hour. - **Spiced Wine Flask** – Grants **+1 Charisma for 1 hour** but **causes mild tipsiness**. - **Quickstep Powder** – A tiny vial of green dust that, when inhaled, **grants +10 feet of movement speed for 10 minutes**, but causes an uncontrollable **urge to tap dance**. - **Mystic Trail Mix** – A blend of dried fruit and nuts that restores **1d8 HP** but causes the eater to **speak in rhymes** for 10 minutes. --- ### **🔎 Missing Heirloom** - **Area Description:** The Ashenwood Forest is thick with tangled roots and misty air, making visibility difficult. A crumbling stone shrine stands in a clearing, overgrown with ivy. - **Unique Features:** An old wooden swing sways gently from a tree branch, though there’s no wind. A small pile of fresh wildflowers is placed near the shrine. An eerie, distant humming can be heard at night. **🌿 Hidden Story:** The swing once belonged to a little girl named **Elira**, the daughter of Lady Amira Venmire. Years ago, Elira wandered too deep into the Ashenwood Forest while playing, lured by the beauty of the wildflowers she loved to collect. When night fell, she tried to find her way home but never did. Her mother searched endlessly, but Elira’s remains were never found. The grief-stricken Lady Amira continued visiting the forest, unknowingly passing by the very place where her child perished. Elira’s spirit remains tied to the swing, waiting for her mother to return. She hums softly at night, a lullaby Lady Amira used to sing to her. If the party presents the **family heirloom**, which once belonged to Elira, she will gently cradle it, whisper "thank you," and finally move on, leaving behind a **Forest’s Blessing Charm**—a delicate wooden charm that grants **advantage on survival checks in forests.** If the party tries to free her, she resists, explaining she cannot leave because the forest remembers her. She is part of it now. If they insist, she will only agree if they take her locket on her skeleton and place it in her mother’s hands, giving her closure. Only then will she be able to rest peacefully, and the forest will grant the party **a hidden path known only to the spirits, allowing them to traverse Ashenwood Forest safely in the future.** **🦴 Enemies:** - **Treant Sapling (x1, guarding the shrine)** – AC 16, HP 45, Slam +7 (2d8+3 Bludgeoning), Grasping Vines (DC 15 Strength or restrained), Resistant to Non-Magical Damage. - **Mysterious Tracker (x1, another adventurer looking for the locket)** – AC 15, HP 35, Rapier +7 (1d8+3 Piercing), Parry (Reaction, +2 AC to avoid one melee attack), Evasion (Half damage on failed Dex saves, none on success). **🎲 Possible Trinkets:** - **Petrified Flower Pendant** – A small stone flower that **pulses faintly when in the presence of fey creatures**. Grants **advantage on Nature checks related to plants.** - **Engraved Wooden Ring** – A ring carved with **unreadable runes**. When twisted, it **shifts colors based on nearby emotions**, helping with **Insight checks**. - **Elira’s Shimmering Hair Ribbon** – A spectral-blue ribbon tied into a neat bow. Grants **advantage on Charisma (Performance) checks when dancing** but gives the wearer occasional daydreams of a distant meadow. ### **🍴 Consumables:** - **Mystic Berry Jam** – Eating it grants **advantage on the next Perception check**, but for an hour, the eater **can only whisper.** - **Ghostwater Flask** – When poured out, the water **briefly reflects past events in that location**. - **Luminous Petal Tea** – This floral tea **glows faintly in the dark** and grants **advantage on Insight checks** for an hour. - **Elven Honeydrop** – A single golden lozenge that **instantly soothes pain** but also causes the eater to **hear soft, distant singing for 10 minutes.** --- ### **⛏️ Mysterious Cave** - **Area Description:** A yawning cave entrance sits nestled in the rocky hills, with cool air seeping from within. Inside, luminescent fungi line the walls, casting an eerie blue glow. Stalactites drip with an unknown, viscous liquid. - **Unique Features:** A stone pedestal stands in a shaft of light from an opening above, cradling a rusted iron chest. The echoes inside the cave sometimes repeat words the adventurers never said. Strange claw marks line the walls. **🕵️ Hidden Story:** Long ago, **Rendell Voss**, an ambitious explorer and scholar, ventured into the cave searching for a legendary artifact known as the **Heart of the Hollow Echo**. According to ancient texts, the Heart was said to grant its wielder knowledge beyond mortal comprehension—but at a terrible cost. Rendell’s journal, found within a rusted iron chest near the cave’s entrance, details his descent into the cavern. Initially, his writings are filled with excitement over the bioluminescent fungi and the strange, shifting echoes. However, as the entries progress, his tone becomes erratic. He writes of _whispers that respond to his thoughts before he speaks them, shadows that move when he isn't looking, and a reflection of himself in the water that does not match his own movements._ His final entry is smeared, the ink blotched by what appears to be dried blood: > _"The cave knows me now. It speaks in my voice. I see myself in the dark, and I am smiling when I should not be. I will find the Heart, or perhaps it has found me. If I do not return, do not seek me. The echo has taken my name. It belongs here now."_ Deeper inside the cave, the adventurers may discover **Rendell’s skeletal remains**, eerily **intact and posed as if writing one final passage**. His fingers are curled around a glowing gemstone—the supposed **Heart of the Hollow Echo**. However, taking the gem **causes the echoes in the cave to grow louder**, eventually coalescing into a humanoid form that mirrors one of the party members. If ignored, it merely watches. If engaged, it attacks with the strength of its chosen host, mimicking their movements and abilities. Destroying the mimic does not destroy the echoes. The cave will always remember those who enter. ****🦴 Enemies:** - **Echo Wraith (x1, haunting the cavern)** – AC 15, HP 50, Shadow Claws +7 (2d6 Psychic), Phases Through Walls, Life Drain (DC 14 Con save or lose 1d8 max HP for 1 hour). - Multiattack - **Animated Armor (x3, protecting something valuable)** – AC 18, HP 45, Slam +6 (1d6+3 Bludgeoning), Immune to Poison, Blindness, and Charm, Overclock (Can take two attacks per round if not hit the previous round). WERAITH - **Mirror Strike:** It **attacks just as a player swings**, mimicking their own attack roll **against them.** - **Echo Step:** It vanishes and **reappears behind them**, using their own **last movement pattern.** - **Final Scream (10 HP or less):** It **erupts into dozens of spectral forms**, forcing **everyone to make a DC 16 Charisma save** or **see themselves die in a future vision. - 🌀 **Fragmented Reality** _(Passive)_ – If an enemy **misses an attack**, the Wraith **rewinds time slightly**, forcing them to **reroll the attack at disadvantage**—as if they never swung in the first place.** 🌀 **Unfinished Sentences** _(Passive, Aura 30 ft.)_ – Any time a creature speaks near the Wraith, **their sentence is repeated back to them before they finish** in their own voice. If a player tries to cast a spell that requires **verbal components**, they must make a **DC 15 Intelligence save** or **fail the spell as their words are lost in the echoes. ** 🌀 **Echo’s Final Whisper** _(Legendary Action, Once per Fight)_ - The Wraith **copies a single ability from any creature in combat** and uses it immediately, even if it’s a spell. **🎲 Possible Trinkets:** - **Whispering Pebble** – A small, smooth stone that **whispers unintelligible phrases** when held. If placed in water, it reveals **the last words spoken near it.** - **Old Brass Compass** – The needle spins wildly, then settles when near **ancient ruins or hidden doors.** - **Chipped Silver Mask** – A cracked, elegant mask. When worn, **causes people to mistake the wearer for someone else for a short time (DC 13 Insight to see through it).** - **Fungal Lantern Core** – A glowing chunk of bioluminescent fungus. Can be used as a **dim light source for 24 hours** before crumbling into dust. - **Rendell’s Lost Coin** – A heavy, tarnished silver coin with an unfamiliar face on it. Flipping it sometimes **yields three results: heads, tails, or an eerie glowing sigil.** ### **🎲 Additional Trinkets:** - **Cave Diver’s Charm** – A small stone amulet that grants **advantage on saves against being blinded** in dark places. - **Echoing Locket** – A metal locket that **repeats any sound made near it exactly 30 seconds later.** - **Rendell’s Broken Compass** – Points in the **direction of the nearest magical anomaly** but never north. - **Glowing Geode** – Can be cracked open to release **a faintly glowing mist** that lasts for an hour. ### **🍴 Consumables:** - **Glowcap Mushroom** – When eaten, grants **dim light around the eater for 1 hour**, but **makes their skin faintly bioluminescent for 24 hours**. - **Blackroot Tea** – Drinking this grants **resistance to poison for an hour** but **causes mild hallucinations.** - **Cave Lichen Loaf** – A dense, chewy bread that **keeps you full for 24 hours**, but causes **all food eaten afterwards to taste like dirt** for a day. - **Dwarven Stonebrew** – A thick, almost chewable beer that grants **advantage on Constitution checks** but makes the drinker **speak in Dwarvish for an hour.** --- ### **⚔️ Bounty: Goblin Raiders** - **Area Description:** A muddy clearing in the middle of dense underbrush, scattered with makeshift wooden barricades and half-rotten tents. The faint smell of burnt meat lingers. - **Unique Features:** A half-buried wooden chest sits beside a goblin fire pit, its lock rusted shut. A crude painting on a stone wall depicts a goblin riding what appears to be a giant boar. **⚔️ Hidden Story:** The goblins are more organized than expected—too disciplined for a typical raiding party. Among their belongings, the adventurers may find a **sealed missive in perfect Common**, outlining a **contract between an unknown figure and the goblins.** The letter warns them to **"attack only weak caravans and avoid killing those who ask the right questions."** Who is behind these orders? And why are the goblins listening? **⚠️ Goblin Ambush:** The goblins have set up **hidden spike pits** (DC 14 Perception to notice, 2d6 piercing if fallen into) and **a collapsing net trap** (DC 13 Dex save or be restrained). If the party is too noisy, the goblins will trigger the traps first, then attack from the trees with javelins before retreating into cover. **🦴 Enemies:** - **Goblin Scouts (x6)** – AC 15, HP 18, Shortsword +6 (1d6+3 Slashing), Nimble Escape (Disengage as bonus action). - **Goblin Boss (x1)** – AC 17, HP 38, Scimitar +7 (1d8+3 Slashing), Boss Orders (Grants an ally an extra attack, once per round). - **Hobgoblin Overseer (x1, if party investigates further)** – AC 18, HP 50, Longsword +7 (1d10+4 Slashing), Martial Discipline (Advantage on attacks when allies are near). **🎲 Possible Trinkets:** - **Goblin Carved Bone Flute** – Strangely, it **only plays one eerie note**. Any goblin who hears it **must roll a DC 12 Wisdom save or become frightened for 1 turn.** - **Tattered Map with Goblin Scrawlings** – Depicts **a hidden supply cache** deep in the hills. A successful **Investigation check (DC 14)** can reveal the location of hidden treasure. [[Random Funny Loot]] - **Old Dwarven Coin** – Possibly looted from an ancient site, depicts a long-forgotten king. Can be sold for **15 GP** or used to **gain favor with dwarves.** - **Goblin’s Lucky Eyeball** – A fake glass eye on a string, rumored to bring **good luck to whoever wears it (advantage on one ability check per long rest).** - **Bone Dice of Trickery** – A pair of crude dice that always seem to roll in the owner’s favor… unless someone is watching closely (DC 14 Perception to notice the trick). ### **🎲 Additional Trinkets:** - **Goblin’s Laughing Coin** – Flipping it produces **a random goblin cackle** instead of a sound. - **Hobgoblin War Beads** – Worn as a bracelet, grants **advantage on Intimidation checks against goblins**. - **Crude Wooden Mask** – Wearing it **makes goblins think the wearer is one of them (DC 15 Insight to see through the disguise).** - **Goblin Sketchbook** – A series of crude, chaotic doodles depicting **hilariously exaggerated battles.** ### **🍴 Consumables:** - **Goblin Firebrew** – A fiery alcohol that **causes the drinker to breathe out a harmless puff of smoke for 10 minutes.** - **Crunchy Bug Biscuit** – Restores **1d4 HP** but tastes **so vile it imposes disadvantage on Concentration checks for 10 minutes.** - **Goblinoid Meat Jerky** – Unknown meat. Grants **temporary hit points equal to 1d6**, but the eater must make a **DC 12 Constitution save** or feel **mildly nauseous**. - **Spicy Squiggles** – A bag of **crunchy, spicy dried fungi** that grants **resistance to cold damage for 1 hour** but makes the eater **sweat profusely.** --- # 📜 **The Gravedigger’s Curse – An Undead Encounter** ## **⚰️ Grave Robbery Investigation** ### **🕯️ Area Description:** The **Elverdeen Cemetery** is a place of old stone paths and weathered graves, surrounded by **twisted, skeletal trees** that creak in the wind. A heavy fog clings to the ground, and the air is **unnaturally cold**. In the center of the cemetery stands a **half-dug grave**, with a shovel still buried in the dirt, its handle snapped in two. The headstones nearby are **disturbed**, and some have **faint claw marks** running down their surface. In the distance, a shadowed figure **moves between the tombstones**, muttering to himself as he digs **over and over**, never stopping, never looking up. --- ## **💀 Hidden Story: "The Gravedigger’s Curse"** Once, **Edric Varn** was a simple gravedigger, a quiet man who honored the dead by ensuring they were buried with care. But one night, **he made a mistake.** A wealthy noble had died suddenly, and his family insisted on **a rushed burial** before dawn. Edric followed orders, but he failed to notice **something was wrong.** The noble **wasn’t dead.** Buried alive, the man **scratched at his coffin for hours, screaming beneath the earth, unheard by all—except Edric.** By the time he realized the truth, it was too late. The guilt consumed him. **He began digging at night, convinced he could still hear voices calling from the graves.** One night, something **answered.** A spirit, drawn to his torment, **bound itself to him**, forcing him to dig **forever, searching for the one he buried alive.** Now, Edric is **neither alive nor fully dead**, cursed to **dig and dig, never resting, never remembering why.** His shovel moves as if guided by an unseen force, and his **shadow twitches and moves independently**—as if it is controlling him, not the other way around. --- ## **🦴 Enemies: The Gravedigger’s Curse** ### **Edric Varn, the Cursed Gravedigger (Undead Spirit-Host)** - **AC 16 | HP 75 | Speed 30 ft | Resistances: Necrotic, Psychic, Nonmagical Weapons | Condition Immunities: Charmed, Frightened** **🗡️ Attacks & Abilities:** - **Cursed Shovel Strike** _(Melee, +7 to hit, 2d8+3 Bludgeoning + 1d6 Necrotic)_ – Every strike leaves a **rotting wound** that cannot be healed until a long rest. - **Digging Frenzy (Recharge 4-6):** Swings wildly in a circle, forcing all creatures within 10 feet to make a **DC 14 Dexterity save** or take **3d6 Slashing damage** as his shovel digs through **flesh as if it were soil.** - **The Voice from Below:** Every round, the **spirit whispers in his ear**, forcing him to **attack the nearest creature, regardless of friend or foe.** - **Restless Duty (Passive):** He **never truly dies**—if reduced to 0 HP, he **collapses but rises again in 1d4 rounds unless the spirit is exorcised.** ### **The Whispering Spirit (True Enemy – Invisible)** - **AC 13 | HP 50 | Speed 40 ft | Resistances: Radiant, Nonmagical Weapons | Condition Immunities: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened** **🗡️ Attacks & Abilities:** - **Spirit's Grip (Bonus Action):** The spirit can **possess Edric’s body**, granting him **advantage on all attacks for 1 round**. - **Unseen Whisper (Passive):** The spirit is **completely invisible** unless a **Detect Magic, See Invisibility, or radiant spell reveals it.** - **Bury Them Deeper (Recharge 5-6):** The spirit commands the earth itself to **pull enemies underground** (DC 15 Strength save or be restrained for 1 round). --- ## **💀 How to Truly Kill It** - **Edric is not the real enemy**—the **spirit is controlling him**. - Attacking Edric only **delays him**, but he **always gets back up unless the spirit is exorcised.** - The spirit is **invisible unless revealed by magic or attacking the empty space around Edric.** - If the party **digs up the noble’s grave**, they find **rotted fingernails inside the coffin lid**—proving what happened. This **weakens the spirit**. - Pouring **holy water into the grave or burning the noble’s remains banishes the spirit permanently.** --- ## **🎲 Possible Trinkets & Consumables** - **Edric’s Rusted Shovel** – Functions as a **+1 weapon**, but once per long rest, it can **dig a 5ft-deep grave instantly.** - **Noble’s Signet Ring** – Belonged to the buried noble. Grants **advantage on Persuasion checks with nobility** but makes **ghosts notice the wearer more easily.** - **Soil of the Forgotten** – A pouch of grave dirt from the noble’s grave. When thrown, it **briefly reveals invisible undead within 30 feet.** - **Lamenting Locket** – An old locket with a portrait inside. Once per day, the wearer can hear a **soft whisper warning them of impending danger.** ---

entries.title: "📜 Adventurers’ Guild Job Board – Silver Tier"
entries.summary: # 📜 Adventurers’ Guild Job Board – Silver Tier
entries.body:
# 📜 Adventurers’ Guild Job Board – Silver Tier

## **🟠 Silver Tier (Intermediate-Level Quests – Balanced for a Strong Level 5 Party)**

| **Quest Name**                        | **Description**                                                                                                    | **Location**              | **Encounter Details**                                                                                                           |
| ------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **🐺 Wolf Pack Terrorizing Farmland** | A **large, aggressive wolf pack** has been attacking **livestock and travelers** near the village of **Durnhill**. | Durnhill Farmlands        | **Alpha Dire Wolf (x1), Shadow Wolves (x5-7)**. Wolves **attack at night, using stealth and coordination to pick off targets.** |
| **🦷 Cave of the Gnoll Warband**      | A **small gnoll warband** has been seen **gathering weapons** in an abandoned cave. The mayor fears an attack.     | Broken Fang Cave          | **Gnoll Pack Leader, Hyenas, & Trained Gnoll Hunters**. Gnolls are preparing a **large-scale raid and have a deadly shaman.**   |
| **🦑 Something Lurks in the Lake**    | The **fishermen of Stillwater Lake** report that something **huge** is attacking boats at night.                   | Stillwater Lake           | **Enormous Lake Monster (Kraken Spawn or Water Elemental)**. Can be **negotiated with, driven off, or fought in deep waters.**  |
| **👁️ The Hermit’s Crypt**            | A **lonely crypt** on the outskirts of Elverdeen has begun to **glow with eerie green light at night.**            | The Forgotten Burial Site | **Powerful Undead Guardian, Trapped Souls, and a Lich’s Apprentice**. The crypt **hides ancient secrets and lost magic.**       |

---

## **🐺 Wolf Pack Terrorizing Farmland**

- **Area Description:** Rolling farmlands stretch across the horizon, dotted with abandoned fields and broken fences. **The howls of wolves echo through the hills** every night, making sleep impossible for the villagers.
    
- **Unique Features:** A **massive, clawed tree stump** stands at the edge of the farmland, filled with scratch marks and the **bones of past kills.** A local shepherd swears the Alpha Wolf speaks in whispers before it strikes.
    

**🐾 Hidden Story:** The Alpha Dire Wolf, **Fangbane**, was once a guardian spirit of the land, but something **cursed and corrupted it**. Now, it leads its pack in relentless terror, drawn toward something buried deep beneath the farmland.

**🦴 Enemies:**

- **Alpha Dire Wolf (x1)** – AC 16, HP 90, Bite +8 (2d8+4 Piercing), **Pack Leader (Grants wolves advantage on attacks within 30 feet).**
    
- **Shadow Wolves (x5-7)** – AC 15, HP 45, Bite +6 (1d8+3 Piercing), **Vanishing Step (Once per turn, can move 10 ft without provoking opportunity attacks).**
    

### **🎲 Possible Trinkets:**

- **Wolf Fang Pendant** – Grants **+1 AC against beasts**, but **wolves are always hostile toward the wearer**.
    
- **Hunter’s Lucky Arrow** – **+1 magical arrow** that, if missed, **returns to the quiver after 6 seconds**.
    
- **Moonstone Collar** – An old enchanted wolf collar. **Howls faintly at night but may be used to befriend one wolf.**
    

---

## **🦷 Cave of the Gnoll Warband**

- **Area Description:** The cave entrance is **lined with crude spears** and painted with the **symbols of Yeenoghu, the demon god of slaughter**. The deeper tunnels **reverberate with the gnoll’s hyena-like laughter.**
    
- **Unique Features:** A **torture pit** lined with gnawed bones and a **strange glowing idol** in the back of the cave.
    

**⚔️ Hidden Story:** The gnolls aren’t just raiders; they are **preparing a ritual sacrifice** to summon something much worse. If not stopped, they will unleash a **feral demon into the region.**

**🦴 Enemies:**

- **Gnoll Pack Leader (x1)** – AC 17, HP 100, Glaive +8 (2d10+4 Slashing), **Pack Frenzy (Attacks twice if an ally is nearby).**
    
- **Trained Gnoll Hunters (x3)** – AC 15, HP 50, Longbow +6 (1d8+2 Piercing), **Tracker’s Mark (Enemies hit cannot hide).**
    
- **Gnoll Shaman (x1)** – AC 14, HP 60, **Casts Inflict Wounds, Hold Person, and Summon Hyena.**
    

### **🎲 Possible Trinkets:**

- **Hyena’s Laughing Skull** – If held, causes the user to randomly **laugh uncontrollably once per day** (DC 13 Wis save to resist).
    
- **Tainted Gnoll War Banner** – Covered in dried blood. Holding it **grants advantage on Intimidation checks** but **disadvantage on Persuasion**.
    
- **Bone Dagger of the Hunt** – A curved blade that **glows when a creature within 30 feet is bleeding.**
    




---

## **🦑 Something Lurks in the Lake**

- **Area Description:** The still waters of **Stillwater Lake** ripple despite the absence of wind. Strange **bubbles rise to the surface** at irregular intervals. **The old dock creaks underfoot.**
    
- **Unique Features:** An **abandoned fishing boat** is anchored offshore, completely untouched, except for deep claw marks along its hull.
    

**🌊 Hidden Story:** The beast in the lake is not a **mindless creature**—it is the last guardian of an **ancient, submerged temple**. If approached with respect, it may offer knowledge **instead of death.**

**🦴 Enemies:**

- **Lake Horror (x1)** – AC 18, HP 120, Tentacle Slam +9 (2d10+5 Bludgeoning), **Drag Under (If hit, DC 15 Strength or pulled underwater).**
    
- **Summoned Water Wraiths (x3)** – AC 15, HP 55, Drown Touch +7 (1d8+3 Necrotic), **Resistant to non-magical damage.**
    

### **🎲 Possible Trinkets:**

- **Pearl of the Abyss** – Allows the holder to breathe underwater **for 10 minutes per day.**
    
- **Enchanted Fishing Hook** – Any fish caught with this is **three times larger than normal** but **cursed with eerie whispers**.
    
- **Barnacle-Encrusted Silver Ring** – Grants **advantage on Athletics (Swimming) checks**, but **smells faintly of seawater forever.**
    

---

## **👁️ The Hermit’s Crypt**

- **Area Description:** The entrance to the crypt is **covered in ancient carvings**, glowing faintly with green energy. The **air is thick with decay, and strange whispers** beckon the living inside.
    
- **Unique Features:** A **door covered in runes**, a **floating ghostly lantern**, and **a skeletal hand clutching a silver key.**
    

**💀 Hidden Story:** The crypt belonged to **The Nameless Hermit**, a cursed scholar who sought eternal knowledge. Now, his **soul is bound** to the crypt, forced to guard the **secrets he once sought.**

**🦴 Enemies:**

- **The Cursed Hermit (x1, Undead Sorcerer)** – AC 18, HP 110, Casts **Ray of Enfeeblement, Arcane Lock, and Animate Dead.**
    
- **Skeletal Guardians (x4)** – AC 16, HP 55, Sword +7 (1d8+3 Slashing), **Resistant to Piercing Damage.**
    

### **🎲 Possible Trinkets:**

- **Spectral Lantern** – A floating lantern that **never goes out** but sometimes whispers in Infernal.
    
- **Silver Key of the Nameless** – Unlocks **any magically sealed door once**, then vanishes.
    
- **The Hermit’s Last Words** – A page of indecipherable writing. Anyone who deciphers it **learns a forgotten spell, but at what cost?**
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Session plans/Guild Quests!/Guild Board details (Silver).md

entries.title: "**The Howling Glass**"
entries.body:
## **The Howling Glass**

### **Quest Giver:** Remus Varrin, a desperate alchemist

A jittery, sleep-deprived alchemist named **Remus Varrin** begs the party for help. His prized **obsidian mirror** has been stolen, and he's convinced it is cursed. **Anyone who gazes into it sees their worst fears whispered back at them**, slowly driving them mad.

### **The Investigation**

- The thief is **Mikkel Darthe**, a rogue who was **obsessed with his own reflection** and believed he was meant for greater things.
- Witnesses say **Mikkel has been acting strangely**—his voice echoing slightly, his movements a little too fluid, and his reflection **not matching his actions**.

### **The Twist**

- **Mikkel's reflection has possessed him.** The real Mikkel is **trapped inside the mirror**, and the entity now controlling him is slowly **learning to exist in the real world**.
- The reflection is **imperfect**—sometimes blinking out of sync or **mouthing different words** than what Mikkel actually says.
- The **mirror cannot be broken** without also killing Mikkel. To save him, the party must **trick the entity into looking into its own reflection**, forcing it back into the glass.

### **Resolution**

- If the party saves Mikkel, he remains shaken and avoids mirrors for the rest of his life.
- If they fail, the entity **escapes fully**, becoming an **independent doppelgänger** capable of replacing **anyone** it chooses.

---

## **The Tournament of Deception**

### **Quest Giver:** Varrek Steelhide, Guild Master

Varrek, the gruff and no-nonsense Guild Master, wants the tournament to be fair—but **every contestant is cheating in some way**. The tournament will be a **bracket-style series of 1v1 duels**, but the party is also **tasked with exposing the cheaters**.

### **Tournament Structure**

- The event is held in **Elverdeen's Grand Arena**, a massive stone coliseum.
- **Eight contestants**, including the party, will fight in **single-elimination rounds**.
- **The final match's prize**: A **legendary enchanted weapon** said to grant immense power.

### **The Cheaters**

1. **Garrik "The Iron Wall" Thorne** – A knight using **hidden armor runes** that make him _immune_ to the first hit of every fight.
2. **Lailia "The Phantom Blade"** – A rogue who secretly uses **invisible poison-coated daggers** hidden in her sleeves.
3. **Borik the Unbreakable** – A barbarian who drinks a **"rage elixir"** between rounds, boosting his strength past normal limits.
4. **Fenrir "The Cursed Monk"** – A spellcaster **disguised as a monk**, channeling magic through "pure martial arts."
5. **Ulgrim the Undying** – A **literal undead warrior** enchanted to not "die" in combat unless sunlight touches him.
6. **Jekko the Trickster** – A clown-like sorcerer who **swaps places with a duplicate** if he’s about to be knocked out.
7. **A Random Goat** – No one knows why it was entered. It does not cheat, but it **fights surprisingly well**.

### **The Twist**

- The **enchanted weapon** is actually _cursed_—whoever wields it **loses their next battle** no matter what.
- The organizer, **Lord Fexar**, is actually **betting on the rigged matches** and wants to keep the cheating secret.

### **Resolution**

- If the party fights fair and wins, they can **break the curse** on the weapon.
- If they **expose the cheating**, the tournament ends in **chaos**, leading to **a city-wide brawl** as angry spectators demand refunds.

---

## **The Merchant’s Curse**

### **Quest Giver:** Gareth Vindle, a cursed merchant

Gareth, a frantic and increasingly **disheveled** merchant, pleads for help. Ever since a mysterious **sorcerer** cursed him, **everything he touches transforms**—sometimes into gold, sometimes into **absolute garbage**.

### **The Chaos of the Curse**

- **Touching metal coins?** Turns into **dead fish.**
- **Holding a mug?** Transforms into a **screaming frog**.
- **Accidentally brushing against his own **clothing**? Becomes **solid granite**.

### **The Investigation**

- The sorcerer, **Professor Myndrik**, is **testing new magic** to create **"living conduits of change"**.
- Myndrik believes he has **perfected "Wild Magic Infusion"**, and Gareth is **just an experimental subject**.
- Gareth will **explode into pure arcane chaos** in **three days** if the magic isn’t reversed.

### **The Twist**

- The curse can **only be undone** if someone **willingly** takes it from Gareth.
- The sorcerer offers **a deal**: one party member **can inherit the Wild Magic**, gaining a random magical effect every dawn.

### **Resolution**

- If the party removes the curse, **Gareth resumes business—though forever paranoid of touching things**.
- If the curse remains, **he continues transforming objects at random**, eventually **turning into pure energy** and dissipating.

---

## **The Echoing Duel**

### **Quest Giver:** Dibbins, the Immortal Annoyance

A tiny, **ridiculously confident** little creature (**race of your choice—kobold, goblin, animated plush doll**) **challenges the party’s strongest fighters**. He claims that **each time he dies, he grows stronger.**

### **First Fight**

- Dibbins is **comically weak** and **instantly dies** to the first attack.
- With his **dying breath**, he **laughs maniacally** and promises, _"I shall return… STRONGER THAN EVER!"_

### **The Cycle**

- Dibbins **keeps showing up**—every few hours, every day, every week—always **announcing his return with a dramatic entrance**.
- However, **he never actually gets stronger**.
- He might bring **slightly bigger weapons** each time (sticks, spoons, a butter knife), but he still dies instantly.

### **The Twist**

- **Dibbins is truly immortal.**
- He **remembers every fight** but **learns nothing useful**—he keeps making the **same mistakes**.
- He starts **setting up elaborate duels** with **epic entrances**, **music**, and **fireworks**.
- People in town **start betting on how fast he’ll die.**

### **Resolution**

- If the party plays along, Dibbins **becomes their eternal fan**, constantly telling tales of **"his epic battles"** (where he died in one hit).
- If they ignore him, he **follows them forever**, randomly challenging them at **the worst possible moments**.

---

## **The Head That Talks**

### **Quest Giver:** A panicked merchant named Ovrik

Ovrik purchased **a jar containing a preserved severed head** from a traveling wizard. Unfortunately, the head **won’t stop talking**, and worse—it **knows things it shouldn’t**.

### **The Head’s Knowledge**

- Secrets about **royalty**, **hidden treasures**, **assassinations**, and **ancient conspiracies**.
- **It knows each party member’s name** and some **embarrassing personal facts**.
- It **talks constantly**, making sleep impossible for whoever carries it.

### **The Twist**

- The head **belongs to General Mordain**, a legendary **military strategist** executed decades ago.
- It **wants to be revived**—and if the party helps, he **could change Elverdeen’s political landscape**.
- However, if they **fail to keep him hidden**, powerful factions will **hunt them down** to silence him.

### **Resolution**

- If revived, Mordain **begins plotting his return to power**—potentially sparking **a civil war**.
- If left in the jar, he **complains constantly**, but will **offer valuable military advice** when bribed with fine wine.

entries.title: "Random Funny Loot"
entries.summary:
- **Mug of Infinite Backwash** – A crude wooden mug that magically refills itself with **lukewarm, suspiciously chunky ale** once per day.
- **Goblin Tooth Necklace** – Each tooth **whispers compliments** to the wearer but only in **Goblin**, making it useless unless you speak the language.
- **Screaming Rock** – A small rock that, when thrown, lets out a **horrible goblin scream**, causing **everyone within 10 feet to be startled** (but nothing else).
- **Mystic Slime Jar** – A jar of **questionably alive green slime** that sometimes **changes shape to mock people nearby** but does nothing else useful.
- **Goblin Wrestling Belt** – A crudely decorated leather belt that **grants +1 Strength for grappling but forces the wearer to challenge random people to fights.**
- **Really Long Spoon** – A spoon so absurdly long (5 feet) that it **grants +1 to etiquette checks** but makes it impossible to eat from a normal-sized bowl.
- **Potion of Goblin Courage** – Drinking this **imposes disadvantage on Intelligence checks** for an hour but **grants temporary hit points equal to your level.**
- **Bag of Unfinished Goblin Snacks** – Contains **half-eaten jerky, a single roasted beetle, and a moldy bread crust**. Eating any of it **restores 1 HP but tastes horrible**.
- **The G.O.A.T. Horn** – A goat horn that, when blown, **summons the nearest goat within 1 mile**. If no goat is present, it instead **gives the user a loud, raspy goblin cough**.
