entries.title: "🏰 **Dungeon Layout & Encounters**"
entries.body:
## 🏰 **Dungeon Layout & Encounters**

### 🚪 **Room 1: Entrance Chamber**

- **Description:** Damp, dimly lit room with scattered bones, debris, and echoes of distant dripping water.
- **Encounter:**  
    **3 Giant Rats**
    - **HP:** 7
    - **AC:** 12
    - **Attack:** Bite (+4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing)
- **Notes:** Easy intro fight; sets spooky vibe.

### 🪨 **Room 2: Trapped Corridor**

- **Description:** Narrow hallway; suspicious pressure plates visible (easy DC 12 perception check to spot).
- **Trap:**  
    **Arrow Trap**
    - **Effect:** Pressure plate triggers arrow (DC 12 Dex save or 1d6 piercing damage).
- **Notes:** Introduces players to watching out for traps.

### ⚔️ **Room 3: Guard Post**

- **Description:** Old guard post with broken furniture; remnants of recent activity (signs of struggle).
- **Encounter:**  
    **2 Skeletons**
    - **HP:** 13
    - **AC:** 13 (armor scraps, shield)
    - **Attack:** Shortsword (+4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing)
- **Notes:** Adds undead vibe; quick combat.

### 🧩 **Room 4: Puzzle Chamber**

- **Description:** Stone room with **3 levers**; closed gate at the end.
- **Puzzle:** Simple **lever puzzle** (pulling levers in wrong order summons **1 Giant Rat** per failed attempt, correct order: middle → left → right).
- **Encounter (if wrong order):**
    - **1 Giant Rat** (same stats as Room 1)

### 🔥 **Room 5: Main Chamber (Miniboss Fight)**

### 🏛️ **Room Description**

- Large, dimly lit chamber, **sinister altar** at center.
- Missing child tied up in corner, terrified, in a blood star circle.
- Dark mage chanting ritual, protected by guards.
- Enormous, monstrous beast chained nearby, released when combat starts.

---

### 🧙‍♂️ **1. Dark Cult Mage (Leader)**

- **HP:** 20
- **AC:** 12 (robes)
- **Attack:**
    - **Fire Bolt:** +4 to hit, 1d10 fire damage (cantrip)
    - **Magic Missile:** auto-hit, three darts, 1d4+1 force each (1 slot)
    - **Sleep:** total 5d8 HP of creatures, starting lowest HP first, fall asleep (1 slot)
- **Tactics:**
    - Stay behind guards and monster.
    - Cast **Sleep** early, use **Magic Missile** on threatening players.

---

### ⚔️ **2. Cult Guards (x2)**

- **HP:** 10 each
- **AC:** 12 (leather armor)
- **Attack:** Scimitar (+3 to hit, 1d6+1 slashing)
- **Tactics:**
    - Protect mage, block melee attackers.

---

### 🦍 **3. Chained Monstrosity ("The Guardian")**

- **Description:** Large, twisted beast (ogre-like, mutated)
- **HP:** 30
- **AC:** 11 (thick hide)
- **Attack:**
    - **Slam:** +5 to hit, 1d10+3 bludgeoning
    - **Roar (1/encounter):** DC 12 Wisdom save or frightened (disadvantage on attacks, can't move closer) until end of next turn
- **Tactics:**
    - Goes straight for biggest threat.
    - Roars early to frighten players.

---

## 🎭 **Combat Flow Suggestions**

- **Round 1:** Mage casts **Sleep**, guards rush forward, mage releases **monster**.
- **Round 2:** Monster **roars**, guards engage, mage uses **Magic Missile**.
- **Later rounds:** Mage switches to **Fire Bolt**, guards stay defensive, monster attacks closest player.

---

## 📜 **Encounter Summary & Stats**

### **Dark Cult Mage**

- **HP:** 20 | **AC:** 12
- **Spells:** Fire Bolt (+4, 1d10), Magic Missile (auto-hit, 3x1d4+1), Sleep (5d8 HP total)

### **Cult Guards (x2)**

- **HP:** 10 each | **AC:** 12
- **Attack:** Scimitar (+3, 1d6+1 slashing)

### **Chained Monstrosity**

- **HP:** 30 | **AC:** 11
- **Attack:** Slam (+5, 1d10+3)
- **Special:** Roar (DC 12 Wis save or frightened)

---

## ✨ **Extra Flavor**

- **Mage RP:** Chanting dark prayers (“You’re too late! The Guardian awakens!”).
- **Room Flavor:** Ritual symbols glowing, chains breaking dramatically as monster is unleashed.
- **Rewards:** After defeat, party finds mysterious clue, connecting to larger cult or deity.

entries.title: "**💀 Enemy Stats & Abilities**"
entries.body:
## **💀 Enemy Stats & Abilities**

### **🛡️ Sun Knights (x2) (Elite Paladins of Kaya)**

💪 _Heavily armored zealots sworn to Kaya, they are her enforcers, cutting down all who oppose the Order of the Light._

**📝 Stat Block:**

- **HP:** 45
- **AC:** 18 (Plate Armor, Sunlit Shield)
- **Speed:** 30 ft

**⚔️ Attacks:**

- **Greatsword of Radiance (Melee, +6 to hit)**
    - 2d6+3 **slashing + 1d6 radiant**
- **Sunfire Smite (Bonus Action, 1/day)**
    - Adds **2d8 radiant damage** to next hit.
    - Target must make a **DC 14 Con save or be blinded** until the end of next turn.

**🔥 Special Abilities:**

- **Sun Knight’s Devotion (1/encounter)**
    - When the **Priest Aldric would take damage**, a **Sun Knight can take the hit instead.**
- **Unyielding Light (1/encounter)**
    - If reduced to **0 HP**, the knight can **make a DC 14 Con save**. On a success, they **remain standing at 1 HP** and gain an **extra attack** on their next turn.
- **Aura of the Sun**
    - Creatures **within 10 feet** of the knight **cannot be frightened** and have **advantage on saves against necrotic damage.**

---

### **🛡️ Sunlight Enforcers (x4) (Lesser Knights of the Order)**

💀 _Loyal foot soldiers who follow the will of the high clergy, enforcing "purification" with blade and faith._

**📝 Stat Block:**

- **HP:** 28
- **AC:** 16 (Half Plate)
- **Speed:** 30 ft

**⚔️ Attacks:**

- **Sunsteel Longsword (Melee, +4 to hit)**
    - 1d8+2 **slashing**
- **Shield Bash (Bonus Action, 1/day)**
    - Target must make a **DC 12 Strength save or be knocked prone.**

**🔥 Special Abilities:**

- **Sunlit Formation**
    - If at least **two Enforcers** are adjacent, they gain **+1 AC and +1 to hit.**
- **Sacrificial Zeal (1/encounter)**
    - If a **Sun Knight is below 15 HP**, an **Enforcer can give up their turn to heal them for 10 HP.**
- **Sunborn Discipline**
    - Resistant to **charm & fear effects.**

---

### **🔥 Priest Aldric (High Cleric of Kaya, Boss)**

👁️ _A devout priest of Kaya, Aldric believes that purging Hollowbrook is a holy mission. He will stop at nothing to "cleanse the darkness."_

**📝 Stat Block:**

- **HP:** 50
- **AC:** 14 (Blessed Robes of the Sun)
- **Speed:** 30 ft

**⚔️ Attacks:**

- **Radiant Smite (Melee, +6 to hit)**
    - 4d8 **radiant damage**
    - On hit, target must make a **DC 14 Con save or be blinded for 1 turn.**
- **Sacred Sunfire (Ranged, DC 14 Dex Save)**
    - 2d10 **radiant damage**
    - If the target fails by **5 or more**, they **catch fire**, taking **1d6 radiant damage per turn** until they use an action to put it out.

**🔥 Special Abilities:**

- **Divine Purge (Ultimate, 1/encounter)**
    - _"The Light Takes All."_
    - The Priest **raises his staff to the sky**, calling down a **massive explosion of holy fire**.
    - ALL creatures in a **20 ft radius** make a **DC 15 Dex save**.
        - **Failure:** **5d8 radiant damage**.
        - **Success:** Half damage.
- **Blessing of Kaya (Bonus Action, 1/day)**
    - Heals **a Sun Knight or Enforcer** for **20 HP.**
- **Words of Conviction (1/encounter)**
    - Attempts to **turn one player against their allies.**
    - Target makes a **DC 14 Wis save** or is **charmed for 1 round**, forced to defend Aldric.

---

## **🛡️ Battle Tactics & Combat Flow**

💀 _This is not just a fight—it’s a test of the party’s will against the Order’s twisted faith._

### **🔥 Combat Strategy:**

1. **Knights Protect, Priest Attacks from Range.**
    
    - **Sun Knights stay near Aldric**, taking hits for him when necessary.
    - **Enforcers focus on flanking and breaking the party’s formation.**
2. **The Purge Begins.**
    
    - **Aldric uses his Divine Purge early** to deal **massive damage.**
    - **Enforcers use Sunlit Formation** to get advantage on rolls.
3. **Final Phase - The Last Stand.**
    
    - **If Aldric is below 20 HP,** he tries to **retreat into the chapel.**
    - **Sun Knights use Unyielding Light to keep fighting at 1 HP.**
    - **Enforcers go berserk, refusing to surrender.**

---

## **📜 Session Cliffhanger: What Happens After?**

🏆 **If the Party Wins:**

- **They stop the ritual.**
- The **Order of the Light now knows their names—they are branded as heretics.**
- **Do they take the anti-magic weapon? Destroy it? Or flee before reinforcements arrive?**

🔥 **If the Party Loses:**

- **Captured and taken before the High Cleric of the Sun Order.**
- Forced into a **moral test**—do they convert, or resist?
- **A new enemy watches from the shadows… someone even more powerful.**

entries.title: "🧪 **Consumables**"
entries.body:
First chest 💰💰💰💰💰

6 GOLD PEICES!

- **Warden’s Shield:**
    - +1 AC. Once/day, cast **Shield** (reaction) without spell slot.
- **Ring of Minor Restoration:**
    - Once/day, wearer can heal self or ally for 1d8 HP as bonus action.
### 🧪 **Consumables**

- **Potion of Lesser Strength:**
    - Grants +2 to Strength checks for 1 hour.
- **Vial of Corrosive Acid (Thrown Weapon):**
    - DC 13 Dex save or take 2d6 acid damage.
- 2 Pot healing

### 📜 **Damaged Scroll of Severing Light**

- **Description:**  
    _"This damaged scroll pulses with violent, unstable magic. It's scorched and tattered, but you sense a sharp, focused power within. Though unreadable, it crackles urgently, begging to be released."_
    
- **Effect (One-Time Use):**  
    **"Beam of Severing Light"**
    
    - **When cast:** A blinding, blood-red beam shoots from the scroll at a single target within 30 feet.
    - **Effect:**
        - Target must make a **DC 14 Constitution save**.
        - **Failure:** The beam **instantly severs** one limb of your choice, dealing **3d8 radiant damage**. The target also has **disadvantage** on attack rolls and abilities that require that limb.
        - **Success:** Target takes half damage, no limb loss, but still briefly **stunned** (loses next action).
- **Notes:**
    
    - Perfect for taking off the giant monster’s arm—dramatic and helpful but not an insta-kill.
    - After use, the scroll burns up dramatically.

### ✨ **RP Flavor for Use**

- When cast, describe a **scarlet beam** shooting forth, cutting cleanly like a **laser**, leaving a **smoking, cauterized wound**.
- Monster roars in pain; fight feels epic!



## 💰 **Cool Loot Ideas (Post-Fight Rewards)**

24 GOLD PEICES!!!!!
### 🗡️ **Weapons & Gear**

**Tinker’s Gauntlet (Glove, 1-Handed)**

- A strange metallic gauntlet with rotating gears.
- **Effect:** Once per day, can be used as **Thieves’ Tools** or cast **Mending**.

**Blade of Lingering Shadows (Dagger):**
    - +1 to hit, deals +1d4 necrotic damage once per short rest.

### 📿 **Magic Trinkets**

- **Amulet of the Crimson Eye:**
    
    - Allows wearer to cast **Detect Magic** at will.
    - Has a faint red glow in darkness.

### 📚 **Lore Items**

- **Cultist’s Diary:**
    - Contains clues about larger cult conspiracy and hints about a draconic language.
- **Mysterious Key:** - tristan got a nat 20
    - Engraved with same symbol found in the tome given to Esil, foreshadowing future quests.

entries.title: "📜 **Encounter Summary & Stats**"
entries.body:
## 📜 **Encounter Summary & Stats**

### 🐀 **Giant Rat**

- **HP:** 7 | **AC:** 12
- **Attack:** Bite (+4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing)

### 💀 **Skeleton**

- **HP:** 13 | **AC:** 13
- **Attack:** Shortsword (+4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing)


💀 **Skeleton** archer

- **HP:** 12 | **AC:** 13
- **Attack:**
    - **Shortbow:** +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft, **1d6 piercing**
    - **Bone Arrow (Special):** Once per encounter, the archer fires a cursed arrow. Target must make a **DC 12 Con save** or take **1d6 additional necrotic damage** and suffer disadvantage on their next attack.
    - 
### 🧙‍♂️ **Cultist Acolyte (Miniboss)**

- **HP:** 24 | **AC:** 13
- **Attack:**
    - **Dagger:** +4, 1d4+2 piercing
    - **Sacred Flame:** DC 12 Dex save, 1d8 radiant
    - **Inflict Wounds:** +4, melee, 3d10 necrotic (2 slots)
    - **Shield of Faith:** +2 AC (concentration)
- **Special:** Summon 2 Giant Rats (once per encounter)



### 🦍 **3. Chained Monstrosity ("The Guardian")**

- **Description:** Large, twisted beast (ogre-like, mutated)
- **HP:** 40
- **AC:** 11 (thick hide)
- **Attack:**
    - **Slam:** +5 to hit, 1d10+3 bludgeoning
    - **Roar (1/encounter):** DC 12 Wisdom save or frightened (disadvantage on attacks, can't move closer) until end of next turn
- **Tactics:**
    - Goes straight for biggest threat.
    - Roars early to frighten players.

entries.title: "🗒️ **First Session Plot Points**"
entries.body:
### 🗒️ **First Session Plot Points**

[[Git/DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Session plans/Season 1/Session 1/Dungeon]]
[[LOOT!!!!!]]
[[Monsters]]
[[Git/DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Session plans/Season 1/Session 1/Enemy Stats|Enemy Stats]]
#### 🏚️ **Tavern Intro (Classic Opening)**


- All characters start in a busy tavern; you briefly describe atmosphere, NPCs, etc.
- **Tristan (Silver)** decides to use his **wish**. Genie grants him an **ancient, creepy-looking tome**.
- Tristan’s disappointed it's not direct power, sees Ryan’s character (**Esil**) eyeing it curiously.

#### 💰 **Book Trade Scam**

- Tristan tells Esil it's **written in "ancient draconic"**, selling it as "legendary power" but useless to him.
- **Esil**, fascinated by dragons, trades a large sum of money for it—**Silver scams her big time**.
- Esil now has the **book** but can’t decipher it yet.

- As esil looks at the book - metion marco - he is interested in tristan saying something about unholy dark powers
- Also mention miki and isaac walking in

#### 📜 **Call for Adventure**

- Right after the trade, a **panicked villager/NPC** bursts into the tavern, urgently seeking help.
- **Hook:** A **child/young villager** is missing—last seen near an old, abandoned dungeon nearby.
- **Key detail:** Local guards and adventurers have been summoned elsewhere due to a **sudden goblin attack** nearby, so **only these adventurers remain** to help quickly.

#### ⚔️ **Party Gathers & Goes**

- **Lawful/Good-aligned characters** (Esil likely one) feel morally obligated, push the party to help.
- Characters reluctantly or willingly team up, **introductions** and small banter happen on the way.

#### 🕳️ **Exploration of Dungeon**

- Simple, **low-level dungeon**: traps, minor monsters (rats, skeletons), signs of the lost child (dropped item, footprints).
- **First combat:** easy encounter (e.g., giant rats, weak goblins) to test teamwork and abilities.

#### 🚨 **Cliffhanger Encounter**

- Party finds the **lost child** but sees they're trapped by a **mysterious figure** (cultist, shadowy humanoid, etc.) deeper inside.
- **End session:** mysterious figure notices party, gives ominous warning (“You shouldn’t have come here...”) and retreats deeper inside.
- Child is saved, but the dungeon is **clearly not empty**, teasing next session’s adventure.

#### 📖 **Esil's Curiosity (Post-session)**

- After returning, Esil studies the tome alone at night (between sessions).
- You privately message Ryan the **creepy ritual instructions**. Ryan describes Esil performing it, unlocking **paladin powers** for next session.

---

### ✨ **Extra Tips**

- **Humor:** Silver’s genie should comment sarcastically on the wish outcome.
- **Atmosphere:** Use creepy, tense vibes in the dungeon to contrast with the lighter tavern opening.
- **Incentives:** Promise **reward** from villagers for finding the kid, keeping players motivated.

entries.title: "🦷 **Guild Quest: Cave of the Gnoll Warband**"
entries.body:
Things to do: 

Hearings of Valter's theater - Fear in the city, paladins worries
Cave to the Hand-cutter
Cave to the [[The Sword in the Stone (Vroskael)]]

[[Consumeables]]
[[Loot Tables]]



## 🦷 **Guild Quest: Cave of the Gnoll Warband**

### 📍 **Location:** Broken Fang Cave

Hidden in a ravine carved into the hills, **Broken Fang Cave** is a twisting tunnel complex with layers of gnoll filth and demonic corruption. The air stinks of wet fur and rot.

---

### 🗺️ **Cave Layout Overview**

| **Chamber**                       | **Details**                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| --------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **1. Entry Tunnel**               | Spear-lined walls and bone chimes that rattle like laughter. DC 13 Stealth check to avoid alerting scouts.                                                                                                                             |
| **2. Hyena Kennels**              | 3 hyenas chained. Loud and aggressive. Freeing or silencing them may aid stealth.                                                                                                                                                      |
| **3. Trapper’s Den**              | 2 Trained Gnoll Hunters lying in wait. Tripwire traps (DC 14 Perception / Dex Save) trigger falling rocks (2d6 bludgeoning).                                                                                                           |
| **4. Torture Pit**                | Dozens of gnawed bones. A dying prisoner here knows of the ritual and the shaman (DC 12 Medicine check to stabilize).                                                                                                                  |
| **5. Idol Chamber** _(Boss Area)_ | Glowing idol carved in Yeenoghu's image. Gnoll Pack Leader and Shaman are preparing the final phase of their blood ritual. A **sacrificial hyena pup** trembles nearby, its blood ready to be spilled. A foul magic builds in the air… |

---

### 🔥 **Combat: Key Enemies**

#### **Gnoll Pack Leader**

- **AC**: 17 | **HP**: 100
    
- **Multiattack**: Glaive +8 to hit, 2d10+4 slashing
    
- **Pack Frenzy**: If an ally is within 10 ft, make one extra attack as a bonus action
    
- **Howl of Bloodlust (Recharge 5–6)**: All gnolls within 30 ft get +2 damage and advantage on melee attacks until the end of their next turn.
    

#### **Trained Gnoll Hunters (x3)**

- **AC**: 15 | **HP**: 50
    
- **Longbow +6** (1d8+2 piercing), **Shortsword +5** (1d6+2)
    
- **Tracker’s Mark**: On hit, target glows faintly (no stealth until end of combat unless healed)
    
- **Hunter’s Ambush**: +2 damage when attacking from stealth or cover
    

#### **Gnoll Shaman**

- **AC**: 14 | **HP**: 60
    
- **Spell List**:
    
    - _Inflict Wounds (3d10)_
        
    - _Hold Person (DC 13)_
        
    - _Summon Hyenas (2 CR 1 Hyenas)_
        
    - _Guidance, Thaumaturgy_
        
- **Ritual of the Maw**: If the ritual completes (6 rounds of casting), a **Lesser Demon of Yeenoghu** emerges from the idol (see below).
  
  ## 📖 Combat Spell Descriptions – _Gnoll Shaman_

**Spellcasting:** Wisdom-based, Spell Save DC 13

- **Cantrips (at will)**:
    
    - _Thaumaturgy_ – Creates minor supernatural effects (rumbling voice, shaking ground, flickering flames).
        
    - _Guidance_ – Adds +1d4 to an ally's ability check.
        
- **1st Level (3 slots):**
    
    - _Inflict Wounds_ – Melee spell attack, +5 to hit, **3d10 necrotic damage** on a hit.
        
    - _Shield of Faith_ – Bonus action, +2 AC to one creature for 10 minutes (concentration).
        
    - _Command_ – DC 13 Wis save or obey a 1-word command (e.g., “Flee,” “Drop,” “Kneel”).
        
- **2nd Level (2 slots):**
    
    - _Hold Person_ – DC 13 Wis save. Paralyzes a humanoid for 1 minute. Save at end of each turn.
        
    - _Summon Hyenas_ – Summons 2 CR 1 Hyenas (or 4 CR ¼ standard hyenas) under the shaman's command for 1 minute.
    

---

### ⏳ **Ritual Mechanics**

The ritual begins when the party enters the Idol Chamber. If not disrupted within **6 rounds**, the shaman completes the ritual and the **Feral Mawspawn** is summoned.

## 🩸 Final Boss – **Gorraak, Mawspawn of Yeenoghu**

> _“The bones snap. The altar bleeds. The idol hatches... and Gorraak is born from hunger made flesh.”_

**Large Fiend (Demon), Chaotic Evil**  
**AC**: 17 (demonic hide)  
**HP**: 155 (13d10+78)  
**Speed**: 40 ft  
**Saves**: Str +6, Con +7, Wis +4  
**Resistances**: Cold, Fire, Lightning, Nonmagical Weapons  
**Immunities**: Poison, Charm, Frighten  
**Condition Immunities**: Charmed, Frightened, Poisoned  
**Languages**: Abyssal, telepathy 60 ft  
**Challenge**: 7 (2,900 XP)

### 💥 Actions

**Multiattack**: Gorraak makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws.

- **Bite**: +8 to hit, 10 ft reach, **2d10+4 piercing + 1d6 necrotic**. If the target is a beast or humanoid, it must make a **DC 14 Con save or bleed**, taking 1d6 necrotic at the start of each of its turns (save ends at end of turn).
    
- **Claw**: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft, **2d8+4 slashing**.
    
- **Hunger Leap (Recharge 5–6)**: Gorraak leaps up to 30 ft. Creatures in a **10 ft radius where he lands** must make a **DC 15 Dex save** or take **4d6 bludgeoning** and be knocked **prone**. Half damage and no knockdown on save.
    

---

### 🌪️ Legendary Actions (2 per round)

1. **Savage Swipe** – Makes one claw attack against a creature within range.
    
2. **Gnashing Roar** – Emits a horrific laugh-howl. All creatures within 30 ft must succeed a **DC 14 Wis save** or be **frightened until the end of their next turn**.
    
3. **Blood Frenzy (Costs 2 Actions)** – After reducing a creature to 0 HP, Gorraak may **immediately move up to half his speed and make one bite attack**.
    

---

### 🩸 Passive Traits

- **Aura of Hunger (Passive)** – Any creature that starts its turn within 10 ft of Gorraak must make a **DC 13 Con save** or **gain 1 level of exhaustion** (spiritual fatigue from proximity to the demon’s hunger aura). Immunity if passed once.
    
- **Demonic Fortitude** – When reduced to 0 HP, Gorraak may **make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw**. On a success, he drops to 1 HP instead. Once per combat.
- .
    

### 💀 Weakness / Special Mechanic:

The **idol** glowing in the ritual chamber links Gorraak to the material plane. If the idol is **destroyed (AC 14, HP 25)** or **dispelled** (DC 15 Arcana or _Dispel Magic_), Gorraak takes **double damage** for the next round and **loses his legendary actions** for 1 minute.

---

### 🎲 **Possible Trinkets (Found in Idol Chamber or on enemies)**

| **Item**                                 | **Effect**                                                                                                                                                                  |
| ---------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Hyena’s Laughing Skull**               | Once per day, must make a DC 13 Wisdom save or laugh uncontrollably for 1 round when held.                                                                                  |
| **Tainted Gnoll War Banner**             | Advantage on **Intimidation**, disadvantage on **Persuasion** while carried.                                                                                                |
| **Bone Dagger of the Hunt**              | Glows faintly red when a creature within 30 ft is **below half HP**. Grants +1 to attack rolls against bleeding targets.                                                    |
| **Idol Fragment of Yeenoghu** _(cursed)_ | Grants +1 to Strength checks and melee damage, but you **must succeed DC 15 Wis save** after each kill or suffer **Blood Frenzy (must attack nearest creature next turn)**. |
| **Shaman’s Carved Fang Necklace**        | Once per long rest, cast _Inflict Wounds_ at 1st level (DC 13). Worn teeth twitch when near divine magic.                                                                   |

---

### 🧠 **Secrets & Story Hooks**

- **The idol’s magic is spreading** — a growing influence of Yeenoghu is seeping into nearby wildlife.
    
- **The mayor may be hiding something** — perhaps he once traded with gnolls for protection or let them fester.
    
- The shaman’s ritual notes mention **a larger gathering of gnoll tribes under a “Beast King”**. This could foreshadow a regional invasion arc.

| 20      | **Glowing Spine Fragment**   | Radiates warmth. Grants **resistance to cold damage**, and once per long rest, the holder can **shed bright light (20 ft) that reveals invisible creatures** for 1 minute.  |

entries.title: "⚰️ **Guild Silver Quest: The Hermit’s Crypt & The Gravedigger’s Curse**"
entries.body:
Guild Quest!


## ⚰️ **Guild Silver Quest: The Hermit’s Crypt & The Gravedigger’s Curse**

> A lonely crypt on the outskirts of Elverdeen has begun to glow with an eerie green light every night. Locals whisper of **Edric Varn**, the old gravedigger, who died years ago but was buried just beyond the crypt’s sealed door. Now, screams echo through the graveyard—and **nothing stays buried**.

---

### 🗺️ **Quest Location: Old Hermit’s Crypt**

- Built into the side of a forest hill. Its outer walls are cracked and covered in moss. Green ghostlight drifts from between the stone slabs.
    
- The **main gate is ajar**, but inside is a **maze of old burial chambers**, some collapsed, some untouched.
    
- **Tombstones chatter softly**, relaying pieces of Edric’s regrets to anyone who listens for 1 minute.


---

### 👻 **The True Horror – Story & Progression**

- Edric was **cursed in life** by a noble he buried alive. The noble's dying spirit now **possesses him**, keeping his soul tethered to the crypt.
    
- The spirit believes Edric still owes him "one last burial," and refuses to release him from death until **every intruder is silenced**.
    
- The only way to stop the curse is to **find the noble’s coffin**, **prove he was buried alive**, and perform a ritual exorcism or cleansing.
    

---

## 💀 **Main Encounter: Edric Varn & The Whispering Spirit**

### **Edric Varn – The Cursed Gravedigger**

**AC**: 16 | **HP**: 75 | **Speed**: 30 ft  
**Resistances**: Necrotic, Psychic, Nonmagical Weapons  
**Immunities**: Charmed, Frightened

#### 🪓 Attacks:

- **Cursed Shovel Strike** – +7 to hit, 2d8+3 bludgeoning + 1d6 necrotic
    
    > Inflicts a **rotting wound**: cannot be magically healed until a long rest.
    
- **Digging Frenzy** _(Recharge 4–6)_ – 360° sweep with the shovel.
    
    > All creatures within 10 ft make a **DC 14 Dex save** or take **3d6 slashing** and fall prone.
    

#### Passive Traits:

- **The Voice from Below** – Every round, Edric must attack the **nearest creature**, friend or foe.
    
- **Restless Duty** – When reduced to 0 HP, he **collapses**, but **rises again in 1d4 rounds** unless the spirit is exorcised.
    

---

### **The Whispering Spirit – The Real Enemy**

**AC**: 13 | **HP**: 50 | **Speed**: 40 ft (flies)  
**Resistances**: Radiant, Necrotic, Nonmagical Weapons  
**Immunities**: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Grappled, Prone

#### Abilities:

- **Spirit’s Grip** _(Bonus Action)_: Possesses Edric’s body for 1 round, granting him **advantage on all attacks** and +5 temporary HP.
    
- **Unseen Whisper** _(Passive)_: Invisible unless revealed by **Detect Magic**, **See Invisibility**, or **radiant effects**.
    
- **Bury Them Deeper** _(Recharge 5–6)_: Pulls enemies underground.
    
    > DC 15 Strength save or be **restrained** by ghostly earth hands for 1 round.
    
## ⚔️ **Legendary Actions (Gravedigger + Spirit)**

Use 2–3 legendary actions per round depending on difficulty.

---
### 1. **Chain Drag Slam** _(1 action)_

> Edric swings the coffin around in a wide arc.

- All creatures in a 15-ft cone must make a **DC 14 Dex save** or take **2d10 bludgeoning** and be **knocked prone**.
    

---

### 2. **Crypt Anchor** _(2 actions)_

> The spirit reinforces the chains, causing the ground to shudder.

- A 10-ft radius centered on Edric becomes **difficult terrain**.
    
- Creatures entering or ending turn there must make a **DC 14 Strength save** or be **pulled 10 ft toward the crypt** by ghostly chains.
    

---

### 3. **Unearth the Past** _(2 actions)_

> The spirit rips up a chunk of the graveyard’s memory.

- Targets within 20 ft see a vision of their **own death or betrayal**.
    
- Must make a **DC 15 Wis save** or be **frightened** for 1 round and take **2d6 psychic damage**.
    

---

### 4. **Wailing Coffin** _(1 action, Recharge 5–6)_

> The coffin emits a banshee-like moan.

- All creatures within 30 ft must make a **DC 14 Con save** or be **deafened for 1 minute** and **take 1d10 thunder** damage.
    

---


## 🧩 **Solving the Curse (Exorcism Mechanics)**

1. **Search the Noble’s Coffin (DC 13 Investigation):**
    
    - Inside: **rotted fingernails**, blood-scratched walls, signs of struggle.
        
    - Discovering this **weakens the spirit** (it takes double damage from radiant sources).
        
2. **Destroy or Purify the Corpse:**
    
    - **Holy Water**, _Dispel Evil_, or **consecration** removes the spirit's tether.
        
    - Burning the remains also works (DC 14 Religion or Arcana to perform the rite).
        
    - Doing so **permanently defeats both Edric and the spirit.**
        



## 🧿 **More Thematic Trinkets**

|**Item**|**Effect**|
|---|---|
|**Cryptbound Chain Link**|Once per long rest, **cast _Hold Person_** (DC 13). The chain glows faintly when near undead.|
|**Gravedust Flask**|You may scatter it to **nullify necrotic resistance** for one creature for 1 minute. One use.|
|**Coffin Key of Silence**|Can be inserted into any coffin or chest to cast _Silence_ (10-ft radius) for 1 minute. Usable once per day.|
|**Noble’s Guilt Pendant**|Wearer may cast _Detect Evil and Good_ once per long rest. **If worn near Edric’s coffin, it glows and pulses with heat.**|
|**Wailing Nail**|A long blackened fingernail. If driven into wood or earth, it **prevents the undead from rising within 10 ft** for 24 hours.|
|**Stone of Mourning**|Whispering into the stone lets you communicate with the spirit bound to the crypt for 1 question per day.|

## 🎁 Loot & Trinkets (Silver Tier)

| **Item**                              | **Effect**                                                                                                                       |
| ------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Edric’s Rusted Shovel**             | Acts as a **+1 weapon**. Once per long rest, can **dig a 5 ft grave instantly**, even through stone or ice.                      |
| **Noble’s Signet Ring**               | Grants **advantage on Persuasion** checks with nobility, but **ghosts can sense the ring** and may react aggressively.           |
| **Soil of the Forgotten**             | Throw to **reveal invisible undead within 30 ft** for 1 minute. One use.                                                         |
| **Lamenting Locket**                  | Contains a portrait of the noble’s wife. Once per day, it **whispers a warning** when danger is nearby (DM’s choice).            |
| **Chime of the Buried Oath** _(Rare)_ | Can be rung once per long rest to **temporarily silence all undead in a 30 ft radius for 1 round** (no speech, no spellcasting). |

entries.title: "💥 Guild Quest: 'Take Action Regarding That Individual' — Goblin Dive Rocket Raid"
entries.summary:
Take action regarding that individual. 
Relax, Ill handle it.
entries.body:
Take action regarding that individual. 
Relax, Ill handle it. 

I am the angry pumpkin.

The architect and the builder arrive from their escalator with a scenes a purpose. They are playing at their residence. The heads are soaring!


## 💥 Guild Quest: "Take Action Regarding That Individual" — Goblin Dive Rocket Raid

### 🏘️ **Quest Summary**

- **Quest Type**: Silver Tier Guild Contract (Field Response / Emergency)
    
- **Objective**: Defend the village of **Brassmere** from a goblin raid using dangerous, ancient tech: rocket-propelled explosive launchers.
    
- **Complication**: A massive orc barbarian shows up mid-fight to help, but becomes overtaken with ancient rage and turns into a secondary threat.
    

---
### 🎬 **Session Opening**

The party arrives at the edge of a cliff overlooking **Brassmere**, where a half-buried **ancient goblin mineshaft elevator** juts from the rock.

Once part of a sprawling goblin industry complex during the Age of Bronze Sparks, the lift now sputters to life with glowing copper glyphs and churning gearwork.

Architect - ogbog - Orc
Village in valley - elevator down

The platform lowers in jerky mechanical pulses, riding old chain-linked rails, groaning with every descent. Arcane pistons hiss. From somewhere inside the lift console.

As the village comes into view below, explosions crackle in the air. Trails of smoke arc overhead. Buildings are already burning. Goblins scream joyfully as they rocket through the skies.

Mayonnaise - 

Mayyonase, is still on the lift. The platform suddenly reverses, and Mayyonase begins ascending instead—slowly, majestically—bathed in radiant light from a glowing fissure above. For a few seconds, it looks as if the ant is being lifted into heaven. Then the platform resets, and the party follows normally.

A frantic villager spots the descending party and shouts up in terror: **“Oh no! It is the dive rocket launcher! Take action regarding that individual!”** The party arrives in **Brassmere** under skies filled with streaks of smoke and fire. Buildings burn. Goblins scream with joy and terror as they **rocket-dive through the air**, some exploding on impact.

A frantic villager screams: “Oh no! It is the dive rocket launcher. Take action regarding that individual!”


### 📌 Phase 1: Hero

A huge orc barbarian (friendly at first) stomps into the field and grabs a rocket launcher. He yells, “Relax, Ill handle it.” He proceeds to destroy several goblins... until one shoots him with a red-plated rocket.

### 📌 Phase 1: Hero

- **Gruug** fights on the players’ side. Has 60 HP and cleaves through goblins using improvised weapons.

-- **Appearance MAYO:**  
Towering over standard soldier ants, its armor is an iridescent black-blue, cracked with glowing veins of amber light. Its mandibles are not only weapons but also symbols of command, etched with ancient hive-marks. Two long antennae curve like horns, glowing faintly when issuing orders.

---

## 👺 **Goblins of the Dive Rocket Tribe**

**Lore**: These goblins are using relics from the **Age of Bronze Sparks** — an ancient goblin technological era long lost to time.

### ⚔️ Goblin Dive Rocketeer (x6)

- **AC**: 14 | **HP**: 18
    
- **Weapon**: Dive Rocket (20-ft range; +4 to hit; 2d6 bludgeoning, target and goblin take half on a miss)
    
- **Special**: Can launch themselves 30 ft as a bonus action. If they land adjacent to a creature, the creature must make a **DC 13 Dex save** or take **2d6 fire** from the explosive tank's blast.
    

### ⚙️ Goblin Tinkerer (x2)

- **AC**: 13 | **HP**: 22
    
- **Weapon**: Spring Bolt Launcher (1d10 piercing)
    
- **Gadget**: Deploys rocket ramps or trip-launch pads (targets must make a DC 14 Dex save or be launched 10 ft in a random direction).
    
- **Support**: Can repair other goblin gear (heals 1d8 to another goblin).
    

---

## 🧌 **Major Encounter: Gruug the Blasting Rage**

### 🛠️ Pumpkin’s High-Level Barbarian Traits (Phase 2)

In addition to his explosive goblin-tech-powered moves, Gruug retains several barbarian-based combat abilities during his rage phase:

#### 💢 **Berserker’s Momentum**

- If Gruug moves at least 20 ft and ends adjacent to a creature, he may make a bonus **Rocket Club Slam** attack.
    

#### 💢 **Relentless Endurance**

- The first time Gruug would be reduced to 0 HP, he instead drops to 1 HP and remains standing (once per combat).
    

#### 💢 **Brutal Critical**

- When Gruug lands a critical hit, he rolls an **additional damage die**.
    

#### 💢 **Rage-Fueled Defiance**

- While below half HP, Gruug gains **resistance to bludgeoning, slashing, and fire damage**.
    

#### 💢 **Barbaric Roar (Recharge 6)**

- Gruug unleashes a thunderous roar. All creatures within 30 ft must make a **DC 15 Wisdom saving throw** or be **frightened** until the end of their next turn.
    



### 📌 Phase 2: Unleashed

The red rocket activates **Berserker Rage Protocol**, an ancient goblin tech virus.

- **Gruug becomes hostile to everything.**
    
- **HP**: 120 | **AC**: 16 | **Speed**: 40 ft
    
- **Attacks**:
    
    - **Rocket Club Slam**: +8 to hit, 2d10+5 bludgeoning, knocks target prone.
        
    - **Explosive Leap (Recharge 5–6)**: Gruug jumps 30 ft and creates a 10-ft explosion. All in the area must make a **DC 15 Dex save** or take **4d6 fire**.
        

### 💢 Unstoppable Rage Aura

- At the start of each of Gruug’s turns, creatures within 10 ft take **2 fire damage** from his overheating tech and aura.
    

---

### 🌿 The Druid’s Role (Scripted Ending Tool)

- The party must **hold Gruug off for 3–4 rounds**.
    
- The guild druid **Delwenna** begins casting **Ritual of Transfigured Temperament** to polymorph Gruug.
    
- If uninterrupted, she casts **Polymorph**, turning him into an **angry pumpkin**.
    
- The pumpkin remains sentient, glaring, and must be placed in **cold storage** in the guild hall.
    

---

## 🎲 Encounter Loot Ideas

- **Goblin Rocket Scraps** – Can be fashioned into a one-use jump pack or trap.
    
- **Tinkerer’s Ignition Goggles** – Advantage on saves vs blindness and fire.
    
- **Cursed Red Rocket Fragment** – Still glowing with rage. Cast _Enlarge_ on a creature once (1 minute duration) before crumbling.
    

---

## 🧠 Optional Side Objectives

- Rescue villagers in the inn’s wine cellar before it collapses.
    
- Disable a large goblin rocket battery set up outside the mayor’s house.
    
- Find the **manual of the Dive Rocket Launcher**, which explains the ancient tech’s true purpose: it was a **goblin sport.**
    

---

Let me know if you’d like the pumpkin form of Gruug to retain some minor magical ability, or if you want a guild reward or badge of honor for surviving the “Dive Rocket Protocol.”

entries.title: "🔴 **Red Gem ➤ _Molten Igniter Bolt_**"
entries.body:
#### 🔴 **Red Gem ➤ _Molten Igniter Bolt_**

_A jagged shard of scorched red iron. Sparks fly off the end if you tap it too hard. Smells like burnt toast._

> **Effect:** +1 fire damage on melee or ranged attacks. Can be slammed into the ground to trigger a fire burst (2d6 fire damage, 10 ft). Disintegrates after use.

---

#### 🟣 **Purple Gem ➤ _Whispercoil Medallion_**

_A thin, rusted coil of wire strung on twine. When worn, faint muttering fills the air around your head._

> **Effect:** Once per long rest, reroll a failed INT or WIS save. Fails on nat 1 and causes 1d4 psychic damage + hallucinated goblin insults.

---

#### 🟢 **Green Gem ➤ _Mossy Breather Mask_**

_A cracked ceramic mask overgrown with moss. Still smells faintly of garlic and swamp gas._

> **Effect:** Nullifies 1 poison or gas effect. Once absorbed, exhales a healing mist (1d8 HP in 5 ft radius). If left unused too long, sneezes randomly.

---

#### 🟡 **Yellow Gem ➤ _Goblin DetCord Twine_**

_A frayed yellow rope, stiff with dried alchemical goo. Glows faintly when tied around something._

> **Effect:** Can be rigged as a tripwire or thrown like a whip. Explodes for 3d6 lightning damage in 10 ft. 50/50 chance to misfire and shock user.

---

#### 🔵 **Blue Gem ➤ _Freezeframe Core_**

_A spherical orb with a swirling blue storm trapped inside. Cold vapor leaks from a hairline crack._

> **Effect:** Halves fire damage once per day. Can freeze a 5x5 surface into slippery ice. If dropped, may freeze your _shoe_ instead.

---

#### ⚫ *_Black Rock ➤ _Wyrdcore Remnant (Cursed)__

_A lump of black stone fused with metal claws. It throbs when near magic. You hear… chewing?_

> **Effect (Cursed):**

- Grants +2 AC… at first.
    
- Causes nightmares in Goblin.
    
- Takes 1d12 necrotic damage at dawn.
    
- Can’t be unequipped willingly (DC 14 WIS save).
    
- If burned, it _screams_.
    

---

#### 💎 **Diamond ➤ _Timelocked Lens_**

_A perfectly smooth lens encased in an old gear. You can see yesterday through it._

> **Effect:** Rewind your turn once per session. Using it makes your hands briefly age 10 years.

---

#### 🟥 **Red Cross ➤ _Goblin Blood-Pad™_**

_A sticky red bandage covered in bandaid runes. Pulses with something vaguely biological._

> **Effect:** Slap it on to instantly heal 2d10 HP. Leaves a hand-shaped red print on you for 24 hours. Goblins might salute you.

---

#### 🟦 **Blue Cross ➤ _ZapPatch Injector_**

_A rusty syringe filled with glowing blue goo. Vibrates like a hummingbird on meth._

> **Effect:** Grants +10 ft speed & advantage on DEX saves for 1 minute. Causes a post-rush crash (exhaustion level 1).

---

#### ⚪ **Clear Bead ➤ _Nullglass Spike_**

*A small, perfectly clear crystal nail. Looks like nothing. Is very much _something._

> **Effect:** Cancels one magical effect in a 5 ft burst. Turns cloudy and shatters after use. If you stare into it too long, it stares back.

---

#### 🟡 **Yellow Beads x2 ➤ _Glowgnat Cages_**

_Tiny bronze cages filled with glowing firefly-like bugs. Warm, jittery, and buzzing._

> **Effect:** Lights up a 20 ft radius. If broken, bugs fly at enemies (disadvantage on ranged attacks/stealth for 1 turn). One may crawl into your bag. Permanently.

---

#### 🔵 **Blue Beads x2 ➤ _Gob-Tech Think Beans_**

_Smooth, blue, bean-shaped stones with silver wiring. Taste like menthol if licked (don’t)._

> **Effect:** Advantage on 1 spell-related check. Causes mild migraines and involuntary ranting about goblin politics.

---

#### 🔷 **Dark Blue Bead ➤ _Chrono-Gob Node_**

_A dark pearl housed in a metal bracket shaped like a stop sign. The word “NOPE” is carved on the side._

> **Effect:** Freeze a single object or projectile for 6 seconds. Object unfreezes violently—watch out.

---

#### 🪙 **Crushed Coin ➤ _Royal Goblin Token (Forbidden Currency)_**

_A warped coin with a goblin king's sneer, smeared in blackened ash. Still smells like crown grease._

> **Effect:** Presented to any goblin = instant intimidation, loyalty, or existential crisis. Once per session.

---

#### 🐚 **Shell ➤ _Echo of the War Chant_**

_A hollowed-out war horn shaped like a seashell, bandaged with goblin war stickers._

> **Effect:** Grants reroll on CHA check involving storytelling, intimidation, or chants. Playing it sounds like ten goblins screaming _offbeat_.

entries.title: "**🦴 Boss Enemy – Othric Graves, The Mayor of Soil and Flesh**"
entries.summary: ### **🦴 Boss Enemy – Othric Graves, The Mayor of Soil and Flesh**
entries.body:
### **🦴 Boss Enemy – Othric Graves, The Mayor of Soil and Flesh**

- **Undead-Infused Gravekeeper**
    
- **AC:** 18 | **HP:** 150 | **Speed:** 30 ft
    
- **Damage Resistances:** Necrotic, Psychic, Nonmagical Weapons
    
- **Damage Immunities:** Poison
    
- **Condition Immunities:** Charmed, Frightened, Paralyzed, Poisoned
    
- **Weakness:** **Fire & Radiant Damage**
    

#### **🗡️ Attacks & Abilities**

- **⚒️ Bury the Living (Melee, +10 to hit, 2d12+5 Bludgeoning + 2d6 Necrotic)**
    
    - On hit, target is **partially buried**, reducing speed by half **until freed (DC 15 Strength check).**
        
    - **"You don’t need to fight… Just rest, and let the roots embrace you."**
        
- **🌱 Harvest’s Price (Recharge 4-6)**
    
    - Roots **burst from the ground**, attempting to **restrain** all creatures within **20 feet** (DC 16 Dexterity Save).
        
    - If failed, the target takes **3d6 Necrotic damage** and is **Restrained for 1 minute (repeat save at end of turn).**
        
    - **"The land gives back what we offer. Can’t you feel its love?"**
        
- **🕯️ The Mayor’s Call (Passive, Aura 30ft)**
    
    - The villagers, mind-bound by the fruit, **attack the party on sight** if they harm Othric.
        
    - If a player eats the fruit, they must make a **DC 15 Wisdom Save or become Charmed by Othric for 10 minutes**.
        
    - **"Eat. You’ll understand soon enough."**
        
- **🕳️ Rooted Rebirth (Legendary Action)**
    
    - Othric slams his shovel into the ground, summoning **1d4 tree-animated corpses** to fight for him.
        
    - **"You think I work alone? My harvest watches over me."**
        
- **🩸 Feast of the Forgotten (Legendary Action, 2/Day)**
    
    - As Othric **loses HP**, he **absorbs the strength of those buried**, healing **4d10 HP**.
        
    - **"Their sacrifice keeps me strong. Maybe you’ll help, too."**
        
- **☠️ The Rooted One (Phase 2, At 40% HP)**
    
    - Othric **shoves his shovel into his own chest**, letting the roots **consume him**.
        
    - He **gains resistance to all damage for 2 rounds**, and his attacks **deal an additional 2d6 Poison damage**.
        
    - **"You cannot kill the soil… You can only return to it."**
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Session plans/Season 1/Session 13 Paradise/Orthic Graves (BOSS).md

entries.title: "**📜 Story Progression & Key Events**"
entries.summary:

Stores and shops
Develop The Woodcarver for miki
