entries.body:
[[Git/DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Session plans/Season 1/Session 2/Session 2]]
[[Voicelines]]
[[Git/DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Session plans/Season 1/Session 4/Session 4]]

## **🌆 Scene 1: The Heat is Rising**

As the session starts, **Elverdeen is still quiet… for now.**

### **🔹 Early Warning Signs**

- **The paladins are getting suspicious** – A **scout is missing**, and the **Order is expecting word from Hollowbrook** soon.
- **A messenger from the Order arrives** – He’s looking for **Rudolph Halloway** (the quest-giver they killed).
- **Rumors spread** – _“Did you hear? Hollowbrook was… wiped out. Stabbed in the back in the middle of the night”_

**⏳ Timed Event:** If they **do nothing**, **the Order of the Light will investigate soon.**
- give warning [[Voicelines]] by others to get them to get rid of the evidence
---

## **🗡️ Scene 2: Destroying the Evidence**

The players still **have incriminating items** from Hollowbrook, including:

- **Sunsteel Greatsword & Armor** (Official Order gear, could get them caught).
- **Documents, relics, or anything taken from the village.**
- **Personal knowledge of the event—someone might break under questioning.**
### **🔹 How They Can Get Rid of It**

✔ **Sell It to the Black Market** – _The Rusty Dagger_ or **Marlund’s Shop** might take the gear off their hands—**but will they keep quiet?**  
✔ **Dump It in the Wilds** – A remote **cave, river, or abandoned ruin** could serve as a disposal site.  
✔ **Melt It Down at the Forge** – **Darrow Ironbrand** might be able to **reforge the metal**, making it untraceable. 
✔ **Frame Someone Else** – The party could **plant the gear on someone**, shifting the blame.

## **🕵️ Scene Expansion: Destroying the Evidence**

After the **funeral ceremony**, the Order begins **actively searching for clues** about what happened at Hollowbrook. The party has **a limited window of time** to dispose of **stolen weapons, armor, documents, or personal effects taken from the paladins and village**.

---

### **🔥 Option 1: Selling to the Black Market**

- **The Rusty Dagger (Thieves' Den)** – A discreet fence in Elverdeen willing to take **Sunsteel gear, documents, and relics**. He offers **50% of market value** but warns:
    
    > _“I don’t ask questions, but if this glows too bright, someone’s gonna come knockin’. If I hear rumors, I’ll tell you first—for a price.”_
    
- **Marlund’s Shop (O-Block Black Market)** – More willing to take **dangerous or cursed artifacts** but **will NOT destroy them**.
    
    > _“This ain’t a pawn shop. You bring something like this in, I’m keeping it for leverage. Or fun.”_
    
- **Risk:** **If the buyer is caught**, they **might give up the party’s name** under interrogation.

---

### **🌲 Option 2: Dumping It in the Wilds**

- **Remote Cave or River** – A good hiding place **for armor, weapons, and incriminating documents**. If weighted down properly, the **river will erode the evidence over time**.
- **Abandoned Ruins Near Elverdeen** – An old **collapsed temple site** or **bandit hideout** where they can dump the items. If they **don’t hide it well**, it **may be discovered later.**
- **Risk:** **Scavengers** or **curious travelers** might stumble upon the gear, leading back to the party **weeks later**.

---

### **⚒️ Option 3: Melting It Down at the Forge**

- **Darrow Ironbrand (Dwarven Smith)** – The only **blacksmith skilled enough** to melt down Sunsteel weapons and armor. He is **loyal to gold, not law** but **charges a high price**.
    
    > _“Sunsteel’s a rare metal, lad. Ain’t right to just melt it down. Unless you’re willing to pay for me to forget it existed.”_
    
- **Risk:** If Darrow **talks or gets pressured by the Order**, **they will track the metal**—**especially if someone starts selling reforged Sunsteel items**.

---

### **🔪 Option 4: Framing Someone Else**

- **The Black Talons (Bandit Group)** – The party can **plant stolen Order gear** at a **known criminal hideout** to redirect suspicion.
- **A Rival Noble House** – By **leaving Order artifacts in the home of a noble with anti-paladin sentiments**, the party can **shift the investigation** onto them.
- **Risk:** If **the frame-up is sloppy**, the Order **will investigate more aggressively**, making it harder for the party to stay ahead.

---

## **⚖️ Scene 3: The Verdict – Are They Safe?**

At the end of the session, **the Order will make a decision** based on the party’s actions.

### **🔹 Possible Outcomes**

✔ **They Are Cleared (Success)** – The **Order moves on**, thinking it was the legend of the underdark that killed the paladins.**  
✔ **They Are Suspected, but Not Proven (Partial Success)** – The **Order is wary, but doesn’t act… yet.**  Same as success but there may be some that know something. 
✔ **They Are Marked as Heretics (Failure)** – The **Order starts hunting them**, making every future encounter **more dangerous.** 


After the **party successfully destroys or conceals the evidence**, the **Order of the Light** continues its search, but cracks begin to show in their narrative.

✔ **Suspicious Paladins** – Some in the Order whisper that **something unnatural happened** at Hollowbrook. A survivor, a scout, or a rogue priest **may still hold clues**, meaning that **word might eventually leak** if the party isn't careful.  
✔ **Mourning the Fallen** – The Order **holds a ceremony in Elverdeen** for the fallen knights. A priest **publicly vows revenge** on whoever committed the crime. The party must **stay low** or risk being called upon.  
✔ **Lingering Paranoia** – **Ryan's connection to the Order is under scrutiny.** The paladins **can’t prove anything, but his presence unsettles them.**

If the **party succeeded in covering their tracks**, the Order **moves on**, but a few high-ranking members might still **have lingering doubts.** If they **failed**, bounty hunters or inquisitors may **start searching for suspects** in the coming days.



# 📜 **The Order of the Light Funeral Ceremony – A Farewell to the Fallen**

## **🌅 Scene Setup: The Funeral of the Hollowbrook Paladins**

The city square of **Elverdeen** has been transformed into a solemn, sacred site. At the heart of it, **a towering pyre of polished oak and sanctified oils** stands, encircled by **hundreds of flickering golden candles**. The air is thick with the scent of burning incense and the low, mournful hum of the assembled paladins. The people of the city—merchants, commoners, even rival factions—gather in uneasy silence, watching as **the white-cloaked clergy of the Order prepare the final rites.**

The bodies of the fallen paladins lie in **perfect formation** upon the pyre, their "armor" polished to a gleaming gold, their hands crossed over their chests in eternal vigilance. The sun is beginning to set, casting long, crimson streaks across the sky—**as if the heavens themselves are bleeding for the fallen.**

At the center of it all, standing upon the raised steps of the **Chapel of Holy Radiance**, is **High Priest Aldros Veylan**, an aging but imposing figure with piercing amber eyes. His voice carries over the crowd like a rolling storm.

---

## **🗣️ High Priest Aldros Veykon’s Speech**

> _"Brothers. Sisters. Children of the Light._
> 
> _Tonight, we stand with grief, our hearts burdened by the weight of loss. Here, before us, lie those who gave their lives in service to Kaya, in the pursuit of purity, in the never ending war against the creeping shadow. They were the sword and shield of the righteous. And yet... they were taken from us._
> 
> _Hollowbrook was meant to be a beacon of faith, a sanctuary for the weary. But now, it is nothing but ash. And still, we do not know why. Who dares strike down Kaya’s chosen? What foul hands desecrated our kin? We do not yet have these answers. But hear me now, and hear me well:_ _we shall not rest until we do._
> 
> _We do not weep as lesser men do. We do not let sorrow shackle us. Instead, we ignite the flame of vengeance. We let our wrath be the torch that guides us through the darkness. Our fallen do not die in vain. Their light is eternal._
> 
> _And so we commit them now to the Eternal Radiance. May their souls rise beyond mortal binds. May they take their place in the halls of the divine. And may their justice be served by the hands they leave behind._"

At his final words, **the gathered paladins kneel in perfect unison, lowering their heads in silent prayer.** The air hums with divine energy as **acolytes light the pyre**, and the flames consume the fallen in a brilliant, golden blaze. The fire does not crackle wildly—it burns **steadily, reverently, almost unnaturally controlled**, a sign (to the faithful) that Kaya herself welcomes them home.

---

## **⚔️ Possible Party Interactions:**

- **A Vengeful Paladin Approaches** – A paladin, **Sir Evalis Dorne**, speaks through gritted teeth: _"We will find the ones who did this. And when we do, they will burn as our brothers burned."_ He may suspect the party.
    
- **A Grieving Family Member Notices Something Odd** – A **mourner**, possibly the family of one of the fallen, **recognizes an item or weapon** looted from Hollowbrook. **Will the party be confronted?**
    
- **A Scout Returns with News** – Just before the ceremony ends, **a scout rushes forward** to whisper something into High Priest Veylan’s ear. His expression darkens, and he turns toward the gathered knights. _"The hunt begins."_

---

## **📜 Wrapping Up – The Next Arc Begins**

🎭 **With the Order off their backs, the party can finally breathe.** This sets up **a return to normal adventuring**—they can:

- **Take on normal mercenary work** without fear of being hunted.
I gotta find out what people's motives are and how to keep the party together

## **🏛️ Scene 1: Finding the Guild**

After **covering their tracks**, the party has **a moment of peace.** But if they want **gold, fame, and jobs that don’t involve divine massacres**, they need to **find work.**

### **🔹 How They Hear About the Guild**

✔ **The Bartender Mentions It** – _"If you’re lookin’ for honest coin, the guild’s always got work."_  
✔ **A Drunken Adventurer Boasts About a Job** – _"Three gold just to escort some caravan? Easy money!"_  
✔ **A Flyer in the Tavern** – _“Elverdeen Adventurers’ Guild – Seeking Capable Hands!”_  
✔ **A Guard Suggests It** – _"You lot look like the type to handle yourselves. Better to make coin legally than have us watchin’ you."_

### **🔹 Getting There**

- The **guildhall is located downtown**, a **large stone structure** with a **wooden sign hanging out front**.
- The sign reads: **"Elverdeen Adventurers’ Guild – Fortune & Glory Await!"**
- A **massive bulletin board** outside is filled with **job postings, ranging from pest control to dragon hunts.**

---

## **🏰 Scene 2: Entering the Adventurers' Guild**

Inside, the **Elverdeen Adventurers’ Guild** is **a bustling hub of warriors, mages, and mercenaries.**

### **🔹 What They See Inside**

✔ **A Massive Job Board** – Adventurers crowd around, looking at quests.  
✔ **Guild Reception Desk** – A **tired clerk** handles **registrations and payments.**  
✔ **A Bar & Lounge Area** – Adventurers **share stories and drinks** between missions.  
✔ **Weapon & Armor Dealers** – A **small shop inside the guild sells basic adventuring gear.**  
✔ **Trophy Wall** – The heads of **slain monsters and legendary weapons** decorate the hall.

---

## **🧑‍🎤 Scene 3: Meeting the Guild Master**

The party is **greeted by the Guild Master**, a seasoned **half-orc fighter named Varrek Steelhide**.

**👤 Varrek Steelhide – Guild Master**

- A **massive, scarred half-orc** with a **gruff but fair attitude.**
- He **doesn’t care about pasts**—only **if you can handle yourself in a fight.**
- **His Motto:** _"No gods, no masters—just coin and steel."_

### **🔹 What He Asks the Party**

✔ _"You new here? You fight well?"_  
✔ _"Guild takes a cut, but the pay’s fair."_  
✔ _"You want glory? Stick to the big jobs. You want to stay alive? Start small."_

### **🔹 Guild Registration**

Before they can take jobs, they must **register.**

- Each member gets a **Guild Token**, proving they belong.
- **Guild Ranks:**
    - **Bronze (Beginners)** – Basic jobs (pest control, escort quests).
    - **Silver (Veterans)** – Bigger risks, better pay.
    - **Gold (Elites)** – Only the best take these.

Once registered, **Varrek directs them to the Job Board.**

---

## **📜 Scene 4: The First Job Board**

The **Job Board** is filled with **quests**. Some are **basic**, some **dangerous**, but all promise **gold**.
[[Adventure's Guildboard]]

### **🔹 Sample Jobs on the Board**

| **Quest Name**                | **Description**                                                                    | **Reward**                          |
| ----------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------- |
| **Giant Rat Infestation** 🐀  | A local warehouse is overrun with **giant rats.** Clear them out.                  | 10 GP per person                    |
| **Caravan Escort** 🚛         | Guard a **merchant caravan** heading to a nearby town. Bandit risk is low.         | 15 GP each + bonus for safety       |
| **Missing Heirloom** 🔎       | A noble lost a **family heirloom** in the forest. Find and return it.              | 25 GP, no questions asked           |
| **Mysterious Cave** ⛏️        | A strange **cave opened up** near town. Someone needs to explore it.               | 20 GP, plus anything valuable found |
| **Bounty: Goblin Raiders** ⚔️ | A group of **goblins** has been raiding villages. Bring proof of at least 3 kills. | 30 GP                               |


---

## **📜 Scene 5: Preparing for the Quest**

Once they **accept a job**, they have **time to prepare**:

✔ **Buy supplies** – Healing potions, torches, rations, and any gear they need.  
✔ **Gather information** – Talk to locals, find rumors, **get details on the job.**  
✔ **Recruit allies** – If the job is **too big**, they can **hire mercenaries** for a cut of the reward.  
✔ **Rest & Plan** – They decide **how to tackle the job.**

entries.title: "**🎭 Overheard Conversations in the Tavern**"
entries.body:
### **🎭 Overheard Conversations in the Tavern**

_(The air is thick with murmurs, laughter, and low conversations. Here are snippets of what the party might overhear.)_

1. **"You hear about Hollowbrook? No one’s come from there in days… bad omen, that."**
2. **"Had a fella in here last night, swore up and down he saw a paladin riding hard toward the capital. Something big’s happening."**
3. **"They say the Order’s sending someone to ‘investigate’ a village out east. You know what that means."** _(A drink is downed in silence.)_
4. **"That lot of knights was real proud after the last battle. Ain’t seen ‘em since. Wonder what they’re up to."**
5. **"There’s been a lot more cloaked strangers in town lately. None of ‘em talk much."**
6. **"Some poor bastard tried selling Order gear in the market. Haven’t seen him since."**
7. **"I tell ya, something’s not right. The air’s _different_ lately. Feels like somethin’ is coming."**

---

### **🚨 Passing Guards' Conversations**

_(The town guards stand at their posts, half-interested in their duties. Here’s what they mutter between shifts.)_

1. **"Got orders to keep an eye out for anyone selling ‘unmarked relics.’ Dunno why."**
2. **"Commander says the High Order’s sending someone. Means we better stay outta the way."**
3. **"Some merchant went missing the other day. Last seen taking a job with outsiders. You hear anything?"**
4. **"I don’t get it. First the Hollowbrook rumors, now some knight caravan’s gone missing too? The hell’s happening out there?"**
5. **"We’re supposed to report anything strange. Which means… we pretend we saw nothing, yeah?"**
6. **"Why’s the chapel so quiet lately? No sermons? No blessings? Feels… wrong."**
7. **"Any idiot caught wearing stolen Order gear’s gonna find themselves in a real shallow grave. Just sayin'."**

---


### **🛡️ Strahd (Ryan’s Father) – Subtle Warnings & Observations**

_(Strahd is a pragmatic and experienced man. He’s noticed small changes in Ryan but doesn’t yet know the cause.)_

**To Ryan (Observing His Son’s Behavior):**

1. **"You’ve been quiet lately. That usually means trouble."**
2. **"You ever stare too long into a fire, boy? You start seeing things in the flames that weren’t there before. Something’s in your eyes lately. What is it?"**
3. **"I heard there was a massacre in Hollowbrook. Not the work of bandits, not the work of beasts. Makes you wonder who’s left to blame."**
4. **"Knights came through town earlier, looking for someone. Didn’t say who. You didn’t make enemies I should know about, did you?"**
5. **"When you pray, does she still answer?"** _(A pointed question—he’s noticed Ryan’s faith may be shaken.)_
6. **"You keep checking your back. I taught you better than that. What are you afraid of?"**
7. **"You’re fighting something, Ryan. I see it. Just make sure you win."**

---

**To the Bartender (Casual Conversation, Concern About Ryan):**

1. **"You ever notice the boy’s been… different?"**
2. **"I thought he wanted to be a knight. Now, I’m not so sure."**
3. **"He’s always been stubborn, but now? It’s like he’s at war with himself."**
4. **"Noticed him gripping his sword like he expects it to jump from his hand. Makes a man wonder what he’s been fighting."**
5. **"If you hear anything about knights looking for someone, let me know."**

---

### **🍻 The Bartender – Rumors & Tavern Talk**

_(The bartender isn’t connected to the Order, but they hear a lot. Their words might be small talk—or veiled warnings.)_

**To Ryan (If He Asks About the Order or Faith):**

1. **"Faith’s a funny thing. It’s easy when things are bright. Harder when the shadows get long."**
2. **"You look like a man who saw something he wasn’t meant to. Am I wrong?"**
3. **"You ever notice how the Order’s always looking for someone? It’s never a _what_, it’s always a _who_."**
4. **"I had a paladin in here last night. Didn’t drink. Just watched the room. Gave me the feeling I should be somewhere else."**
5. **"You ever hear of a knight breaking their oath? No? That’s because they don’t live long enough to tell the tale."**

---

**To Strahd (Talking About Ryan, Without Direct Accusation):**

1. **"Your boy’s been quiet. Too quiet for a man his age."**
2. **"Saw him at the chapel the other day. Didn’t go inside. Just… stood there. That mean anything to you?"**
3. **"You ever see a man carrying a weight that ain’t on his shoulders?"**
4. **"Some people pray because they believe. Some pray because they’re afraid. You think Ryan’s one or the other?"**
5. **"I’ve run this tavern a long time. I know when someone’s got a ghost following ‘em."**

entries.title: "📜 **Official Adventurer's Guild Scroll**"
entries.body:
### 📜 **Official Adventurer's Guild Scroll**

**Issued by:** _Elverdeen Chapter of the Adventurer’s Guild_  
**Guildmaster:** _Varrek Steelhide_  
**Scroll Classification:** 🔹 **Tier 1 Assignment – "Prove You’re Not Useless"**

---

**TO WHOM IT MAY CONCERN (and you specifically, rookie):**

The Adventurer’s Guild welcomes your fragile mortal frame into our glorious ranks of gold-grabbing, goblin-stabbing misfits. You’ve got two legs and a heartbeat (for now), so it's time you earn your keep.

---

### 🧭 **Quest Title:**

**"Kill them Gobbies"**

---

### 📌 **Objective:**

Retrieve a stolen **guild charter scroll**, last seen in the possession of a suspiciously well-dressed raccoon near the **Library Ruins of Burnmark Hollow**.

- Yes, we know that sounds insane.
- No, we don’t care what you think.
- Just get the scroll.


---

### 📍 **Known Hazards:**

- Raccoons (of **unusual intelligence and possibly literacy**)
- Angry ghost librarians
- Collapsing bookshelves
- A mysterious creature referred to only as “Shush”
- Traps. Because of course there are traps.

---

### 💰 **Reward (if returned in readable condition):**

- 15 gold pieces
- 1 guild-brand potion of “Not Dying”
- A free drink at the Rusty Dagger
- **+1 Guild Standing**
- A handshake from Varrek (maybe)

---

### ✍️ Notes:

- Do not burn the scroll.
- Do not try to eat the scroll.
- Do not give the scroll back to the raccoon.
- This is your chance to prove you belong here.

Fail, and you’ll be back on stable-mucking duty before you can say “I’m not even a real wizard.”

---

**Signed,**  
🖊️ _Steelhide Varrek_  
"Guildmaster, Axe-Collector, 3-time Goblin Cook-Off Champion"



## ⚔️ **Bounty: Goblin Raiders** — Enhanced Encounter

---

### 🗺️ **Area Description – Tactical Terrain**

The fight takes place in a **muddy, uneven clearing** surrounded by **dense underbrush** and trees. There are makeshift **barricades**, **rotting tents**, and scattered debris from past raids.

**Key Terrain Features:**

- **Spike Pit Traps (2 total):** DC 14 Perception to spot, DC 13 Dex save to avoid falling in (2d6 piercing + prone).
- **Collapsed Net Trap (near firepit):** DC 13 Dex save or restrained. Net is ropey and crusty, AC 10, HP 5.
- **Rotted Log Barricades:** Half cover (AC +2) or full if crouching behind (AC +5), but can be burned or smashed (HP 15).
- **Goblin Lookout Post:** A crude tree platform (15 ft up), 2 Goblin Scouts start here with javelins.
- **Fog of Burnt Flesh:** Light obscurement in 10 ft radius near firepit; causes ranged attacks to have **disadvantage**.

---

### 🎭 **Combat Phases & Flow**

#### **Phase 1 – The Ambush**

- If the party **fails to stealth** or is loud, goblins **trigger traps** first.
- **2 Goblin Scouts** start hidden in trees with readied javelins.
- Remaining **4 goblins spread out**, ready to **flank or lead party into spike pits**.

#### **Phase 2 – Coordinated Assault**

- **Goblin Boss** emerges from behind barricade, shouting orders:
    
    > _“Kill the loud ones, but leave the clever ones breathing!”_
    
- He uses **Boss Orders** to give a scout an extra attack per round.
- **Scouts begin using Nimble Escape** to dart between tents and brush, drawing PCs into traps or flank zones.

#### **Phase 3 – Hidden Agenda Revealed**

- Upon reaching the **firepit or chest**, party finds:
    
    - **The sealed letter in perfect Common**
    - **An unfinished carving of the figure from the contract: robed, faceless, hands behind back**
- If the party lingers or gets injured badly, **Hobgoblin Overseer** arrives from nearby ridge, shouting:
    
    > _“You fools! They're not weak enough yet!”_
    
- He charges in, using **Martial Discipline** to gain advantage when his allies are nearby.
    

---

### 👹 **Enemies**

#### **Goblin Scouts (x6)**

- **AC 15**, HP 18
- **Shortsword +6 (1d6+3 slashing)**
- **Javelin +4 (1d6+2, range 30/120 ft.)**
- **Nimble Escape:** Disengage or Hide as bonus action
- **Tactics:** Hit-and-run, trap luring, high ground archery

#### **Goblin Boss (x1)**

- **AC 17**, HP 38
- **Scimitar +7 (1d8+3 slashing)**
- **Boss Orders (1/round):** One ally makes an attack as a reaction
- **Tactics:** Barks orders, stays mid-field, focuses on support

#### **Hobgoblin Overseer (Optional)**

- **AC 18**, HP 50
- **Longsword +7 (1d10+4 slashing)**
- **Martial Discipline:** Advantage on attack rolls when within 10 feet of an ally
- **Tactics:** Frontline brawler, uses **Tactical Positioning** to stay with allies for buffs

---

### 🎁 **Combat-Reward Hooks**

#### **Firepit Chest (locked, DC 12 to break or pick)**

- 32 gp, a few **caravan trinkets**, and the **sealed missive**
- The **contract** hints that the goblins were hired to:
    - “Weaken outer trade routes”
    - “Avoid killing diplomats or anyone carrying the Mark of Question”
    - **Signed only with a red ink symbol that resembles a stylized "?"**

#### **Optional Challenge: Goblin Boar-Rider**

- If you want to spice things up, the **crude painting** is foreshadowing:
    - A **Goblin Boar-Rider** crashes in mid-fight!
    - AC 16, HP 30, **charge attack (2d6+2 piercing + knockdown on DC 13 Str save)**
    - Can trample allies and enemies alike!

---

### 🎲 Post-Fight Loot Table (Optional Roll)

|d6|Loot|
|---|---|
|1|**Goblin Carved Bone Flute** – Frightens goblins when played (DC 12 Wis save)|
|2|**Lucky Eyeball Charm** – 1 ability check/day at advantage|
|3|**Crunchy Bug Biscuit** – Heal 1d4 HP, but ughhh|
|4|**Spicy Squiggles** – Cold resistance 1 hr, but drippy sweat penalty|
|5|**Goblin’s Laughing Coin** – Cackles on flip|
|6|**Tattered Map** – Leads to **another trap-filled goblin stash**|

---

### 🌟 Encounter Themes & Vibes

- 🎯 **Tactical Chaos** – Traps, cover, movement, flanking
- 🧠 **Mystery Thread** – The contract hints at a bigger plot
- 💀 **Threat Scaling** – Add the Hobgoblin or Boar Rider for a harder encounter
- 😆 **Weird Loot & Humor** – Flavorful but fun rewards

entries.body:
The Shadow Lynx
Shadow Lynx Stats and Abilities
Size: Medium
Type: Monstrosity
AC (Armor Class): 14 (Natural Armor)
HP (Hit Points): 80
Speed: 40 ft.

Ability Scores:
STR: 14 (+2)
DEX: 15 (+2)
CON: 12 (+1)
INT: 3 (-4)
WIS: 12 (+1)
CHA: 7 (-2)

Skills:
Stealth: +4
Perception: +3

Senses:
Darkvision 60 ft., Passive Perception 13

Languages:
Understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak
Challenge: 1 (200 XP)

Special Abilities:

Bite Attack:
Attack Roll: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target.
Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

Shadow Blend: In dim light or darkness, the Shadow Lynx can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

Pounce: If the Shadow Lynx moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the Shadow Lynx can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

Terrifying Howl: Once per combat, the Shadow Lynx can unleash a terrifying howl. Every creature of the Shadow Lynx's choice within 30 feet and aware of it must succeed on a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.


The Shadow Lynx prefers to start the encounter hidden, using its Shadow Blend ability to surprise its enemies.
It will attempt to isolate and pounce on weaker-looking targets first, using its mobility to evade direct confrontation with stronger party members.
If it takes significant damage (reduced to 10 HP or less), it will use its Terrifying Howl in a desperate attempt to scatter the party.


The Mimics
1. Mimic of the Sharpshooter's Bullet
Type: Mimic (Magic Bullet Knowledge)
AC (Armor Class): 14
HP (Hit Points): 40
Speed: 10 ft., fly 30 ft. (hover)
Abilities:
Magic Shot: Fires a magic-imbued projectile that seeks its target (+5 to hit, range 60/120, 1d10+2 force damage).
Ricochet Trick: Once per turn, can bounce its shot off a hard surface to hit a target behind cover, negating the cover bonus.
Special Defense: Resistant to piercing and force damage.
1. Mimic of the Necromancer's Command
Type: Mimic (Necromantic Control)
AC: 12
HP: 35
Speed: 15 ft.
Abilities:
Spore Control: Releases a cloud of necrotic spores within a 20-ft. radius. Creatures within the area must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 1d8 necrotic damage and become poisoned for 1 minute.
Summon Minion: Once per battle, can animate a nearby dead creature as a zombie under its control.
Special Defense: Immune to poison and necrotic damage.
1. Mimic of the Paladin's Holy Weapon
Type: Mimic (Holy Weapon Knowledge)
AC: 16 (holy armor)
HP: 50
Speed: 10 ft.
Abilities:
Smite: Empowers its melee attack with radiant energy, dealing an additional 2d6 radiant damage.
Blinding Light: Can emit a dazzling burst of light. All creatures within 15 ft. must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be blinded for 1 round.
Special Defense: Resistant to radiant and slashing damage.
1. Mimic of the Barbarian's Explosive Hammer
Type: Mimic (Explosive Knowledge)
AC: 13
HP: 45
Speed: 20 ft.
Abilities:
Explosive Strike: On a hit, explodes in a 5-ft. radius. Targets must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d8 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
Fire Aura: Radiates heat that causes 1d4 fire damage to any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of it.
Special Defense: Immune to fire damage.
1. Mimic of the Cleric's Healing Ambition
Type: Mimic (Healing Knowledge)
AC: 15
HP: 55
Speed: 10 ft.
Abilities:
Healing Wave: Can cast a healing wave once per encounter, restoring 2d8+3 hit points to itself and any allies within 20 ft.
Cure: On its turn, can remove a condition (poisoned, blinded, etc.) from itself or an ally within touch range.
Special Defense: Resistant to bludgeoning and psychic damage.
Final Boss Mimic: "How to Beat Mimics 101"
Type: Mimic (Ultimate Knowledge Repository)
AC (Armor Class): 18
HP (Hit Points): 85
Speed: 5 ft. (Very slow due to its thickness and weight)
Abilities:
Absorb Knowledge: The book can absorb spells cast within 30 ft. of it. Whenever a spell is cast, it has a 50% chance to nullify the spell and gain a temporary buff based on the spell’s school of magic (e.g., absorption of a fire spell grants it a fiery aura that deals extra damage).
Heavy Slam: Due to its massive size, the book can perform a slam attack on adjacent enemies. This attack has a +7 to hit, deals 2d8+4 bludgeoning damage, and has the potential to knock targets prone (DC 15 Strength saving throw to resist).
Binding Pages: Once every two rounds, the book can open its pages wide, releasing a whirlwind of pages that attempt to bind around a target within 20 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or become restrained for 1 round as they struggle to free themselves from the thick, enveloping pages.
Ink Spray: As a defensive mechanism, the book can spray a blinding ink in a 15-foot cone once every three rounds. Targets in the cone must succeed on a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of their next turn.
Special Defenses:
Resilient Pages: The book's thick pages make it resistant to piercing and slashing damage.
Slow Regeneration: The book regenerates 5 HP at the start of its turn unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn.
Weakness:
Fire Vulnerability: The pages are susceptible to fire; fire damage deals an extra 50% damage to the book.
Encounter Dynamics
Given its low speed but high resilience and potentially devastating attacks, the party will need to employ a strategic approach to overcome this formidable foe:
Mobility is Key: The party should leverage their speed advantage, staying mobile to avoid the book’s area-of-effect attacks and using hit-and-run tactics.
Exploit Weaknesses: Utilizing fire-based attacks can be highly effective, both in dealing damage and preventing the book's regeneration ability.
Diversion and Attack: While one or two party members draw its attention and attacks, others can flank it or prepare powerful spells and attacks.
Environmental Advantage: If the fight occurs in the library, the party might use the environment to their advantage, such as knocking over large shelves to hinder the book’s movement or to trap it temporarily.

entries.title: "Loot Library (old)"
entries.body:
**

- In the Village of Eldenwood
    

- Whispering Pendant: A small, silver pendant that, when held close to the ear, mimics the sound of forest leaves rustling. It can calm animals slightly, making them less likely to attack unless provoked.
    
- Evercool Hat: A wide-brimmed hat that keeps the wearer's head pleasantly cool in hot weather but has no effect in cold conditions.
    
- A Small, Unbreakable Mirror: It only reflects objects in sepia tones. Animals are fascinated by their reflections in it.
    
- Rabbit's Foot on a String: Claimed to be a genuine lucky charm, but the only luck it brings is finding more rabbit's feet.
    
- A Jar of Laughing Fireflies: The light from these fireflies makes people giggle when passing through it. The fireflies never die but stop glowing if the jar is opened.
    

- On the Path to the Library
    

- The Leaf of Direction: This leaf always points north when placed on flat ground. In a forest, north might not always be the most useful direction.
    
- Boots of Slight Speed: Increases the wearer's walking speed, but only when they're walking backwards.
    
- Invisible Inkwell: An inkwell filled with invisible ink that can only be seen under the moonlight. Useful for secret messages that aren't time-sensitive.
    
- The Unquenchable Flask: Contains a liquid that tastes exactly like the best ale but doesn't quench thirst or cause inebriation. It also refills once every full moon.
    
- A Feather that Falls Like Stone: When dropped, this feather falls as fast as a pebble. A curiosity that defies natural laws but has no obvious use.
    
- Bark mask of blending: Peeling from a magical tree in the Whispering Willows, this mask makes the wearer's face appear as bark when worn, offering camouflage in wooded areas. It's rather uncomfortable and leaves a slight rash.
    

- Inside the Enchanted Library
    

- Gloves of Spider Climbing: Allow the wearer to climb walls like a spider, but only for 3 feet before they need to rest for an hour.
    
- The Book of Mundane Beasts: A detailed encyclopedia of normal animals that slightly increases the reader's knowledge of animal behavior. The knowledge is too basic to impact gameplay significantly.
    
- Magnifying Glass of Minor Clarity: When used to read text, it makes the words slightly larger but also slightly blurrier.
    
- A Helmet That Lets You Breathe Underwater: But only functions when completely dry. Its utility is thus, humorously, nullified.
    
- The Unending Quill: Never runs out of ink and can write on any surface, but only writes in an ancient, forgotten language that nobody can understand.
    



**

entries.title: "🌿 Act 1: The Village of Eldenwood (Hook & Setup)"
entries.summary: **Eldenwood Arc - Detailed Session Outline for DM Reference**
entries.body:
**Eldenwood Arc - Detailed Session Outline for DM Reference**

---

## 🌿 Act 1: The Village of Eldenwood (Hook & Setup)

**Important NPCs:**

- **Sheriff Arlen**: Steampunk aesthetic, ex-hunter of magical beasts. Gruff, skeptical. Will test party with Shadow Lynx.
    
- **Bella & Dorn Silverstream**: Dwarf siblings running Silverstream Forge.
    

**Locations:**

- **The Twisted Oak (Tavern)**: Giant oak grows through the center. Meeting point. Gossip and rumors can be gathered here.
    
- **Eldenwood Market**: Colorful stalls. Parents pooling money to hire adventurers. Traders may sell useful or weird trinkets.
    
- **Silverstream Forge**: Commission gear or enhance weapons. Bella is the no-nonsense one; Dorn is chatty.
    
- **The Whispering Willows**: Avoided at night. Used later for Bark Mask item origin.
    

**Quest Hook:**

- Children have gone missing near the forest edge. The sheriff is overwhelmed and too familiar with the dangers to act directly.
    
- Party must prove themselves by defeating the Shadow Lynx before venturing out.
    

---

## 🧪 Act 2: Trial by Beast - The Shadow Lynx

**Encounter Notes:**

- **Shadow Lynx**: Uses stealth, pounce, and fear. Should be eerie and dangerous.
    
- **Setting**: Edge of the Whispering Willows at dusk. Mist rolls in. Slight shadow movement.
    
- **Cinematic Moment**: After a tense fight, a beam of light vaporizes the lynx mid-pounce. Hint at magical forces watching.
    

**Trinkets Found After Victory:**
    
- **Shadow-Touched Leaf**: A leaf that’s always cool to the touch and doesn’t cast a shadow. Can be used as a focus for shadow-related magic.
    
- **Tiny Totem of the Watcher**: A wooden carving that hums faintly when near hidden things. Advantage on the next check to detect a trap or illusion.
    

---

## 🌳 Act 3: Into the Enchanted Forest

**Vibe**: Subtle magical realism. Weird, wondrous, eerie.

**Notable Moments:**

- **Trapped Spirit Fox (Lumina)**:
    
    - **Appearance**: A glowing, ethereal fox with fur that shifts like the northern lights. Eyes shimmer with star-like light. Voice is melodic and echoing, communicating through emotion, whispers, or direct speech at DM's discretion.
        
    - **Backstory**: Lumina is a guardian spirit of the forest, once a druid’s familiar ascended through ancient rites. Bound by oath to protect the balance, her essence is tied to the forest's magic. The trap she's caught in is an old remnant of forgotten hunters who once preyed on magical beasts.
        
    - **Save**: Boon of Foresight (1 use: glimpse seconds into the future, ask DM a yes/no question or rewind a small mistake).
        
    - **Kill**: Minor curse (small misfortunes such as slipping, gear failing subtly, minor events going wrong).
        
    - **Ignore**: Disadvantage on Concentration checks until they help another creature. Haunting cries follow them briefly.
        
    - **Additional Effect**: Lumina is the final key to solving the puzzle at the Crossroads of Fate. If the party doesn't save her, they cannot unlock the third secret path. If saved, she walks alongside them briefly, guiding with subtle light and calm.
        
- **Crossroads of Fate**:
    
    - The party comes across three ancient standing stones, forming a triangle at a forest fork. The stones appear worn but each holds a faint magical pulse.
        
    - **Puzzle: Unlocking the Third Path**
        
        - **Visual Setup**:
            
            - Each stone is etched with runes and a unique symbol:
                
                - **Left Stone**: Thorns curling over a bootprint — represents the Shortcut.
                    
                - **Right Stone**: A winding river — represents the Long Route.
                    
                - **Center Stone**: A fading spiral-moon glyph — only glows if Lumina is present.
                    
        - **Initial State**:
            
            - The Left and Right paths are clearly visible trails leading into the forest.
                
            - The Center stone seems inert unless Lumina has been saved.
                
        - **Mechanics**:
            
            - Once Lumina appears, she walks to the Center Stone and curls beside it. Her fur reflects the spiral glyph carved into the stone, activating it.
                
            - Runes on all three stones begin to pulse in synchronized rhythm. The players must:
                
                1. **Observe the Pulse Pattern**: The runes pulse in a sequence: Left – Right – Center – Left – Center – Right – ?
                    
                    - Players must deduce the next rune in the pattern (Center).
                        
                2. **Trace the Symbol**: To activate the hidden path, a party member must trace the spiral-moon glyph from the center stone into the earth using one of the following:
                    
                    - Charcoal, blood, or a spell (e.g., _Prestidigitation_, _Druidcraft_).
                        
                    - If the tracing is incorrect or incomplete, the sequence resets and magical feedback stings the caster for 1d4 psychic damage.
                        
                3. **Final Trigger**: Once the correct symbol is traced and Lumina places her paw in the center, the illusion of trees parts, revealing a third, hidden path forward.
                    
        - **Optional Hint**:
            
            - If the players struggle, Lumina may whine or nudge toward the spiral glyph repeatedly, offering subtle guidance.
                

-------------------------
-----

## 🌲 The Forest Paths – Choosing a Route

### 🛤️ 1. **Left Path – The Shortcut** (Dangerous but Fast)

**Environment:**

- A crooked trail winding through dense, gnarled trees. The air is humid and smells of moss and decay.
    
- Strange lights flicker just beyond view. The path seems to twist slightly when you blink.
    

**Traps & Hazards:**

| **Hazard**                                                            | **Effect**                                                                                                                                      |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Illusory Fork** (DC 14 Investigation)                               | Trail splits into two—only one is real. Taking the wrong one teleports the group back to the beginning.                                         |
| **Enchanted Vine Trap** (DC 13 Perception to notice / DC 14 Dex Save) | Grapples and restrains a target for 1 round; vines have AC 12, HP 10 to sever.                                                                  |
| **Spore Cloud Pitfall** (DC 15 Dex Save)                              | A hidden pit covered in leaves. On fail: fall 10 ft and inhale spores (DC 13 Con Save or suffer **Disadvantage on Int/Wis checks** for 1 hour). |
|                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                 |

**Combat Encounter:**

- **Animated Brambles (x2)**
    
    - **AC**: 13 | **HP**: 45 each
        
    - **Vine Lash**: +5 to hit, 2d6 bludgeoning + Grapple (escape DC 13)
        
    - **Entangle Burst** (Recharge 5–6): 10-ft radius difficult terrain and DC 14 Strength save or restrained for 1 round.
        

---

### 🎭 2. **Right Path – The Long Way** (Safe but Clever)

**Environment:**

- A peaceful trail surrounded by moonflowers and glowing mushrooms. The air is lighter, carrying hints of music and laughter.
    

**Riddle Spirits:**

- Three wispy, glowing spirits appear along the path. They block the way unless their riddles are answered.
    

**Riddles:**

1. _“The more of me there is, the less you see. Shine a light and I flee.”_ (**Answer: Darkness**)
    
2. _“I am not alive, but I grow; I don’t have lungs, but I need air; I don’t have a mouth, but water kills me.”_ (**Answer: Fire**)
    
3. _“I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?”_ (**Answer: A joke**)
    

**Moon-Phase Puzzle:**

- A circle of seven moon-carved stones must be placed in correct order. **DC 15 Arcana or Insight check** to understand the phases.
    
- Correct placement causes the path ahead to shimmer and open a grove that leads safely around all major hazards.
    

**Reward (Optional):**

- One player may gain **Whispering Spirit’s Boon**: Once per long rest, roll a d4 and add it to any Intelligence or Wisdom-based skill check.
    

---

### 🌙 3. **Secret Third Path – The Hidden Grove** (Only with Lumina)

**Requirements:**

- Only visible if Lumina (the spirit fox) is rescued. She guides them through an illusion wall after solving the moon-phase puzzle.
    

**Environment:**

- The air thickens with magic. The forest grows quiet, and time seems to stretch. Pale light beams down through dense tree canopies. An ancient stone shrine sits at the center of a clearing.
    

**Guardian Encounter (Optional):**

- **Forest Sentinel Wisp**
    
    - **AC**: 17 | **HP**: 60
        
    - **Radiant Pulse**: +6 to hit, 2d8 radiant
        
    - **Soothing Glow** (Recharge 6): All allies in 10 ft regain 1d4 HP.
        
    - Immune to Necrotic and Poison.
        

**Treasure Shrine:** Players can choose **one reward per character**, drawn from a set of unique boons:

| **Artifact**                   | **Effect**                                                             |
| ------------------------------ | ---------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Lunar-Etched Charm**         | Once per day, reduce incoming damage by 1d6 (no action required).      |
| **Moon Petal Dust**            | Blow into the air to cast _Faerie Fire_ (DC 14 Dex Save, one use).     |
| **Scroll of Woodland Passage** | One-time use scroll that casts _Pass without Trace_ (duration 1 hour). |
| **Silver Acorn Token**         | Advantage on Animal Handling checks in forests, once per long rest.    |
| **Glimmering Bark Circlet**    | Grants +1 to AC while in forest terrain.                               |

-------

---

## 🏛️ Act 4: The Enchanted Library

**First Impressions:**

- **Ruins Illusion**: As the party approaches through thick mist, the structure appears broken and overtaken by nature. With each step, the illusion peels away to reveal a towering arcane structure of living wood and ancient stone, fused with magic.
    
- **Environmental Details**: The air hums softly with energy. Books float lazily between shelves. Candlelight flickers in the absence of flame. Stained glass windows glow with depictions of forgotten adventurers, gods, and monsters.


---
## 🌀 Interior Layout & Key Areas

### **1. The Atrium (Entrance Hall)**

- **Features**: Suspended walkways, enchanted lanterns, floating shelves. Whispered voices echo softly.
    
- **Mysteries**:
    
    - Books occasionally whisper secrets to curious readers (Insight or Arcana DC 13 to interpret).
        
    - A massive tapestry shows a battle between heroes and shapeshifters — it's a clue that **mimics are present**.
        

---

## 🪞 Library Mimic Replicas: Party Reflections Encounter

**Event Trigger**: Upon entering the center of the library, the stained-glass windows crack. Magic pulses from the floor, and magical copies of each player begin to form — **mimic reflections**, tailored to mirror their skills, attacks, and appearance.

**General Traits for All Mimics:**

- **AC**: 15
    
- **HP**: 30
    
- **Speed**: 30 ft.
    
- **Damage Resistances**: Nonmagical weapons, Psychic
    
- **Condition Immunities**: Charmed, Frightened
    
- **Special Trait**: **Mirrorform** – Mimic gains advantage on attack rolls against the character they’re copied from.
    

---

### **1. Fire Druid Mimic**

- **Abilities:**
    
    - **Flame Coil** (Ranged Spell Attack, +6 to hit, 60 ft): 2d8 fire damage, target must succeed DC 13 Dex save or be ignited (1d4 fire dmg for 1 round).
        
    - **Wildfire Step** (Recharge 5–6): Teleports up to 20 ft, leaving a flame trail. Any creature in path takes 1d6 fire.
        
    - _Spells_: _Produce Flame_, _Burning Hands_ (2/day)
        

### **2. Time Winder Mimic (Magic Stone/Time Spells)**

- **Abilities:**
    
    - **Magic Stone** (1d6 + 4) 
        
    - **Chrono Slow** (Recharge 5–6): One creature must succeed on DC 13 Wis save or have movement halved and disadvantage on attacks until end of next turn.
        

### **3. Stealth Rogue Mimic**

- **Abilities:**
    
    - **Shadow Strike** (Melee Weapon Attack, +7 to hit): 1d6+3 piercing + 2d6 sneak attack if mimic has advantage.
        
    - **Vanish**: As a bonus action, turn invisible until next attack or end of turn. (1/round)
        
    - **Evasion**: Half damage on failed Dex saves, no damage on success.
        

### **4. Dark Paladin Mimic (Krovi Disciple)**

- **Abilities:**
    
    - **Krovi’s Judgment** (Melee, +6 to hit): 2d10 necrotic. If target is below half HP, they make DC 14 Con save or are frightened for 1 round.
        
    - **Dark Reprisal** (Reaction): When hit, deals 1d8 necrotic back to attacker.
        
    - **Aura of Dread**: 10 ft aura – enemies within start turn with DC 12 Wis save or take 1d4 necrotic.
    

### **5. Ant Master Mimic (Summoner)**

- **Abilities:**
    
    - **Swarm Command** (Recharge 5–6): Summons a swarm of spectral ants. Enemies in 10-ft radius must succeed on DC 13 Dex save or take 2d6 piercing.
        
    - **Ant Shield**: Once per rest, summons ants that impose disadvantage on next attack targeting the mimic.
        
    - **Pheromone Mark**: One creature takes +1d4 damage from mimic’s allies until end of next round.
        

### **6. Dwarf Warrior with Explosion Hammer Mimic**

- **Abilities:**
    
    - **Blast Hammer** (Melee, +6 to hit): 2d6+3 bludgeoning + DC 14 Dex save or take 1d6 fire.
        
    - **Ground Slam** (Recharge 4–6): 15-ft cone. DC 13 Strength save or be knocked prone and take 2d6 thunder.
        
    - **Stubborn Resilience**: Once per combat, reduces damage from a single attack by half.
        




## 📖 **Spirit Shot System – Echoes of the Hunted**

**Mechanic:**  
The mimic may **fire one Spirit Shot per round** as part of its multiattack or as a **Legendary Action**. Each spirit manifests as a semi-transparent creature and triggers a **special magical blast**.

Roll a **d6** to determine which spirit is launched (or pick them tactically).

---
### 🦌 1. **Glass-Horned Stag (Piercing Clarity)**

- A shimmering stag erupts from the book and charges in a straight line.
    
- **Effect**: 40-ft line, 5 ft wide — creatures in the line must make a **DC 15 Dex save**
    
    - On fail: Take **4d10 piercing** and are **blinded** for 1 round.
        
    - On success: Half damage, no blindness.
        
---
### 🐍 2. **Twilight Serpent (Venom Echo)**

- A spiraling, translucent serpent lashes outward.
    
- **Effect**: 30-ft cone
    
    - Creatures must make a **DC 14 Con save** or take **3d8 poison damage** and be **poisoned for 1 minute** (save ends each turn).
        
    - Success = half damage, no poison.
        
---
### 🐉 3. **Cinder Drake (Ashbomb Howl)**

- A flaming dragonling made of smoke spirals out, diving into a group before exploding.
    
- **Effect**: Choose a point within 60 ft. Creatures in a **15-ft radius** must make a **DC 15 Dex save**
    
    - On fail: Take **6d6 fire damage** and **lose reactions** for 1 round.
        
    - Half damage on save.
        
---
### 🐺 4. **Spectral Moonwolf (Howl of Dread)**

- A ghostly wolf leaps from the pages and howls with unearthly resonance.
    
- **Effect**: All creatures within **20 ft** of the mimic must make a **DC 14 Wis save**
    
    - On fail: **Frightened** until end of next turn and take **2d6 psychic damage**
        
    - Immune if already frightened.
        
---
### 🐦 5. **Storm-Talon Roc (Flash Dive)**

- A hawk made of lightning tears downward in a flash.
    
- **Effect**: One target within 60 ft must make a **DC 15 Dex save**
    
    - On fail: Take **4d8 lightning damage** and lose their next bonus action.
        
    - Affected area is considered difficult terrain as static charges the ground.
        
---
### 🐢 6. **Iron-Back Tortoise (Reflective Barrier)**

- A slow, floating tortoise spins out and explodes in runes.
    
- **Effect**: The mimic gains **+2 AC and resistance to all damage** until the start of its next turn.
    
    - Additionally, the **next ranged spell attack that misses** is reflected back to the caster (DC 15 Dex save to avoid).
        
---
### 🧠 Optional Legendary Action: **Bestial Barrage**

- The mimic expels **two spirit shots at once**, choosing two different beasts. Costs 2 legendary actions.
    
---
## 🎭 Aftermath Consequences for Arlen

Arlen has just watched the ghosts of his past—creatures he captured or killed—used as weapons. Here are some dramatic and story-rich fallout ideas:

---
### 1. **Psychic Backlash**

- The echoing cries of the beasts linger in his mind. Arlen gains a **minor madness flaw**:  
    _“Hears the whispers or howls of the spirits he’s bound. Sleeps lightly and trusts silence even less.”_
    
---
### 2. **Magical Guilt**

- Lumina might view him differently now—perhaps she **keeps her distance** for a while, until Arlen proves he’s not the hunter he once was.
    
---
### 3. **Spiritual Debt**

- The spirits demand **atonement**:  
    Arlen now **must release one magical creature from a similar fate** (e.g., a bound elemental, captured dryad, imprisoned beast) to free himself of the echo-curse.
    
---
### 4. **Permanent Mark**

- After the mimic dies, **one spirit lingers** in Arlen’s arm or gun. He occasionally channels it… but it may have **a mind of its own**.
    
> Ex: The **Cinder Drake** appears whenever Arlen casts fire spells or attacks recklessly, scorching nearby allies unintentionally unless he keeps it in check.






---

## 📚 Final Boss: "How to Defeat Mimics 101" – The Great Tome

**Description**: A colossal, levitating book with a thick metal cover, glowing runes etched across its spine. As it opens, the wind howls with thousands of whispered strategies, each incorrect. Pages slam shut like guillotines. This mimic contains the knowledge of every mimic slain in the library.

**Stats:**

- **AC**: 19 (hardened cover)
    
- **HP**: 210
    
- **Speed**: 5 ft (hovers slowly)
    
- **Resistances**: Bludgeoning, Piercing, Force, Psychic
    
- **Immunities**: Charm, Fear, Poison, Grapple, Prone, Restrain
    
- **Weakness**: Vulnerable to Fire
    
- **Legendary Actions**: 2 per round (used at the end of another creature’s turn)
    

**Abilities:**

- **Ink Spray (Recharge 5–6)**: 15-ft cone of acidic ink. DC 15 Dex save or take 4d8 acid and be blinded until end of next turn.
    
- **Binding Pages**: 30-ft ranged tendril attack. +7 to hit, 2d6 bludgeoning + DC 15 Strength save or become restrained (escape DC 15).
    
- **Counterspell Rewrite (1/turn)**: When a spell is cast, the book may attempt to unweave it. 50% chance to cancel spells of level 3 or lower. If successful, the spell is absorbed and heals the book for 10 HP.
    
- **Heavy Slam**: +8 to hit, 2d10 bludgeoning, target must make DC 15 Con save or be knocked back 10 ft.
    

**Legendary Actions:**

1. **False Knowledge**: Forces a target within 60 ft to make a DC 13 Int save or suffer disadvantage on all checks until the end of their next turn.
    
2. **Page Barrage**: Hurls razor-sharp pages at up to 3 targets. +6 to hit, 1d6+4 slashing each.
    

**Death Trigger:**

- When the book is destroyed, all mimic replicas and enchanted tomes in the library fall still, dissolving into inert paper. The magic sealing parts of the library ends.

---

## 🏡 Trinket & Loot Notes

**Village Items:**

- Whispering Pendant, Unbreakable Mirror, Laughing Fireflies Jar
    

**Forest Items:**

- Leaf of Direction, Bark Mask of Blending, Invisible Inkwell
    

**Library Items:**

- Gloves of Spider Climbing (3 ft only), Mundane Beast Book, Underwater Helmet (only works when dry), Unending Quill
    

---

## 🛡️ Tips for DMing This Arc:

- Play up contrasts: cozy village vs. alien magic of the forest and library
    
- Let players earn trust and escalate the mystery organically
    
- Use trinkets and spirits as ways to reward exploration
    
- Don’t overdo mimic combat – intersperse with puzzle or roleplay-driven rooms
    
- Lumina’s survival should matter beyond her first appearance — she can return later or be linked to greater forest magic
    

---

Ready to expand any section (mini dungeon in the library? missing kids side quests? spirit fox arc?) when you are!

entries.title: "The Hidden Mimic library"
entries.body:
[[Enemy Stats MLibrary]]
[[Loot Library (old)]]
[[Revised Sess Library]]
[[Trinkets]]
**

The Village

- Village bussing for concern for missing children
    
- Parents pooled their resources together to offer adventures to save their children
    
- Overburdened sheriff
    

Nestled at the edge of a vast and ancient forest, Eldenwood is a quaint village known for its hardy folk and deep-rooted traditions. The village is surrounded by thick stone walls, a testament to the villagers' determination to protect their home from the mysteries and dangers of the forest. Eldenwood boasts cobblestone streets, cozy timber houses with thatched roofs, and a central square where most of its social life unfolds.


The Twisted Oak: The village's only tavern, known for its warm, inviting atmosphere and the large, ancient oak that twists through its center, branching out and forming part of the roof. It's a place where tales are told, and plans are made, making it an ideal spot for the party to meet either by chance or by design.


Eldenwood Market: Held in the central square, this bustling market is where villagers and travelers alike trade goods, gossip, and news. Stalls brimming with local produce, handcrafted goods, and the occasional rare item from the forest make it a hub of activity and information.

  

The Silverstream Forge: Run by the dwarf siblings, Bella and Dorn Silverstream, this forge is renowned for its exquisite metalwork and craftsmanship. Adventurers often stop here to commission new gear or gather information about the dangers lurking in the forest.

  

The Whispering Willows: A small grove just outside the village, known for its serene beauty and the soft whispers carried by the wind. Though considered a place of peace, locals avoid it after dusk, believing it to be enchanted or cursed.

  

The Sheriff

- Steampunk man
    
- Once a renowned hunter of magical beasts, Sheriff Arlen now serves as the village's protector
    
- Ay you fools arn’t allowed in the woods. You’ll die within seconds. 
    
- Well if you want to venture out, you gotta prove yourselves. 
    
- Hm. How about a little hunt. Stand your ground against this shadow Lynx and your good to go. 
    

  

The Shadow Lynx

Defeating: 

- Just as the Shadow Lynx prepares to pounce on a vulnerable party member, the air crackles with arcane energy. A beam of light shoots through the air, directly though the beast’s head. It collapses, its head vaporized. 
    
-   
    

The Enchanted Forest Edge

- Depart in the morning
    
- the air cools, colors seem more vivid, and whispers follow their steps
    
- Trapped Fox
    
- Upon entering the forest, the party encounters a trapped spirit animal—a luminous, ethereal fox named Lumina, with fur that shifts colors like the northern lights. Its ethereal form flickers from being trapped in an enchanted snare.
    

  

Trapped Fox (Lumina)

- If they save Lumina: Grateful, it offers its guidance, granting the party a boon of foresight, allowing them a single instance where they can glimpse a few seconds into the future, potentially avoiding a trap or getting a hint during a crucial moment.
    
- If they kill Lumina: The spirit animal's demise unleashes a curse upon the party, causing them to suffer minor misfortunes like stumbling over roots or losing small items, until they perform a deed of equal kindness to lift the curse.
    
- If they ignore Lumina: Its cries haunt them, leading to disadvantage on concentration checks due to the guilt or distraction from its persistent wails, until they aid another creature of the forest.
    

  
  
  

Crossroads of Fate

- The party comes upon an ancient stone with runes, standing at a crossroads. The runes glow when touched, presenting a riddle that hints at the paths: one leads to a shortcut fraught with dangers, another leads through a seemingly safer, longer route.
    

  

- The stone at the crossroads presents a riddle that hints at the dangers and rewards of each path. For example, "Left takes you through the thorns of time, quick yet painful, right winds the long way, safe yet full of rhyme." This riddle suggests the left path is faster but more dangerous, while the right is longer but safer, with potential for enchanting encounters or puzzles.
    
-   
    
- Left Path (Shortcut): The shortcut is laden with magical traps, remnants of ancient wards meant to deter intruders. The party must navigate through illusions that disorient them, pits that appear and disappear, and aggressive, enchanted vines seeking to ensnare.
    
- Right Path (Longer Route): This path takes them through a part of the forest where the magic is whimsical but less dangerous. They encounter puzzles that test their intellect and magical creatures that challenge them in riddles or games of wit, rather than combat.
    
- Puzzle: A clearing features stones with inscriptions in the ancient language of the forest. Aligning them according to the phases of the moon opens a hidden grove that provides a safe passage, avoiding the more dangerous creatures.
    

  
  
  

The Whispering Glade

- In a serene clearing, spirits of the forest whisper secrets of the library’s history and the nature of the mimics, providing valuable insights that could help in the upcoming battles. However, the spirits speak in riddles, and understanding their hints requires sharp wits.
     
    
- "I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?"
- (Answer: An Echo)
    
- "Forward I am heavy, but backward I am not. What am I?"
- (Answer: The word "Ton")
    
- "You will always find me in the past. I can be created in the present, but the future can never taint me. What am I?"
- (Answer: History)
    
- "I am not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?"
- (Answer: Fire)
    
- "Walk on the living, they don’t even mumble. Walk on the dead, they mutter and grumble. What are they?"
- (Answer: Leaves)
    
- "I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?"
- (Answer: A map)
    
- "The more of this there is, the less you see. Shine a light on me and I flea. What am I?"
- (Answer: Darkness)
    
- "I speak without a voice, to those who listen from within. Holder of the ancient truths, keeper of the kin. I bind what's scattered, tell what's true, but in your hands, I'm new. What am I?"
- (Answer: A book)
  

The Bridge

- Fireflies 
  
  

Arrival at the Library

- First Sight: The dense forest unexpectedly opens up to a clearing where the library stands—seemingly a ruin at first glance, with ivy-clad walls and moss-covered statues flanking a grand, arched entrance. Ancient, towering trees envelop the structure, almost as if nature herself is cradling this bastion of knowledge.
    
- Realization: As they approach, the air hums with magic, and the ruins shimmer, revealing the library's true form—a magnificent edifice of stone and wood, with stained glass windows depicting scenes of legendary quests and mythical creatures. The realization hits; this is the fabled library, a repository of arcane knowledge lost to time.
    
- Entering: Crossing the threshold, they find themselves in an expansive atrium, where the air is thick with the scent of old paper and magic. Books float lazily back to shelves, and the sound of whispered words fills the air, as if the library itself is greeting them. Ahead, rows upon rows of shelves stretch out, filled with tomes that glow faintly in the dim light, promising both peril and discovery.
    

**
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/Campaign Kaya/Session plans/Season 1/Session 6-8 Library/The Hidden Mimic library.md

entries.title: "🔥 **Sheriff Arlen – Spirit Echo Arsenal**"
entries.body:
## 🔥 **Sheriff Arlen – Spirit Echo Arsenal**

**Level**: 5+ | **HP**: 68 | **AC**: 17 | **Special Feature**: **Cannon Arm with Spirit Infusion Module**

### 💀 **Spirit Echo Shots**

Arlen can fire one **Spirit Echo Shot** as an **action**, once per long rest per type, or use a special item to recharge (e.g., Spirit Core Shard). He chooses the shot he wishes to channel by **mentally focusing on the memory of the hunt.**

---

### 🦌 **Glass-Horned Stag – “Piercing Clarity”**

- **Effect**: 30-ft line, 5 ft wide.
    
- **DC 15 Dex Save** or take **3d10 piercing** and be **blinded** for 1 round.
    
- **Half on success, no blindness.**
    
- **Visual**: Glowing golden antlers lash forward from the barrel.
    

---

### 🐍 **Twilight Serpent – “Venom Echo”**

- **Effect**: 15-ft cone.
    
- **DC 14 Con Save** or take **3d8 poison** and be **poisoned** for 1 minute (save at end of each turn).
    
- **Visual**: A misty serpent coils from the muzzle and hisses as it strikes.
    

---

### 🐉 **Cinder Drake – “Ashbomb Howl”**

- **Effect**: Point within 60 ft, **15-ft radius blast**.
    
- **DC 15 Dex Save**, **6d6 fire**, and lose reactions for 1 round.
    
- **Visual**: Red flame wings spiral up and dive like a meteor.
    

---

### 🐺 **Moonwolf – “Howl of Dread”**

- **Effect**: 20-ft radius centered on Arlen.
    
- **DC 14 Wis Save** or be **Frightened** and take **2d6 psychic**.
    
- **Visual**: Echoing white wolf silhouette howls through him.
    

---

### 🐦 **Storm-Talon Roc – “Flash Dive”**

- **Effect**: Target within 60 ft.
    
- **DC 15 Dex Save**, **4d8 lightning**. Area becomes **difficult terrain** from static.
    
- **Visual**: A streak of lightning with winged edges arcs from the cannon.
    

---

### 🐢 **Iron-Back Tortoise – “Guardian Shell”**

- **Effect**: Gain **+2 AC and resistance to all damage** until start of next turn.
    
- **Bonus**: Reflects first missed ranged spell back to caster (DC 15 Dex to dodge).
    
- **Visual**: A runic shell snaps around Arlen briefly.
    

---

### 🦁 **Sun-Mane Lion – “Courage Roar”**

- **Effect**: All allies within 30 ft **gain temporary HP = Arlen’s proficiency bonus + Cha mod (min 5)** and are immune to fear for 1 minute.
    
- **Visual**: A translucent lion leaps from the cannon and roars, golden light pouring from its jaws.
    
- **Flavor**: This is Arlen’s rarest spirit echo—he only calls it in moments of true leadership.
    

---

## 🎯 Tactical Use

- Arlen should use **Glass-Horned Stag** and **Roc** for precision clearing.
    
- **Lion** is used in **climactic moments** to **buff the party** and **rally broken morale**.
    
- **Wolf + Serpent** are great for panic and soft control.
    
- **Tortoise** is Arlen’s emergency panic button.**

entries.summary:
Eldrin Past:
🔥 **The Glow of Golden Light**  
A hall stretches before you, vast and endless. **Sunlight pours through high-arched windows, flooding the room in gold.** The light feels… too strong. It presses on your skin like a heavy hand, leaving shadows too sharp. **Someone kneels before the light—then a sword is raised.**  
A voice says: _"May Kaya’s light cleanse this stain from our blood."_

entries.title: "🌿 Bonus Trinket Table – Forest & Library Mixed (Roll 1d10)"
entries.summary: ## 🌿 Bonus Trinket Table – Forest & Library Mixed (Roll 1d10)
entries.body:
## 🌿 Bonus Trinket Table – Forest & Library Mixed (Roll 1d10)

| **d10** | **Trinket**                | **Detailed Description**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| ------- | -------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| 1       | **Bark Mask of Blending**  | Grants **+2 to Stealth checks** in forest terrain. When worn, the mask shifts in texture to resemble surrounding bark and leaves. _Flaw:_ It causes a mild rash if worn for more than an hour straight (DC 10 Con save or Disadvantage on Charisma checks until a long rest). |
| 2       | **Leaf of Direction**      | A perfectly preserved oak leaf. When placed on a flat surface, it **spins briefly, then points north**. Functions even in magical darkness, but **loses effectiveness near magnetized objects**. Cannot be used during a storm or in strong wind.                             |
| 3       | **Moonlit Petal Charm**    | A silvery blossom that **glows faintly under moonlight**. Grants **advantage on Nature checks at night**. Additionally, once per long rest, it can emit dim light (10 ft radius) for 10 minutes. _Flaw:_ The glow cannot be turned off once activated.                        |
| 4       | **Whispering Acorn**       | When held, this acorn **emits soft whispers** audible only to the holder if a hostile creature is within 30 ft. The whispers increase in urgency the closer the threat is. Usable **3 times per day**, recharges at dawn. Does not work if deafened.                          |
| 5       | **Runed Branch Wand**      | This twig wand bears faint runes. Once per day, the user may cast **_Druidcraft_**. If used near a druidic circle or leyline, the spell is enhanced to also detect nearby fey. The wand will **wither** if used in an area corrupted by necromancy.                           |
| 6       | **Spectral Dewdrop Vial**  | Contains a shimmering drop of moonlit dew. When consumed, **restores 1 HP** and grants **invisibility to insects and tiny creatures** for 1 hour. Particularly useful in bug-ridden magical forests. _Flaw:_ Leaves a sweet scent on the user for 2 hours.                    |
| 7       | **Librarian’s Brooch**     | A silver pin shaped like an open book. Grants **advantage on one Arcana check per day**. If placed near an open magical tome, the pages **flip automatically to the most relevant passage**. _Flaw:_ Occasionally activates randomly, flipping non-magical books.             |
| 8       | **Inkroot Clipping**       | A twisted root saturated with ancient ink. Once, it can **write a full sentence** (up to 25 words) dictated by the user, in flowing sylvan script. Afterward, it **crumbles into dust**. Can write on any surface, including stone, flesh, or air.                            |
| 9       | **Chrono Vine**            | A twisted vine that **defies time**, partially frozen in motion. Can be thrown (20 ft range) as an action to **restrain one creature** for 1 round. Target must make a **DC 14 Strength save** to break free. One use. Reverts to ash afterward.                              |
| 10      | **Gossamer Tome Fragment** | A delicate, translucent page that shimmers faintly with arcane threads. Can be **attached to a spell scroll or spellbook page**, granting **+1 to the spell save DC** of one spell cast from it. **Consumed upon use**. _Flaw:_ Whispers the spell’s name until used.         |





## 🪞 Mimic-Specific Trinket Drops (Detailed)

| **Mimic**                      | **Trinket**                    | **Effect**                                                                                                                                                          | **Flaw / Quirk**                                                                                                                                          |
| ------------------------------ | ------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Fire Druid Mimic**           | **Ember-Stained Feather**      | Once per long rest, you may cast **_Produce Flame_** (Spell Save DC 13). While held, you have **resistance to cold damage** for 1 minute.                           | The feather always smolders slightly, leaving **a faint trail of ash**, making Stealth rolls at disadvantage in natural terrain for 10 minutes after use. |
| **Time Winder Mimic**          | **Stuttering Hourglass Shard** | Once per long rest, force a creature within 10 ft to **re-roll their initiative** and take the new result. While carried, gain **+1 to initiative rolls**.          | When used, time hiccups slightly—**all spell durations decrease by 1 round** for the next 5 minutes.                                                      |
| **Stealth Rogue Mimic**        | **Mirrored Cowl Fragment**     | Grants **+1 to Stealth checks**. Once per day, you may cast **_Disguise Self_** for 1 hour.                                                                         | Reflections in glass or water occasionally **move out of sync**, unnerving those nearby (Charisma checks made in bright light suffer -1 penalty).         |
| **Dark Paladin Mimic (Krovi)** | **Krovi’s Tainted Vial**       | As a bonus action, crush to **heal 1d6 HP** and deal **1d6 necrotic damage** to one creature within 5 ft (DC 13 Con save for half).                                 | Causes faint **black veins to pulse** through the user’s arm until their next long rest. Divine characters may sense corruption.                          |
| **Ant Master Mimic**           | **Queen’s Jaw Trinket**        | Once per long rest, summon a **spectral ant scout** for 1 hour. The ant provides **+1 to Survival checks** and **can sense hidden pathways or doors** within 10 ft. | The ant whispers **pointless or confusing directions** unless the user passes a DC 12 Insight check to command it clearly.                                |
| **Dwarf Warrior Mimic**        | **Smoldering Hammer Pin**      | Once per long rest, deal an additional **1d6 fire damage** on a melee hit. Gain **+1 to Strength (Athletics)** checks involving smashing or breaking objects.       | The pin radiates heat when near metal. You suffer **disadvantage on Sleight of Hand checks involving tools or locks** while it’s worn.                    |
