entries.title: "🏰 **Dungeon Layout & Encounters**"
entries.body:
## 🏰 **Dungeon Layout & Encounters**

### 🚪 **Room 1: Entrance Chamber**

- **Description:** Damp, dimly lit room with scattered bones, debris, and echoes of distant dripping water.
- **Encounter:**  
    **3 Giant Rats**
    - **HP:** 7
    - **AC:** 12
    - **Attack:** Bite (+4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing)
- **Notes:** Easy intro fight; sets spooky vibe.

### 🪨 **Room 2: Trapped Corridor**

- **Description:** Narrow hallway; suspicious pressure plates visible (easy DC 12 perception check to spot).
- **Trap:**  
    **Arrow Trap**
    - **Effect:** Pressure plate triggers arrow (DC 12 Dex save or 1d6 piercing damage).
- **Notes:** Introduces players to watching out for traps.

### ⚔️ **Room 3: Guard Post**

- **Description:** Old guard post with broken furniture; remnants of recent activity (signs of struggle).
- **Encounter:**  
    **2 Skeletons**
    - **HP:** 13
    - **AC:** 13 (armor scraps, shield)
    - **Attack:** Shortsword (+4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing)
- **Notes:** Adds undead vibe; quick combat.

### 🧩 **Room 4: Puzzle Chamber**

- **Description:** Stone room with **3 levers**; closed gate at the end.
- **Puzzle:** Simple **lever puzzle** (pulling levers in wrong order summons **1 Giant Rat** per failed attempt, correct order: middle → left → right).
- **Encounter (if wrong order):**
    - **1 Giant Rat** (same stats as Room 1)

### 🔥 **Room 5: Main Chamber (Miniboss Fight)**

### 🏛️ **Room Description**

- Large, dimly lit chamber, **sinister altar** at center.
- Missing child tied up in corner, terrified, in a blood star circle.
- Dark mage chanting ritual, protected by guards.
- Enormous, monstrous beast chained nearby, released when combat starts.

---

### 🧙‍♂️ **1. Dark Cult Mage (Leader)**

- **HP:** 20
- **AC:** 12 (robes)
- **Attack:**
    - **Fire Bolt:** +4 to hit, 1d10 fire damage (cantrip)
    - **Magic Missile:** auto-hit, three darts, 1d4+1 force each (1 slot)
    - **Sleep:** total 5d8 HP of creatures, starting lowest HP first, fall asleep (1 slot)
- **Tactics:**
    - Stay behind guards and monster.
    - Cast **Sleep** early, use **Magic Missile** on threatening players.

---

### ⚔️ **2. Cult Guards (x2)**

- **HP:** 10 each
- **AC:** 12 (leather armor)
- **Attack:** Scimitar (+3 to hit, 1d6+1 slashing)
- **Tactics:**
    - Protect mage, block melee attackers.

---

### 🦍 **3. Chained Monstrosity ("The Guardian")**

- **Description:** Large, twisted beast (ogre-like, mutated)
- **HP:** 30
- **AC:** 11 (thick hide)
- **Attack:**
    - **Slam:** +5 to hit, 1d10+3 bludgeoning
    - **Roar (1/encounter):** DC 12 Wisdom save or frightened (disadvantage on attacks, can't move closer) until end of next turn
- **Tactics:**
    - Goes straight for biggest threat.
    - Roars early to frighten players.

---

## 🎭 **Combat Flow Suggestions**

- **Round 1:** Mage casts **Sleep**, guards rush forward, mage releases **monster**.
- **Round 2:** Monster **roars**, guards engage, mage uses **Magic Missile**.
- **Later rounds:** Mage switches to **Fire Bolt**, guards stay defensive, monster attacks closest player.

---

## 📜 **Encounter Summary & Stats**

### **Dark Cult Mage**

- **HP:** 20 | **AC:** 12
- **Spells:** Fire Bolt (+4, 1d10), Magic Missile (auto-hit, 3x1d4+1), Sleep (5d8 HP total)

### **Cult Guards (x2)**

- **HP:** 10 each | **AC:** 12
- **Attack:** Scimitar (+3, 1d6+1 slashing)

### **Chained Monstrosity**

- **HP:** 30 | **AC:** 11
- **Attack:** Slam (+5, 1d10+3)
- **Special:** Roar (DC 12 Wis save or frightened)

---

## ✨ **Extra Flavor**

- **Mage RP:** Chanting dark prayers (“You’re too late! The Guardian awakens!”).
- **Room Flavor:** Ritual symbols glowing, chains breaking dramatically as monster is unleashed.
- **Rewards:** After defeat, party finds mysterious clue, connecting to larger cult or deity.

entries.title: "**💀 Enemy Stats & Abilities**"
entries.body:
## **💀 Enemy Stats & Abilities**

### **🛡️ Sun Knights (x2) (Elite Paladins of Kaya)**

💪 _Heavily armored zealots sworn to Kaya, they are her enforcers, cutting down all who oppose the Order of the Light._

**📝 Stat Block:**

- **HP:** 45
- **AC:** 18 (Plate Armor, Sunlit Shield)
- **Speed:** 30 ft

**⚔️ Attacks:**

- **Greatsword of Radiance (Melee, +6 to hit)**
    - 2d6+3 **slashing + 1d6 radiant**
- **Sunfire Smite (Bonus Action, 1/day)**
    - Adds **2d8 radiant damage** to next hit.
    - Target must make a **DC 14 Con save or be blinded** until the end of next turn.

**🔥 Special Abilities:**

- **Sun Knight’s Devotion (1/encounter)**
    - When the **Priest Aldric would take damage**, a **Sun Knight can take the hit instead.**
- **Unyielding Light (1/encounter)**
    - If reduced to **0 HP**, the knight can **make a DC 14 Con save**. On a success, they **remain standing at 1 HP** and gain an **extra attack** on their next turn.
- **Aura of the Sun**
    - Creatures **within 10 feet** of the knight **cannot be frightened** and have **advantage on saves against necrotic damage.**

---

### **🛡️ Sunlight Enforcers (x4) (Lesser Knights of the Order)**

💀 _Loyal foot soldiers who follow the will of the high clergy, enforcing "purification" with blade and faith._

**📝 Stat Block:**

- **HP:** 28
- **AC:** 16 (Half Plate)
- **Speed:** 30 ft

**⚔️ Attacks:**

- **Sunsteel Longsword (Melee, +4 to hit)**
    - 1d8+2 **slashing**
- **Shield Bash (Bonus Action, 1/day)**
    - Target must make a **DC 12 Strength save or be knocked prone.**

**🔥 Special Abilities:**

- **Sunlit Formation**
    - If at least **two Enforcers** are adjacent, they gain **+1 AC and +1 to hit.**
- **Sacrificial Zeal (1/encounter)**
    - If a **Sun Knight is below 15 HP**, an **Enforcer can give up their turn to heal them for 10 HP.**
- **Sunborn Discipline**
    - Resistant to **charm & fear effects.**

---

### **🔥 Priest Aldric (High Cleric of Kaya, Boss)**

👁️ _A devout priest of Kaya, Aldric believes that purging Hollowbrook is a holy mission. He will stop at nothing to "cleanse the darkness."_

**📝 Stat Block:**

- **HP:** 50
- **AC:** 14 (Blessed Robes of the Sun)
- **Speed:** 30 ft

**⚔️ Attacks:**

- **Radiant Smite (Melee, +6 to hit)**
    - 4d8 **radiant damage**
    - On hit, target must make a **DC 14 Con save or be blinded for 1 turn.**
- **Sacred Sunfire (Ranged, DC 14 Dex Save)**
    - 2d10 **radiant damage**
    - If the target fails by **5 or more**, they **catch fire**, taking **1d6 radiant damage per turn** until they use an action to put it out.

**🔥 Special Abilities:**

- **Divine Purge (Ultimate, 1/encounter)**
    - _"The Light Takes All."_
    - The Priest **raises his staff to the sky**, calling down a **massive explosion of holy fire**.
    - ALL creatures in a **20 ft radius** make a **DC 15 Dex save**.
        - **Failure:** **5d8 radiant damage**.
        - **Success:** Half damage.
- **Blessing of Kaya (Bonus Action, 1/day)**
    - Heals **a Sun Knight or Enforcer** for **20 HP.**
- **Words of Conviction (1/encounter)**
    - Attempts to **turn one player against their allies.**
    - Target makes a **DC 14 Wis save** or is **charmed for 1 round**, forced to defend Aldric.

---

## **🛡️ Battle Tactics & Combat Flow**

💀 _This is not just a fight—it’s a test of the party’s will against the Order’s twisted faith._

### **🔥 Combat Strategy:**

1. **Knights Protect, Priest Attacks from Range.**
    
    - **Sun Knights stay near Aldric**, taking hits for him when necessary.
    - **Enforcers focus on flanking and breaking the party’s formation.**
2. **The Purge Begins.**
    
    - **Aldric uses his Divine Purge early** to deal **massive damage.**
    - **Enforcers use Sunlit Formation** to get advantage on rolls.
3. **Final Phase - The Last Stand.**
    
    - **If Aldric is below 20 HP,** he tries to **retreat into the chapel.**
    - **Sun Knights use Unyielding Light to keep fighting at 1 HP.**
    - **Enforcers go berserk, refusing to surrender.**

---

## **📜 Session Cliffhanger: What Happens After?**

🏆 **If the Party Wins:**

- **They stop the ritual.**
- The **Order of the Light now knows their names—they are branded as heretics.**
- **Do they take the anti-magic weapon? Destroy it? Or flee before reinforcements arrive?**

🔥 **If the Party Loses:**

- **Captured and taken before the High Cleric of the Sun Order.**
- Forced into a **moral test**—do they convert, or resist?
- **A new enemy watches from the shadows… someone even more powerful.**

entries.title: "Session 14"
entries.summary:
Rumors spread through Elverdeen: the Grand Cathedral has announced a “miracle.”  
Priests of Kaya begin visiting every district to bless citizens with the _Star of Joy_ — a glowing mark placed behind the eyes that’s said to “banish grief and ensure eternal faith.”
entries.body:
Rumors spread through Elverdeen: the Grand Cathedral has announced a “miracle.”  
Priests of Kaya begin visiting every district to bless citizens with the _Star of Joy_ — a glowing mark placed behind the eyes that’s said to “banish grief and ensure eternal faith.”

On the surface, it’s the Church’s attempt to heal a mourning city.  
Beneath it, it’s a **soul-binding ritual** — each “star” connects its bearer to a network of divine runes powered by sorrow siphoned from the masses.

entries.title: "**Act I – The Holy Bloom**"
entries.body:
## **Act I – The Holy Bloom**

### **Overview**

Rumors spread through Elverdeen: the Grand Cathedral has announced a “miracle.”  
Priests of Kaya begin visiting every district to bless citizens with the _Star of Joy_ — a glowing mark placed behind the eyes that’s said to “banish grief and ensure eternal faith.”

On the surface, it’s the Church’s attempt to heal a mourning city.  
Beneath it, it’s a **soul-binding ritual** — each “star” connects its bearer to a network of divine runes powered by sorrow siphoned from the masses.

---

### 🕯️ **Events and Encounters**

1. **Priests Enter the Slums**
    
    - Paladin patrols begin “volunteer blessings.”
        
    - Refugees in the Burrows start vanishing — some willingly following the priests, others taken.
        
    - NPCs like **Sera Clay** or **Tamrin** might be taken or implanted with the mark.
        
2. **The Star’s Side Effects**
    
    - The “blessed” become eerily calm and obedient, smiling through pain.
        
    - Some lose emotions entirely; others whisper hymns in their sleep.
    j    
    - Detect Magic reveals **threads of radiant energy** connecting hundreds of people to a source in the Cathedral.
        
3. **A Whisper in the Burrows**
    
    - Clod’s Queen begins _mimicking the pattern_ of the stars in resin — meaning she can **feel the signal** through the earth.
        
    - If the players investigate, they learn that **something deep beneath Elverdeen is amplifying it** — possibly an ancient divine focus tied to the Purge network.
        

---

## **Act II – The Duke of Light**

### **Overview**

The Church’s true goal surfaces: they are attempting to **resurrect Duke Valen Deymar**, one of Kaya’s highest mortal servants, whose body was preserved in a crystal tomb beneath the Cathedral.  
His resurrection requires a _“Resonance of Joy”_ — the combined emotional energy of Elverdeen’s population.

The “stars” in everyone’s eyes are **conduits** — once the ritual is complete, every joyful emotion in the city will be permanently extracted and burned into divine energy.  
In exchange, the people will never feel sorrow again — at the cost of free will.

---

### ⚖️ **Conflict Choices**

1. **Expose the Church**
    
    - Sneak into the Cathedral to reveal the ritual before it begins.
        
    - Find a way to dispel the “star network” before it activates — perhaps using Clod’s ant resin or Silver’s Genie connection.
        
2. **Corrupt or Control It**
    
    - The party learns they could **redirect the energy** to power something else — resurrect someone _else_ (a fallen ally, one of their alternate selves, etc.).
        
    - Doing so could start merging Kaya’s and Krovi’s timelines.
        
3. **Let It Happen — Then Strike**
    
    - If the party fails or chooses to wait, the Duke’s revival happens.
        
    - He becomes the radiant “Savior of Joy,” ruling the city through divine hypnosis.
        
    - The next arc becomes a _resistance narrative_ with the Burrows as the last bastion of free will.
        

---

## **Act III – The Day of the Bright Silence**

### **Cinematic Event**

The sky over Elverdeen turns gold. Bells ring for a full hour.  
Citizens pour into the streets, laughing and crying, their eyes glowing like small suns.  
Then — one by one — their emotions fade, replaced with radiant serenity.

**You can describe it like this:**

> “You watch from the Great Spiral as light spills from the Cathedral, flooding the streets. Laughter fills the air — not real laughter, but something hollow and perfect. Every cry, every scream, every song echoes with the same tone. Above, a star burns brighter than the sun. And when it fades… the city is silent. Utterly, beautifully silent.”

After this, the Duke walks again — haloed, serene, and utterly wrong.

---

## 🌒 **Key NPC Roles**

|NPC|Role|Potential Fate|
|---|---|---|
|**Orthic**|Becomes a reluctant leader of the resistance, trying to keep the refugees safe while fighting the Church’s control.|Could be “starred” later, forcing a rescue or tragic mercy kill.|
|**Clod’s Ant Queen**|Begins **absorbing radiant energy** leaking into the Burrows, mutating further — her hive mind could start “reflecting” the star network back at the Church.|Eventually becomes a _mirror god-machine_, channeling divine power against its creators.|
|**Priest Aldric**|The Archbishop leading the resurrection, utterly convinced he’s saving the world.|Final boss or tragic figure who truly believes sadness is sin.|
|**The Genie (Silver’s Patron)**|Sees opportunity — offers to _“grant the wish of saving the city”_ if Silver sacrifices part of his soul.|Possible deal that redirects the entire ritual.|

---

## 🌀 **Deeper Lore Connection – The Dual Timelines**

- The “Star Network” is a **faint echo of Krovi’s old world** — in the Krovi timeline, the same ritual was used not to _resurrect_ someone but to _seal_ a god.
    
- By interfering, the party risks collapsing the boundary between timelines.
    
- This event could serve as **the bridge into the Feywild timeline jump**, with Elverdeen’s “light” becoming the portal itself.
    

---

## 🧩 **Next Steps You Can Run Immediately**

### **Session 1 of This Arc – “The Blessing Parade”**

- The Church sends a caravan of priests and paladins into the Smog Quarter to perform “mass blessings.”
    
- The party witnesses the ritual firsthand and must decide:
    
    - Help refugees hide.
        
    - Sabotage the priests.
        
    - Pretend to participate and infiltrate.
        
- End the session with **someone close (Sera or Orthic)** being forcibly marked — and the mark briefly flares with the symbol of Krovi instead of Kaya.

entries.title: "**Whispered Voice Lines**"
entries.body:
[[Isaac (Apple π)]]

- **The Coin Flip** – ApplePie flips his lucky coin at a tavern, but just before it lands, he hears a whisper:  
    _"Call heads."_  
    It lands heads up.
    
- **The Dream** – One night, ApplePie dreams of walking through a forest he has never seen before. The trees sway in an unseen wind, their leaves glowing faintly. A whisper calls:  
    _"Find the hollow trunk."_  
    Days later, in reality, he stumbles upon the exact place from his dream.
    
- **The Forgotten Spell** – During combat, ApplePie instinctively mutters an incantation he doesn’t remember learning. As energy surges from his hands, a whisper sighs in relief:  
    _"Yes… just like before."_
    
- **The Mirror Reflection** – In a still pond or a polished surface, ApplePie catches a glimpse of his reflection—but the eyes staring back are older, wiser, watching. The reflection’s mouth moves, but no sound reaches him.
    
- **The Vanishing Name** – ApplePie tries to recall the name of someone you feel like belonged to a life long companion. Someone you could trust in any case, but it slips from his mind like water through his fingers. In its place, a voice hums:  
    _"That name was never yours to remember."_ - (Name of a character of alternate party)
    
- **The Dice Game** – In a moment of gambling, he hears the whisper:  
    _"The dealer holds a nine."_  
    He calls the bluff and wins, but when he turns back, the gambler who sat across from him is gone.
    
- **The Moment of Hesitation** – Just before touching something dangerous (a cursed object, a dangerous relic, or even an enemy), the voices grow agitated, whispering rapidly in a language he does not understand—until suddenly, in clear words:  
    _"Not yet."_



### **Whispered Voice Lines**

- _"You've done this before."_ - done
- _"A step left, then forward. Yes… like that."_ - done 
- _"Don't speak. Just listen."_ - done
- _"Do you feel it? The moment where time bends?"_ - done
- _"This place remembers you, even if you don’t."_ - done
- _"Close your eyes. The answer is already there."_
- _"We walked this path once, long ago."_
- _"The stars are different here… but the story is the same."_
- _"They won’t understand… but you will."_
- _"It’s a game, isn’t it? Just a different table."_
- _"You found the first key. Keep going."_
- _"The river runs backward, and so do we."_
- _"You can’t see it yet. But you will."_
- _"If you turn back now, you’ll forget."_
- _"I  wonder why they all look familiar?"_

entries.title: "**Cantrips**"
entries.body:
### **Cantrips**

1. **Whisper of the Self** _(Divination)_
    
    - **Casting Time:** 1 action
    - **Range:** Self
    - **Effect:** You hear a brief whisper from ---------, granting you insight. Once before your next turn, you can reroll one ability check and take either result.
    - **Flavor:** A faint, echoing voice murmurs suggestions in your own tone.

2. **Flicker Step** _(Transmutation)_
    - **Casting Time:** 1 reaction
    - **Range:** 5 ft
    - **Effect:** If an enemy attacks you, you momentarily shift half a second forward or backward in time, reducing the attack roll against you by 1d8.

**Feyfire** _(Conjuration)_
- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** 30 ft
- **Effect:** A flickering, ethereal flame that does not burn appears on a creature or object. It harmlessly illuminates an area in eerie colors and can change its hue at will. The flame dances in unnatural ways, occasionally flickering into unsettling shapes.

**Whispers of the Glade** _(Enchantment)_
- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** 30 ft
- **Effect:** You cause faint, melodic whispers to drift around a creature’s ears. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw or become mildly **distracted**, suffering disadvantage on Perception checks and Investigation checks for 1 minute.


## Level 1 spells

**Temporal Gambit** _(Enchantment)_

- **Casting Time:** 1 bonus action
- **Range:** 30 ft
- **Effect:** Roll a d20. If the result is 10 or higher, you can impose disadvantage on an enemy's next attack or saving throw. If the result is 9 or lower, you suffer the same effect.

**Echoed Step** _(Transmutation)_

- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** Self
- **Effect:** You take a step forward, but for a brief second, your body leaves a temporal echo behind. On your next turn, you can use your bonus action to instantly teleport back to where you cast this spell.

**Trickster’s Step** _(Illusion)_

- **Casting Time:** 1 bonus action
- **Range:** Self
- **Effect:** When you move, you briefly **phase between multiple versions of yourself**. For the next turn, creatures must roll a d6 when attacking you. On a 5 or 6, the attack misses as they strike an illusion instead.

**Gossamer Veil** _(Transmutation)_

- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** Self
- **Effect:** Your body shimmers like silk in the wind, allowing you to pass through **tiny cracks, bars, or vines** for 10 minutes. This effect does not make you intangible—your form simply adapts like flowing mist.


## Level 2 Spells

**Mirthful Mirage** _(Illusion)_

- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** 30 ft
- **Effect:** You cause an area to shimmer and flicker with ghostly party lights, sounds of distant laughter, and soft, music. Any creature within the area must make a Wisdom saving throw or become **charmed** for 1 minute. They will not attack while affected but may still defend themselves.

## One time use spells
## **3. The Reflection That Wasn’t You** _(Illusion/Chronomancy)_

_"You see yourself in the water, and it smiles back before you do."_

- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** Self
- **Effect:**
    - Your **reflection steps out of the nearest mirrored surface**, standing beside you as a perfect copy.
    - It **fights for you, thinks like you, and even speaks like you**—but its thoughts are **not fully aligned with yours**.
    - At any moment, the **reflection might refuse to obey**, making choices that **it thinks you would make instead of what you command**.
    - At the **end of the battle**, it disappears, but a piece of it **stays in the world**, watching.
## **6. The Feywild Unleashed** _(Conjuration)_

_"You let reality slip, and the Feywild pushes through."_

- **Casting Time:** 1 action
- **Range:** 30 ft
- **Effect:**
    - A **Feywild anomaly bursts into the Material Plane**, affecting the area with a **random effect** from the list below:
        1. **Gravity reverses** for 1 minute.
        2. Every creature in a **30-ft radius swaps places** instantly.
        3. A **random Fey creature** appears
        4. **Time freezes**, but only for you—you can’t act, only observe, for 6 seconds.
        5. **Every living creature ages forward or backward** by 1d20 years (this is permanent).
    - The spell **cannot be stopped or controlled**, only endured.

## **7. The Fey King's Favor** _(Chronomancy/Illusion)_

_"For a moment, you are not you. You are something else."_

- **Casting Time:** 1 minute
- **Range:** Self
- **Effect:**
    - For the next 10 minutes:
        - **Every creature treats you as royalty**, bowing or obeying simple commands.
        - **Any spell you cast is heightened** to its strongest possible effect.
        - Your name is erased from the Material Plane **until the effect ends**—as if you never existed.
    - At the **end of the spell**, you **forget why you cast it**.

entries.title: "1. **_NieR: Automata — 2B & 9S**"
entries.summary: Fish is a warrior who existed first in the feywilds. They then get summoned to fight in a universe of kaya, before the knight appears when they were losing. After this,
entries.body:
Fish is a warrior who existed first in the feywilds. They then get summoned to fight in a universe of kaya, before the knight appears when they were losing. After this, 



Maybe fish was a robot made to protect the humans when they were being wiped out by krovi
### 1. **_NieR: Automata — 2B & 9S**
Machines wiped out humanity ages ago, yet two android soldiers keep fighting on our behalf because their very purpose depends on believing we’re worth saving. As missions spiral into existential horror, each revelation asks whether “being human” is biology, memory, or the stubborn act of caring anyway. The tragedy is circular: the more they learn, the more they bleed—yet learning is the only path to meaning. In the end, the androids’ struggle turns the player into a partner in grief, nudging us to decide if hope is a program that can be rewritten.

| **Area**                                                                 | **First Impressions & Entry**                                                                                                                                                    | **Key Discoveries / Skill Gates**                                                                                                                                                                                             | **Secrets & Rewards**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | **Complications / Hooks**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------ | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| **1. The Whispering Stacks** (sub-basement library)                      | Dusty spiral stairs behind a toppled bookcase; faint murmurs of **spirit-voices** drift between shelves.                                                                         | • _History DC 12_—spot inconsistencies in “official” war annals.• _Investigation DC 14_—notice mismatched bindings (rewritten texts).• _Perception DC 12_—hear a spectral quill scratching on its own.                        | • Journal fragment naming a **hidden reliquary** two floors deeper.• 1 × “Sentari Flicker” shard (minor chaos magic component).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | The spirit quill tries to insert propaganda into any open book—can erase Hendrik’s notes unless calmed (Druidcraft / Persuasion vs DC 14).                                                                                                                                     |
| **2. The Reliquary of Broken Oaths**                                     | Ironwood door lacquered in dried **Rive** motes; sealed by a temperature-sensitive lock (cold suppresses chaos → opens).                                                         | • _Arcana or Nature DC 15_—realize a **Seraphite crystal** (ordered emotion) will cool the lock.• _Stealth DC 13_—evade night-guard patrols.                                                                                  | Through barred grates Hendrik glimpses: • Shattered **Kaya paladin helms** charred by Rive.• A rune-latticed **longbow** that hums with suppressed memories.• Ledger revealing castle’s true purpose: **contain artifacts from both gods—then erase history of Kaya.**                                                                                                               | A single loose helm can be pilfered. Wearing it subjects Hendrik to sporadic flashbacks (advantage on History rolls about the war, but 1 Lvl 1 exhaustion on a failed Wis save after each vision).                                                                             |
| **3. The Fey-Slip Conservatory**                                         | Forgotten greenhouse where reality blurs; hanging vines fade between material & Fey realms every few minutes.                                                                    | • _Survival DC 14_—time crossing while vines are corporeal.• _Nature DC 12_—identify **Heartthorn**, a plant used to heal spirits.                                                                                            | • Fey mirror-pools show fleeting images of **Hans** running through mist (location clue).• Collectable Heartthorn—later cures the Direwolf spirit.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   | Occasional “slip pulse” shifts terrain; stay too long and Hendrik must make Cha save vs **Fey Bewilderment** (short-term disorientation).                                                                                                                                      |
| **4. The Knight’s Veil Gallery** (mural-cave)                            | Natural cave exposed by a collapsed well-shaft. Bioluminescent algae illuminates a **60-ft mural**: Knight of Krovi cutting a silver dragon in half while faceless crowds cheer. | • _Climb or Athletics DC 13_—descend shaft.• _History DC 15_—read ancient **Kaya glyph captions** contradicting official tales (shows _villages in flames_, _forced conversions_).                                            | • Glyph-pattern matches runes Hendrik has seen on spirits—first big breakthrough in **Sigil Reading** (unlock a new cantrip-scale sigil-tattoo at Lvl 2).                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | When mural is touched, a **Kaya-aligned sentinel spirit** appears (AC 14, 22 HP). Hendrik can fight, flee, or parley; defeating or placating it grants safe passage to…                                                                                                        |
| **5. The Direwolf Sanctum**                                              | Old krennel-tunnel opens into a moon-lit cavern with a stone sunken pool. A wounded **direwolf spirit** (white-blue Rive lines = House Hindenburg sigil) limps beside the pool.  | • _Animal Handling DC 15_ with Heartthorn salve = heal & befriend.• _Medicine DC 13_—diagnose spirit-wound (Fey iron shard lodged).                                                                                           | Upon bonding, Hendrik gains **Spirit Companion: Direwolf Pup** (flavored as an astral hound). It starts Tiny, grows with Hendrik’s level.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | The Fey iron shard, once removed, can later be forged into a **Spirit-Key**—a multi-purpose focus able to unlock Seals in the Reliquary (area 2) or other spirit-wards you introduce.                                                                                          |
| **6. The Sentari Ossuary** (sealed ossuary alcove under the Reliquary)   | A granite arch inlaid with **rose-pink crystal veins**. The air hums quietly, almost musical.                                                                                    | • _Arcana DC 14_—recognise the pink crystals as **Sentari**, naturally shed from Elkin horns. • _History DC 15_—recall that crystal-horned folk once ruled Azterra.                                                           | • A **finger-length Sentari shard** (counts as a spell-focus; grants +1 to Druid spell-attack rolls when channeling emotion). • Wall relief shows Elkin emotions mapping to horn-colours (red = rage, blue = grief, yellow = joy, etc.)                                                                                                                                              | When Hendrik pockets the shard, an echo of an Elkin archivist manifests—begs him to “remember us” and points toward the Prism Archive (Area 7). Failsafe wards slam the arch shut behind him until the spirit is laid to rest (Persuasion or Turn Undead-style ability).       |
| **7. The Prism Archive** (crystal-lined natural cave beyond mural shaft) | A huge geode chamber: multi-coloured crystal growths converge into a broken **crystal throne** with two **violet-pink horn cores** embedded in the arm-rests.                    | • _Investigation DC 16_—spot hidden drawers under the throne. • _Religion or Arcana DC 17_—decipher sigils on the walls that align like circuitry when lit by torchlight (first practical lesson in **Spirit-Sigil mapping**) | **Archive Tablets** – thin crystal slates that project illusory pages describing:  ‣ Elkin ruled Azterra before gods  ‣ Horns cyclically shed Sentari based on life experience  ‣ Early warnings that Krovi’s rise would turn emotion into a weapon. Reading three tablets grants Hendrik permanent _Comprehend Sigils_ (flavoured _Comprehend Languages_ for runes & spirit-marks). | Crystal growth is unstable—every ten minutes roll d6: on 1 the chamber resonates; failing a Con save causes **psychic feedback** (1d6 psychic dmg, Hendrik’s emotions colour the crystals). Shards that break off can be collected but harvesters risk another feedback pulse. |
### 📚 Forbidden & Forgotten Book Knowledge – Jot Dots

#### 🏰 Castle & War History

- **Castle Hohenzollern** was built in Year 801 as a vault, not a fortress—meant to seal magic relics and erase their origin.
    
- The **Knight of Krovi** led the campaign that “liberated” cities—most of which had surrendered peacefully before being razed.
    
- Many paladins of Kaya **disappeared**, not died—records mention “exile through mirrored flame.”
    
- Castle records abruptly stop before Year 600—likely rewritten after the war.
    
- Early maps show a **“Seraphite Temple”** where the reliquary now sits—its mention is scratched out in newer books.
    

#### 🌌 Elkin Lore

- Elkin horn colors **reflect emotion**, but most scholars believed this was only symbolic—ancient texts confirm it's **functional magic**.
    
- **Pink Sentari** only forms from complex emotions like **hope**, **longing**, and **betrayal**—a rare state that blends joy with sadness.
    
- Elkin once ruled by **empathy-based succession**—only those who truly understood another's sorrow could inherit leadership.
    
- The Elkin had no word for “truth.” Instead, they used the word “**Recall**,” as memory was sacred and changeable.
    
- After Krovi's rise, most Elkin cities were crystallized and left to collapse—**not destroyed**, just… forgotten.
    

#### 🌀 Spirit & Magic

- Sigils **change shape** when carved by a person in deep emotion—grief makes them sharper, joy makes them flow.
    
- Spirits fear **Seraphite**, but are drawn to Rive—emotion fuels their forms.
    
- Early druids didn’t use spells—they carved memories into their skin, creating **“flesh-sigils.”**
    
- Magic used to be a **language**—spoken only by those who remembered the old songs. The Forgetting made the language unstable.
    
- Spirits bound to relics whisper endlessly, repeating the moment of their death or failure like a broken loop.
    

#### ⚠️ Propaganda Red Flags

- Identical war speeches appear in multiple texts “by different generals”—plagiarized scripts likely used for control.
    
- Books that **mention Kaya without disdain** are often damaged, rewritten, or misattributed.
    
- Some copies of war records contain pages sewn in backwards or out of order—evidence of **mass manual alteration**.
    
- “Liberated” towns described in war ledgers had no survivors or follow-up census entries.

The town council offers a bounty. | Farms west of Elverdeen | **6-8 Goblins (AC: 13, HP: 9, Scimitar +4, 1d6+2 damage, Shortbow)**. May be led by a **goblin boss** with minor magical ability. | | **🕯️ Candlelight in the Hollow** | Villagers report **ghostly lights** dancing in **Marrow Hollow**, a sunken glade avoided since the war. | Marrow Hollow, East of Elverdeen | **1 Wispbound Spirit**, **2-3 Hollow Shades**, and a mysterious **flickering crystal flame**. Emotional or magical responses may alter the encounter's outcome. | # 📜 DM Detailed Encounter Notes – Adventurers’ Guild Jobs ## **🟤 Bronze Tier (Beginner Jobs – Balanced for a Strong Level 3 Party)** ### **🐀 Giant Rat Infestation** - **Area Description:** A dark, damp warehouse filled with towering crates and the stench of moldy grain. Scratching sounds echo from the shadows. In the center of the room, a hole in the wooden floor descends into darkness—something has been burrowing. - **Unique Features:** A rusted iron chest rests under a beam of moonlight filtering through a broken roof panel. Inside are old merchant records and a silver dagger with rat skull engravings. Strange footprints that do not belong to a rat are found near the hole. **🐾 Hidden Story:** The warehouse was once home to **Veska the Ratkeeper**, a reclusive merchant who specialized in breeding "trained" vermin for underground fights. Over time, her obsession with rats grew unnatural, and she vanished one night, leaving behind only her journals and a network of tunnels beneath the warehouse. Some say her presence lingers, her whispering voice urging the rats onward. If the party listens closely, they may hear a woman’s laughter—despite the warehouse being empty. **🦴 Enemies:** - **Giant Rats (x12)** – AC 13, HP 24, Bite +6 (1d6+3 Piercing), Pack Tactics, Diseased Bite (DC 13 Con or Poisoned for 1 hour). - **Alpha Rat (x1)** – AC 15, HP 40, Bite +7 (2d6+3 Piercing), Toxic Spray (Cone 15 ft, DC 14 Con or take 3d6 Poison damage). - **Mutated Rat Swarm (x1, if nest is disturbed)** – AC 15, HP 45, Swarm Bite +7 (3d6 Piercing), Resistant to Non-Magical Weapons, Spawns 1d4 new rats per round. ### **🗡️ Unique Weapon:** - **Dagger of Vermin** – +1 dagger, when used against beasts or swarms, deals an additional 1d4 poison damage. Once per long rest, can summon rats. ### **🎲 Possible Trinkets:** - **Rat King's Crown** – A tiny golden circlet, oddly well-crafted, found in the Alpha Rat’s nest. If worn, grants **advantage on Animal Handling checks with rodents** but also makes cheese smell irresistible to the wearer. - **Cheese of Questionable Age** – A moldy wheel of cheese that **emits faint heat**. If eaten, grants **temporary hit points equal to 1d6** but imposes disadvantage on **Charisma-based checks for an hour** due to the breath. - **Warehouse Ledger with Missing Pages** – A record of **mysterious shipments**. If pieced together, reveals a secret **smuggling route** beneath the city. - **Paw of the Pestilent** – A mummified rat paw on a string. Once per long rest, the wearer can **cause a small swarm of harmless insects to appear nearby**, useful for distractions or unsettling enemies. --- ### **🏹 Caravan Escort** - **Area Description:** A winding dirt road cutting through thick woodlands. The trees create long shadows as the sun sets. Wagon wheels creak as they roll over uneven cobblestone remnants of an old imperial road. The caravan is heading toward **Valmere**, a small trading town on the frontier, known for its bustling market and reliance on imported goods. - **Unique Features:** A shattered stone mile marker by the roadside has faint, ancient writing—possibly from a lost civilization. A wrecked wagon lies further ahead, its supplies scattered and torn apart. **🚛 Hidden Story:** Valmere was once a peaceful town, but a **string of recent disappearances** among traders has led to rumors of something lurking in the surrounding forests. Some believe bandits are responsible, while others whisper of a **cursed traveler** who steals the names of those who meet his gaze. Grelwin Thorne, the merchant, is particularly nervous—he’s heard the tales and refuses to stop for the night, even when exhaustion sets in. If the party investigates the wrecked wagon, they may find a **ledger with names, the last few entries violently scratched out.** **🦴 Enemies:** - **Bandit Scouts (x5)** – AC 15, HP 26, Shortsword +6 (1d6+3 Slashing), Sneak Attack (+1d6 on surprise attack). - **Bandit Captain (x1)** – AC 17, HP 50, Cutlass +7 (1d8+4 Slashing), Tactical Orders (Grants +2 AC to an ally for 1 turn), Parry (+2 AC once per round). - **Hidden Archers (x2, setting up ambush)** – AC 15, HP 30, Shortbow +7 (1d8+3 Piercing), Marksman’s Aim (Ignores half cover, can target weak points for extra 1d6 damage). **🎲 Possible Trinkets:** - **Silver Merchant's Seal** – A stamped coin of **Valmere's trade guild**. Can be used to negotiate better prices or convince a merchant you are a trusted trader. - **Lucky Bandit’s Coin** – A coin with **two heads**, always landing on heads when flipped. **Gives advantage on the first gambling check per day**, but someone may **recognize it as false.** - **Fine Bottle of Elverdeen Reserve** – A bottle of **very rare wine** worth 50 GP to collectors. Drinking it grants **+1 Charisma for 1 hour**, but drinking too much **imposes disadvantage on Dexterity checks.** - **Torn Wanted Poster** – A crumpled, half-burned bounty poster. The name and face are too faded to read, but the reward is **200 GP** if turned in to the right person. - **Horsehair Fetish** – A braided strand of horse hair tied with a small silver charm. Grants **advantage on Animal Handling checks with horses** but smells slightly of sweat and hay. ### **🎲 Additional Trinkets:** - **Valmere Trader’s Token** – A **symbol of Valmere’s trading guild**, which grants **advantage on Persuasion checks with merchants**. - **Runed Arrowhead** – A dull metal arrowhead **engraved with strange markings**. Glows when pointed north. - **Shattered Spyglass Lens** – Holding this up to one eye **reveals faint, ghostly outlines of where objects used to be.** - **Silver Button of Luck** – When flipped, grants **advantage on the next skill check**, but disappears after use. ### **🍴 Consumables:** - **Merchant’s Rations** – A fancy box of preserved food. Restores **3d4 HP**, but the packaging is **so noisy it imposes disadvantage on Stealth checks** for an hour. - **Spiced Wine Flask** – Grants **+1 Charisma for 1 hour** but **causes mild tipsiness**. - **Quickstep Powder** – A tiny vial of green dust that, when inhaled, **grants +10 feet of movement speed for 10 minutes**, but causes an uncontrollable **urge to tap dance**. - **Mystic Trail Mix** – A blend of dried fruit and nuts that restores **1d8 HP** but causes the eater to **speak in rhymes** for 10 minutes. --- ### **🔎 Missing Heirloom** - **Area Description:** The Ashenwood Forest is thick with tangled roots and misty air, making visibility difficult. A crumbling stone shrine stands in a clearing, overgrown with ivy. - **Unique Features:** An old wooden swing sways gently from a tree branch, though there’s no wind. A small pile of fresh wildflowers is placed near the shrine. An eerie, distant humming can be heard at night. **🌿 Hidden Story:** The swing once belonged to a little girl named **Elira**, the daughter of Lady Amira Venmire. Years ago, Elira wandered too deep into the Ashenwood Forest while playing, lured by the beauty of the wildflowers she loved to collect. When night fell, she tried to find her way home but never did. Her mother searched endlessly, but Elira’s remains were never found. The grief-stricken Lady Amira continued visiting the forest, unknowingly passing by the very place where her child perished. Elira’s spirit remains tied to the swing, waiting for her mother to return. She hums softly at night, a lullaby Lady Amira used to sing to her. If the party presents the **family heirloom**, which once belonged to Elira, she will gently cradle it, whisper "thank you," and finally move on, leaving behind a **Forest’s Blessing Charm**—a delicate wooden charm that grants **advantage on survival checks in forests.** If the party tries to free her, she resists, explaining she cannot leave because the forest remembers her. She is part of it now. If they insist, she will only agree if they take her locket on her skeleton and place it in her mother’s hands, giving her closure. Only then will she be able to rest peacefully, and the forest will grant the party **a hidden path known only to the spirits, allowing them to traverse Ashenwood Forest safely in the future.** **🦴 Enemies:** - **Treant Sapling (x1, guarding the shrine)** – AC 16, HP 45, Slam +7 (2d8+3 Bludgeoning), Grasping Vines (DC 15 Strength or restrained), Resistant to Non-Magical Damage. - **Mysterious Tracker (x1, another adventurer looking for the locket)** – AC 15, HP 35, Rapier +7 (1d8+3 Piercing), Parry (Reaction, +2 AC to avoid one melee attack), Evasion (Half damage on failed Dex saves, none on success). **🎲 Possible Trinkets:** - **Petrified Flower Pendant** – A small stone flower that **pulses faintly when in the presence of fey creatures**. Grants **advantage on Nature checks related to plants.** - **Engraved Wooden Ring** – A ring carved with **unreadable runes**. When twisted, it **shifts colors based on nearby emotions**, helping with **Insight checks**. - **Elira’s Shimmering Hair Ribbon** – A spectral-blue ribbon tied into a neat bow. Grants **advantage on Charisma (Performance) checks when dancing** but gives the wearer occasional daydreams of a distant meadow. ### **🍴 Consumables:** - **Mystic Berry Jam** – Eating it grants **advantage on the next Perception check**, but for an hour, the eater **can only whisper.** - **Ghostwater Flask** – When poured out, the water **briefly reflects past events in that location**. - **Luminous Petal Tea** – This floral tea **glows faintly in the dark** and grants **advantage on Insight checks** for an hour. - **Elven Honeydrop** – A single golden lozenge that **instantly soothes pain** but also causes the eater to **hear soft, distant singing for 10 minutes.** --- ### **⛏️ Mysterious Cave** - **Area Description:** A yawning cave entrance sits nestled in the rocky hills, with cool air seeping from within. Inside, luminescent fungi line the walls, casting an eerie blue glow. Stalactites drip with an unknown, viscous liquid. - **Unique Features:** A stone pedestal stands in a shaft of light from an opening above, cradling a rusted iron chest. The echoes inside the cave sometimes repeat words the adventurers never said. Strange claw marks line the walls. **🕵️ Hidden Story:** Long ago, **Rendell Voss**, an ambitious explorer and scholar, ventured into the cave searching for a legendary artifact known as the **Heart of the Hollow Echo**. According to ancient texts, the Heart was said to grant its wielder knowledge beyond mortal comprehension—but at a terrible cost. Rendell’s journal, found within a rusted iron chest near the cave’s entrance, details his descent into the cavern. Initially, his writings are filled with excitement over the bioluminescent fungi and the strange, shifting echoes. However, as the entries progress, his tone becomes erratic. He writes of _whispers that respond to his thoughts before he speaks them, shadows that move when he isn't looking, and a reflection of himself in the water that does not match his own movements._ His final entry is smeared, the ink blotched by what appears to be dried blood: > _"The cave knows me now. It speaks in my voice. I see myself in the dark, and I am smiling when I should not be. I will find the Heart, or perhaps it has found me. If I do not return, do not seek me. The echo has taken my name. It belongs here now."_ Deeper inside the cave, the adventurers may discover **Rendell’s skeletal remains**, eerily **intact and posed as if writing one final passage**. His fingers are curled around a glowing gemstone—the supposed **Heart of the Hollow Echo**. However, taking the gem **causes the echoes in the cave to grow louder**, eventually coalescing into a humanoid form that mirrors one of the party members. If ignored, it merely watches. If engaged, it attacks with the strength of its chosen host, mimicking their movements and abilities. Destroying the mimic does not destroy the echoes. The cave will always remember those who enter. ****🦴 Enemies:** - **Echo Wraith (x1, haunting the cavern)** – AC 15, HP 50, Shadow Claws +7 (2d6 Psychic), Phases Through Walls, Life Drain (DC 14 Con save or lose 1d8 max HP for 1 hour). - Multiattack - **Animated Armor (x3, protecting something valuable)** – AC 18, HP 45, Slam +6 (1d6+3 Bludgeoning), Immune to Poison, Blindness, and Charm, Overclock (Can take two attacks per round if not hit the previous round). WERAITH - **Mirror Strike:** It **attacks just as a player swings**, mimicking their own attack roll **against them.** - **Echo Step:** It vanishes and **reappears behind them**, using their own **last movement pattern.** - **Final Scream (10 HP or less):** It **erupts into dozens of spectral forms**, forcing **everyone to make a DC 16 Charisma save** or **see themselves die in a future vision. - 🌀 **Fragmented Reality** _(Passive)_ – If an enemy **misses an attack**, the Wraith **rewinds time slightly**, forcing them to **reroll the attack at disadvantage**—as if they never swung in the first place.** 🌀 **Unfinished Sentences** _(Passive, Aura 30 ft.)_ – Any time a creature speaks near the Wraith, **their sentence is repeated back to them before they finish** in their own voice. If a player tries to cast a spell that requires **verbal components**, they must make a **DC 15 Intelligence save** or **fail the spell as their words are lost in the echoes. ** 🌀 **Echo’s Final Whisper** _(Legendary Action, Once per Fight)_ - The Wraith **copies a single ability from any creature in combat** and uses it immediately, even if it’s a spell. **🎲 Possible Trinkets:** - **Whispering Pebble** – A small, smooth stone that **whispers unintelligible phrases** when held. If placed in water, it reveals **the last words spoken near it.** - **Old Brass Compass** – The needle spins wildly, then settles when near **ancient ruins or hidden doors.** - **Chipped Silver Mask** – A cracked, elegant mask. When worn, **causes people to mistake the wearer for someone else for a short time (DC 13 Insight to see through it).** - **Fungal Lantern Core** – A glowing chunk of bioluminescent fungus. Can be used as a **dim light source for 24 hours** before crumbling into dust. - **Rendell’s Lost Coin** – A heavy, tarnished silver coin with an unfamiliar face on it. Flipping it sometimes **yields three results: heads, tails, or an eerie glowing sigil.** ### **🎲 Additional Trinkets:** - **Cave Diver’s Charm** – A small stone amulet that grants **advantage on saves against being blinded** in dark places. - **Echoing Locket** – A metal locket that **repeats any sound made near it exactly 30 seconds later.** - **Rendell’s Broken Compass** – Points in the **direction of the nearest magical anomaly** but never north. - **Glowing Geode** – Can be cracked open to release **a faintly glowing mist** that lasts for an hour. ### **🍴 Consumables:** - **Glowcap Mushroom** – When eaten, grants **dim light around the eater for 1 hour**, but **makes their skin faintly bioluminescent for 24 hours**. - **Blackroot Tea** – Drinking this grants **resistance to poison for an hour** but **causes mild hallucinations.** - **Cave Lichen Loaf** – A dense, chewy bread that **keeps you full for 24 hours**, but causes **all food eaten afterwards to taste like dirt** for a day. - **Dwarven Stonebrew** – A thick, almost chewable beer that grants **advantage on Constitution checks** but makes the drinker **speak in Dwarvish for an hour.** --- ### **⚔️ Bounty: Goblin Raiders** - **Area Description:** A muddy clearing in the middle of dense underbrush, scattered with makeshift wooden barricades and half-rotten tents. The faint smell of burnt meat lingers. - **Unique Features:** A half-buried wooden chest sits beside a goblin fire pit, its lock rusted shut. A crude painting on a stone wall depicts a goblin riding what appears to be a giant boar. **⚔️ Hidden Story:** The goblins are more organized than expected—too disciplined for a typical raiding party. Among their belongings, the adventurers may find a **sealed missive in perfect Common**, outlining a **contract between an unknown figure and the goblins.** The letter warns them to **"attack only weak caravans and avoid killing those who ask the right questions."** Who is behind these orders? And why are the goblins listening? **⚠️ Goblin Ambush:** The goblins have set up **hidden spike pits** (DC 14 Perception to notice, 2d6 piercing if fallen into) and **a collapsing net trap** (DC 13 Dex save or be restrained). If the party is too noisy, the goblins will trigger the traps first, then attack from the trees with javelins before retreating into cover. **🦴 Enemies:** - **Goblin Scouts (x6)** – AC 15, HP 18, Shortsword +6 (1d6+3 Slashing), Nimble Escape (Disengage as bonus action). - **Goblin Boss (x1)** – AC 17, HP 38, Scimitar +7 (1d8+3 Slashing), Boss Orders (Grants an ally an extra attack, once per round). - **Hobgoblin Overseer (x1, if party investigates further)** – AC 18, HP 50, Longsword +7 (1d10+4 Slashing), Martial Discipline (Advantage on attacks when allies are near). **🎲 Possible Trinkets:** - **Goblin Carved Bone Flute** – Strangely, it **only plays one eerie note**. Any goblin who hears it **must roll a DC 12 Wisdom save or become frightened for 1 turn.** - **Tattered Map with Goblin Scrawlings** – Depicts **a hidden supply cache** deep in the hills. A successful **Investigation check (DC 14)** can reveal the location of hidden treasure. [[Random Funny Loot]] - **Old Dwarven Coin** – Possibly looted from an ancient site, depicts a long-forgotten king. Can be sold for **15 GP** or used to **gain favor with dwarves.** - **Goblin’s Lucky Eyeball** – A fake glass eye on a string, rumored to bring **good luck to whoever wears it (advantage on one ability check per long rest).** - **Bone Dice of Trickery** – A pair of crude dice that always seem to roll in the owner’s favor… unless someone is watching closely (DC 14 Perception to notice the trick). ### **🎲 Additional Trinkets:** - **Goblin’s Laughing Coin** – Flipping it produces **a random goblin cackle** instead of a sound. - **Hobgoblin War Beads** – Worn as a bracelet, grants **advantage on Intimidation checks against goblins**. - **Crude Wooden Mask** – Wearing it **makes goblins think the wearer is one of them (DC 15 Insight to see through the disguise).** - **Goblin Sketchbook** – A series of crude, chaotic doodles depicting **hilariously exaggerated battles.** ### **🍴 Consumables:** - **Goblin Firebrew** – A fiery alcohol that **causes the drinker to breathe out a harmless puff of smoke for 10 minutes.** - **Crunchy Bug Biscuit** – Restores **1d4 HP** but tastes **so vile it imposes disadvantage on Concentration checks for 10 minutes.** - **Goblinoid Meat Jerky** – Unknown meat. Grants **temporary hit points equal to 1d6**, but the eater must make a **DC 12 Constitution save** or feel **mildly nauseous**. - **Spicy Squiggles** – A bag of **crunchy, spicy dried fungi** that grants **resistance to cold damage for 1 hour** but makes the eater **sweat profusely.** --- # 📜 **The Gravedigger’s Curse – An Undead Encounter** ## **⚰️ Grave Robbery Investigation** ### **🕯️ Area Description:** The **Elverdeen Cemetery** is a place of old stone paths and weathered graves, surrounded by **twisted, skeletal trees** that creak in the wind. A heavy fog clings to the ground, and the air is **unnaturally cold**. In the center of the cemetery stands a **half-dug grave**, with a shovel still buried in the dirt, its handle snapped in two. The headstones nearby are **disturbed**, and some have **faint claw marks** running down their surface. In the distance, a shadowed figure **moves between the tombstones**, muttering to himself as he digs **over and over**, never stopping, never looking up. --- ## **💀 Hidden Story: "The Gravedigger’s Curse"** Once, **Edric Varn** was a simple gravedigger, a quiet man who honored the dead by ensuring they were buried with care. But one night, **he made a mistake.** A wealthy noble had died suddenly, and his family insisted on **a rushed burial** before dawn. Edric followed orders, but he failed to notice **something was wrong.** The noble **wasn’t dead.** Buried alive, the man **scratched at his coffin for hours, screaming beneath the earth, unheard by all—except Edric.** By the time he realized the truth, it was too late. The guilt consumed him. **He began digging at night, convinced he could still hear voices calling from the graves.** One night, something **answered.** A spirit, drawn to his torment, **bound itself to him**, forcing him to dig **forever, searching for the one he buried alive.** Now, Edric is **neither alive nor fully dead**, cursed to **dig and dig, never resting, never remembering why.** His shovel moves as if guided by an unseen force, and his **shadow twitches and moves independently**—as if it is controlling him, not the other way around. --- ## **🦴 Enemies: The Gravedigger’s Curse** ### **Edric Varn, the Cursed Gravedigger (Undead Spirit-Host)** - **AC 16 | HP 75 | Speed 30 ft | Resistances: Necrotic, Psychic, Nonmagical Weapons | Condition Immunities: Charmed, Frightened** **🗡️ Attacks & Abilities:** - **Cursed Shovel Strike** _(Melee, +7 to hit, 2d8+3 Bludgeoning + 1d6 Necrotic)_ – Every strike leaves a **rotting wound** that cannot be healed until a long rest. - **Digging Frenzy (Recharge 4-6):** Swings wildly in a circle, forcing all creatures within 10 feet to make a **DC 14 Dexterity save** or take **3d6 Slashing damage** as his shovel digs through **flesh as if it were soil.** - **The Voice from Below:** Every round, the **spirit whispers in his ear**, forcing him to **attack the nearest creature, regardless of friend or foe.** - **Restless Duty (Passive):** He **never truly dies**—if reduced to 0 HP, he **collapses but rises again in 1d4 rounds unless the spirit is exorcised.** ### **The Whispering Spirit (True Enemy – Invisible)** - **AC 13 | HP 50 | Speed 40 ft | Resistances: Radiant, Nonmagical Weapons | Condition Immunities: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened** **🗡️ Attacks & Abilities:** - **Spirit's Grip (Bonus Action):** The spirit can **possess Edric’s body**, granting him **advantage on all attacks for 1 round**. - **Unseen Whisper (Passive):** The spirit is **completely invisible** unless a **Detect Magic, See Invisibility, or radiant spell reveals it.** - **Bury Them Deeper (Recharge 5-6):** The spirit commands the earth itself to **pull enemies underground** (DC 15 Strength save or be restrained for 1 round). --- ## **💀 How to Truly Kill It** - **Edric is not the real enemy**—the **spirit is controlling him**. - Attacking Edric only **delays him**, but he **always gets back up unless the spirit is exorcised.** - The spirit is **invisible unless revealed by magic or attacking the empty space around Edric.** - If the party **digs up the noble’s grave**, they find **rotted fingernails inside the coffin lid**—proving what happened. This **weakens the spirit**. - Pouring **holy water into the grave or burning the noble’s remains banishes the spirit permanently.** --- ## **🎲 Possible Trinkets & Consumables** - **Edric’s Rusted Shovel** – Functions as a **+1 weapon**, but once per long rest, it can **dig a 5ft-deep grave instantly.** - **Noble’s Signet Ring** – Belonged to the buried noble. Grants **advantage on Persuasion checks with nobility** but makes **ghosts notice the wearer more easily.** - **Soil of the Forgotten** – A pouch of grave dirt from the noble’s grave. When thrown, it **briefly reveals invisible undead within 30 feet.** - **Lamenting Locket** – An old locket with a portrait inside. Once per day, the wearer can hear a **soft whisper warning them of impending danger.** ---

entries.title: "📜 Adventurers’ Guild Job Board – Silver Tier"
entries.summary: # 📜 Adventurers’ Guild Job Board – Silver Tier
entries.body:
# 📜 Adventurers’ Guild Job Board – Silver Tier

## **🟠 Silver Tier (Intermediate-Level Quests – Balanced for a Strong Level 5 Party)**

| **Quest Name**                        | **Description**                                                                                                    | **Location**              | **Encounter Details**                                                                                                           |
| ------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **🐺 Wolf Pack Terrorizing Farmland** | A **large, aggressive wolf pack** has been attacking **livestock and travelers** near the village of **Durnhill**. | Durnhill Farmlands        | **Alpha Dire Wolf (x1), Shadow Wolves (x5-7)**. Wolves **attack at night, using stealth and coordination to pick off targets.** |
| **🦷 Cave of the Gnoll Warband**      | A **small gnoll warband** has been seen **gathering weapons** in an abandoned cave. The mayor fears an attack.     | Broken Fang Cave          | **Gnoll Pack Leader, Hyenas, & Trained Gnoll Hunters**. Gnolls are preparing a **large-scale raid and have a deadly shaman.**   |
| **🦑 Something Lurks in the Lake**    | The **fishermen of Stillwater Lake** report that something **huge** is attacking boats at night.                   | Stillwater Lake           | **Enormous Lake Monster (Kraken Spawn or Water Elemental)**. Can be **negotiated with, driven off, or fought in deep waters.**  |
| **👁️ The Hermit’s Crypt**            | A **lonely crypt** on the outskirts of Elverdeen has begun to **glow with eerie green light at night.**            | The Forgotten Burial Site | **Powerful Undead Guardian, Trapped Souls, and a Lich’s Apprentice**. The crypt **hides ancient secrets and lost magic.**       |

---

## **🐺 Wolf Pack Terrorizing Farmland**

- **Area Description:** Rolling farmlands stretch across the horizon, dotted with abandoned fields and broken fences. **The howls of wolves echo through the hills** every night, making sleep impossible for the villagers.
    
- **Unique Features:** A **massive, clawed tree stump** stands at the edge of the farmland, filled with scratch marks and the **bones of past kills.** A local shepherd swears the Alpha Wolf speaks in whispers before it strikes.
    

**🐾 Hidden Story:** The Alpha Dire Wolf, **Fangbane**, was once a guardian spirit of the land, but something **cursed and corrupted it**. Now, it leads its pack in relentless terror, drawn toward something buried deep beneath the farmland.

**🦴 Enemies:**

- **Alpha Dire Wolf (x1)** – AC 16, HP 90, Bite +8 (2d8+4 Piercing), **Pack Leader (Grants wolves advantage on attacks within 30 feet).**
    
- **Shadow Wolves (x5-7)** – AC 15, HP 45, Bite +6 (1d8+3 Piercing), **Vanishing Step (Once per turn, can move 10 ft without provoking opportunity attacks).**
    

### **🎲 Possible Trinkets:**

- **Wolf Fang Pendant** – Grants **+1 AC against beasts**, but **wolves are always hostile toward the wearer**.
    
- **Hunter’s Lucky Arrow** – **+1 magical arrow** that, if missed, **returns to the quiver after 6 seconds**.
    
- **Moonstone Collar** – An old enchanted wolf collar. **Howls faintly at night but may be used to befriend one wolf.**
    

---

## **🦷 Cave of the Gnoll Warband**

- **Area Description:** The cave entrance is **lined with crude spears** and painted with the **symbols of Yeenoghu, the demon god of slaughter**. The deeper tunnels **reverberate with the gnoll’s hyena-like laughter.**
    
- **Unique Features:** A **torture pit** lined with gnawed bones and a **strange glowing idol** in the back of the cave.
    

**⚔️ Hidden Story:** The gnolls aren’t just raiders; they are **preparing a ritual sacrifice** to summon something much worse. If not stopped, they will unleash a **feral demon into the region.**

**🦴 Enemies:**

- **Gnoll Pack Leader (x1)** – AC 17, HP 100, Glaive +8 (2d10+4 Slashing), **Pack Frenzy (Attacks twice if an ally is nearby).**
    
- **Trained Gnoll Hunters (x3)** – AC 15, HP 50, Longbow +6 (1d8+2 Piercing), **Tracker’s Mark (Enemies hit cannot hide).**
    
- **Gnoll Shaman (x1)** – AC 14, HP 60, **Casts Inflict Wounds, Hold Person, and Summon Hyena.**
    

### **🎲 Possible Trinkets:**

- **Hyena’s Laughing Skull** – If held, causes the user to randomly **laugh uncontrollably once per day** (DC 13 Wis save to resist).
    
- **Tainted Gnoll War Banner** – Covered in dried blood. Holding it **grants advantage on Intimidation checks** but **disadvantage on Persuasion**.
    
- **Bone Dagger of the Hunt** – A curved blade that **glows when a creature within 30 feet is bleeding.**
    




---

## **🦑 Something Lurks in the Lake**

- **Area Description:** The still waters of **Stillwater Lake** ripple despite the absence of wind. Strange **bubbles rise to the surface** at irregular intervals. **The old dock creaks underfoot.**
    
- **Unique Features:** An **abandoned fishing boat** is anchored offshore, completely untouched, except for deep claw marks along its hull.
    

**🌊 Hidden Story:** The beast in the lake is not a **mindless creature**—it is the last guardian of an **ancient, submerged temple**. If approached with respect, it may offer knowledge **instead of death.**

**🦴 Enemies:**

- **Lake Horror (x1)** – AC 18, HP 120, Tentacle Slam +9 (2d10+5 Bludgeoning), **Drag Under (If hit, DC 15 Strength or pulled underwater).**
    
- **Summoned Water Wraiths (x3)** – AC 15, HP 55, Drown Touch +7 (1d8+3 Necrotic), **Resistant to non-magical damage.**
    

### **🎲 Possible Trinkets:**

- **Pearl of the Abyss** – Allows the holder to breathe underwater **for 10 minutes per day.**
    
- **Enchanted Fishing Hook** – Any fish caught with this is **three times larger than normal** but **cursed with eerie whispers**.
    
- **Barnacle-Encrusted Silver Ring** – Grants **advantage on Athletics (Swimming) checks**, but **smells faintly of seawater forever.**
    

---

## **👁️ The Hermit’s Crypt**

- **Area Description:** The entrance to the crypt is **covered in ancient carvings**, glowing faintly with green energy. The **air is thick with decay, and strange whispers** beckon the living inside.
    
- **Unique Features:** A **door covered in runes**, a **floating ghostly lantern**, and **a skeletal hand clutching a silver key.**
    

**💀 Hidden Story:** The crypt belonged to **The Nameless Hermit**, a cursed scholar who sought eternal knowledge. Now, his **soul is bound** to the crypt, forced to guard the **secrets he once sought.**

**🦴 Enemies:**

- **The Cursed Hermit (x1, Undead Sorcerer)** – AC 18, HP 110, Casts **Ray of Enfeeblement, Arcane Lock, and Animate Dead.**
    
- **Skeletal Guardians (x4)** – AC 16, HP 55, Sword +7 (1d8+3 Slashing), **Resistant to Piercing Damage.**
    

### **🎲 Possible Trinkets:**

- **Spectral Lantern** – A floating lantern that **never goes out** but sometimes whispers in Infernal.
    
- **Silver Key of the Nameless** – Unlocks **any magically sealed door once**, then vanishes.
    
- **The Hermit’s Last Words** – A page of indecipherable writing. Anyone who deciphers it **learns a forgotten spell, but at what cost?**

entries.title: "🏰 **Dungeon Layout & Encounters**"
entries.body:
## 🏰 **Dungeon Layout & Encounters**

### 🚪 **Room 1: Entrance Chamber**

- **Description:** Damp, dimly lit room with scattered bones, debris, and echoes of distant dripping water.
- **Encounter:**  ''
    **3 Giant Rive Rats**
    - **HP:** 7
    - **AC:** 12
    - **Attack:** Bite (+4 to hit, 1d4+2 piercing)
- **Notes:** Easy intro fight; sets spooky vibe.

### 🪨 **Room 2: Trapped Corridor**

- **Description:** Narrow hallway; suspicious pressure plates visible (easy DC 12 perception check to spot).
- **Trap:**  
    **Arrow Trap**
    - **Effect:** Pressure plate triggers arrow (DC 12 Dex save or 1d6 piercing damage).
- **Notes:** Introduces players to watching out for traps.

### ⚔️ **Room 3: Guard Post**

- **Description:** Old guard post with broken furniture; remnants of recent activity (signs of struggle).
- **Encounter:**  
    **2 Skeletons**
    - **HP:** 13
    - **AC:** 13 (armor scraps, shield)
    - **Attack:** Shortsword (+4 to hit, 1d6+2 piercing)
- **Notes:** Adds undead vibe; quick combat.

### 🧩 **Room 4: Puzzle Chamber**

- **Description:** Stone room with **3 levers**; closed gate at the end.
- **Puzzle:** Simple **lever puzzle** (pulling levers in wrong order summons **1 Giant Rat** per failed attempt, correct order: middle → left → right).
- **Encounter (if wrong order):**
    - **1 Giant Rat** (same stats as Room 1)

### 🔥 **Room 5: Main Chamber (Miniboss Fight)**

### 🏛️ **Room Description**

- Large, dimly lit chamber, **sinister altar** at center.
- Missing child tied up in corner, terrified, in a blood star circle.
- Dark mage chanting ritual, protected by guards.
- Enormous, monstrous beast chained nearby, released when combat starts.

---

### 🧙‍♂️ **1. Dark Cult Mage (Leader)**

- **HP:** 20
- **AC:** 12 (robes)
- **Attack:**
    - **Fire Bolt:** +4 to hit, 1d10 fire damage (cantrip)
    - **Magic Missile:** auto-hit, three darts, 1d4+1 force each (1 slot)
    - **Sleep:** total 5d8 HP of creatures, starting lowest HP first, fall asleep (1 slot)
- **Tactics:**
    - Stay behind guards and monster.
    - Cast **Sleep** early, use **Magic Missile** on threatening players.

---

### ⚔️ **2. Cult Guards (x2)**

- **HP:** 10 each
- **AC:** 12 (leather armor)
- **Attack:** Scimitar (+3 to hit, 1d6+1 slashing)
- **Tactics:**
    - Protect mage, block melee attackers.

---

### 🦍 **3. Chained Monstrosity ("The Guardian")**

- **Description:** Large, twisted beast (ogre-like, mutated)
- **HP:** 30
- **AC:** 11 (thick hide)
- **Attack:**
    - **Slam:** +5 to hit, 1d10+3 bludgeoning
    - **Roar (1/encounter):** DC 12 Wisdom save or frightened (disadvantage on attacks, can't move closer) until end of next turn
- **Tactics:**
    - Goes straight for biggest threat.
    - Roars early to frighten players.

---

## 🎭 **Combat Flow Suggestions**

- **Round 1:** Mage casts **Sleep**, guards rush forward, mage releases **monster**.
- **Round 2:** Monster **roars**, guards engage, mage uses **Magic Missile**.
- **Later rounds:** Mage switches to **Fire Bolt**, guards stay defensive, monster attacks closest player.

---

## 📜 **Encounter Summary & Stats**

### **Dark Cult Mage**

- **HP:** 20 | **AC:** 12
- **Spells:** Fire Bolt (+4, 1d10), Magic Missile (auto-hit, 3x1d4+1), Sleep (5d8 HP total)

### **Cult Guards (x2)**

- **HP:** 10 each | **AC:** 12
- **Attack:** Scimitar (+3, 1d6+1 slashing)

### **Chained Monstrosity**

- **HP:** 30 | **AC:** 11
- **Attack:** Slam (+5, 1d10+3)
- **Special:** Roar (DC 12 Wis save or frightened)

---

## ✨ **Extra Flavor**

- **Mage RP:** Chanting dark prayers (“You’re too late! The Guardian awakens!”).
- **Room Flavor:** Ritual symbols glowing, chains breaking dramatically as monster is unleashed.
- **Rewards:** After defeat, party finds mysterious clue, connecting to larger cult or deity.


### 🎁 **Bonus Hidden Room (Optional)**

**Hidden Door in Main Chamber (DC 16 Perception/Investigation)**

- Leads to a small, stone chamber that is **eerily clean**, like untouched by time.
    
- At its center floats a **half-shattered crystal disc** — half kaya half krovi


### 🔮 **Interactive Element – The Shattered Disc**

- **Touching it** triggers a **shared vision** (or a vision seen by one player, your choice):
    
    - A vast, ethereal **dragon of silver light** soars above a calm ocean.
        
    - A **shadowed, coiling dragon** erupts from below, made of flame and screaming color.
        
    - The sky **cracks** like glass as they **collide**, and time **stops**.
        
    - A **third figure**, a man in dark robes with a broken crown (Eje), reaches toward the crack.
        
    - Then darkness.
	
	CV 32QWAZ`2Q`

entries.title: "**💀 Enemy Stats & Abilities**"
entries.body:
## **💀 Enemy Stats & Abilities**

### **🛡️ Sun Knights (x2) (Elite Paladins of Kaya)**

💪 _Heavily armored zealots sworn to Kaya, they are her enforcers, cutting down all who oppose the Order of the Light._

**📝 Stat Block:**

- **HP:** 45
- **AC:** 18 (Plate Armor, Sunlit Shield)
- **Speed:** 30 ft

**⚔️ Attacks:**

- **Greatsword of Radiance (Melee, +6 to hit)**
    - 2d6+3 **slashing + 1d6 radiant**
- **Sunfire Smite (Bonus Action, 1/day)**
    - Adds **2d8 radiant damage** to next hit.
    - Target must make a **DC 14 Con save or be blinded** until the end of next turn.

**🔥 Special Abilities:**

- **Sun Knight’s Devotion (1/encounter)**
    - When the **Priest Aldric would take damage**, a **Sun Knight can take the hit instead.**
- **Unyielding Light (1/encounter)**
    - If reduced to **0 HP**, the knight can **make a DC 14 Con save**. On a success, they **remain standing at 1 HP** and gain an **extra attack** on their next turn.
- **Aura of the Sun**
    - Creatures **within 10 feet** of the knight **cannot be frightened** and have **advantage on saves against necrotic damage.**

---

### **🛡️ Sunlight Enforcers (x4) (Lesser Knights of the Order)**

💀 _Loyal foot soldiers who follow the will of the high clergy, enforcing "purification" with blade and faith._

**📝 Stat Block:**

- **HP:** 28
- **AC:** 16 (Half Plate)
- **Speed:** 30 ft

**⚔️ Attacks:**

- **Sunsteel Longsword (Melee, +4 to hit)**
    - 1d8+2 **slashing**
- **Shield Bash (Bonus Action, 1/day)**
    - Target must make a **DC 12 Strength save or be knocked prone.**

**🔥 Special Abilities:**

- **Sunlit Formation**
    - If at least **two Enforcers** are adjacent, they gain **+1 AC and +1 to hit.**
- **Sacrificial Zeal (1/encounter)**
    - If a **Sun Knight is below 15 HP**, an **Enforcer can give up their turn to heal them for 10 HP.**
- **Sunborn Discipline**
    - Resistant to **charm & fear effects.**

---

### **🔥 Priest Aldric (High Cleric of Kaya, Boss)**

👁️ _A devout priest of Kaya, Aldric believes that purging Hollowbrook is a holy mission. He will stop at nothing to "cleanse the darkness."_

**📝 Stat Block:**

- **HP:** 50
- **AC:** 14 (Blessed Robes of the Sun)
- **Speed:** 30 ft

**⚔️ Attacks:**

- **Radiant Smite (Melee, +6 to hit)**
    - 4d8 **radiant damage**
    - On hit, target must make a **DC 14 Con save or be blinded for 1 turn.**
- **Sacred Sunfire (Ranged, DC 14 Dex Save)**
    - 2d10 **radiant damage**
    - If the target fails by **5 or more**, they **catch fire**, taking **1d6 radiant damage per turn** until they use an action to put it out.

**🔥 Special Abilities:**

- **Divine Purge (Ultimate, 1/encounter)**
    - _"The Light Takes All."_
    - The Priest **raises his staff to the sky**, calling down a **massive explosion of holy fire**.
    - ALL creatures in a **20 ft radius** make a **DC 15 Dex save**.
        - **Failure:** **5d8 radiant damage**.
        - **Success:** Half damage.
- **Blessing of Kaya (Bonus Action, 1/day)**
    - Heals **a Sun Knight or Enforcer** for **20 HP.**
- **Words of Conviction (1/encounter)**
    - Attempts to **turn one player against their allies.**
    - Target makes a **DC 14 Wis save** or is **charmed for 1 round**, forced to defend Aldric.

---

## **🛡️ Battle Tactics & Combat Flow**

💀 _This is not just a fight—it’s a test of the party’s will against the Order’s twisted faith._

### **🔥 Combat Strategy:**

1. **Knights Protect, Priest Attacks from Range.**
    
    - **Sun Knights stay near Aldric**, taking hits for him when necessary.
    - **Enforcers focus on flanking and breaking the party’s formation.**
2. **The Purge Begins.**
    
    - **Aldric uses his Divine Purge early** to deal **massive damage.**
    - **Enforcers use Sunlit Formation** to get advantage on rolls.
3. **Final Phase - The Last Stand.**
    
    - **If Aldric is below 20 HP,** he tries to **retreat into the chapel.**
    - **Sun Knights use Unyielding Light to keep fighting at 1 HP.**
    - **Enforcers go berserk, refusing to surrender.**

---

## **📜 Session Cliffhanger: What Happens After?**

🏆 **If the Party Wins:**

- **They stop the ritual.**
- The **Order of the Light now knows their names—they are branded as heretics.**
- **Do they take the anti-magic weapon? Destroy it? Or flee before reinforcements arrive?**

🔥 **If the Party Loses:**

- **Captured and taken before the High Cleric of the Sun Order.**
- Forced into a **moral test**—do they convert, or resist?
- **A new enemy watches from the shadows… someone even more powerful.**

entries.title: "**⛏️ Mysterious Cave**"
entries.summary:
### **⛏️ Mysterious Cave**
 - RED MIST DEAD NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO
entries.body:
### **⛏️ Mysterious Cave**
 - RED MIST DEAD NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO

[📖]( Journal Entry – Entry 17 We entered the Vale just before dusk. That’s when the mist turned red. Not the kind that clings to the ground—this rose in pillars. It shimmered like light through blood, slow and deliberate. Serrin called it “Rive memory”—magic so soaked in emotion that it remembers what the world has forgotten. Then the shape appeared. A girl. Maybe twenty. A half-elf in layered red armor, elegant but battle-worn. The plates caught the last light and refracted it, like she was built from fire-glass. She didn’t walk. She just… was. Standing there on the ridge above us, hair drifting like smoke, gaze pinned to something far behind us. She was beautiful in the way legends are beautiful—too much, too sharp. Too sad. She never moved. Never spoke. And when the wind shifted, her body scattered—back into mist, as if the valley itself couldn’t bear to forget her. We said nothing after. Serrin kept walking. But I swear the mist was trying to remember her. To rebuild her from scraps of emotion and old blood. It almost did.
