entries.title: "🎭 Drunk Side Effects (Fail by 5 or More)"
entries.body:
Sir Baldric the Boastful

| **Drink Number** | **Difficulty (CON Save DC)** | **Effect on Fail**           |
| ---------------- | ---------------------------- | ---------------------------- |
| **1st Drink**    | **DC 10**                    | Just a warm-up 🍺            |
| **2nd Drink**    | **DC 12**                    | Feeling tipsy… 🤔            |
| **3rd Drink**    | **DC 14**                    | Words start slurring 😵‍💫   |
| **4th Drink**    | **DC 16**                    | Standing is an issue… 🚶‍♂️  |
| **5th Drink**    | **DC 18**                    | Blackout danger! 🌀          |
| **6th Drink+**   | **DC 20+**                   | Rolling with disadvantage 😵 |
### 🎭 Drunk Side Effects (Fail by 5 or More)

*Roll 1d8 when someone REALLY botches a drinking roll!*

| d8 Roll | Drunk Effect                                                                                                                                               |
| ------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **1**   | **"Oh gods, it's coming back up!"** – Roll **DC 12 Con Save** or vomit on someone nearby! 🤮                                                               |
| **2**   | **"Why is the room spinning?"** – Disadvantage on next ability check. 🌪️                                                                                  |
| **3**   | **"I LOVE YOU GUYS!"** – Must **hug** the nearest person (even if they don’t want it). 🤗                                                                  |
| **4**   | **"Did I just bet my pants?"** – Accidentally gamble **1d10 gold** on something stupid. 💰                                                                 |
| **5**   | **"This chair looks comfy!"** – Falls asleep mid-drink. **Miss next turn.** 😴                                                                             |
| **6**   | **"I CAN FIGHT A DRAGON!"** – Gains **temporary confidence**, tries to start a tavern brawl. 🐉                                                            |
| **7**   | **"I am THE Bard now!"** – Starts singing, horribly. Everyone within 10ft **rolls WIS save** or gets **-1 on next roll** from secondhand embarrassment. 🎶 |
| **8**   | **"Your FACE looks funny"** – Insult the biggest guy in the room.                                                                                          |
|         |                                                                                                                                                            |

entries.title: "**🛡️ Bandit Stats & Abilities (Easy Mode)**"
entries.body:
## **🛡️ Bandit Stats & Abilities (Easy Mode)**

### **🦴 Bandit Grunts (x6)**

💀 _"We outnumber 'em! That means we win, right?"_

- **HP:** 11
- **AC:** 11 (Leather Armor)
- **Speed:** 30 ft
- **Cowards – More likely to run than fight to the death.**

**⚔️ Attacks:**

- **Rusty Shortsword (Melee, +3 to hit)**
    - 1d6+1 **slashing**
- **Hand Crossbow (Ranged, +3 to hit, 30/120 ft)**
    - 1d6 **piercing**

**🔥 Special Abilities:**

- **Gang Up (Pack Tactics Lite)** – If attacking **with an ally**, they get **+1 to hit** (instead of full advantage).
- **"Wait, This Ain’t Worth It!" (1/Encounter)** – If **two bandits go down**, the others must make a **DC 10 Wisdom save or flee**.

---

### **🛠️ Bandit Bruisers (x3)**

💀 _"We’re the muscle! …Right?"_

- **HP:** 18
- **AC:** 13 (Cheap Chain Shirt)
- **Speed:** 30 ft

**⚔️ Attacks:**

- **Big Club (Melee, +4 to hit)**
    - 1d8+2 **bludgeoning**
- **Thrown Rock (Ranged, +3 to hit, 20/60 ft)**
    - 1d4+1 **bludgeoning** (yes, they throw rocks)

**🔥 Special Abilities:**

- **Intimidating Presence** – If a Bruiser **lands a hit**, the target must make a **DC 10 Charisma save or lose 5 ft of movement** next turn (_"Oh gods, he actually hit me!"_).
- **Not-So-Tough (1/Encounter)** – If a Bruiser drops to **5 HP or lower**, they **fake an injury & beg for their life**.

---

### **💀 Captain Jareth "Ironjaw" (Bandit Leader, Mini-Boss)**

💀 _"I don’t lose fights. I just… tactically retreat."_

- **HP:** 24
- **AC:** 14 (Worn Studded Leather)
- **Speed:** 30 ft

**⚔️ Attacks:**

- **Rusty Cutlass (Melee, +5 to hit)**
    - 1d8+2 **slashing**
- **Boot Knife (Bonus Action, +4 to hit, melee)**
    - 1d4+1 **piercing**

**🔥 Special Abilities:**

- **Parry (Reaction, 1/Turn)** – Can add **+2 AC against one melee attack.**
- **Coward’s Gambit (1/Encounter)** – If below **10 HP**, Jareth can **throw dirt in someone’s face (DC 12 Dex save or blinded for 1 turn) and attempt to flee.**
- **"Screw This, I’m Out!"** – If **four of his bandits die**, Jareth **runs for his life**.






### **📜 Final Battle: Knights of the Sun Goddess Kaya**

🔥 _"The Light Does Not Tolerate Shadows."_


---
Fanatic takes 4 necrotic and adds **2d6 fire** to next hit.

### **Chaos Pulse** _Bonus Action, 2/short rest_

Crackling crimson energy lashes in a 15-ft cone. Creatures in the area make a **DC 16 Dex save**.  
_Fail_: 4d6 force + pushed 10 ft & knocked prone.  
_Success_: Half damage, no push.

### **Smite of Unmaking** _Recharge 5–6_

After a hit, unleash a pulse of Rive: add **1d8 necrotic** and force the target to make a **DC 16 Con save** or **lose 1 spell slot (highest available)** or be **stunned** until the end of its next turn (non-casters automatically save).

### **Aura of Fraying Fate** (10-ft radius)

Creatures (including allies) that start their turn in the aura **roll d6**: on a **1** they suffer **1d6 psychic** damage; on a **6** they **gain 1d6 temp HP**. (Represents Krovi’s unpredictable blessing.)

### **Unyielding Chaos** _1/encounter_

When reduced to 0 HP, the Paladin explodes in Rive. All creatures within 15 ft take **4d6 force**, **DC 16 Dex half**. The Paladin then stands at **20 HP**, drops aura, and gains **advantage on all attacks** for one round. After that round he dies unless healed above 0.

### **🔥 Combat Strategy:**

1. **Knights Protect, Priest Attacks from Range.**
    
    - **Sun Knights stay near Aldric**, taking hits for him when necessary.
    - **Enforcers focus on flanking and breaking the party’s formation.**
2. **The Purge Begins.**
    
    - **Aldric uses his Divine Purge early** to deal **massive damage.**
    - **Enforcers use Sunlit Formation** to get advantage on rolls.
3. **Final Phase - The Last Stand.**
    
    - **If Aldric is below 20 HP,** he tries to **retreat into the chapel.**
    - **Sun Knights use Unyielding Light to keep fighting at 1 HP.**
    - **Enforcers go berserk, refusing to surrender.**

---

## **📜 Session Cliffhanger: What Happens After?**

🏆 **If the Party Wins:**

- **They stop the ritual.**
- **Do they take the anti-magic weapon? Destroy it? Or flee before reinforcements arrive?**

🔥 **If the Party Loses:**

- **Captured and taken before the High Cleric of the Sun Order.**
- Forced into a **moral test**—do they convert, or resist?
- **A new enemy watches from the shadows… someone even more powerful.**

Could be sold for **5 GP** or used as a trophy.) | --- ### 🔥 Loot from the Order of the Light Battle | **Enemy** | **Loot** | | ------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | **Sun Knights (x1, Elite Paladin of Kaya)** | - **Sunsteel Greatsword** (*Fine craftsmanship, sells for **50 GP** or reforged into a +1 weapon*)

- **Half Plate Armor** (*Usable, but covered in sun sigils—worth **40 GP** each or melted down*)

- **Golden Ritual Knife** (*Intricately crafted, but slightly stained. Worth **75 GP**, or might have a hidden purpose...*) | --- ### 📦 Bonus Loot: Hidden Items & Special Finds | **Item** | **Description** | | ----------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | **Priest Aldric’s Journal** | Details secret plans of the Order, hints at more "purification" sites and upcoming rituals. | | **Sun-Kissed Gemstone** | A smooth, radiant stone worth **150 GP**, reacts oddly when held near magic users. | | **Key to a Locked Sun Order Vault** | Could be important later… but where does it go? | | **A Map with Marked Locations** | Has **three** locations marked, possibly future "cleansing" sites? | --- ### 💰 What They Can Do with the Loot ✔ **Sell to merchants or black market contacts** ✔ **Keep Order of the Light gear to infiltrate their ranks** ✔ **Use the documents & maps to plan their next move** ✔ **Investigate the Sun-Kissed Gemstone—why does it react to magic?**

entries.body:
[[BOTTOMS UP!!!  Sess 2 K]]
[[Enemy Stats  Sess 2 K]]
[[LOOT!!!! Sess 2 K]]
[[The Merchant's Quest  Sess 2 K]]
[[THE TAVERN BRAWL  Sess 2 K]]
### Party travels back to tavern
- Ryan reads his book
- Others trudge back

### Arrival at tavern
- Go into tavern
- Bartender is pleased to see that party saved Penelope
- Celebration as Penelope runs into her mother's arms. 9
- Beers on the house!!!
- Party begins - party eats, bards play music, its lively
- More Cheers abrupt as a paladin captain and some lower ranked footmen come in cheering. They had successfully defended the North side of the town from a goblin attack. 
- More cheers

### Tavern brawl
- Brawll!!!! 

After the **bar brawl settles**, the shady merchant **Rudolph Halloway** approaches the party, glancing around as if being watched.

> _"You lot have proven you can handle yourselves. Ah yes, a paladin. Lower rank.... I have a job. A simple delivery—no questions asked."_

### **🧳 The Mission**

- **Deliver a sealed, iron-bound chest** to a **priest of the Sun Goddess Kaya** in a village called **Hollowbrook**—a **small, forgotten farming town** to the east.
- **50 gold upfront**, 200 gold upon return with confirmation from the priest.
- Come meet me behind the tavern tomorrow an hour before dusk. 
He speaks to ryan the most. 

FREE TIME! - long rest until the next and and the morning people can do stuff. 
- Brady will go to the black market to buy food for his egg
- Ryan will preform the ritual
- Others will do other things - [[Free Time Activities]]



- The NEXT DAY:
- **Do NOT open the chest.**
- **Speak to NO ONE in Hollowbrook** except for **the priest**.
- **Leave immediately after delivery.**
- 

💰 **Payment:**

- **50 gold upfront**, 200 gold upon return with confirmation from the priest.

entries.title: "**📜 Scene 1: The Job Offer (Right After the Brawl)**"
entries.summary: ## **📜 Scene 1: The Job Offer (Right After the Brawl)**
entries.body:
## **📜 Scene 1: The Job Offer (Right After the Brawl)**

After the **bar brawl settles**, the shady merchant **Rudolph Halloway** approaches the party, glancing around as if being watched.

> _"You lot have proven you can handle yourselves. Ah yes, a paladin. Lower rank.... I have a job. A simple delivery—no questions asked."_

### **🧳 The Mission**

- **Deliver a sealed, iron-bound chest** to a **priest of the Sun Goddess Kaya** in a village called **Hollowbrook**—a **small, forgotten farming town** to the east.
- **Do NOT open the chest.**
- **Speak to NO ONE in Hollowbrook** except for **the priest**.
- **Leave immediately after delivery.**

💰 **Payment:**

- **50 gold upfront**, 200 gold upon return with confirmation from the priest.

THE BOX IMAGE


🎭 **The Catch (Early Clues Something is Off)**

- The **box hums slightly**, as if **pulsing with restrained energy**.
- Silver’s **Genie Patron whispers**: _"You deliver a curse, not a gift."_
- Esil’s **dragon magic senses** feel a **void of power inside**, something that is **anti-magic in nature**.
- 🍎π’s **druid senses tingle**—the land itself seems to reject whatever is inside.
- Eldrin’s **rabbits sniff the box and immediately hide.**

💬 **Player Choices Before Leaving**

- **Try to Investigate the Box?**
    - It’s **warded**—breaking the lock might **trigger a backlash**.
- **Question Rudolph?**
    - He refuses to answer. He was **paid to hire couriers, not to ask questions.**
- **Turn Down the Job?**
    - If they refuse, **Rudolph finds another group**—but that might mean they need to **stop them later.**

---

## **📜 Scene 2: The Journey to Hollowbrook (Building Suspense)**

The **journey takes several hours**—Hollowbrook is **isolated** and far from any major cities. The roads are **unpatrolled**, and the land grows **barren** as they travel.

### **🛤️ Travel Events (Slowly Building the Horror)**

Choose **1-2 minor events** before they arrive:

1️⃣ **The Withered Tree** 🌳⚫

- A **massive, dead tree** stands by the roadside, split down the middle.
- **Scorched symbols** of the Sun Goddess **burned into the bark**.

2️⃣ **The Empty Shrine** ⛪

- A small **abandoned shrine to Kaya** sits **crumbling** along the road.
- Offerings of **withered crops** and **rusted coins** lie untouched.
- If **inspected**, players see **script scratched into the stone:**
    > _"The Light does not save. It takes."_

### Sneak attack!!! - Bandits

A small bandit warband blocks the road, hiding in the trees and behind rocks. Their leader, Captain Jareth "Ironjaw", steps forward, cracking his knuckles.

"We ain't here for trouble. Just hand over that fancy-lookin’ chest and all the gold in your pockets, and we won’t have to get messy."

Bandit encounter

---

## **📜 Scene 3: Arrival at Hollowbrook (Something Is Very Wrong)**

The party reaches **Hollowbrook at dusk**.

🎭 **What They See:**

- A **small, struggling village**—**hungry children**, **thin farmers**, **crumbling homes**.
- The **crops are failing**, the **soil is dry**, and the **people are weary**.
- Yet **looming over the town** is a **pristine golden chapel**, **far too grand** for such a poor village.
- **At the center of the village square** stands a **massive Sun Sigil**—newly placed, its **edges still glowing from divine magic.**

💬 **Reactions from the Villagers:**

- **The people are silent, afraid.**
- If the party **tries to speak to them**, the villagers **shake their heads and walk away**.
- **A mother clutches her child tightly**, avoiding eye contact.
- **One elderly man whispers:**
    
    > _"They say it will purify us… "_
    

---

## **📜 Scene 4: The Priest & The Trap**

Waiting for them is **Priest Aldric**, a **devout cleric of Kaya**.

**👤 Priest Aldric (Human, Cleric of the Sun)**

- **Golden robes**, **sun-etched gauntlets**, a **staff of white oak**.
- **Eyes that gleam too bright**—as if **he sees nothing but faith**.
- Two **massive Sun Knights** flank him, their armor **gleaming unnaturally**.

💬 **Aldric’s Greeting:**

> _"You have done well, children of the Light. The Goddess Kaya smiles upon you."_  
> _"Place the chest before me. Your service is complete."_

🎭 **The Final Clue That Something is Wrong:**

- **As the players set the chest down, villagers begin gathering, whispering in fear.**
- **A child begins to cry.**
- **The priest does not acknowledge them.**

💬 **A Villager Breaks & Shouts:**

> _"IT’S A LIE! THEY’RE GOING TO WIPE US OUT!"_

🚨 **At this moment, the party has a choice.**

### **🛠️ Player Choices (Final Moral Dilemma)**

1️⃣ **Hand Over the Box (The Bomb Will Detonate)**

- The **priest will activate the device**, and the villagers **begin to scream**.
- **Magic-users and "impure" people** will begin to **wither away**, their **souls absorbed**.
- **The party will witness a massacre.**
- The Order **will reward them.**
- **Silver’s Genie laughs.**

2️⃣ **Refuse & Flee (Hunted by the Order)**

- The **Sun Knights will draw their weapons**, preparing to **kill them for betrayal**.
- The **priest will call them heretics**, shouting for reinforcements.
- **If they escape**, they are now **wanted by the Order of the Light.**

3️⃣ **Fight the Priest & the Sun Knights (Boss Battle Begins!)**

- The **priest tries to activate the weapon mid-combat.**
- **Two elite Sun Knights stand in the way.**

---

## **📜 Final Battle: Knights of the Sun Goddess Kaya**

| Enemy                                       | HP  | AC  | Attack                             |
| ------------------------------------------- | --- | --- | ---------------------------------- |
| **Sun Knights (x1, Elite Paladins)**        | 45  | 18  | **Greatsword +6 (2d6+3 radiant)**  |
| **Sunlight Enforcers (x4, Lesser Knights)** | 28  | 16  | **Longsword +4 (1d8+2 slashing)**  |
| **Priest Aldric (Cleric Leader)**           | 50  | 14  | **Radiant Smite +6 (4d8 radiant)** |

📜 **Special Abilities:**

- **Sun Knight’s Devotion:** **Once per fight**, a knight can **block an attack for the priest**.
- **Divine Purge (Priest Aldric, Once Per Fight):** Calls down a **pillar of burning light (DC 14 Dex, 4d8 radiant)**.

---

## **📜 Session Cliffhanger: The Order Knows Their Names**

If they **save the town**, they are **now hunted heretics**.  
If they **help the Order**, they **become its pawns**.

🚀 **What Comes Next?**

- **Does the party fight against the Order, or infiltrate it?**
- **Where will they run next? Who else might help them?**
- **What other "purification projects" is the Order hiding?**

🔥 **Let me know if you want to tweak anything!** 🚀
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/Campaign Krovi/Session Plans/Session 3/The Merchant's Quest  Sess 2 K.md

entries.title: "**🔹 Scene 1: Setting the Stage**"
entries.summary: Tavern Brawl --> Hired for a heist
entries.body:
Tavern Brawl --> Hired for a heist

### **🔹 Scene 1: Setting the Stage**

Start with a lively description:

> _The Elverdeen Tavern is more crowded than usual. The air is thick with the scent of roasted meat and spilled ale, and the walls shake with laughter and drunken shouts. A bard strums a hurried melody on his lute, trying to keep up with the chaos._ The people are celebrating that the goblin attack was fended off in the north while the party had saved the child Penelope in the meantime. 


### **🔹 Scene 2: The Trouble Begins**

While the party is enjoying their drinks, **two separate things start stirring up trouble:**

1️⃣ **The Drunken Knight Challenge** 💪

- A **large, drunken knight**, Sir Baldric the Boastful, is **challenging people to arm wrestling bets.**
- He loudly declares:
    
    > _"None in this tavern has the strength of a TRUE warrior! Prove me wrong, if you dare!"_
    > I will drink more then ANYONE HERE! I bet 20 SILVER ON THAT!
    
- 🍎π **(or another strong character) might be tempted to challenge him.**
- **Betting gets involved.** If they **win**, they earn gold and respect. If they **lose**, Baldric mocks them mercilessly.

2️⃣ **The Gnome Hat Dispute** 🏴‍☠️

- Another **Forest Gnome**, **Grizzle “the Hat Lord”**, enters the tavern.
- He has a **massive, ridiculous hat collection**—and immediately **locks eyes with Diangelo** (Marco’s rogue).
- > _"I see ye be wearin' a _fine_ piece of headwear, lad... but ye be standin’ in MY domain!"_
    
- **This leads to a standoff.** Does Diangelo **fight** for his honor, or try to **steal** from Grizzle instead?

### **🔹 Scene 3: The Bar Fight Breaks Out** 🍺

### **🎭 How the Dispute Starts**

- **Grizzle sees Diangelo** (Marco’s rogue) and **gasps** dramatically.
    
- He **stomps forward, slamming a tiny gnome fist on the table**:
    
    > _"Oi! That hat! That is a RARE specimen! You don’t deserve to wear that! Trade me, or I shall reclaim it in the name of the Hat Lords!"_
    
- If Diangelo **refuses**, the **brawl will begin immediately**.
    
- If Diangelo **agrees**, Grizzle **will still try to cheat him**.


- Someone **throws the first punch** (maybe Sir Baldric, maybe Grizzle’s goons).
- The **bartender slams his fist on the counter** and shouts:
    
    > _"NO KILLING—BUT EVERYTHING ELSE GOES!"_
    
- A full **barroom brawl begins!**

**🏴 Rules of the Fight:**

- **No weapons, just fists, chairs, and good old-fashioned wrestling.**
- If a player **wants to cheat**, the bartender **WILL notice** (and hold a grudge).
- 🍎π **or anyone gambling loses some gold if they get knocked out early.**

🛠️ **How It Ends:**

- The fight **settles down** when a **mysterious figure** enters the tavern.
- The **real job** of the night is about to begin…

### FIGHTERS
### **🥊 Sir Baldric the Boastful (Drunken Knight)**

- **HP:** 28 | **AC:** 15 (Chainmail)
- **STRONG BUT SLOW**
- **Attacks:**
    - **Drunken Swing** (Melee): +5 to hit, 1d6+3 bludgeoning (fist)
    - **Table Slam (Once per fight):** Uses a whole wooden **table** as a weapon (1d8+4 damage).
- **Special:** **Too Drunk to Fall Over** – If reduced to 0 HP, makes a **DC 12 Con save** to stay standing with 1 HP.

---

### **🛠️ Big Sven (Blacksmith & Tavern Bouncer)**

- **HP:** 22 | **AC:** 13
- **A tower of muscle, but a fair fighter.**
- **Attacks:**
    - **Hammer Fist:** +4 to hit, 1d6+2
    - **Grab & Throw:** Can attempt a **Grapple (DC 14 Str check)**—throws opponent into a table.

---

### **🐀 Grizzle "The Hat Lord" (Gnome Thief)**

- **HP:** 14 | **AC:** 12
- **Fast & Sneaky**
- **Attacks:**
    - **Hat Toss (Ranged):** +4 to hit, 1d4 damage (a thrown hat).
    - **Dirty Trick:** Once per fight, can **blind** an enemy for one turn with **pocket sand**.
- **Special:** **"The Chicken Hat Defense"** – If hit, his **chicken hat will peck back** (1 damage).

---

### **💪🍎π (Isaac’s Character) - (If He Joins the Brawl)**

- **Strength-Based Fighter – Might Challenge Sir Baldric to a Test of Strength**
- **Gambling on Fights – Might Lose Money or Make a Fortune**

---

### **💀 Mysterious Spectator (Foreshadowing)**

- A **cloaked figure** sits in the **corner**, watching the brawl.
- He **does not fight**

---

## **🛠️ Running the Bar Fight**

**Rules:**

- **No lethal weapons** (fists, chairs, and mugs allowed).
- **First to drop to 0 HP is out.**
- **Creativity is encouraged!** (Swing from chandeliers, break tables, use kegs as cover.)
- **Tavern Owner will throw someone out if things get TOO crazy.**

**How It Ends:**

- **After 3-4 rounds**, the **Merchant arrives**, offering the **real job** (leading to Option 3).
- **Whoever wins the brawl gets free drinks and some gold.**
- **Grizzle either loses a hat or gains one from Diangelo.**

---

## **🔥 Extra Chaos Options**

- 🍺 **A drunk dwarf starts singing a horrible song, making all Charisma checks harder.**
- 🎯 **A dart from a side game lands in someone's shoulder by accident.**
- 🐰 **Eldrin's rabbits get loose, causing even more chaos.**
- 📦 **A random NPC gets thrown into a pile of barrels, knocking over supplies.**

---

## **⏳ Transition to the Heist / Escort Job**

Once the fight **settles down**, Rudolph Halloway (the merchant) steps in:

> _"Well… that was certainly entertaining. But if you lot are looking for **real money**… I have a job for you."_

🎲 **Now the party moves into Option 3!** 🎲
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/Campaign Krovi/Session Plans/Session 3/THE TAVERN BRAWL  Sess 2 K.md

entries.title: "👻 **Naivessa, the Mourning Ember**"
entries.body:
## 👻 **Naivessa, the Mourning Ember**

> _“I burned it all to forget… but the fire remembered.”_

### **Appearance:**

A floating figure of cracked porcelain and drifting silk, wrapped in flickering blue fire that **glows only when no one is looking directly at it**. Her face has no mouth, but tears of glass fall endlessly from empty eye sockets and shatter when they hit the ground, releasing bursts of cold.

---

### **Stat Block – Custom Spirit (CR ~4-6)**

**Naivessa, Mourning Ember**  
_Medium Undead (Spirit) – Neutral Sad_

- **AC:** 16 (Ethereal Body)
    
- **HP:** 85
    
- **Speed:** 0 ft. (floats 30 ft.)
    
- **Resistances:** Fire, Cold, Necrotic, Nonmagical Weapons
    
- **Condition Immunities:** Prone, Charmed, Frightened
    
- **Vulnerabilities:** Radiant, Being Remembered
    
- **Saves:** Wisdom +6, Charisma +5
    
- **Passive Perception:** 15
    

---

### 🕯️ **Abilities**

#### 🌫️ _Aura of Quiet Grief (30 ft aura)_

Creatures within the aura must make a **DC 15 Charisma save** at the start of their turn. On a fail, they are overwhelmed by sadness and have **disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws** until the start of their next turn.  
If they speak during this state, **they involuntarily share a memory they regret.**

---

#### 💧 _Glass Tears (Recharge 5–6)_

Naivessa launches **3 glass tear-shards** at up to 3 creatures.

- +6 to hit, 2d8 psychic damage each.
    
- On a hit, the target hears a **voice from their past** and must make a **DC 14 Wisdom save** or be **unable to willingly move closer to Naivessa** for 1 minute.
    

---

#### 🔥 _Kindled Memory_

When she drops below half HP, her cracked porcelain exterior **shatters**, revealing a body of blue flame and emotional energy.

- Her aura becomes **visible and burning**.
    
- She gains a reaction: **Flicker of Sadness** – When targeted by an attack, she may **force the attacker to see themselves through her eyes** (DC 14 Wisdom save or lose the attack and be stunned for 1 turn).
    

---

#### 🔄 _Ember of What Was_

Once per encounter, if a creature within 60 ft **recalls a personal memory aloud**, Naivessa **listens** and **mirrors the emotion** back:

- If it's **sad**, she becomes pacified for 1 round, and all her attacks deal **radiant instead of psychic/fire** (she burns with hope).
    
- If it's **angry or violent**, she **splits into 2 shadow clones** (10 HP each) that mimic basic attacks and speak in the voice of the player.
    

---

### 👣 **Legendary Action (1/Day): "Funeral Pyre"**

At the end of any round where she is below 20 HP, Naivessa **screams silently**, unleashing a 30-ft pulse of weeping fire.  
Each creature must make a **DC 16 Charisma save** or:

- Take **4d10 fire + 2d10 psychic damage**
    
- Drop anything they’re holding
    
- Be **silenced** (cannot speak, cast spells with verbal components) for 1 round
    

Those who pass still take half damage and feel **numb to joy** for 1 minute—any healing they receive is halved.

---

## 🕯️ Optional Roleplay Interaction:

- If a character carries **a token of grief** (a locket, memorial, letter), Naivessa pauses and whispers its name.
    
- If the party comforts her, she may **grant them a fragment of her fire**, a passive aura that **prevents charm effects** by "burning away false emotions."

entries.title: "📍 **Location:** Marrow Hollow – **The Village That Grieved Itself to Death**"
entries.summary: ###  📍 **Location:** Marrow Hollow – **The Village That Grieved Itself to Death**
entries.body:
###  📍 **Location:** Marrow Hollow – **The Village That Grieved Itself to Death**

Once a modest farming village known for its festival of lights, **Marrow Hollow** is now abandoned. Homes are intact. Meals left half-eaten. Chairs still warm near the hearths. **But no one is here.** And the **air is heavy**—like something is pressing down on the soul.

| **Quest Name**                    | **Description**                                                                                         | **Location**                     | **Encounter Details**                                                                                                                                           |
| --------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **🕯️ Candlelight in the Hollow** | Villagers report **ghostly lights** dancing in **Marrow Hollow**, a sunken glade avoided since the war. | Marrow Hollow, East of Elverdeen | **1 Wispbound Spirit**, **2-3 Hollow Shades**, and a mysterious **flickering crystal flame**. Emotional or magical responses may alter the encounter's outcome. |
|                                   |                                                                                                         |                                  |                                                                                                                                                                 |

---

## 🔦 Area Description:

Marrow Hollow is a steep, overgrown glade where **no birds sing and no wind stirs**. At its center lies a crumbled shrine, half-swallowed by the earth. At night, glowing lights drift just above the grass—flickering like candle flames, never touching anything, never casting shadows.

A constant **feeling of grief** hangs in the air, growing stronger the longer one lingers.

---

## 🕵️ Hidden Story: _The Forgotten Flame_

During the final days of the war, a **young Elkin named Naivessa** tried to **purge her emotions** to create a perfect Seraphite crystal. She failed, instead producing a **blazing Sentari of sorrow**, unstable and radiant. Rather than destroy it, she sealed it inside the shrine and let herself die to keep it from falling into the wrong hands.

Now, her **sorrow lingers**, bound to the flame. The lights seen at night are **her unspent memories**, searching for someone who will listen.

- If a player **comforts the spirit**, they may glimpse **her final vision**—a burning battlefield, a lost friend, and the moment her magic failed.
    
- If they **ignite the Sentari**, it pulses with **raw Rive energy**, attracting **emotion-hungry creatures**.
    
- If they **calm the flame** using Seraphite or a focused memory, the shrine is purified and a **Blessing of Clarity** is granted.
    

---

## 🦴 Enemies:

- **Wispbound Spirit (Naivessa's Echo)** – AC 15, HP 65, Emotional Drain (DC 15 Wis save or lose a prepared spell), **Weeps Flames** (3d6 Fire, reflavored radiant if calmed), Phases into trees, immune to nonmagical weapons.
    
- **Hollow Shades (x2–3)** – AC 13, HP 30, Soul Slash (1d10 Psychic), **Mirror Grief** (DC 14 Cha save or be overwhelmed with memories for 1 turn, stunned).
    
- **Sentari Ember (Optional Trigger)** – A living flame, crackling with unstable Rive energy (acts on initiative 20, unleashing emotional pulses each round unless stabilized).
    

---

## 🧪 Unique Effects & Mechanics:

- Standing within the shrine causes players to **recall suppressed memories** (DM choice or player backstory).
    
- Speaking truthfully about those memories can **weaken or pacify the spirit**.
    
- Casting a spell using an **emotional focus** (e.g., a letter, locket, or memory) allows advantage on spell attack rolls for 1 turn.
    

---

## 🎲 Possible Trinkets:

- **Naivessa's Weeping Sigil** – A teardrop-shaped pendant that grants **advantage on Insight checks**, but once per long rest, forces a DC 13 Wis save or become emotionally overwhelmed for a turn when near tragedy.
    
- **Cracked Sentari Flame** – A shard of volatile emotion magic. **Glows brighter near undead**. Can be used to **light magical rituals**, adding a random emotional effect.
    
- **Shrine-Root Band** – A ring of woven roots grown around old stone. Grants **resistance to being frightened** and once per long rest, lets you cast _Calm Emotions_.
    
- **Lantern of Memory** – When lit, this lantern **reveals any spirits or magical auras** within 30 ft. for 1 minute. The flame cannot be extinguished by wind or water.
    

---

## 🍴 Consumables:

- **Seraphite Dust Tea** – Calms the drinker, removing **one level of exhaustion** and granting **+1 Wisdom for 10 minutes**, but **prevents rage or other emotion-based abilities** during this time.
    
- **Ember-Crusted Berry** – Eating it floods the user with raw grief, allowing them to **reroll a failed saving throw**, but they are **unable to take reactions** for 1 minute.
    
- **Gladewater Flask** – Water from the roots beneath Marrow Hollow. Restores **2d6 HP** and **removes fear**, but causes **vivid dreams** that night.

entries.title: "🌫️ **Pre-Encounter Clues & Interactions** _(before Naivessa manifests)_"
entries.body:
### 🌫️ **Pre-Encounter Clues & Interactions** _(before Naivessa manifests)_

#### 🕯️ 1. **Drifting Candles** (Perception DC 13)

- Unlit candles sit in every window. Some begin to light **spontaneously** as the players enter—**with cold, blue flame.**
    
- If lit by a player, the candle **doesn't burn**—but **whispers a single word** from a villager’s memory: _“Alira”_, _“Don’t leave”_, _“Please”_.
    

#### 📖 2. **Diary in the Schoolhouse** (Investigation DC 14)

- Belongs to a young teacher who wrote of her **struggle to keep the children hopeful**.
    
- Last entry: _“Naivessa said the flame would help us forget. But it only made us remember harder.”_
    
- Flipping through the pages causes a player to hear **children laughing**, followed by sudden silence.
    

#### 🎭 3. **Fallen Masks from the Festival of Light** (Scattered)

- Locals wore **emotion-themed masks** during their festival: joy, sorrow, anger.
    
- Every mask in the village is **cracked**, except one: **a smiling mask**, hidden under a collapsed house beam.
    
- Wearing it grants **advantage on saving throws against sadness effects**—but the wearer **can’t speak** until removed.
    

#### 🪞 4. **The Wishing Basin** (Center of Town)

- A stone basin filled with stagnant water.
    
- If a player looks in, they see **a reflection of themselves from a memory they’ve forgotten.**
    
- If they **touch the water**, they hear **Naivessa’s voice**:
    

> _“They begged me to make it stop. I only meant to quiet the fire. Not... extinguish it.”_

#### 🧵 5. **Thread of Regret (Weaver’s Hut)**

- A spool of silvery thread lies untouched on a loom.
    
- If touched, the player hears **a woman softly weeping**, then sees **visions of her weaving names into blankets**—names that fade as she cries.
    
- Taking the thread causes a subtle **telepathic link with Naivessa**, which may later allow peaceful communication.

entries.title: "(The Knight of Kaya)"
entries.body:
---

---
![[knight of kaya.jpg]]

Alternate version of [[Ryan (Esil Dei Krovi)]]

Is a mix between dragonborn and Astral elf
parents are
- [[Mira Quickfang (Tristan)]]
- [[Tristan (Silver)]]

The one gifted by the sun - many thousands of years old - or may just be alternate E
The one Ryan saw do draconic magic in a memory
Comes from the land where the sky and land is a beautiful red.  [[The Red Plains]]


Lived for many years, since the wars. They came to be as the child of the battle of the gods. After the two gods fought and died, causing a large part of land to turn into the red plains, eradicating all life on that side of the continent, all the lifeforce concentrated into a child that was in a small village that was obliterated by the fight. This made the child immortal, gaining the blessing of the sun god herself. 

15 years from present, the dwarves were attacked. The kingdom held many magical items that were unholy. They vanished, either taken or went into the void. At the same time, Esil's mom vanished, taken by a portal. Her husband and daughter watched her get consumed and taken away. 


- **Title**: The One Gifted by the Sun
    
- **Age**: around 30

- **Notable Sightings**: Ryan saw them using draconic magic in a vision - light magic (time altering vision)
	
- Appearance: Red hair. Some say she is a ugly wicked skinny witch. Some say she enchants those who see her with her beauty. 
    
- **Origin**: [[The Red Plains]] – a land where sky and land are permanently stained red from the battle of the gods.
    
- **Backstory**:
    
    - The child of the battle between the old gods [[Krovi]] and [[Kaya]]
        
    - When the gods clashed, their destruction turned a vast region into _The Red Plains_, wiping out all life.
        
    - A lone child from a destroyed village absorbed the lifeforce of the battle, making them immortal and granting the blessing of Kaya.

	- A ring was enchanted by the powers of Krovi and was picked up by the child. 
        
    - The King of the Elves found the child and took them in, but treated them as a weapon rather than a person.
        
    - Used in war, the Knight of Kaya led the elves to victory, but at the cost of unimaginable bloodshed.
        
    - After the war, they vanished, seeking peace, but remain feared and hated. Some of the elves though the Knight gave many false hope, causing them to fling themselves into battle, and other races call them the "Witch of the Sun," fearing their overwhelming power.
        
- **Significance in Recent Events**:
    
    - 15 years ago, the dwarves were attacked, and their sacred magical artifacts vanished—either stolen or consumed by the void.
        
    - Esil’s mother was taken by a portal at the same time, with her husband and daughter witnessing the event. Esil doesn't remember.
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/GODS and Magic Orgins/Kaya/(The Knight of Kaya).md

entries.title: "**Kaya** (Order, Illumination, Unity)"
entries.summary:
Sister of [[Krovi]]
One of the great old dragon gods of this land. All light magic comes from this being. 
#### **Kaya** (Order, Illumination, Unity)
entries.body:
Sister of [[Krovi]]
One of the great old dragon gods of this land. All light magic comes from this being. 
#### **Kaya** (Order, Illumination, Unity)

- **Status**: Deceased
    
- **Domain**: Light, Immortality, Order
	
- Color theme: White

- Tenets:** Harmony through control, mercy through justice
    
- **Legacy**:
    
    - Their death in battle with _Krovi_ created _The Red Plains_.


## Kaya's evil

- Purification of emotions

entries.title: "📘 Seraphite Effects Table"
entries.summary: This is [[Kaya]]'s physical form of emotions
entries.body:
This is [[Kaya]]'s physical form of emotions

> _"The Silence of the Soul"_

- **Origin:** Extracted emotion through **Kaya’s purification methods**
    
- **Form:** Pale crystal, faintly glowing, smooth and sterile
    
- **Color:** Silver-blue, glasslike sheen
    
- **Use:**
    
    - Used in emotionless enchantments, divine suppressants, loyalty collars
        
    - Commonly embedded in **priest relics, emotion dampeners, and mind shields**
        
- **Vibe:** Feels cold to the touch. Holding it makes one’s thoughts quieter.
    

---


Volitile but under influence of exact manufacturing process, can be used in amazing ways - 


### 📘 Seraphite Effects Table

_Purified emotion, crystallized through controlled separation. Refined, stable, sacred._

#### Seraphite Table (Emotion Refinement via Seraphite)

|                           |                                          |                                                    |                                                  |                                                   |                                             |                                                  |                                                       |
| ------------------------- | ---------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------- |
| Emotion (Crystal Name)    | Flicker                                  | Pulse                                              | Surge                                            | Crest                                             | General Use                                 | Side Effect                                      | Physical Changes / Description                        |
| **Joy (Gleamstone)**      | Calm glow; suppress fear/rage for 1 turn | Auto-pass one wisdom save                          | +2 to all allies’ checks for 1 minute            | Freeze time for 6 seconds                         | Burned in noble incense for peace           | Emotional dullness for 1 hour                    | Skin glows warmly; laughter echoes faintly in aura    |
| **Rage (Blazegem)**       | +1 arcana/perception                     | Nullify one emotional effect                       | Suppress emotion in area                         | Cast any spell, no components                     | Used to calm berserkers in battle           | Temporary numbness in arms/hands                 | Eyes flicker orange; aura flicks like heatwaves       |
| **Sorrow (Griefglass)**   | Ignore 1 level of exhaustion             | Immune to psychic dmg for 1 round                  | Immune to charm, fear, grief                     | Remove all conditions from allies in 20 ft        | Placed in grief temples                     | User unable to cry or empathize for a day        | Mist trails from feet; eyes dull, colorless           |
| **Fear (Tremorite)**      | +1 saving throw for 1 round              | Remove frightened condition                        | Silence mind effects                             | Restore 1 memory or gain knowledge                | Used in memory temples & research labs      | Possible resurfacing of traumatic memories       | Shadow under eyes deepens; cold aura repels animals   |
| **Love (Heartsong)**      | Resist charm/fear 1 turn                 | Ally immune to fear 1 round                        | Block emotional magic in 30 ft                   | Dispel all magic in 30 ft                         | Used in diplomacy and sacred rites          | Brief emotional detachment from loved ones       | Pupils heart-shaped, faint rose tint around body      |
| **Ambition (Vaultflame)** | +1 concentration/will saves              | +2 to planning/strategy checks                     | Cast spell silently                              | Immune to control/psychic effects for 1 min       | Used in high-tier mage circles              | May forget basic needs (eat, sleep) for hours    | Glyphs glow beneath skin like blue circuitry          |
| **Envy (Shadecryst)**     | Detect who envies you nearby             | Mask presence; invisible to those who covet you    | Hex target with envy-driven rot                  | Dominate creature of similar ability for 1 minute | Used by spies to disrupt court politics     | User sees others as rivals; becomes mistrustful  | Skin turns faintly greenish; eyes become slit-pupiled |
| **Hope (Luminarite)**     | Flicker of light; illuminate illusions   | Bolster courage; gain +1 to saves for 1 hour       | Restore lost will; end charm/fear/mental control | Heal and revive all allies below 50% HP           | Carried by resistance leaders in dark times | User may become irrationally optimistic          | Eyes glow pale blue; sparkles drift from fingertips   |
| **Disgust (Filthstone)**  | Resilience to poison or corruption       | Create a toxic barrier; enemies hesitate to attack | Dissolve falsehoods; dispel illusions in 30 ft   | Strip glamours, disguises, illusions              | Wielded by purifiers and heretic hunters    | User develops phobia of purity, beauty, or touch | Skin flakes at fingertips; foul aura lingers in air   |

entries.title: "**Krovi** (Darkness, sacrifice, and chaos)"
entries.summary:
Brother of [[Kaya]]
One of the great old dragon gods of this land.
entries.body:
Brother of [[Kaya]]
One of the great old dragon gods of this land. 

#### **Krovi** (Darkness, sacrifice, and chaos)

- **Status**: Deceased, but could be revived
    
- **Domain**: Shadows, Sacrifice, Blood Magic
	
- Color theme: Black and purple/red

- **Tenets:** Growth through pain, freedom through deception
    
- **Legacy**:
    
    - Their essence lingers in forbidden texts, such as [[The tome (Ryan) - First Page]].
        
    - The Genie aims to resurrect Krovi, triggering an apocalyptic shift in the world's balance.

**Elvar’din (Krovi World)** – Broken ruins run by whispers and shadow guilds, where truths are paid for in blood.


## Krovi's evil

- Uncontrollable emotions - takes your over

entries.title: "🔥 ** Rive**"
entries.body:
### 🔥 ** Rive** [[Krovi]]'s version of physical emotion [[Alchemy]] > _"The Burn of Being"_ - **Origin:** Surge emotion harvested at its peak—through release, overload, or catharsis - **Form:** Vials of liquid fire, unstable and pulsating - **Color:** Ever-shifting (depends on the emotion) – e.g. red for wrath, violet for grief - **Use:** - Powers spells of passion, rage, chaos, or desire - Infused into weapons and artifacts with **raw, volatile emotional magic** - Risk of backlash—**emotional overload or loss of control** - **Vibe:** Holding it stirs something deep—can trigger memories or feelings ### 📕 Rive Effects Table _Raw, unstable emotion surges crystallized during moments of overload. Powerful but often damaging._ #### Rive Table (Emotion Enhancement via Rive) | Emotion (Crystal Name) | Flicker | Pulse | Surge | Crest | General Use | Side Effect | Physical Changes / Description | | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------- | | **Joy (Gleamstone)**
Bright golden-yellow | Smile uncontrollably; next charisma check has advantage | Echoing laughter; charm one nearby NPC for 1 minute | Blinding euphoria; next spell/attack has max effect | Radiant burst of joy; allies heal 2d10 in 10 ft | Nobles smoke Gleamstone shards as a stimulant | User suffers melancholy for 1 hour after use | Eyes shimmer like prisms, faint golden aura surrounds user | | **Rage (Blazegem)**
Deep Crimson Red | Veins glow; melee attacks deal +1 dmg for 1 turn | Muscle tremors; light rage (+2 dmg) | Ferocious roar; enemies frightened 1 round | Unstoppable fury; +4 to attacks/saves for 1 min | Gladiators burn Blazegem into blades | 1 level of exhaustion after effect ends | Eyes glow red, muscles swell, voice deepens | | **Sorrow (Griefglass)**
blue-violet | Eyes well; +2 insight, disadvantage on charisma | Crying fits; enemies -1 attack rolls | Wailing scream; psychic damage in 10 ft | Grief wave; stun all in 15 ft | Artists consume for creative visions | Cannot speak coherently for 10 minutes | Black tear streaks, pale skin, visible cold breath even in warmth | | **Fear (Tremorite)**
ashen gray | Jittery reflexes; +2 initiative | Detect hidden creatures nearby | Teleport 10 ft on danger | Cast _Fear_ free | Spies inject for reaction speed | User is paranoid for 1 hour, thinks being followed | Eyes dilate, breath rapid, sweat beads form instantly | | **Love (Heartsong)**
rosy pink | Nostalgic warmth; resist charm 1 turn | Aura of protection; ally +1 AC | Absorb damage for ally once | Revive ally at 1 HP | Used in empathy rituals, weddings | Emotionally dependent on target for 1 day | Subtle pink glow from chest, heartbeat audible nearby | | **Ambition (Vaultflame)**
fiery orange | +2 to next ability check | Auto-succeed investigation roll | Take an extra action | Craft magical item/solution instantly | Alchemists burn Vaultflame for breakthroughs | Compulsive overworking, risk of obsession | One eye glows gold; arcane symbols flicker on skin | | **Envy (Shadecryst)**
acid green | Sharp glance; gain +1 to deception | Imitate enemy action once in combat | Copy spell or attack that hit you last | Steal enemy’s highest stat for 1 min | Assassins embed Shadecryst to mimic targets | User feels inferior for 1 day, even when succeeding | One eye turns silver-green; shadow lingers behind movement | | **Hope (Luminarite)**
sky blue | Brief clarity; reroll failed insight or perception | Shield an ally from despair; they gain temp HP | Group-wide morale boost; all allies gain +1 to rolls | Radiant beacon; all allies immune to fear & charm 1 min | Carried by rebels and freedom fighters | Crashes user into hopelessness after effect ends | Soft white glow outlines limbs; flower-like patterns appear on skin | | **Disgust (Filthstone)**
green-brown | Repel weak-minded enemy; they are repulsed for 1 turn | Acidic aura; attackers take 1 dmg | Vomit bile of rejection; forces Con save or debuff | Blight burst; enemies lose buffs and take psychic damage | Used by nihilist cults to remove illusions of purity | User smells unbearable and can't be approached | Skin becomes grey-veined, breath leaves visible green mist | | 🧪 **Nostalgia Rive**
Dusty amber with flickering flecks of gold and gray | Effect: Brief flash of a forgotten moment

Side Effect: User becomes confused for 1 minute, unsure if it was a dream or real | Side Effect: You misattribute someone else's voice or face to someone you know (disadvantage on Insight checks for 10 min) | Side Effect: Forget a current memory — DM chooses one recent event or face you lose until long rest | gain full knowledge of a long-lost secret | Old people wanting to relive their youth | | |

entries.title: "Alchemist’s Quick Cheat‑Sheet"
entries.body:
## Alchemist’s Quick Cheat‑Sheet

- **R digit (0‑9)** decides the **emotion family**; any level can brew any family.
    
- **E digit (0‑9)** is the **minimum character level** required to brew that recipe.  
    _E 0‑1 ≈ cantrip/1st‑level spell power · E 2‑3 ≈ 2nd‑level · E 4‑5 ≈ 3rd‑level · E 6‑7 ≈ 4th‑level ·_ ********************************************_E 8‑9_******************************************** _should feel_ ********************************************_mythic_********************************************_._
    
- Replace static bonuses with **dice** whenever possible:  
    •  P d4 / d6 / d8  
    • Damage = `**1dX + P**` or `**P dX**` (X rises with E).
    
- **Potency P (0‑9)** scales **quantity**: number of dice, radius (`5 ft + P ft`), duration (`P` rds), jump distance, etc. Potency is limited by the alchemist's level as well, so 9 potency is very powerful and expensive. 
    
- **Drink effects** = self‑buff, survival, or short‑range; **Use effects** = offensive, area, or ally utility.
    
- Powerful crowd‑control or self‑revive features should be **once per short rest**.
    
- Narrative first: each R family’s flavour should shine (Joy heals, Rage burns, etc.).
    
- _Next families queued: Rage (R 2), Love (R 3), Fear (R 4), Sorrow (R 5)_
    

---

### Rive Alchemy — Base Effect Reference (Flicker Tier)

_Code = R (Emotion) · E (Effect)_  •  _Choose Variant & Potency when you brew_

entries.title: "💎 **Sentari Quality System**"
entries.summary: “When the soul overflows or is drained, it leaves behind residue—the pulse of who we are. This is Sentari.”
entries.body:
“When the soul overflows or is drained, it leaves behind residue—the pulse of who we are. This is Sentari.”

Krovi : [[🔥 Rive]]
Kaya : [[🕊️ Seraphite]]

- 🔴 **Rage** – Deep red
    
- 🟣 **Grief** – Violet-black
    
- 🔵 **Fear** – Cold blue
    
- 🟡 **Joy** – Bright gold
    
- 🟢 **Hope** – Pale green
    
- ⚪ **Love** – Soft pink-white
    
- ⚫ **Despair** – Heavy grey
    
- 🟠 **Curiosity** – Flickering amber
    
- 🟣 **Desire** – Amethyst swirl

## 💎 **Sentari Quality System**

Each Sentari (crystallized emotion) comes in **four quality tiers**, determined by **intensity of emotion** at the moment of extraction, **ritual precision**, or **rare circumstances** like a lunar eclipse, the death of a loved one, or a divine interaction.

| **Tier** | **Name**    | **Appearance**                              | **Source**                                              | **Power Level**                                         |
| -------- | ----------- | ------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| 1️⃣      | **Flicker** | Dull, cracked, unstable                     | Weak emotional moments, cheap extractions               | Minor buffs, short durations                            |
| 2️⃣      | **Pulse**   | Vibrant, stable glow                        | Normal Rive/Seraphite extractions                       | Standard effects, minor magic item fuel                 |
| 3️⃣      | **Surge**   | Radiates energy, hums softly                | Intense emotional surges or curated rituals             | Major boosts, single-use powerful effects               |
| 4️⃣      | **Crest**   | Gleams with spectral light, sometimes sings | Divine events, near-death emotion, Feywild interference | Game-altering effects, potential permanent enchantments |


🧠 **Emotional Feeling Descriptions (Rive/Seraphite Use)**

- **Joy (Gleamstone):**  
    _Everything is more vivid. Colors pop. Sounds ring with clarity. You feel like a child again—safe, light, and full of laughter._
    
- **Rage (Blazegem):**  
    _Adrenaline surges like fire in your veins. Every tiny inconvenience becomes a threat. You’re powerful. You’re dangerous._
    
- **Sorrow (Griefglass):**  
    _Memories resurface like waves. Your heart feels heavy. You cry without knowing why. But it’s beautiful, almost sacred._
    
- **Fear (Tremorite):**  
    _Your skin crawls. Every shadow is a monster. Time slows down. You notice everything—but feel hunted by it all._
    
- **Love (Heartsong):**  
    _Warmth spreads through your chest. You remember someone who made you feel whole. You’d do anything to protect them._
    
- **Ambition (Vaultflame):**  
    _Your mind races with plans and possibilities. Everything feels like a stepping stone. You _must_ build, win, prove._
    
- **Envy (Shadecryst):**  
    _Your eyes sting. Everyone else seems better. You _need_ what they have. But you’re clever enough to take it._
    
- **Hope (Luminarite):**  
    _You feel like things might actually work out. That maybe... just maybe... there’s light ahead. You stand taller._
    
- **Disgust (Filthstone):**  
    _The world is filthy. Everything is stained. You want to strip it all away—to purge, to burn, to start clean._

entries.title: "**5. Cultural Elements**"
entries.body:
## **5. Cultural Elements**

### **The Twin Festivals**

- Celebrated once a year when the moon fully eclipses the sun.
    
- In Kaya’s world: A festival of renewal and unity.
    
- In Krovi’s world: A chaotic purge night, where people shed identities and purge secrets.


### **Każþarim** – “The Thousand Echoes”

- A subterranean city built into the corpse of a god. Every word spoken echoes for hours. Dwarves here believe the echoes guide fate.
    
- In the Krovi version, the god’s body is _awake_ and subtly moving.
    

### **Sol’Kareth** – “City of Gilded Chains”

- Massive floating platforms tethered to a mountain by radiant chains.
    
- In Kaya’s world, it’s a utopia of law and magic.
    
- In Krovi’s, the chains break nightly, and it crashes to the surface—only to rise again with new scars.
    

### **Vasrið’s Hollow**

- Forest commune where Apple Pie came from. A peaceful society shaped by whispered truths from nature.
    
- In Krovi’s version, the forest is sentient and oppressive, forcing visions on trespassers and trapping them in dreams.

entries.title: "**1️⃣ The Spoon of Ultimate Precision**"
entries.body:
### **1️⃣ The Spoon of Ultimate Precision**

_Wondrous Item, Uncommon_

- This **perfectly balanced** silver spoon grants **+1 to Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks**, but **only when eating soup**.
- If used as a weapon, it deals **1 damage and loudly complains** in a posh accent about being misused.

---

### **2️⃣ The Bag of Inconvenient Holding**

_Wondrous Item, Rare_

- Functions like a **Bag of Holding**, but whenever an item is retrieved, a random **useless** object (like a handful of sand, a broken quill, or a single boot) is pulled out first.
- The desired item will always be **at the very bottom.**
- The bag whispers **passive-aggressive insults** about the player's organizational skills.

---

### **3️⃣ The Coin of Bad Decisions**

_Wondrous Item, Common_

- A **gold coin** that forces its holder to make **impulsive choices**.
- Once per day, if the owner flips the coin, they must **immediately follow through on the first idea that pops into their head** (DC 15 Wisdom save to resist).
- The coin **always lands on the least beneficial outcome.**

---

### **4️⃣ The Goblin’s Sneaky Shoes**

_Wondrous Item, Uncommon_

- These **bright red slippers** grant **+5 to Stealth checks**—but only when **tiptoeing cartoonishly**.
- Walking normally causes the shoes to **squeak loudly** every few steps (DC 12 Dexterity check to move silently).
- Once per long rest, the wearer can **hover an inch above the ground for 10 seconds** before immediately falling prone.

---

### **5️⃣ The Hat of Minor Invisibility**

_Wondrous Item, Uncommon_

- While worn, the **hat itself** turns **completely invisible**, but the wearer does not.
- If removed, the hat can **never be found again** unless the wearer spends **exactly one hour** searching while whistling.

---

### **6️⃣ The Extremely Useless Wand**

_Wand, Common_

- Contains **7 charges** that can be used to cast **Mage Hand, but only to slap the user’s own face** (1d4 bludgeoning damage).
- The wand **vibrates aggressively** when near important magical items, but **doesn’t actually detect magic**.

---

### **7️⃣ The Scroll of Definitely Not Fireball**

_Scroll, Common_

- The text **appears to be a Fireball spell**, but when read aloud, it **instead casts Prestidigitation to create a faint warm breeze**.
- If thrown into a fire, it **bursts into red confetti** instead of burning normally.

---

### **8️⃣ The Ring of Slightly Faster Falling**

_Ring, Uncommon_

- Grants the wearer **-5 feet to Feather Fall speed** if the spell is cast on them.
- If falling naturally, they will **fall 10% faster than normal** but take **no extra damage**.
- Makes **no difference in combat** but makes long drops **mildly more unsettling**.

---

### **9️⃣ The Belt of Questionable Strength**

_Wondrous Item, Rare_

- Grants the wearer **+4 Strength**, but **only for lifting objects that serve no purpose in the current situation** (e.g., a random rock, a bench, or an unconscious goblin).
- If attempting to use the strength **for combat or a meaningful task**, the belt **undoes itself and falls off.**

---

### **🔟 The Talking Rock of Useless Advice**

_Wondrous Item, Common_

- This **smooth, gray rock** speaks once per day, offering **completely irrelevant** but confident advice (e.g., _“Never trust a man with two left shoes.”_).
- The advice **changes daily** but is **always vague** and **never applicable** to the current situation.
- If ignored, the rock **gets offended** and refuses to talk for a week.

entries.title: "🔥 **The Torch-Heart Core**"
entries.body:
owned my [[Jonah (Mulek Sorrengail)]]
## 🔥 **The Torch-Heart Core**

_Wondrous Item 
**Rarity:** Rare
**Appearance:** A glowing red-orange crystal sphere encased in bronze bands shaped like ribs or vines, pulsing softly with inner flame. It’s warm to the touch and faintly beats like a heart when held.  
**Weight:** 1 lb  
**Crafted by:** An ancient goblin forge-mage trying to preserve “the spark” of lost champions.

- **Burning Spirit** – You have **resistance to fire damage**.

### 💥 **Active Abilities (Once per Long Rest):**

#### **1. Flamewake Revival**

When you are reduced to 0 HP, you can choose to **immediately erupt in a blast of flame** and revive.

- You return to life with **1 HP**, and every creature within 10 feet must make a **DC 15 Dexterity saving throw**, taking **4d6 fire damage** on a fail, half on a success.
- Your torch-heart then dims until your next long rest.

> _"The fire doesn't go out—only changes shape."_


### 🔥 **Flavor Hooks & Secrets:**

- The core pulses in the presence of **dormant magical flame sources** or **other artifacts of the Emberforged**.
- It was once the **heart-core of a goblin battle automaton**, repurposed into a relic.
- Placing it into certain pedestals or machinery may **“reactivate” lost functions** of forgotten places.
- At full power, it could be used to **light one of the Three Vault Fires** needed to open an ancient goblin gate...

entries.title: "**Mysterious Key (Tristan’s Nat 20 Arcana)**"
entries.body:
Current possession [[Tristan (Silver)]]

![[KeyImage.png]]
#### **Mysterious Key (Tristan’s Nat 20 Arcana)**

- Small, ancient, forged from **obsidian and dragonbone**, warm to the touch.
    
- Engraved with the **same star eye symbol found in Esil’s tome.
    
- Has too much magic to unlock something as simple as a door—possibly a **sealed vault, prison, or forgotten temple**.
    
- Inscription (only readable via magic or divine insight) reads:
    
    > _"The chains are worn. The blood must flow. The gate shall open."_

entries.title: "🦊 Lumina, Spirit Fox of the Whispering Willows"
entries.body:
Tamed by [[Ryan (Esil Dei Krovi)]]

## 🦊 Lumina, Spirit Fox of the Whispering Willows

**Small Fey (Spirit), Neutral Good**  
**Armor Class**: 14 (ethereal agility)  
**Hit Points**: 14 
**Speed**: 40 ft.  
**Languages**: Understands Sylvan, Elvish, and Common emotions. Communicates only via **empathic projection**.

### 🧠 Emotion-Speak

Lumina does not use words. Instead, she projects vivid **emotions** (fear, excitement, sorrow, curiosity) into the minds of nearby creatures.


✨ Coiling Enchantment: “Foxmark Sigils”

Rune of Echolight - The next time the creature is reduced to 0 HP, they remain standing at 1 HP instead (does not stack with Relentless Endurance).


### 🌙 Ethereal Fox Traits

- **Fey Step (1/day)**: Lumina may teleport up to 30 ft. as a bonus action, leaving behind a trail of glowing footprints for 1 round.
    
- **Fade Into Light**: When reduced to 0 HP, Lumina vanishes into a burst of shimmering particles. She **cannot be killed**, but **reappears at the next dawn** unless magically banished.
    
- **Whispering Bond**: While within 30 ft of her bonded party member, Lumina grants **+1 to Insight checks** and **advantage on saving throws against being frightened**.

entries.body:
(Frami)
The soul lost in time. A loop, a forever witness.

Eje - first timeline
- Timeline was peaceful - full balance and no knight appeared
- He did something terrible and caused a shift. Something to appear and caused a knight to go back in time. He also got trapped in a loop while trying to revive the gods. A kobold named [[Dibbins 1]] fell into the spell and caused things to go wrong - creating a knight. Eje Cursed dibbins to forever die and come back to make him feel pain but not remember previous timelines. Dibbins is truly the immortal annoyance. Eje then used him to try and annoy the true heros. 

Wants to kill [[The True Heros]] - has done it many times

Naw we changing this - make Eje a man who goes around helping people he has met in the timelines - always going around meeting people. He keeps his friend close and everyone knows him, but he dosent want to stick out. 

Make the dukes be lesser dragons and make dragons exist in Azterra - the dukes may be alive or not be.  We can put their skeletons in caves and have them be places of warship and power. 

Eje will be my character - able to remeber past characters, help the party when needed, and be a mysterious figure. Overall, he is in reality the true big bad, but many will never find out. He is a travler who lives for fun until the order of kaya or krovi builds up enough power/influence to summon back their god. At this point, he will always swoop in and steal it to reset the timeline, making him eternal. He is the real big bad in a sense that he will never let the story of azterra continue.

entries.title: "**📜 DnD Campaign Summary – Complete Record**"
entries.body:
# **📜 DnD Campaign Summary – Complete Record**

## **🌌 Main Plotline – The Two Timelines**

### **The Dual Worlds of Kaya and Krovi**

The **endgame of the campaign** is the realization that the world is split into **two parallel timelines**, happening **simultaneously**. In one timeline, **Kaya is the dominant deity**, worshiped by the masses and seen as the light of the world. In the other, **Krovi reigns instead**, with history rewritten in his favor.

Each character has **a counterpart in the opposite timeline**, fulfilling the same roles but in different ways. Some are direct reflections, while others have their motivations twisted by the nature of their world.

Eventually, through **a portal to the Feywilds**, the party will be sent **1,000 years into the past**, finding themselves in the other timeline. They will **become the history of that world**, shaping its events and forcing them to question **which side is truly good or evil.**

### **Key Revelations in the Late Game**

- **The party is destined to be the counterforce**—whatever god is worshiped in the current world, the party is fated to become the champions of the opposite force.
    
- **The Knight of Kaya and Esil are the same person**, in different worlds.
    
- **Ivan’s mentor, Opta, is actually his own alternate self from the other timeline**, having already lived through the events the party is about to experience.
    
- **The war Mulek resents may have happened differently in the other world**, flipping the roles of conqueror and victim.
    
- **Silver’s patron may have an agenda that exists across both realities, revealing their wishes shape fate itself.**
    
- **The red mist Cordo befriended is an echo from the other timeline**, trying to communicate across the divide.
    

### **The Final Choice**

The party will ultimately have to **choose whether to let history remain as it is** or **break the cycle**, merging or destroying one of the timelines. Whatever choice they make will define the future for both worlds.

---

## **🏙️ Elverdeen – The Party’s Home Base**

### **Major Locations**

- **The Adventurer’s Guild** – Central hub for quests, ranking, and party interactions.
    
- **The Rusty Dagger** – A back-alley shop that serves as an entry point to the black market.
    
- **Elverdeen Cemetery** – Site of supernatural disturbances, including the **Gravedigger’s Curse**.
    
- **The Grand Cathedral of Kaya** – The main religious center, full of Order of the Light operatives.
    

### **Notable NPCs**

- **Varrek Steelhide** – Half-orc Guild Master, no-nonsense, values results over ethics.
    
- **Marlund** – Runs a shop in the O-Block black market, deals in dangerous and forbidden artifacts.
    
- **Priest Aldric** – High cleric of Kaya, suspected of deep corruption.
    
- **Strahd (Esil's Father)** – A former knight and protector of the town, heavily influenced Esil's upbringing 【421:1†Ryan (Esil Dei Krovi).md】.
    
- **Opta** – Cordo’s former mentor, a monk-turned-assassin who orchestrated his life’s purpose. In the Krovi timeline, Opta and Cordo are the same person 【421:2†Cordo Backstory (Ivan).md】.
    
- **Scorne** – Mulek’s former comrade, taken by high elves after a failed battle. Mulek continues searching for him 【421:0†Jonah (Mulek Sorrengail).md】.
    
- **Violet Veletti** – A human woman who saved Mulek’s life after his kingdom fell. He promised to return to her once he reclaimed his throne 【421:0†Jonah (Mulek Sorrengail).md】.
    
- **The Genie** – Silver’s patron, a mysterious and possibly malevolent force that thrives on harm being caused by his wishes 【421:7†Tristan (Silver).md】.
    
- **Mira Quickfang** – Silver’s childhood friend and only trusted companion, an astral elf fighter seeking vengeance alongside him 【421:7†Tristan (Silver).md】.
    
- **Grazkul** – Apple Pie’s childhood friend, an architect from Każþarim who helped raise him after his parents died 【421:19†Isaac (Apple π).md】.
    

---

## **🎭 Player Characters & Their Alternate Selves**

### **Current Party Members & Their Counterparts**

#### **Cordo (Ivan)**

**Who They Are:** A wood elf fighter raised by Opta, an ex-assassin monk who took in orphans. Cordo was trained under a mysterious plan and spent decades following a hit list before abandoning it. Now, he wanders, seeking purpose beyond his past.

**Alternate Timeline:** In the Krovi-dominant timeline, **Cordo is Opta**, the assassin monk training others to ensure history repeats itself.

---

#### **Mulek Sorrengail (Jonah)**

**Who They Are:** A displaced dwarven prince whose kingdom was overthrown by “Kaya’s Stray Dogs.” He now fights to reclaim his homeland and redeem himself.

**Alternate Timeline:** In the Krovi timeline, **Mulek is a conqueror**, one of the generals responsible for a brutal war against humans and elves.

---

#### **Esil Dei Krovi (Ryan)**

**Who They Are:** A human paladin of Kaya who lost faith after witnessing the corruption of the Order. Originally fascinated by dragon magic, he unknowingly pledged himself to Krovi.

**Alternate Timeline:** In the Krovi world, **Esil is the Knight of Krovi**, a holy warrior revered in the same way the Knight of Kaya is in this world.

---

#### **Silver (Tristan)**

**Who They Are:** A dragonborn warlock bound to a genie patron whose wishes always lead to unintended harm.

**Alternate Timeline:** Silver’s patron exists across both worlds and may be responsible for the cycle of fate itself.

---

#### **Apple Pie (Isaac)**

**Who They Are:** An orc druid with a deep connection to nature, struggling between his gambling past and newfound magical responsibility.

**Alternate Timeline:** In the Krovi timeline, **Apple Pie is a twisted oracle**, revered but feared for his chaotic visions of fate.

---

#### **Eldrin (Miki)**

**Who They Are:** A high elf druid from a hidden village, once a guardian of holy rabbit warrens.

**Alternate Timeline:** In the Krovi timeline, **Eldrin is the Wild Sage**, an exiled prophet whose visions were ignored until it was too late.

---

## **📜 Session Summaries**

### **Session 1 – Tavern Beginnings**

- The party met in Elverdeen’s main tavern.
    
- They took on their first quests - a child was missing and they went to save her by defeating a cultist in a random dungeon. 
    

### **Session 2 – The Hollowbrook Purge**

- The party escorted a mysterious box to Hollowbrook, instructed only to deliver it to a priest and leave.
    
- Upon arrival, they found **a starving village** with **desperate people**, but followed their orders.
    
- After delivering the package, they **realized too late** that it was **a weapon of mass destruction** designed to purge all magic from the area.
    
- The **Elite Knight of Kaya** and his forces engaged them in battle before he invoked **Divine Purge**, killing all remaining villagers and enemies alike.
    
- The party barely escaped, now holding incriminating evidence that could tie them to the event.
    
- After returning to Elverdeen, they attended a **ceremony mourning the fallen**—an event where Esil felt increasingly distant from his faith.
    

### **Session 3 – The Genie’s Bargain & Tristan’s Nat 1**

- The party sought to cover up their involvement in Hollowbrook by destroying or hiding all evidence.
    
- Silver (Tristan) attempted to use **his genie patron for guidance**, rolling a **Natural 1**.
    
- Instead of receiving help, he was **banished to a different plane for a full combat encounter**, where he **spoke directly with Krovi**.
    
- Meanwhile, the rest of the party took on a **guild quest for killing rats which turned out to be mutants**
    
- Esil’s abilities became **even more unholy in nature after completing another ritual with his tome. **
    

### **Session 4 – The Mysterious Cave**

- The party entered the **Hollow Echo Cave**, dealing with strange **mimicking echoes** that replayed their voices and thoughts.
    
- They found **Rendell Voss’ journal**, revealing past explorers had also fallen to the cave’s influence.
    
- Cordo **befriended the red mist**, a sentient presence that left behind cryptic warnings.
    
- The party engaged in **combat with animated armor**
entries.obsidianPath: DM NOTES/SECRETS - NO LOOKINGGGG/Seriously no looking (Endgame)/KAYA DM Overview.md

entries.title: "**🎭 Player Characters & Their Alternate Selves**"
entries.body:
**📜 DnD Campaign – Character Summary**

---

## **🎭 Player Characters & Their Alternate Selves**

### **Cordo (Ivan)**

- **Race/Class:** Wood Elf Fighter
    
- **Background:** Raised by Opta, an ex-assassin monk who trained him under a secretive plan. Sent on a hit list mission after Opta’s death but abandoned it upon discovering its disturbing nature. Now a wandering mercenary with a drinking problem, questioning his past and purpose.
    
- **Personality:** Determined yet haunted by his past. Pragmatic in battle but reckless when drinking. Holds deep respect for Opta despite his manipulations.
    
- **Strengths:** Highly skilled in assassination techniques, combat strategy, and adaptability in combat.
    
- **Weaknesses:** Struggles with guilt and lack of direction, prone to destructive behavior.
    
- **Alternate Timeline:** Cordo _is_ Opta, the assassin monk ensuring history repeats itself, guiding others down the same dark path he once followed.
    

### **Mulek Sorrengail (Jonah)**

- **Race/Class:** Dwarf Fighter
    
- **Background:** A fallen prince whose kingdom was overthrown by "Kaya’s Stray Dogs." Spent years in self-destructive behavior before rekindling his will to fight. Seeks to reclaim his kingdom and reunite with Violet Veletti, the woman who saved him.
    
- **Personality:** Stubborn and prideful, but deeply loyal to those he trusts. Holds a strong disdain for elves and humans due to his kingdom's fall.
    
- **Strengths:** Natural leader, skilled warrior, determined and fearless in battle.
    
- **Weaknesses:** Prejudiced, overly prideful, struggles with self-worth and guilt over his failures. Enjoys flirting with woman and drinks. 
    
- **Alternate Timeline:** A war-hardened general responsible for a brutal campaign against humans and elves, leading the fight against those he once viewed as allies.
    

### **Esil Dei Krovi (Ryan)**

- **Race/Class:** Human Paladin
    
- **Background:** Initially a devotee of Kaya, he sought dragon magic after witnessing a legendary warrior use it. Given a tome by a mysterious dragonborn, he pledged himself to Krovi in his desperation.
    
- **Personality:** Once noble and idealistic, now jaded and desperate for power. Struggles with his faith and the corruption he sees in his divine magic.
    
- **Strengths:** Exceptional combat prowess, charismatic leader, deeply knowledgeable about divine magic.
    
- **Weaknesses:** Torn between faith and self-doubt, increasingly drawn toward unholy power.
    
- **Alternate Timeline:** The Knight of Krovi, revered as Kaya’s counterpart in the opposite world, carrying out divine justice in a cruel, unwavering way.
    

### **Silver (Tristan)**

- **Race/Class:** Red Dragonborn Warlock (Genie Patron)
    
- **Background:** Orphaned at 11 by nomadic rogues, he found a silver ring that bound him to a Genie. His patron’s wishes always come with unintended consequences. His only trusted companion is Mira Quickfang.
    
- **Personality:** Cunning and resourceful, deeply distrustful of authority. Struggles with the moral implications of his pact but cannot resist the allure of power.
    
- **Strengths:** Charismatic, highly intelligent, creative with magic.
    
- **Weaknesses:** Reckless, emotionally distant, haunted by nightmares of his past.
    
- **Alternate Timeline:** His patron exists in both worlds and may be manipulating the fate of both timelines, using Silver as a pawn in a grander scheme.
    

### **Apple Pie (Isaac)**

- **Race/Class:** Orc Druid (Circle of the Shrine)
    
- **Background:** Grew up in Vasrið’s Hollow, lost his parents young, and later became a gambler. After a strange event in a forest, he developed druidic powers and began hearing mysterious voices.
    
- **Personality:** Stoic but curious, enjoys the thrill of gambling but is deeply loyal to those he considers friends.
    
- **Strengths:** Resilient, versatile in combat, strong-willed.
    
- **Weaknesses:** Has trouble knowing when to quit, follows the whispers he hears even if they lead to danger.
    
- **Alternate Timeline:** A feared oracle whose visions have shaped the fates of rulers, worshiped and feared for his unpredictable foresight.
    

### **Eldrin (Miki)**

- **Race/Class:** High Elf Druid - Circle of wildfire
    
- **Background:** A guardian of the holy rabbit warrens, failed to protect them from an unknown force. Now wanders with an ever-growing army of rabbits, seeking vengeance for their slaughter. 
- The unknown force was his previous mentor. He was being taught a lesson on the meaning of rebirth. The sanctuary must burn down for him to grow and move on. 
    
- **Personality:** Gentle and wise, yet deeply burdened by his failure. Finds solace in nature and the presence of rabbits.
    
- **Strengths:** Highly attuned to nature, possesses vast druidic knowledge, excellent at nonviolent solutions.
    
- **Weaknesses:** Overprotective of animals, distrustful of civilization
    
- **Alternate Timeline:** Similarly to what he is now. The previous shrine master was his alternate self. 
    

### **Clod (Brady)**

- **Race/Class:** Duergar
    
- **Background:** Grew up in an orphanage until the age of 6, later surfaced at 61 after a life underground. Found an egg one day and loves ants. They started to listen to him. This egg will later hatch into a fey-wild ant queen 
    
- **Personality:** Quiet and observant, distrustful of outsiders, loyal to his people.
    
- **Strengths:** Hardy and resilient, excellent survival skills, skilled in underground navigation.
    
- **Weaknesses:** Socially withdrawn, struggles with life on the surface.
    
- **Alternate Timeline:** Unknown.
    

### **Diangelo Ball (Marco)**

- **Race/Class:** Forest Gnome Rogue (Assassin)
    
- **Alignment:** Chaotic Evil
    
- **Background:** A reincarnated "ethical gooner" who died saving a hentai magazine. Now a gnome hoodlum on a quest to find the Unisekai Staff and return to his original world.
    
- **Personality:** Obsessive and unpredictable, values gnome hats above all else, considers crime a way of life. Most random player and does not have much lore. Just here for the ride.
    
- **Strengths:** Quick and sneaky, resourceful, unpredictable in battle.
    
- **Weaknesses:** Rebellious, easily distracted by gnome hats, completely amoral.
    
- **Alternate Timeline:** Unknown.
    

---
